title: Daughters 18th Birthday
text: We were greeted by Reign who went over and beyond to help us and helped us start our trip off and make it a memorable trip. We were here for my daughters 18 birthday and having someone like Reign help gets things started in a positive direction was super encouraging. We stayed in room 2303. Because of staff like Reign we will definitely be coming back to stay with this establishment. Thank you Reign for going over and beyond, this hotel needs more staff like you.

title: Very good options if you go to NYC
text: The hotel was very good and the location is excellent! The breakfast was good and the were good options. The receptionist Alex Rodriguez was very kind and servicial, he did his best effort to speak with us in Spanish. I hope to come back soon and obviously stay in this hotel.

title: Amazing customer service
text: There were some computer issues with my payment. I tried to talk to someone the day before and that person said it will be fine. When i checked out today, I explained to Reign what had happened.  Reign was amazing and got them all fixed for me. I truly appreciate her help. She went out of her way to listen to me. I stayed in 2801.

title: FRAUD ON CARD
text: Would have given a great review if they hadn't charged my card and extra £800 without authorisation. Cannot get hold of anybody at the hotel at all. The worst experience of my life. Now have to wait to go through my fraud department as nobody from the hotel will answer or return calls

title: Horrible Receptionist
text: The receptionist is a liar/racist. she was rude and humiliated me in front of a group of high school students by yelling at me that I was too close to the corner where  she placed my luggage,  and also accused me of not saying excuse me to the guests next to me and pushed them when walking through the crowded lobby, which are totally her illusion.  Worst experience ever!

title: The city view!
text: Reign was amazing! She upgraded our room to a higher floor when I told her we were visiting for just a few days to see the city and we lived in the country. She put us on the 31st floor! The view was awesome just like Reign! Anytime we were there, she always greeted all the guest. She helped us anytime we needed anything, so happy we checked in with her.

title: Highly recommend!
text: We stayed here for the Big East tournament over St. Patrick’s Day weekend and had such a wonderful stay. The staff is incredibly friendly and accommodating. My sister and I absolutely loved Reign at the front desk who was so kind and helpful. Our room 2901 on the high floor was clean and spacious. We will definitely be staying here again in the future. Thank you again! - London & Milan

title: Reign is the reason we came back for a second year. Great asset to your organization.
text: Reign was fantastic at check in. She was able to take our bags and store them safely until our room was ready. She called us when it was ready. This allowed us to get ready earlier for our event. She gave us water and chips which was nice for the long day ahead. Thanks Reign. Room 1204

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Our front deak associate went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. Took the time to see if an early check in was available, provided us water and contacted us when the room was ready. This associate was the reason I'd come to stay here. 2 years in a row and she remembered us. Way to go!

title: Great value for money
text:
I really liked the hotel, comfortable and spacious room, I stayed for 6 days and it was clean and tidy every day. The room has carpet, but it didn't bother me at all, comfortable bed, very good shower. For me, the points to improve in the room would be the noise of the heater, it works really well but makes a lot of noise and I would prefer a glass shower in the bathroom instead of a curtain.
The breakfast is simple but very tasty, the staff are always polite and helpful. In the afternoon there was always hot chocolate at the reception, delicious!
One point to improve would be to expand the cafe location, sometimes it gets very crowded.
Well located hotel, overall I really liked it and would stay again!

title: NYC vacation plan
text: I loved this hotel I love how they made a gift box with some treats like chips candies and water I like the breakfast food there and I like how its near different places and the rooms are nice and I also love how it's near the train station and I like that there is a place to put coats on.

title: Ugly place
text:
One of the two elevators was not functioning. Had to walk up and down the whole weekend.Bedroom needed some update , furniture was damaged and bathroom pipes where taped ?!? 
Pillows were way to big . 
Breakfast was ok, but never going back to this hotel .

title: Holiday Inn express New York City Times Square
text: Holiday Inn Express in Times Square, New York. Reign and the management were outstanding. This is the best Holiday Inn I've stayed at in a long time. They welcomed me with open arms I can’t wait to come back to Nyc stay at this hotel again they are the best with me with autism. They’re amazing.

title: Business hotel next to Times Square
text: The hotel is next to Times Square and walkable to everything in TS. The room is tiny, has a small gym with a few machines, food is basic. One pays for the proximity to TS and good if it’s for official trips and not for luxury stay in New York. Has a decent reception but nothing fancy

title: Terrible
text: The front desk person at am checkout was not helpful and gave a rude attitude. The elevator took long and was operated by keys. People drive business but our experience the Holiday Inn employee wasn’t excellent in customer service and that hurts your brand. Smile and be welcoming next time. Happy New Year from an IHG member.

title: Terrible hotel, stay out of this place
text:
Stay away from this Hotel. I booked a room with this hotel, minutes after I tried to make some changes to the reservation and this Hotel denied the changes. I lost a lot of cash just because their restrictive reservation policies. 
If you value your money and want to deal with serious hotel, do not book here.
They just lost a customer and I will never ever recommend this hotel anymore.

title: Ideal for a break to New York city
text:
Myself and my daughter stayed at this hotel from 30/11 to 4/12.
Overall we enjoyed our stay here and would return if we were to visit New York again.
While the area outside the hotel could be a little daunting as there were numerous homeless people on the street, that said none of them caused us any issues.
The staff on reception, in the breakfast room and housekeeping were all very pleasant and helpful.
Rooms are a decent size and very clean though they are dated and could maybe do with an upgrade.
If there was a negative then it would be that the size of the room for breakfast is very inadequate for the number of rooms/ people in the hotel !!
Either get there early about 7 am or later on about 9.30, anytime in between is crazy.
Though the breakfast choice is very good and brilliant for starting the day.
If like us you spent most of your time exploring the city then this hotel is ideal 😊

title: unauthorised payment on card
text: holiday was great hotel was ok for what it was breakfast nightmare if down for anywhere between 8 & 10 no space have to take to your room to eat paid though a third party for the hotel but when i got back realised holiday inn express had take money for the room again tried to contact them but very unhelpful still waiting on my money to be returned £1'051.57 have emailed and still waiting on reply

title: 4 days in New York with family
text: Recommended by the travel agency, a scandal, super dated rooms, four adults, a small bathroom, only two elevators for 37 floors if I'm not mistaken, so imagine the "traffic"; for breakfast, if you can call it that, few variations, and everything very banal, and above all a space not suitable for the quantity of people; on the last evening we found ourselves with the room key blocked, as a second deposit was missing, something specified by us upon arrival, and after presenting the passport and paying the deposit they released us, moreover we have not yet received the deposit back, too superficial.

title: Great hotel
text:
I was worried about hotel reading reviews and looked at changing many times but decided to stick with it as we got such a good price.
We need never of worried.
Great location
Clean rooms
Comforable beds 
Friendly staff

We were in room 405 and was lovely, clean, spacious and comfortable bed. We had an issue with the safe and they sent someone who fixed it asap. 
There are homeless people outside but we had no issues and they did not bother anyone. 
This hotel is just off Times Square, and perfect for what you need just a room and a bed as too busy Out and about exploring.
Thank you holiday inn Times Square.

title: Great Hotel
text: Went with an open mind, absolutey terrific experience staying here, location perfect, rooms were staff couldnt be more helpful, homeless people outside like there is everywhere in New York, no issues with them, if I return to NYC I will defo be staying here again, big huge thanks to everyone associated with this hotel

title: Ideal para dormir
text: Um hotel bom para dormir, e um café da manhã com o básico, os recepcionistas fizeram um ótimo atendimento, e a equipe de café da manhã sempre repondo as coisas que acabavam, menos um funcionário em específico que era muito mal educado, mas faz parte, nem todo mundo é feliz em New York, agora sobre a equipe de limpeza não espere muita coisa, mas não encontramos nenhum bicho no quarto, ou pelo hotel, isso ja é ótimo, o quarto era pequeno, mas normal de um hotel econômico, então se você quer um hotel só para dormir e passear o dia todo ele é ideal, e na esquina da rua se concentram bastante mendigos e usuários de drogas, mas nada preocupante, ninguém mexe com você!

title: Fantastic
text: Absolutely fantastic hotel, we were left with no hotel when we arrived last Thursday as the other holiday inn had said our tour operater cancelled and couldn't fit us in, when we walked in here we were greeted so well and they did everything to make our stay fantastic. Can not praise the reception  staff enough. The breakfast was also a brilliant bonus as set us up for the day. would definitely stay here again

title: Clean, convenient hotel but stressful breakfast!
text: Firstly, I was concerned about negative reviews I had read. However, this hotel was perfectly adequate. Location is good. Ok there are homeless people on the street outside, but the hotel can't help this! They are most places in New York. The hotel was clean, the beds were comfy. Room was small but fine for the amount of time we were in them. Staff were friendly. My only criticism was the lack of space to eat breakfast. The food was good as was the choice, just nowhere to eat it. It resembled a school canteen. We were prepared for this but if you are expecting a relaxing breakfast experience then go elsewhere!

title: $150 deposit not returned!  Emails ignored!!
text:
I recently stayed on business from the UK with a colleague (17-19.09.23) and when checked in on the Sunday evening I was asked to pay $150 deposit which I paid on my card.

I discovered a few days later this money had been deducted from my account? I questioned this with my employer who had made the booking and they have been repeatedly emailing this hotel asking why this money was taken and not refunded? 

No answer from the hotel has been received and no refund? 

I add no damage was done by I or extra charges incurred as this hotel is B&B only. I've enclosed a photo of the room on the morning of my departure showing the room in good condition. 

Given the hotel's lack of communication I would be very wary and would not recommend it to fellow travellers.

title: I would stay here again
text: This hotel was great for what we needed-a place to stay near Times Square. We didn't take full advantage of the location, but that is on us. The room was clean-small, of course. The gentleman that checked us on was very kind. I would stay here again.

title: Situation et confort parfait pour le temps passé à l’hôtel
text:
Parfait pour le temps qu on y passe
Lit confortable grand 
Ménage fait tous les jours
Nous avions des bouteilles d’eau à l’entrée gratuites et à volonté 
Déjeuner : correct le choix est limité mais il y a de tout frais et réapprovisionné non stop
Bon l’accueil est a revoir 
Mais vraiment pour le prix et la situation parfait

title: Good Stay!
text:
A wonderful stay! I was able to check in early which was fantastic b/c I needed to do some work. The front desk staff was nice. I received 2 free bottles of water every day. I thought the free breakfast was fine, I took it back to my room each morning. I didn't have to wait long for the elevators. The room was okay, the furniture looked like someone took nails across it and the wallpaper was peeling, but that didn't bother me. It was probably one of the largest rooms I've stayed in while in NYC. I had room to move around.  

Yes, the area is a little meh but it's close to Times Square, Penn Station, MSG, etc. and I couldn't hear too many sirens, I was on the 28th floor. The AC worked wonderfully. I'd stay here again depending on the price for when I'm in town again.

title: Stay at Holiday Inn Times Square
text:
This is a decent hotel in the centre of city, tue view from the hotel is amazing, The staff is very helpful, the rooms are little smaller however it doesn’t matter if you are here for site visit . Breakfast is at restaurant,  there are two lifts and tue waiting time can be more .
It’s a good place with splendid view of the city frm top floor.

title: Customer satisfaction should be a higher priority
text: I tried to check in early on the way to a conference. The room was not ready and front desk agent said I would get a text message after confirming my cell number. I never heard back snd it was close to 4:00 so I called, was out on hold, transferred snd disconnected. I called again and spoke to manager who said the room was cleaned moments ago (check in time is stated as 3:00 pm). When I mentioned I wasn’t notified, she became defensive and stated front desk gets busy. As I was not in the area at that time, I had yo check in later that evening lugging my bags with me. The room was missing the TV remote and I called down and was told it would be sent right away. One hour later no remote was delivered so I went down and they gave me a remote that did not work so I gave up. The room itself felt dingy. The bathroom sink was not draining and the shower curtain rod was broken making a mess. The cooling system was especially noisy, so I turned it off. Upon checkout, I saw the agent from the previous morning and asked why I was not contacted as she promised and again, rather than apologize, became defensive. It is experiences like these that make me question my loyalty to IHG. Diamond Ambassador here, if that matters. I’ve stayed at this hotel before because of convenient location but this stay was quite disappointing. Although I had a late checkout, I checked out first thing in the morning and went to a different property.

title: Muito Boa localização. Café da manhã na medida, quarto ótimo.
text: O hotel é muito perto da avenida 34th, e da Times Square. O café da manhã é bem movimentado, mas tudo se ajeita e as opções são excelentes, iogurtes, ovos mexidos, diversos tipos de pão, frutas, chá, café e leite, e tudo sempre sendo reposto o tempo todo. O quarto excelente (pedimos o de andar bem alto), e era limpo todos os dias.

title: Terrible
text:
Room was clean other then that all reception staff do not knw how to smile 
Room service was terrible
Card keys don’t work every 6 to 8 hours
Breakfast was very basic for over 300 pounds a night spent.. over all worst hotel I hv been to

title: Niente di che
text: Abbiamo soggiornato a settembre con famiglia 4 persone. Posizione ottima a pochi minuti da time square. Colazione abbondante peccato che i tavoli per far colazione erano pochissimi ed ora una lotta per trovare spazio. Solo n.2 ascensori per 36 piani, alla mattina almeno 15/30min per scendere a far colazione. Stanza piccolissima e letto il più piccolo che abbia mai trovato in USA (se sei più alto di 1.80m non ci stai). Era per 3 persone non 4. Non c'era posto per n.4 valige. Armadio inutilizzabile. Pulizia non il massimo.

title: Un hotel per chi ha poche pretese anzi pochissime
text:
Sono stato in questo hotel con la mia famiglia 
Premetto che per me l’hotel serve esclusivamente per dormire e dopo una giornata di totale cammino il sonno viene subito 
L’unica cosa che salvo è la pulizia della camera con cambio asciugamani tutti i giorni e la posizione anche se la via non è certo delle migliori 
La colazione anche se abbondante si consuma in una sala a dir poco affollata dove è una fortuna trovare posto a sedere,sicuramente non degna di un hotel.
L’ascensore è un incubo nelle ore che viene maggiormente utilizzato.
Una  via crucis dei piani che fa venire voglia di fare le scale se non fosse che 30 piani non sono una passeggiata 
Una reception inesistente (se non parli inglese non hai speranze) ti aiutano più i passanti che il personale all’ingresso dell’hotel 
In conclusione rapporto qualità prezzo meglio cercare qualcos’altro 
Un hotel senza infamia e senza lode con più infamia che lode

title: Reliable and convenient stop over hotel
text: We spent 4 nights here after finishing our Viking Ocean Cruise.  The hotel has seen better days and was a little shabby, but our room was clean and the bed comfortable,  Breakfast was adequate. We were provided with as much bottled water as we wanted.  There is a small outdoor seating area, which was nice to get outside with a glass of wine and "people watch".  The location is good, just around the corner from The Empire State building, and also Macys department Store.  The crazy Times Square is walkable as is the theatre district.

title: Cambiate mestiere
text:
Esperienza allucinante al momento del check in. Non puoi trattare persone , tuoi ospiti, devastati da 10 ore di aereo e dal jet lag, come una seccatura di cui sbarazzarti il prima possibile. Non puoi fregartene dei loro problemi e fornire informazioni che li risolverebbero solo alla centesima richiesta d’aiuto. Che tu non mi possa aiutare ci può stare, ma la mancanza di empatia e il menefreghismo no! Se fai questo lavoro non puoi far sentire alla gente che se tu vivi o muori, per te è lo stesso.  
A parte la scortesia,  preparatevi a dei quotidiani Hunger Games per accaparrarvi un posto nella minuscola sala colazioni e per salire al vostro piano -  due ascensori per 36 piani sono davvero troppi pochi.

title: Go one block south avoid unless desperate
text: work in area too.  The hotel block has several homeless encampments,  guest bathroom on first floor had open tissue case and no napkins or tissues, both front desk staff were rude and had bad attitudes, and check in was 75 minutes after promised.

title: Shockingly poor hotel
text:
What a shockingly poor hotel! It is run down, poorly managed with rude staff that have zero customer service skills and the tinniest of breakfast rooms that has only 15 tables that are constantly busy where people were actually taking breakfasts back to their room. The staff were miserable and unhelpful and when challenged just threaten to stop talking to you and walk away. And this all started the minute we walked in the premises to find that our rooms were still not ready at 5pm even though check in was from 3pm!

If this hotel was in London it would be closed down.this is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in. Avoid at all cost

title: Times Square, broadway
text: Top location, near all site seeing, clean rooms and daily cleaned, staff very friendly and helpful. Special mention to Rain the evening receptionist could not do enough for us . Great staff.thank you very much. Times Square around the corner also broadway saw a show, lots of places to eat at all budgets, the hotel break was good with plenty of selection.

title: It was all right. But the sister property, The candlewood suites, is better!
text:
Whenever I visit New York city. I would like to be reasonably close to times square. Because of its central location, it makes it easier to radiate out to other tourist attractions from there.
Normally I stay at the candlewood suites, times square location.  But this time, I took the Holiday inn Express times square, for my hotel stay.  Understand that the candlewood suites and the Holiday inn Express, are actually part of the same building.  Even though they are vertically sectioned off one from the other.

My first disappointment, was when I got there early, they said no rooms were available.   That happens often enough. The problem is, although they asked for my number, to let me know when rooms would be available, I never got that call or text.  So just arriving in the city, I had to walk around several hours, kind of just checking things out, without knowing that my room was ready.  With the warm weather, and wearing my travel clothes, versus my casual clothes, that was quite uncomfortable.

Secondly, the quality of the room itself, in relation to normal maintenance appearance, was not up to the standard of the sister hotel next door, The candlewood suites.  Just look at the photo of the mirror that was in my room.
Lastly, they gave me a room for a handicapped individual.  Was so tired from walking I just couldn't complain.

Although the breakfast was decent, it was not elaborate in any way possible. I chose it specifically for the breakfast availability. But next time I will stay back at the candlewood suites.

Bottom line, it is a decent value. But I believe you get more and a higher quality of service, from the sister location next door, The candlewood suites.

title: Alex was great!
text: Alex went above and beyond to help us out out several times. He gave us tips on what to see and where to go as first time visitors in the the Big Apple. He also told us what to avoid.  He gets a 10 for hospitality!

title: Horrible front desk experience
text: Terrible experience from the beginning. I had made a reservation through Dayuse for August 18, 2023. However, upon my arrival, the receptionist took my ID and bluntly informed me that there were no available rooms, suggesting I leave. When I stepped outside to make a phone call, she approached me and asked, "Can I assist you?" I explained that I was taking a call due to the noise outside. In response, she dismissively stated, "I don't care, please take it outside. You're not conducting business with us." She even had the doorman escort me out. I won't be returning to this place. Awful experience.

title: Location
text: Great location, only disappointed that there was a very loud festival out front and couldn't get through to hotel. Staff were great and wonderful breakfast. I also liked that there was free bottled water.

title: Excessive additional fees charged
text: Good property booked through Air BnB. Issue with excessive fees applied without notice nor invoice. Utilised our pre-authorisation payment of USD250 to pay these fees. Only when challenged when we returned to Australia did we receive a statement which detailed ADDITIONAL fees and charges which just happened to add up to the total amount. A shock being charged an additional USD50 per night in service fees which are not regulated by government laws and taxes.

title: Encontramos excremento en nuestra habitación - PÉSIMO servicio al cliente
text:
Nos decidimos por reservar 3 noches en este Holiday Inn en NYC porque queríamos un hotel bueno para nuestras vacaciones, que no vaya a salir alguna "sorpresa" en temas de limpieza de la habitación. Sin embargo, al hacer el check-in el primer día, nos llevamos la horrible experiencia de encontrar popó (excremento/caca) con mucho papel en el servicio higiénico del baño de nuestra habitación, es decir NO hicieron una revisión correcta de que todo estuviera limpio antes de entregarnos el cuarto porque claramente alguien extraño a nosotras había utilizado ese baño y se había olvidado de bajar la palanca. En ningún hotel, ni en los más básicos o económicos en los que me he hospedado he tenido que experimentar esta desagradable situación. Sin tratar de hacer problema ni amargarme las vacaciones, decidí solo bajar la palanca del servicio y esperar que se fuera todo lo que estaba ahí, sin embargo la taza del baño quedó manchada con popó en los bordes por lo que decidimos llamar al front desk para explicar lo que había sucedido y pedir que alguien viniera a limpiar la habitación (porque no había un cepillo apropiado para hacerlo yo misma). Esperamos más de 10 minutos y volvimos a llamar pero nadie apareció. Como teníamos apuro de salir, bajamos del cuarto y le dijimos a la señorita de la recepción del hotel que habíamos llamado para que alguien nos fuera a limpiar el baño y nadie fue, nos informó que el número del front desk no era del hotel sino de una "central" y que por eso no había ido nadie tan rápido a resolver el problema. En todo caso, avisamos nuevamente, esta vez con la señorita del lobby, que necesitábamos que alguien fuera a limpiar el servicio. Quiero resaltar que la señorita con la que hablamos en recepción hablaba español por lo que pudimos explicarle claramente cuál era la situación. 
Después de 8h de estar en la calle paseando, regresamos por la noche a nuestra habitación solo para encontrarnos que nadie había limpiado el baño, por lo que ya bajamos bastante molestas a indicarle este tema a la persona de recepción y fue muuuy grosera y tenía una pésima actitud para solucionar nuestro inconveniente. La solución al problema era tan fácil como enviar a alguien a limpiar el baño.  Esta persona dijo todo el tiempo que la persona de mantenimiento estaba ocupado (con un tono de voz muy grosero y quemimportista), hasta que por casualidad apareció el señor de mantenimiento y al escucharnos molestas reclamando subió con nosotras a limpiar el servicio higienico tal como habíamos solicitado 8h antes. El señor fue el único que se disculpó por las molestias, pese a que no era su responsabilidad. Lastimosamente no sé el nombre del señor pero agradezco muchisimo su atención y empatía para con nosotras.
En los siguientes días, tuvimos una serie de conversaciones con el staff de recepción (todos tenían una pésima actitud y ninguno se disculpó por el inconveniente) y la manager Valerie tanto en la mañana como por la noche en la cual pedíamos que nos compensaran de alguna forma esta terrible experiencia, sin embargo no nos daban ninguna respuesta. Mi hermana tuvo que reclamar en voz alta y muy enojada para que alguien pudiera recién ofrecerle el "gran regalo" (entiéndase mi sarcasmo) del 10% de descuento, y esta oferta solo apareció luego de haber reclamado varias veces. Les dijimos que esta oferta nos parecía muy poco para compensar el pésimo momento que nos habían hecho pasar y sugerimos que deberían darnos al menos la primera noche gratis porque nos estaban cobrando una noche por el servicio de limpieza que incluye entregar la habitación limpia y no fue lo que había sucedido. En todo este intercambio de palabras, NUNCA nadie se disculpó. Solicitamos varias veces hablar con la manager Misko y tampoco nos lo concedían. La última noche que nos hospedamos, RECIÉN la manager Misko intentó contactarnos por teléfono y correo electrónico (algo que pudieron haber hecho desde el comienzo si es que en serio les interesaba tener feliz a sus huespedes) y al fin nos ofreció una disculpa diciendo que por favor la contactemos para hablar con ella y ver como podíamos solucionar el tema. La llamamos y nunca contestó. Le escribimos un correo y tampoco contestó. Hasta el último momento en que estuvimos en el hotel nunca nadie más se contactó con nosotras.
Después de ya regresar a nuestra ciudad de origen, y luego de algunos días, y revisar el estado de cuentas de la tarjeta de crédito que utilizamos para la reserva, nos dimos cuenta que sí hicieron la devolución del precio de 1 noche como lo solicitamos. Al parecer, para obtener una compensación justa había que pelear durante 3 noches seguidas y alzar la voz para que alguien pudiera escucharnos.
Me da mucha pena que nuestras vacaciones hayan tenido que ser opacadas por este evento desagradable porque la habitación y el hotel en general fueron muuuy buenos. Nunca regresaría de nuevo porque la atención del personal de allí es pésima pero debo reconocer que la ubicación y estructura del hotel, la comodidad de la habitación y el desayuno son muy buenos. 
NO SE HOSPEDEN AQUÍ A MENOS QUE QUIERAN QUE LOS TRATEN MAL.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text: Omg this IHG Holiday Inn was a pleasant surprise. The lobby was really busy but the front desk staff remained friendly and professional. The rooms are surprisingly nice and even the general manager is visible and helpful. I am a business traveler and I usually do Marriotts but this hotel far exceeded my expectations. It’s NYC so the elevators are always busy but they provide info on the elevator right in the beginning to manage your expectations. Going forward this is my go to NYC hotel

title: Excelent service!
text: Beautiful hotel with a great location. The best for me was the service I received. People are welcoming, polite, and attentive. Reign made my day; she put a smile on my face as soon as I got to the front desk. The amenities are good, the rooms are clean, and the beds are comfortable. But, honestly, for me, the service was what made this experience exceptional. I would totally recommend it.

title: Terrible service
text: First time in New York City and this hotel is technically a 3-star hotel. Everyone was exceptionally polite, except for the girl that worked the Night Shift. Always on her phone, does not make eye contact with you and does not seem to care to even try to help you. I got a room with my parents and the room included a sofa bed, when I called the receptionist for some sheets and extra pillows she said it was too late and the person who does the housekeeping was gone for the day. She did not try to help resolve the situation, we had an uncomfortable first night. Strike one. Second experience was when I asked her the second night if they could possibly refill the coffee station because mind you, there is a 24/7 coffee station located by the breakfast area. She replied not even looking up at me but upset that she had to hang up the phone call she was on, her personal cell phone. She replied to, you have coffee in your room as she rolled her eyes. Terrible service, other than that, this hotel is not a bad spot to stay while you tourist the city.

title: Holiday Inn Express Times Square...WORST hotel I've ever stayed in.
text: I travel A LOT. This is the worst hotel I've EVER stayed in. Only one elevator for 36 floors. Had to wait up to 15 minutes for the elevator. And it would be packed. Sometimes I would have to walk up or down, and I was on the 15th floor and I am 63 years old. No face towels, AC went out, so many homeless people outside! I have to say the engineer and elevator operators were very nice. The room was not cleaned the second day and my key didn't work the second day. So I had to go all the way down and all the way back up again. Which, as I mentioned, took a long time. I would recommend highly that you do not stay in this hotel. You will be over charged for a sub-standard room.

title: Avoid this hotel
text: We had family vacation in New York city and stayed 2 night in this hotel. Avoid this hotel which has terrible, rude customer service receptionist. In addition they are giving rooms very late. Overall hotel is very dirty : lobby, tables, room. In addition,  lots of homeless people near the hotel. Never going to stay in this hotel again.

title: Horrible
text:
The whole time we stayed there was only 1 tiny elevator
Working.
During peak hour the line fir the elevator going up is up to the outside.
Waiting to go down is almost  45 minutes.we would gladly take the stairs but 31st floor?
I felt like I was robbed with the money I paid for this hotel.
Some customers also commented that the elevator has been broken for more than a week.
Not only it is inconvenient but unsafe and dangerous.
I feel like I should report this hotel for violation .

title: Disappointed
text: It's ok, not a luxury hotel, but that was already known in advance. Two elevators and 36 floors, so you always had to queue for the elevator. It should also be noted that on two nights only one elevator is in operation. The keys to the room did not work 3 times in one week. The day before departure, the desk promised us a room free of charge until 3 p.m., but when we handed over the room at the desk, the woman said that 2 p.m. is free of charge! She demanded us to pay 100$ + taxes for exceeding the hour! This was extremely bad customer service ever! Disappointment with the hotel because of this really big!!

title: Great Customer Service
text: Ivasia and Alex were so helpful and kind. Not only that but they were very personable and made our experience and say enjoyable. There was a communication issue and they resolved it immediately, great customer service overall.

title: 4 day. Ear wigs but 2 good employees
text:
We stayed here for a four-day family vacation. The rooms were not cleaned at all unless you asked several times. The elevators are absolutely garbage as everyone says they are. The breakfast is decent considering it’s included. The location is amazing. It is convenient to everything. We walked everywhere. Most of the stuff is amazing.

The assistant manager is rude. The assistant manager acknowledges your complaint and does nothing and has an undermining response.    Freddie s, the doorman is amazing. He was so nice to my kids and would always ask about our day. Absolute pleasure to deal with. he is one of the best hosts Bellman I’ve ever dealt with. Reign is amazing and accommodating and has helped us throughout the whole stay. She was pleasant, delightful and made or stay at the hotel was amazing even with the obstacles we had to face.. if it wasn’t for these two employees I don’t think I would’ve enjoyed my stay. 

Elevators suck. Earwigs in our room. Assistant manager ignored it with his cocky attitude. He didn’t cave acknowledgie or say cleaning would come up. He’s ignorant and it’s just a jog for him. If you find Arlo or Hyatt stay there.

title: Lack of customer service
text:
What a disappointed and sad stay I had on Monday June 26 in this property. The receptionist Alex, what unprofessional employee. The few encounters we had left me with a poor impression about his personality and his lack of customer service skills, he was very apathetic and disinterested emplyee. 

When I arrive I believe he judge me by my look ( I have a beard of a week, wearing shorts and t-shirt and I admitted, I wasn't in my best look ) I was standing there asking him if he was available to check me in, he just looked at me saying "NO"; I noticed it he was not taking care of none, asked him again and he totally ignored me, it took him minutes to realizes I was there to check in ( at this point he didn't know I was the person he spoke with early that day ). 
During the few minutes I was doing the check in, there wasn't a welcoming conversation, not recognition for being IHG member, not friendly at all and very distant, he seemed very upset and miserable.

After checking in went up to my room, noticed it a red spot on the carpet, wanted to reported but after the unprofessional welcome I received I'd rather to leave it alone. We were about to go to the concert but, all of sudden we started to smell like something was burning inside the room, we checked the bathroom but, we noticed the heater was on..weird...Temperature outside was 71 F and humidity 78%, we tried to turn it off but it was impossible, we read on the AC label that heater activates by outside temperature..??..It's Summer in NYC..so..we said, it will be off when we come back...

At 11'00pm we came back from the concert and, went to the front desk to get a new set of keys because we went through a lot of metal detectors at MSG and keys might get deactivated. I took a deep breath because I had to face Alex unprofessional manners again, while he was making keys, I asked about some cups. I didn't even finished my question when he shut me down saying " I'm making keys ..Let me finish "..WOW.. We grabbed the cups and went up to the room..SURPRISE!!..The room was hot as a sauna, the heater was on the entire time while we were at the concert, I went down and talk to Alex again, God this guy has some issues, told him about the heater in the room, No apologies, not empathy nor acknowledging the inconvenience the hotel was causing us, he just wrote down out room number and bye...

I've had enough of his attitude. I called IHG to report this kind of behavior and the lady on the phone told me it will be addressed. His mannerism and attitude made us feel very uncomfortable, it's sad and embarrassing for a hotel chain like IHG to have a spiritless and overbearing person like this character.

***UPDATE*** I forgot in the room a plastic bag with two electronic toothbrushes, dental floss, dental paste and a comb. I called today June 28 around 5:45am and spoke with a lady who doesn’t has an idea what time housekeeping department open, I was asking for lost and found and her vague response left in shock, she said housekeeping start working at 11am which is the check-out time and I should call at 12noon..REALLY??..Asked her what time the DEPARTMENT open and she has not clue what I’m talking about..THIS IS RIDICULOUS!!!

title: Gave away my room but charged me anyways
text: Showed up at the hotel only to be told that they don't have a room for me.  Was told by the host that my reservation was being canceled and then they charged my card for the full cost of the room the next day.  How do you get away with charging for something you didn't deliver?  They refuse to give me a refund so now that 1 room has given them profit from 2 people.  Will never book there again.  Ruined my whole vacation.  Had to drive 2.5 hours out of New York to find another room.

title: 8/10 GIO APPROVE
text: Amazing! Stayed at this holiday inn for 3 nights while having a boys trip in NY. I must say that it was clean and spacious room. Shout out to Henry truly a asset to this IHG location I would definitely go back. This locations didn’t fail. Thanks again!

title: Ugh but inexpensive option for Times Square area.
text: Good location and value, but BAD ELEVATOR service. Had to wait 10 or 15 mins for an elevator (yes all were working) during breakfast time. Small lobby and breakfast area made me just skip it. Don't think I'd go back unless was cheapest reasonable option.

title: A Solid More Affordable Hotel
text: I can usually find good deals on free nights and using points, but this year a good place in NYC was more expensive than ever. This hotel was the best deal I could find. The location was pretty good   The staff were all very friendly and very helpful. Rooms were small but fine. I would bring my own body  soap if you prefer liquid because they only had bar soap. I liked the included breakfast but mostly just got coffee because we were in a hurry or wanted a fancy bagel. It met our needs, and a friendly staff make all the difference.

title: Melhorar o atendimento.
text: Atendentes poderiam ter um pouco mais de educação, quis pegar uma água que estava em cima do balcão mas a atendente não deixou pegar dois elevadores mas maior parte do tempo só funcionava um. Café da manhã padrão americano bom. Porta automática algumas vezes não abria.

title: Alex at the front desk turned a negative stay into positive memory.
text: We didn't have the perfect expirience from the start . Reservations dropped and overbooking ending in us being moved  from the Candlewwod suites to this property.  Let's say it was a bumpy stay.  Alex at the  front desk handled unpleasnt guest  with grace and kindness.  He helped us out when we had issues and made me happy we stayed in the  his Hotel.  You never know the effect be kind can bring.

title: Probably my worst hotel ever.
text: One of the worst hotels I've stayed in in NYC.  Unwelcoming staff and the person was so botoxed she couldn't speak properly.  Very uncomfortable beds.  Very small rooms.  Cleanliness very questionable.  Elevator problem that was not solved over the weekend, forcing an interminable wait for the only one available covering the 30+ floors.  No house cleaning service during our stay.  The 600CAD room rate is simply a rip-off.

title: Muy sucio
text:
Lo unico bueno que tiene el hotel es que esta bien ubicado, pero es malisima la limpieza todo el hotel, el desayuno es de mala calidad y todos los dias te sirven las mismas dos cosas que tienen. Y antihigiénico ademas cómo está servido.
Consejo: no vayan!

title: NYC Vacay
text: Hotel has clean rooms, good breakfasts, no problems with hot water.  Small rooms but all fit . Within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants.  Very nice hosts especially Alex in the front desk.

title: Extremely friendly environment
text: What a wonderful stay! Alex was extremely helpful on our arrival and during our week long stay in Manhattan. It made our visit even more enjoyable! We will definitely include this hotel in our future travel plans/visits to New York.

title: Mixed bag. Nice people. Uncomfortable bed.
text: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. It is conveniently located in the Garment District which is just a few blocks from Times Square and Broadway theaters. Lots of restaurant choices nearby. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The room was very small but they all are in NYC. Our room door lock was very erratic. We would use the key card and get a green light but most of the time the door would stay locked. It would take us between 3-10 tries to get the door to open. The bed was one of the most uncomfortable beds I've ever slept in. We had a really nice view to the south. So I would not choose this hotel again because of the uncomfortable bed and door lock problems. But it wasn't so bad that we left and went to another hotel.

title: Entertainment event
text: I came to this hotel for an entertainment event. As soon as I walked in I was greeted by the hotel manger Alex. He was so nice & professional. He accommodated me & my friend with ease. Just from the experience alone I would recommend this hotel. I walked into the hotel everything was clean and very welcoming.

title: Amazing Manager
text: I recently stayed at this hotel for an event. We were on a time crunch and the manager Alex helped us tremendously.  He was very accommodating and went above and beyond for us. Alex was kind and made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel, for Alex alone.

title: Emplacement parfait pour quiconque veut visiter la grosse pomme
text:
Ayant choisi l'hotel pour sa localisation (située sur la 8th avenue et la 39th, a deux blocs de Times Square) et pour le service de bagagerie offert dans ce type de chaine, nous n'avons pas été déçus. Nous avons passé 3 nuits à l'hotel, dans une chambre double située au 28ème étage donnant directement sur la 8th. Superbe vue directement sur l'Empire State Building. La chambre était très propre et récente, tout comme la salle de bains. Rien à redire sur la propreté ni sur le service, tout le monde était très serviable et le petit déjeuner tout à fait suffisant. Toutefois, des tarifs elevés, des heures de pointe au niveau des ascenseurs et l'entrée de l'immeuble régulièrement squattée restent des points à améliorer

Je recommande

title: Sight seeing in New York
text:
This is a good place to go, price was reasonable and the included breakfast was good.
I want to say the fella named Alex at the front desk was delightful and extremely accommodating. He went out of his way to make my stay pleasurable, from recommending good restaurants to helping me small nonsense things.

title: friendly & helpful management, welcoming environment!
text: Booked a trip for our company of performers -- manager Alex was INCREDIBLY helpful in ensuring all of the details were ironed out & my guests had smooth transitions checking in & out. They all enjoyed their stay and felt welcome!

title: Great Customer Service!
text: Visited from Atlanta for my birthday weekend and Blanca and Alex were outstanding. Made my stay great and went the extra mile to acknowledge my birthday! A great asset to the HIEX Brand. Would recommend.

title: Vraiment express a fuir pour le prix on peut trouver mieux !
text:
Le seul point positif de cette hôtel est l’emplacement et le personnel accueillant. 
Très cher pour la prestation 760$ deux nuits . L’hôtel est à rafraîchir la chambre est classic et confortable nous avons eu froid car la couette est toute fine et le chauffage fonctionnait mais était très bruyant . Le bruit de la soufflerie extérieur est insupportable. La climatisation chaud froid est inutilisable car très brouillante aussi . 
Propose le petit déjeuner dans le prix mais comme le nom de l’hôtel il est express  pas de choix et tout y est industriel … pas de place pour s’assoir nous sommes remontés dans la chambre pour manger .   
Sur deux nuits nous avons pris un petit dej et le lendemain nous sommes sortis le prendre dehors .

title: Don’t go
text: the management and the staff are incompetent and pay no attention to complaints... Out of 11 days of stay, on three occasions the cleaning of our room was forgotten... And no one is present in the evening when we return to  do the housework.  When the room is cleaned, something is often missing (glasses, shampoo...).  One out of two elevators broken down for 9 days, for a hotel with 36 floors!  Therefore an endless wait at peak times.  During our entire stay, one of the 2 toasters was broken without anyone bothering to replace it

title: Great location Even better staff
text:
This location was great.  
Short walk to Times Square and Central Park
Short subway ride to SI Ferry,Brooklyn Bridge and ground zero! 
Only 1 elevator working which can mean extremely long delays going up and down. 
I was on 17 and took the steps DOWN everyday! Lol 
But what makes this a great place to stay is the staff.  Especially Alex!  His smile was bright and his attitude was infectious! 
Thank you for making our stay memorable!

title: LA PEOR
text:
Tiene dos ascensores uno FUERA DE SERVICIO y el otro fallando así que lo operan manual y las esperas son de más de 20 minutos para subir o bajar
Completamente absurdo.
El hotel debería estar sellado por todo tipo de razones lógicas

title: Unsafe, time-wasting disgrace - stay anywhere else
text:
The hotel currently has one elevator in service.

This one loft is totally insufficient to service over 200 rooms: at peak times you will wait 15 minutes to get up to your room.

Why is this unsafe? The hotel also has a major recurring problem with its key cards not actually working to open doors. Picture yourself having waited 15 minutes to get to your room: the elevator leaves but you discover you can’t unlock your room door. You’re trapped in a small corridor, with no means of contacting reception. You call the lift, but the call button keeps turning off- the lift is under manual operation and the calls are being wiped. You are stuck on the 35th floor. 20 minutes later I was eventually successful in not having a lift call cancelled. 40 minutes of my life I will never get back getting a replacement card and getting back up to my room again - whilst fearing the same thing would happen again.  

Having complained to the hotel - they made it clear that they didn’t care about making it right. Having made it clear I was concerned being trapped in a corridor was a safety issue, they eventually offered to send a member of staff to confirm the key card didn’t fail again and that I didn’t get trapped. When I arrived back at the hotel at 10pm tonight - I was told tough luck, no one was available to accompany me.  I was fortunate that my card worked, but watched another guest suffer the same problem on my way up.  It is a disgrace that the promised remedial action to make the situation safe was then not available. If it was physically possible to have left the hotel and checked in somewhere else with my schedule, I would have done.

If you care about not waiting 15-20 minutes to get to your room; if you care about not being trapped - DO NOT STAY HERE; it was clearly not an isolated incident.

I also didn’t get any housekeeping service. Having reported this, I was assured that my room would be serviced while I was out later that afternoon. It was not.

The worst hotel experience of my life - please spare yourself and go ANYWHERE else but here.

title: Celebrating Special Occasion
text: This hotel experience was wonderful. Everyone there was so kind, welcoming, and accommodating. Upon check in, I let staff know that we were there celebrating our anniversary and birthdays. Alex and Reign decorated the room for us and ensured that our stay was the best I've ever experienced. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff is friendly, professional, and efficient. Also, the hotel is very close to Times Square and everywhere you want to be! Reign and Alex, you are the best!

title: Simple and quite low quality hotel. Don’t expect amazing, but it’s close to many places to visit
text: It’s a simple hotel. Took 3 days to get extra coffee. Lift constantly working sounding like a subway at all times! It’s along a dingy street. Breakfast is basic and crowded. Take a box to make up your own lunch! If you need somewhere central and accessible then this will do.

title: Goed hotel met een centrale ligging
text:
Goed hotel en een dito ligging. De kamers aan de achterzijde van het hotel liggen rustig. Aan de voorzijde is meer geluid van verkeer en dergelijke waarneembaar.

De kamers zijn aan de kleine kant en hebben geen van allen een schitterend uitzicht. Verder kan ik geen kanttekening plaatsen.

title: Juste bon pour dormir
text:
Chambre avec mobilier très fatigué et salle de bain très mal entretenue.
Un ascenseur sur 2 en panne pendants tous le séjour,occasionnant beaucoup d attente pour en avoir un à l heure du petit déjeuner

title: Birthday trip!!!
text: My twin sister and I chose NYC to celebrate our birthday we stayed at this Hotel for the location and the price. The front desks staff is AMAZING Rain has excellent customer service skills and always greeted us by name every time we entered and exited from the hotel. And then we met Alex WOW he took custom service to the next level when he found out we were there for our birthday he had balloons, candy, water, and a teddy bear in our room when we returned from a day out. He went above and beyond to make sure our stay was good. I would recommend staying here if you want good customer service and a front desk staff that cares about people is very refreshing.

title: Great Staff
text:
Overall experience was great the main reason for that is the exceptional support of the all staff members specially from Orlando, the office manager. Staff was very kind & helpful on all our concerns & provided solutions to make our stay comfortable as possible.

As always with a  Holiday Inn Express, the only concern was the complementary breakfast menu. Would have been the best if it changed to a different menu every day.

Again it was great efforts taken from Orlando & team to make the stay comfortable for all guests.

title: Excelente hospedagem!
text: Hotel com excelente localização. Muito próximo do metrô (estação Times Square). Café da manhã muito bom. Cordialidade dos funcionários em especial ao Alex. Este foi muito atencioso durante nossa hospedagem. Com certeza retornaria a este hotel em uma nova visita a Nova York.

title: Great Place! Great services!! Great Management !!!(Kudos to Alex)
text: The staffs were very polite and friendly especially ALEX!! who demonstrated an excellent, caring, polite, friendly  and hospitable  mannerism towards customers.. This is definitely a place to explore …. I will definitely stay there again when in NY

title: Amazing customer service. We love Alex!!
text: I really enjoyed my time here for a couple days. Conveniently located just a block away from Times Square, and has many shops around. Not to mention the customer service was excellent! Alex at the front desk was a 5 star representative! He was absolutely AMAZING and accommodated our EVERY need. Not to mention he’s a Virgo like me! I loved him!!! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Manhattan.

title: Excelente atención
text: Una bienvenida muy calurosa y amable por parte de Alex. Una atención personalizada. Muy agradable. Me encantó el lugar y nos dieron una habitación muy cómoda. El lugar tiene muchas cosas accesibles y Alex nos hizo recomendaciones muy valiosas para diversión y seguridad.

title: Ti rubano i soldi!
text:
Sono stata insieme al mio ragazzo e a suoi genitori per una settimana in questo hotel. 
La camera sporca fin dalla consegna delle chiavi e nei giorni successivi non l’hanno mai pulita! 
La vasca era sporca, e ci hanno sempre dato un asciugamano in meno del dovuto. 
Ma non è questo il peggio. Il primo giorno prendono dalla mia carta la cauzione di 250€ e fin qui tutto bene. Alle 4 del mattino della quarta notte lì ci hanno prelevato dalla carta SENZA AVVISARE 270$ al che il mattino dopo scendiamo a chiedere spiegazioni, nessuno ci dava risposte concrete e dicevano che dovevamo parlare con la manager che sarebbe arrivata alle 3 del pomeriggio. 
Finalmente più tardi parliamo con lei che ci spiega che le donne delle pulizie ci hanno fatto le foto in camera (cosa che non può essere per privacy) ad un pacchetto di heets insinuando che avessimo fumato dentro la camera, cosa ovviamente non vera. Al che ci dicono che ci avrebbero restituito i soldi che ancora non abbiamo visto. 
La notte dopo prelevano altri 260$ senza dire di nuovo nulla, dopo le richieste spiegazioni ci viene detto che è una tassa senza spiegare nulla chiaramente. 
Ad oggi stiamo ancora aspettando i soldi
Pessimo! Non andate!

title: Pessima accoglienza
text:
Sono stata ospite di questo hotel e la sola cosa positiva è stata la posizione ! Ci hanno prelevato di notte tre volte somme di denaro , una sola ad oggi restituita , non sapendo dire  il motivo … un errore di sistema , la carta prepagata , ed infine multa per aver fumato in camera ( assolutamente non vero) solo perché è stato ritrovato e fotografato ( evviva la privacy)un pacchetto di sigarette elettroniche con sigarette già utilizzare all’interno come si è soliti fare con quel tipo di sigarette ( il pacchetto e fatto apposta)! Discutiamo e ci viene detto
Che ci sarà rimborsato perché è stato ovviamente un errore( ad oggi zero)
La manager di faceva desiderare e noi dovevamo trovare in hotel a metà giornata per avere spiegazioni !
Camere sporche e addirittura il week non ti rifanno  il letto ne’ puliscono il bagno!
Insetti passeggiavano tranquillamente sul
Bancone della colazione 
Da NON ripetere

title: La peor experiencia de mi vida
text:
Me quedé 8 noches con mi pareja.
Nueva York, enero, pleno invierno.
Llegamos al check in y la persona que nos recibió nos habló de mala manera y nos cobró cosas de mas sin explicarnos nada.
Llegamos a la habitación y no teníamos calefacción, no andaba (estabamos en pleno invierno de Nueva York), desde ese dia fuimos a la recepción TODOS los dias a pedir que la arreglen o nos cambien de habitación. La rutina era levantarnos a la mañana, pedir que la arreglen,nos decian que vayamos tranquilos a pasear porque la iban a arreglar, irnos a pasear y cuando volvíamos estaba todo igual.
Esta rutina sucedió 5 dias, durante esos dias nos enfermamos por el frio que pasabamos en la habitación.
Despues de nuestra quinta noche en la habitación ya fuimos a pedir directamente un cambio de habitación, la respuesta fue que no había, nada mas. Mas tarde ese dia fuimos a decir que si no nos bb cambiaban de habitación nos ibamos del hotel y la persona que nos atendió (se llamaba Blanca o Bianca, una persona con muy mala predisposición y muy poco profesional) se nos reía en la cara, luego de eso logramos conseguir que nos cambien de habitación. 
Luego de ir a una habitación con calefacción nuestras 3 noches restantes fuimos a pedir un descuento de nuestra estadia el cual arreglamos que iba a ser de un 20%.

Al momento del check out de repente la impresora no andaba, supuestamente no podian mandar mails, todo esto al momento en el cual nos tenían que dar el recibo de la estadía para chequear el descuento, luego de estar media hora pidiendo que nos lo manden y ya con poco tiempo nos llega el recibo y vemos que hicieron menos descuento del que nos prometieron (lo prometió Orlando, el manager, lo hablamos con el al lado de dos personas de la recepción). Al parecer Orlando, no es una persona de palabra ni una persona responsable.

En conclusión no volvería nunca, en esa misma zona hay muchos hoteles, mucho mejores y por el mismo precio. No se lo deseo a nadie el ir a este hotel

title: Nope
text: This hotel is barely acceptable. It is in need of renovation desperately. It isn’t terribly clean, there is virtually no hot water even after running for an extended period of time. The sink stopper broken, sink counter marked up. Toilet runs constantly. Room service should either be all or nothing. Over three days was a a weird combo of something’s touched and others not. I would not recommend this hotel for your stay.

title: HYATT place New York City/Times Square
text: Hôtel superbement situé, près de Times Square, beaucoup de visites se font à pied, le métro et bus proches, accueil chaleureux, Hôtel agréable mais les chambres sont très petites, trop petites. Aucun rangement. Chambre proposée pour 3 ou 4 couchages. Les chambres pour 2 personnes sont correctes .

title: Avoid if you can
text:
The 1st room given on the 5th floor looked like something out of Bates Motel, the dust was at least 2cm thick, handles fell off , heater hanging off wall and the lights / lamps couldn’t make the room light due to facing some sort of wall it was just like a dungeon 
When I went to complain was met with a laugh by Avasha,

title: What a Dump!
text:
Hands down the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in. I choose it for the location and price. I had very, very low expectations of which the hotel managed to exceed. The common areas are filthy. The elevator and hallways were never vacuumed in the 5 days I was there. I kept hoping “maybe today is the day”. The only time my room was cleaned was the day before I checked out. I was usually gone by noon everyday so couldn’t figure that one our. I really don’t require daily housekeeping service when I travel but at least refresh the room a bit and take out the garbage. The staff broke the cardinal rule in the service industry and that is “the customer is always right”. Upon check in I pointed out that the safe in my room wasn’t working to the front desk only to be told “Are you sure?” That’s right, I’m an idiot cause I can’t program a hotel safe. There is no variety of choice for breakfast. Everyday it was either scrambled eggs or “cheese” omelettes, sausages, oatmeal, apples and bananas. That’s it. Maybe they’re not used to multi night stays. I had better food and service at the Pret a Manger on the corner and I was certainly hungry cause you have to run the gauntlet of pot smokers hanging around the front door everyday. When I checked out the clerk said “You’re all set”. When I asked for a copy of my bill they actually said “Seriously?” like it was a problem to print a bill. The shelf above the toilet came off the wall my second to last night when I just set my shaving kit on it to do some pre packing. Maintenance just moved it over and screwed it back into the wall so it’s not in symmetry with the toilet. Unbelievable.

Now for the good news to explain my 2 star review. The bed was extremely comfortable and I slept like a baby because it is surprisingly very quiet. I did not hear slamming doors, people next door, traffic, vacuuming at 8am (see above) etc. So it is what it is. Comfortable bed and shower 3 blocks from Times Square. Shop around, there are way better options nearby for the same price.

title: Perfect off Times Square
text: Perfect location that is super close to Times Square and Hell’s Kitchen. Be wary of the sketchy people in major intersections. The street is lined with hotels so it felt a little safer. There’s a 7/11 nearby and liquor across the street. The hotel is 5 minutes away from Penn Station/ Madison Square Garden. The hotel clerks were very nice and informative! We picked this hotel because there was free breakfast!! But go earlier because it gets so busy after 8. The elevators were slow during breakfast rush time! Overall loved the experience in this hotel! It’s noisy in NYC. Try to get higher levels if possible

title: Horrendous
text: I definitely would NOT recommend this hotel , check your bill , terrible management , horrendous lack of communication, we had to keep asking room service for things , everyday there was an issue , certainly won’t deal with this hotel again !!!!

title: Good hotel in bad part of town
text:
I've traveled to NYC five or six times now, and each time I go I have a good time. This time we were there over Thanksgiving and enjoyed the parade, a Broadway performance and some great food. We chose this Holiday Inn Express as our basecamp since we had stayed there previously and enjoyed our other stay. This time was quite the letdown though... and not so much because of anything the hotel can control. Here are my pros/cons and an explanation.
Pros: 
- Decent/free breakfast
- Close to Times Square
- Slightly more affordable than most similar options
Cons:
- The breakfast area got a bit crowded but it wasn't too bad... my family of four was always able to find somewhere to eat
- The location, while close to many of the sights, has really gone downhill lately. Lots of homeless people around. People that were peddling drugs. Marijuana smoke everywhere. Trash left in the street and on the sidewalk. I used to feel safe walking in this area late at night but not any more.
- On the 14th floor (our floor) there was a very strong weed/pot smell when we came back one night. Someone had obviously been smoking a lot in their room and it seeped out under the door. I believe the hotel sent someone up shortly later to clean the public area as it smelled like cleaning spray, and that helped a fair amount, but really disappointed that this is even an issue at the hotel.

I don't know if I'd stay at this hotel again, based on how it seems this part of town has gone downhill. Really, it seems like most of the city is this way now. If you get a hotel right on Broadway or 5th Avenue then it seems like those areas are still well maintained, though those hotels cost considerably more.

title: Decent enough!
text: For the money (we paid around £180 for a night), this hotel delivers exactly what it needs to. Cheap and cheerful, no frills, decent customer service and an adequate breakfast included. Rooms are basic but functional. For the price, you can't complain.

title: It's a place to sleep. Nothing more or less
text: The folks here are quite helpful and friendly, however the hotel itself is bare bones. The rooms are pretty basic. They're clean, but not incredibly spacious. There's no gym (Are you paying attention AmEx, y'all got this wrong!). There's plenty of food options around. It's easy to grab a cab or hop on the subway.

title: Just Adequate
text:
I chose this hotel for it's location, price, and the room photo showed a chair (which other hotels did not ). Check-in was easy and desk clerk was very helpful. The location is great; only two blocks from Times Square, and restaurants and theaters are nearby. Desk staff provided walking directions and restaurant suggestions. I observed breakfast staff really being helpful also.

When I got to the room the AC was blasting cold air, the room was freezing and the thermostat didn't respond. I tried to call the desk, however I could hear them but they couldn't hear me. So down 28 floors to explain the situation. Staff quickly responded and reset the thermostat to fix the problem.  The room was clean, however the bathroom vanity paint was peeling and the desk was scratched.  The overall appearance was quite dated. I then noticed that there was no chair in the room.  When I asked for one the desk staff said they didn't have any available. How can you have a desk but no chair?  So sitting on the bed was the only option. The breakfast area was cramped, but not uncomfortable, and the food was basic eggs, sausage and breads, with some fruit (the hot sweet rolls were really good). 

Overall, not a bad experience.  Kudos to the friendly and helpful staff.  But this place really needs repairs and updating.

title: Awesome Hotel!
text: I stayed at this hotel and it was great for me.  The rooms are clean and has high standards …very central to everything and very affordable for time square….the complimentary breakfast was also very good…the staff are excellent and very well trained!   Overall very good!

title: Decent hotel, centrally located.  good choice
text: Good customer service, very clean rooms, good breakfast, value for money.  It is centrally located, easy to get transportation.  House keeping is also very good.  Breakfast had options for veg and non veg. I really liked the hotel.

title: Worst and most expensive Hotel I’m stayed in
text:
I generally always use IHG when I stay away as they are generally good to the point I achieved Diamond Elite status with the rewards scheme. We decided to go to New York for our 20 year anniversary for a week and stayed in an indigo hotel in the Lower East Side, which was fine. For our last three nights we decided to move closer to Times Square and booked this hotel as it had 4 stars on here. 
I can honestly say this is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed in. There are homeless in the street  injecting pretty much outside the hotel, I know this is nothing to do with the actual hotel but it’s a disgrace. When we checked in I received no welcome points, drink or complimentary upgrade, when we got to the room it was just beyond tired and I wouldn’t say it was that clean either. I payed stupidly £2400 for three nights which wasn’t even worth £100 a night. You couldn’t sleep with the air con on, there were handles missing off furniture, leather patches torn off the office chair, stains on the carpet, a leaking toilet etc… I complained straight away and was asked to email the manager, which I did. The next day we returned from a lovely day out to the room not even made up the only thing changed was towels which had been replaced with thread bear towels. Again not happy so I emailed the hotel manager again as well as the email for the hotel, no response to either. We stayed three nights and the room wasn’t cleaned once, in fact the whole hotel was dirty with bits on the carpets to the landings. 
During check out I refused to pay until I seen the manager, who did actually come and see me at this point I wasn’t happy and she was told so. She apologised and agreed the hotel was tired and told me she had been at a conference and hadn’t had chance to catch-up with emails and wished she had known as she would have moved us to another hotel. She discounted $958 from our $2544 bill FOR THREE NIGHTS. Which if honest I still was far from happy with. 
To top this off we returned home to find out that the hotel had charged us another unknown bill of £351 to my credit card on top of the original discounted bill. I have emailed the manager and hotel twice in the past two days with no response (must be on another conference) I have now gone through the diamond elite contact to push it on. 
This hotel and management are a joke, please avoid.

title: Check your bills before you leave
text:
Don't leave the hotel before you check your bills. you will be charged extra $$$ on nothing. Also, the hotel never answer your calls and IHG will not help you. 

DO NOT stay here, smells so bad in every floor and the front desk will charge you for their loss or missing money. 

Be aware of all IHG hotels and their charging system. DO NOT trust this property

title: Excelente Localização
text: Estive hospedada neste hotel em Setembro com a minha família e na generalidade gostei muito. A localização é excelente, está perto de tudo e com estação de metro próxima. O hotel tem ainda a vantagem de ter pequeno almoço incluído, o que é uma grande ajuda. As únicas coisas que acho que deveriam repensar é o espaço para o pequeno almoço, que se torna pequeno e o fato de só fazerem limpeza de dois em dois dias.

title: Hot tip - pick this one!
text: I always stay at the Barclay in New York, but the United Nations General Assembly coincided with the dates of current trip. IHG offered Holiday Inn Express as an alternative. I have to admit, after reading reviews I was less than impressed with the curb appeal. However staff (and elevators) all seemed to be working just fine. The not-so-impressive lobby area is actually quite functional, and staff was helpful with storing luggage after a super early arrival. I cannot say enough about the location, at 39th you are a short walk from Times Square, but also very close to Hell's Kitchen restaurants and even the arts center down towards Chelsea. I am traveling alone, so space is not a big concern, but desk and internet are appreciated. I do have to maneuver the chair out of the way when not using the desk, but that's really not a big issue. Another great perk is the free breakfast. I'm an early riser and close to 6am it has never been more than me an 3/4 others in the breakfast area. Each day has been a slight variation, all good and a great (cheap) way to start your day. I 100% recommend this property. Only about 6 rooms per floor, but elevators remained totally functioning my entire stay. I take yearly trips to NYC to see a few plays and I think I have found my new 'home.'

title: One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at
text: Where does one begin. The decor is shabby neglected and crumbling. The reception staff couldn’t be more disinterested if they no longer had a pulse. The carpets were stained the vinyl on the chairs was peeling the bathroom tiles were cracked and the furniture broken. I needed an early morning check-in because the flight landed very early so we booked and pre-paid for the night before and they told us that they had canceled the reservation because we came late notwithstanding it had already been paid and the money had been taken. And it isn’t cheap. Appalling value for a dreadful hotel. Avoid at all costs.

title: Dreadful physical plant
text: Lovely and willing staff can’t make up for the shabby and poorly maintained hotel.  Peeling wallpaper, mold in shower, no safety chain on door,etc.  This is typical of IHGs lack of franchise quality control.  The thermostat controls are so old you can’t see the readout.  I had to have the maintenance staff come up to adjust the control,

title: Rooms small perhaps a bit dated but all you need and clean. Would stay again lovely and central
text:
We were on 16th floor so away from the noise although you could still hear a bit. The hairdryer didn’t work phoned down and within 5 mins a replacement one was provided.  The First Lady who checked us in recommended an Italian restaurant called Tony’s ,  So we went and it was the best spaghetti bolognaise Ive every had and we thought reasonable priced.  The lady with blue hair extended our checkout to 2pm which was great.

We would stay here again as room has everything you need, we didn’t have a problem with staff and it is central for everything.

title: Hotel needs lots of repairs (elevator beware !!!!)
text:
Hello let me start off by saying that pandemic has put a dent in the hotel industry, but this hotel has really put the ihg name in a hole! I am a Gold status ihg frequent traveler and expect a decent room and functional get around plan. Today this place failed bad my wife was stuck on the elevator 17th floor with 7 more including 2 children  that almost went into a panic attack after elevator hot no a/c and the only elevator working for 13 minutes , 36 floors 1 elevator working and apparently the 2nd one was not operating that day only, when instead were told it has been broke on and off for weeks! Very disappointed when I first walked in the room was dirty 8 trash bags in front of room broken bathroom door would not shut, 2 kind young ladies were able to assist us and get us better rooms for our 3 day stay. Service was great hotel needs lots and lots of work!!  

NOT EVEN EXAGGERRATING.  FIRE DEPARTMENT WAS CALLED FROM ELEVATOR BY THE KIDS FATHER. FIRE DEPT. CHIEF TOLD MR.CRUZ FIX THIS OR WE WILL SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN THIS IS NOT THE FIRST TIME!!!

title: Family Trip to N.Y.C.
text:
We arrived  late after 3 hours delayed at J.F.K. On arrival  we did not get  an acknowledgement straight  away  the reception  staff  came across  as rude and seemed  to struggle  with  the concept of booking  in two rooms. She called for help from  a Co worker and due to his attitude and time they were taking to book us in the conversation became  heated! 
After receiving and paying  for our rooms we found  that the hotel  had only one  lift which is ridiculous for buildings  in N.Y.C later I found  that  the problem was going on months before  our arrival. 

Staffing  was limited to say the Least. Breakfast could best be described as chaotic with not enough  seating for the numbers of guests requiring it.

On the day of our departure I witnessed guests  arguing  with
Hotel  staff ,most probably  due to
Customer service issues. 
I left feeling  embarrassed  and hugely disappointed  that I had booked  this Hotel. 
When  we left the staff did not acknowledge us .

title: Viaggio di nozze
text: Servizio in camera pessimo non cambiano lenzuola  sono poco attenti  per il turista e sgarbati non lo consiglio a chi ci deve andare  ci hanno fatto pagare due volte la cauzione per due prenotazioni nella stessa struttura ancora non abbiamo ricevuto il rimborso

title: Terrible
text:
The rooms are neglected, the water flow is very weak in the shower and toilet, so much so that it is impossible to take a shower. We asked them to fix it a number of times and nothing was done about it. There was a water outage in the building for a whole day and we were not given any option to shower or go to the bathroom. We had to find a paid place... and so did all the guests.
In addition, the maids lost an expensive object that I was told I would get the value of from the insurance and to this day I have not received it..

title: Charged my credit card for prepaid room and falsely claiming they will refund
text:
Booked on reservations.com and had a prepaid voucher. The hotel continued to charge my credit card with many claims by front desk that this would be refunded. Now 2 weeks since checkout and no refund though i have escalated to hotel and to reservations.com

Last time i called hotel - they did not answer the phone.

title: Great location, but dated rooms
text:
Great location, but dated rooms, long breakfast queue, 1 lift broken for 2 out of our 3 days stay.
Half decent breakfast.
Best part is the location, 5 mins walk to times Square.

Check-in was smooth, no problems at all. 
Stayed with wife and 2 boys

title: Holiday Inn Express  W 39th Street
text: Melanie checked us in on 7/25 shortly before 3:00pm. I was told that early check-in cost $65. Check-in process was okay. Room was decent, and clean. The cleaning lady on our floor was nice enough to ask if we needed anything. Stayed for 2 nights, Breakfast was good, adequate selection. I want to compliment Sadesha (hope I spelled her name right), Approached her on 7/26 morning regarding our key card.  She was courteous and very helpful. Also, to Miss Deirdre, She listened to my concerns about a situation.  We have seen so much hate and injustice and that should stop. Unfortunately, the Receptionist, "Mr. D" I encountered on both 7/25 and 7/26 evening was extremely rude, to say the least.  Sad though for anyone who had an unpleasant encounter with him. Haven't met an extremely rude, impolite hotel receptionist in all my hotel stays here and abroad.  Sad that my sons had to witness that.  I don't know about my future IHG stay, this isn't my first stay with IHG grp hotel. Holiday Inn was actually the very first hotel I remembered staying in my home country.  We'll see how IHG deals with this situation.  Spread love and blessings y'all!

title: Overcharged and Shameful attitude
text:
I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. After returning to the UK after a long travel period I discovered the hotel had taken a further 3 charges from my bank account equalling over £900. I was later issued an invoice showing the charges were for an extra 3 nights which I did not stay or book for. I immediately contacted the hotel, which meant I was charged for international call, and revived no response. I further contacted the hotel on email. After 48 hours had past their was still no response. 

I contacted IHG guest relations service who advised me I could only get a refund directly from hotel and said there was nothing they could do about it, despite their job being to support guests! Guest relations created a chain email with myself and the Hotel and still no correspondence was made by the hotel. 

It has been 2 weeks since the last charge was taken from my account and I have still not had a single response from the hotel, despite several emails being sent. Guest relations have now told me I have to contact my bank to resolve the issue which is an extreme inconvenience for both myself and the bank. 

I am truly disgusted at the service I have received. The money that was taken I had intended to use for further travel however I have had to pause these plans as I no longer have the funds to support this, causing me great stress and upset. I have never had such a negative experience with a company and I can honestly say I will not be staying at a IHG hotel in the future. 

I can’t believe a huge company like IHG guest relations can’t solve an issue like this for their guests, extremely poor service! 

I’m also in disbelief that a modern hotel is unable to response to a basic email by a guest and can’t answer a telephone call.

title: Great location, ok hotel
text:
Stayed at this hotel because it was about 5 blocks from Madison Square Garden, and 1 block from my office. Hotel was  39,000 points or $335 cash, expensive if paying cash, but a great deal with points.

I got to my room to find the AC didn't work. I called the front desk at 6 and was told someone would be there in 20 minutes, at 6:30 they told me they marked it urgent so the person would come ASAP, at 6:45 I said I had to go. The assured me that my room would be cool when I got back from MSG. I came back to an extremely hot room at 11:30pm. That also happens to be the time the engineer left, so they had to switch my room (just want I wanted to do at that hour). The new room was cool but the tub was nasty, but it was midnight and I just wanted to shower and get to bed. 

Breakfast in the morning was fine.
