Rooms were your typical tiny NYC rooms. I got a room on the 35th floor (out of 36), so city views were pretty good, but wasn't really in the room much to enjoy it. There are only 6 rooms per floor, so every room is near the elevator.

title: Decent for NYC
text:
We looked for quite a while and this one came up with a decent price, so we grabbed it for 5 days. There are no view rooms, but we did pay a bit extra for high floors, to keep street noise at bay.

The hotel says they want a resort fee, but we were not charged any. We parked in Jersey at the train station, and rode into Penn Station, this place is very close to the station. They let us check in at 1030 am, I was amazed.

The King room was small for overall standards, but huge for NYC. It was clean, but there wasnt any maid service, we just got new towels hauled up by staff. Only 1 elevator was working most of the time, so we let them deal with that.

Breakfast was included, the area was very small, but the food was pretty good. It saved us the hassle and $$$ expense of eating elsewhere. It was a real time saver.
There is a nice deli on the corner of 9th ave, for other snacks.

Overall as good as could be hoped for , and a bargain for NYC.

title: Great Find!
text: Great location with spectacular view. Ask for a higher floor at a minimal cost. Perfect for a family but tight. Breakfast was quick and easy but get down before 8:30am or you’re in a big lineup. Only 2 elevators so expect waits at certain times. Staff was awesome and friendly. Rooms are dated but clean. Great price for location and having breakfast included. Definitely would book again!

title: Non ci sono parole!
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per 9 notti presso questo hotel e non abbiamo avuto l'onore di vedere le camere pulite  per l'intero periodo della ns permanenza! Abbiamo dovuto chiedere gli asciugamani puliti e persino la carta igienica! Per non parlare poi dei pasticci fatti alla reception con le carte di credito! Devo ancora capire adesso quanto abbiamo speso! Unica nota a favore la posizione!

title: Horrible experience ever. So deceiving
text: Most horrible experience ever. All the information and pictures put up by them are absolutely deceiving. This ruined our whole NYC trip. They don’t have parking lots nor do they offer us any. The rooms are extremely tiny- worse than a studio room. Last but not the least- the front desk guy HAKIM was extremely rude and is probably a racist. When asked about the deceiving pics and the information on the site he offers a refund and asks us to stay somewhere else as if this useless hotel belongs to his dad 😂 I hope my review saves someone else’s day, money and effort.

title: Granddaughter's 16th birthday present! a trip to NY City
text: The location of the hotel couldn't be better, I looked out my window and I was so close to the Empire State building I could throw a stone and hit it. Great area to shopping, restaurants etc. The beds comfortable and great to have coffee ready in the morning... happy camper

title: Rooms are cleaned every 5 days we’ve been told, and not even that is true...
text: The bathtub was full of hairs when we arrived, the rooms are cleaned every 5 days because of Covid, we’ve been told! No bin bags in the trash cans, we had to find our own bags and empty the bin everyday by ourselves. Clean the room every 5 days means drop clean towels on top of the bed... the floor was not cleaned at all. Breakfast room is very small for a 36 floors hotel... food available is not enough for the amount of guests and there is not enough staff to refill it fast enough, empty the bins or clean the tables... some of the days only 1 person was there...

title: Pior hospedagem da vida
text: Pior hotel que já me hospedei na vida! Quem quiser passar raiva pode se hospedar nele. Quarto sujo, fedorento e antigo. Alias, o hotel inteiro fede. Rs Ficamos 5 dias nele e pasme  não limparam o quarto nenhum dia, apesar de falarem que iam limpar. Recepcionistas extremamente mal educados, principalmente um estrangeiro que com cara de boliviano. Alem disso tudo acima exposto, ainda cobraram indevidamente uma hospedagem que falaram que iam estornar e até agora nada.  No último dia nos hospedamos no hotel ao lado, que diga-se de passagem é outro nível de hotel e pelo mesmo valor. A única vantagem desse lixo de hotel é a localização.

title: Kann man nur empfehlen, wenn man für sein Geld wenig erwartet
text:
Hotel: das Holiday Inn Express Time Square ist günstig gelegen, ist aber definitv KEINE Empfehlung:
-Zimmerservice/Reinigung fand nicht statt,
-das Frühstück ist eine Zumutung- Einweggeschirr mit immer demselben Angebot/kaum Auswahl, der Nachschub der Buffetteile (Kaffee, Brot, Obst, Müsli usw.) dauerte ewig, weil immer nur eine Person vom Hotel für das Frühstück zuständig war,
-Der Frühstücksbereich ist viel zu klein dimensioniert: 36 Stockwerke x 6 Zimmer pro Etage mit mind. 2 Personen pro Zimmer ergibt 432 Personen, die in einen Raum mit ca 50 Plätzen essen wollen. Es war immer voll bzw. man musste sehr lange auf einen Platz warten,
-Fahrstühle mindestes einmal am Tag defekt; bei 36 Stockwerken eine Frechheit, wenn man mit Koffern ein oder auscheckt,
-Meine Kreditkarte wurde über mehrere Tage vom Hotel belastet, da angeblich der Veranstalter nicht bezahlt hat- ein klärendes Gespräch führte glücklicherweise zu einer Einigung,
-Rezeptionspersonal wollte kein Taxi bestellen, weil sie das nie machen!

Wir werden dort kein Zimmer mehr buchen und ich kann jeden nur empfehlen, dies auch nicht zu tun!

title: Ottima pozione!
text:
Quando si pernotta in queste catene alberghiere si è certi di aver una camera decente è un bagno pulito.
E così è stato. Tutto normale e pulito.
Colazione pessima, povera e scarsa.
Cambio giornaliero su 5gg una sola volta!

Pessimi la reception che si sono trattenuti più di 600$… si avete letto bene, SEICENTO, per mi sono stati restituiti dopo 10 giorni!

title: Instalaciones antiguas y sucio
text:
Las instalaciones son antiguas. Solo hay dos ascensores y se colapsan, sobretodo a la hora del desayuno. Hemos tenido que esperar más de 10 min. y bajar a pie 18 pisos en más de una ocasión. 
En las 10 noches que hemos estado no han limpiado la habitación. Hemos tenido que pedir toallas limpias y otros amenities de baño.
El desayuno es pésimo. Ofrecen muy poca variedad y cada día exactamente lo mismo. La calidad de los productos es mala. Además el comedor es minúsculo y se llena de gente en seguida. Es poco higiénico y sin ninguna medida Covid. Más de un día hemos cogido los cafés y desayunado en la habitación. 
Si bien cuando haces la reserva el precio indicado incluye los impuestos y las tasas, una vez en el hotel, nos han sumado otros conceptos.
Eso sí, la ubicación es perfecta. En la 8a avenida con la calle 39, a 10 minutos a pie de Times Square.
Pero no es un hotel de 3 estrellas ni mucho menos. Se paga la ubicación.

title: Don’t stay here!
text: Checked in on April 3, 2022. Right away I noticed the lobby being very dirty looking and not welcoming at all. Once checked in, we walked over to the hallway with 2 elevators. One which had a sign saying it wasn’t working. We waited and waited and noticed the other elevator never moved from the 34th floor. Some guy that may have been a Manager was walking around and I asked him about it. He kind of shrugged his shoulders and said they are working on it. We waited several minutes more and I went to the front desk and asked about it and he said he didn’t know what was going on. Said I could use the stairs. Mind you, I have luggage and am on the 19th floor!! As we were also standing there I noticed a “ homeless” looking guy stumbling in off the street smelling of weed and making his way thru the hall. One of the people working there was telling him as he was walking by, that he couldn’t go back there and needed to leave but he ignored them and kept walking. I never saw anyone go after him. That really bothered me since I was just traveling with my daughter, and I got a bad gut feeling so I went up to the desk and said I wanted to cancel my room and go elsewhere. No apology, front desk said ok, but I’d have to cancel thru booking.com which is where I booked it from. I got charged for 1 night which I am still working on getting back. But do yourself a favor, and go elsewhere. Definitely a shady hotel.

title: Fantastica New York
text:
Siamo stati in questo hotel a fine marzo. Consigliatissimo per la vicinanza a Times  Square e ai mezzi pubblici.La colazione è ripetitiva ma con i costi di New York va più che bene.
L'arredamento è datato e nella nostra camera il riscaldamento era un po' troppo rumoroso. Un servizio molto utile è il deposito bagagli per  chi come noi parte di sera.Lo consiglio soprattutto per chi usa l'hotel esclusivamente come base,per rientrare alla sera dopo tanto girovagare per la città che è meravigliosa.

title: No reserven con la opción de pagar en el hotel
text: Hice una reservación con más de 6 meses de anticipación y nunca me apareció la opción de pagar en el momento, solo de pagar al llegar al hotel; al salir rumbo al aeropuerto,  me llego un correo de que no habían podido hacer el cargo con la tarjeta que hice la reservación , cambie la tarjeta por otra y salí rumbo a nyc, al llegar me encuentro un mensaje que mi reservación había sido cancelada, el precio que me manejaban en ese momento si quería volver a reservar era casi el doble!!!!  Ibamos 7 personas entre ellas mis padres los cuales son adultos mayores y tuve que buscar otro hotel a las 11 pm que llegamos; tuve que pagar más que la reservación original,  por un hotel más lejos que este  que reserve con mucho tiempo de anticipación para que no me pasara lo que me paso en cuanto a precios, y lo pague con la tarjeta que inicialmente “supuestamente” no había pasado, lo cual me lleva a pensar que por haber reservado con un precio más bajo, al que tenía ya no les convenía mi reservación original

title: Siguen sin devolverme el depósito. Asco de hotel
text:
Ha pasado un mes desde que nos hospedamos ahí y siguen sin reembolsarnos o removernos el hold de los depósitos que se hacen por seguridad del hotel. Sigo esperando que me devuelvan mi dinero fueron 6 depósitos y no he visto nada. 
La limpieza es inexistente.
El peor hotel en el que me he hospedado en mi vida.
NO SE HOSPEDEN AHÍ. LO DEBERÍAN CERRAR!

title: They don’t clean the rooms at all/ heating does not work
text:
Heating did not work / they never cleaned the room in the 3 nights I stayed
Elevator did not work 
Location is good
Breakfast is good
Since room wasn’t clean I asked for clean towels, they never brought the towels
The room is fine but service is really bad
If you go in cold season and heating does not work, I do not recommend to book this hotel

title: Uno staff eccezionale!
text: Stiamo passando la nostra fantastica vacanza a NYC Dormendo in questo hotel , strategico per la posizione e con una ottima colazione . Le camere sono un po’ Old school e il servizio Wi-Fi un po’ lento , soprattutto nelle camere più in alto. Voto 10 al personale , soprattutto al signor Orlando ! Ha risolto i nostri problemi in 10 minuti! Grazie mille ! Super consigliato !

title: Cobros exagerados y no cumplen.
text: Estuve hospedado en el hotel alrededor de 5 días a través de Expedia.com. En teoría me costaba alrededor de 750 todo, pero me pidieron un adelanto de 150 dólares para reservar, lo que en teoría debía después de la reserva eran 600 dólares. Al llegar al hotel, me pidieron la tarjeta de crédito para soportar el pago y me dijeron que había un depósito de 50 dólares por noche en caso de que algo se perdiera o por el estilo. Yo acepté y me dijeron que si no había ningún problema esos 250 dólares serían reembolsados. Les pedí la factura del hotel antes de salir y nunca la recibí, me dijeron que me la enviaban por mail y tampoco. Salí del hotel y vaya sorpresa, me habían cargado a la cuenta a la tarjeta 750. Lo cuál me pareció ilógico porque ya había dado un anticipo de 150 antes de hospedarme en el hotel. Les envié un correo directamente al hotel y nunca respondieron, le envié un correo a Expedia y dicen que es un "impuesto" adicional, más los otros impuestos que ya me habían cobrado. Entonces la verdad fue todo un desastre, terminé pagando casi 1000 dólares en el hotel, después de que en teoría eran 750. Entonces la verdad es una vergüenza la forma de cobrar de dicho hotel y de Expedia que no hacen las cosas bien.

title: I SHOULD NEVER BOOKED THIS HOTEL
text: i am an IHG member, i should choose a different property worth of my money, stayed for 2 nights and 2 rooms. FD when i checked in i told her that I am IHG member, replied to me right a way  that i will never received a points because i booked to a 3rd party to booking.com. I am not asking for points in the first place but to recognized me as your patron/member that is

title: Cobros injustificados
text:
Me cobraron 50 dólares del dinero que me retuvieron, el problema es que no especifican la razón del cobro. 
En pocas palabras, te pueden robar todo el dinero que te retienen y no tendrás forma de reclamar o pedir eo detalle, porque el cobro te lo hacen días después de tu partida.

title: No frills but hey it's in New York City
text: My daughters wanted me to give it a 1 or a 2 but it's not that bad.  It should be called Holiday Inn-Hell's Kitchen, not Time Square.  But you can walk to the subway and Time Square.  Tiny room, old furniture.  Tub stained and rusted but I assume clean.  Slow elevators during the morning time, we had to take stairs down from 29th floor.  No fridge. Empty vending machines. Charged 350 hold for incidentals but why? There are no incidentals available. One hot and a cot. Friendly staff.  Great food on 9th avenue around the corner.

title: Charged my card twice for the one stay and won’t reply to my emails.
text:
Thought this was a great place to stay and couldn’t fault it, however staff were nice but when it came to check out they were unhelpful and inexperienced. When I went to check out, I found the card I gave as security which I was told wouldn’t be used for payment, had been charged for my room, before I had even gone to reception to check out. 

I wanted to pay with a different card, as it had local currency on it and I had some cash left I wanted to get rid of, which came to the total I needed to pay. When I went to check out, I was told it was already charged and so a refund had to be put through. I agreed to this and paid with my currency card to discover that after my refund and my payment, the card I used for security, was charged a second time for the room. This balance for the room had already been paid at this stage and when I highlighted it to reception staff, they said I would refunded and it was to do with the reservations team and not them. 

When I returned home, I still had not been refunded this charge. I contacted the reception via email and at first I was getting a response and I thought it would get settled, but I have been ghosted and they still have my money. 

The hotel and staff were okay but I’m very disappointed with how I was treated, not receiving a response nor a follow up and no refund in sight. Other guests on our booking have had the same issue, which makes it worse.

title: Mixed review
text: Let me start with the good. The staff was very nice and the room was a fine value. The first negative was that the hotel does not have a bell service to store bags after check out, which is inconvenient for business travel. The second negative, which for me is a real deal killer, is that Fox News was playing in the breakfast area. The last thing I need to hear while drinking my coffee is seditionist propaganda.

title: NO RESERVÉIS ESTE HOTEL
text:
Llegamos al hotel y nos dicen que para que te hagan la habitación tienes que avisar con 24 horas de antelación, lo cual me parece lamentable pero después de más de 38 horas de avisar, la habitación sigue sin hacer, camas toallas baños  etc 
Caso aparte es el desayuno, aparte de ser lamentable la variedad del mismo, has de comerlo en la misma habitación( esa que no te hacen)
No soy de hacer reseñas mediocres, suelo apuntar las muy buenas y las muy malas , y esta es desgraciadamente de las MUY MALAS

title: Small room; Blocks from Times Square
text: Staff was extremely nice. The room was small, but we didn’t visit NYC to stay in room.  We stayed for three nights and attended four shows, plus other items.  Make sure you know which way you are walking - meaning know your directions - to get there from the subway. Breakfast area is small. Talk building. Two elevators. Most floors only have six rooms each.  Get up and beat crowd or be patient. Fabric district is only a block away.

title: Stay somewhere else!
text: Overpriced hotel with no upkeep, dirty room and no breakfast available. Much better alternatives available. Have tried to post a review on the IHG site twice and it won’t be posted. Location is decent but that is the only positive. Pictures show the condition and cleanliness of the facility.

title: La limpieza en este hotel no existe
text:
La ubicación del hotel es nueva 
Pero el servicio es pésimo 
La limpieza en este hotel no existe 
Nunca nos cambiaron las toallas reclamos todos los días 
El retiro de basura no existe 
Protocolo de COVID 0 
Las mesas de desayuno y limpieza las terminas asiendo tu 
De lo contrario convives con la mugre.
Hemos estado en NYC en otros ocasiones en hoteles similares y lejos este es el peor.
Desayuno casi nulo 
PD- Si quieres pagar un hotel caro y sucio esta es la opción

title: Good Stay - Close to Attractions
text:
Just returned from a fantastic trip to NYC.  Stayed here 3 nights, slept very well each night.  

Cleaning service is sporadic - nothing the first day, so we didn’t expect any cleaning the 2nd.  Came back to find the room tidied up.  We would’ve tipped the cleaning staff if we’d known.  Lately when traveling, we’ve gotten used to not having that service anymore.  They should post the schedule or let us know when to expect this.

Few TV channels, some local, a couple HBO, the typical garbage sports channels, and some others.  

Quiet nights, comfortable bed, typical HI Express breakfast.  

Good location to get to Broadway shows, Times Square, subway, etc.  

Overall we were not disappointed.

title: Great staff, steep prices!
text:
The staff was incredible! 
Beneclicta - she was very kind and accommodating during our check-in even though we had 4 different family groups arriving at the same time. When we asked to be possibly located on the same floor, she managed to get 2 families of each of our groups together which was very nice. When we requested another blanket and an extra bar of soap, she quickly arranged that to be brought up to our room by a very nice young man. On our last night there, she also was gracious enough to grant us permission to use the breakfast room for our large family group to enjoy a takeout dinner together. Of course, as agreed upon, we cleaned everything up and put the room back in order when we were done.

Benjamin- what a wonderful and pleasant young man! He worked so hard to keep the incredibly busy breakfast area stocked with food, the vacated tables cleaned up as quick as possible for the next group of hungry people and the coffee pots full for us caffeine dependent souls. He kindly assured me that the coffee was brewing and would soon be available when I inquired. Considering how crazy the breakfast room had been as I oversaw the slow process of my grandkids, niece, a few nephews, a couple of my daughters, both of my sisters, and all of their husbands fill their belly’s before venturing out for the day... Benjamin could have been rude, but he was NOT! He excused himself, every time, for squeezing in line to refill all the choices offered for breakfast in a professional and kind manner 

Christina - a patient and proficient hostess at the desk, who oversaw our departure with kindness. 

The breakfast offered was wonderful and tasty 
The room was small, as expected, and was comfortable and clean

Not happy about the price! 
My family and I had originally booked (Booking.com) our (4) rooms at the end of August for this NYC adventure to honor my nieces 16th birthday in December. All of us were given a price around $650 for the two nights no matter if we requested king size beds or 2 double beds. A couple weeks before we were to arrive, another one of my daughters was given permission to have the time off work and asked if she and her 2 kids could join me in my room. I called and talked to a nice young man at Booking.com and he then talked with someone at this hotel and arranged to change my reservations from a room with a king size bed to a room with 2 double beds for the total cost of $1,500!!!!!!!!! Mind you, this was only for 2 nights! My daughter quickly managed to look online and found a room with 2 double beds on the Booking.com website for $1,100 for the same hotel... really? I cancelled my room for a king size bed, and took this one, but wonder why, since I already had a room reserved, there was no consideration? Why couldn’t I just switch the type of room without having such an incredibly steep price difference. I did have to pay the horribly more expensive cost because I didn’t want to disappoint my family, but am not happy about it, and will not likely choose to stay at a Holiday Inn Express again.

title: EL PEOR HOTEL DEL MUNDO
text:
No limpian las habitaciones nunca, este es ya mi quinto día y no han pasado por la habitación aunque lo reclamo todos los días 
No cambian toallas ni retiran basura
No limpian mesas de desayuno entre servicios son los propios clientes los que tienen que hacerlo 
Clientes y empleados sin mascarillas 
Una vergüenza en plano COVID
Todo el hotel huele a marihuana y eso que en teoría no se puede fumar
EL PEOR HOTEL DE MI VIDA 
Estoy deseando irme

title: Nothing to appreciate
text: Park on the street. Get a dolly from the hotel next door. Load your luggage. Stand in a lineup in the lobby where everyone is trying to pass. Try to fit the dolly in the elevator. go up to your room. You can't get the dolly out of the elevator ! The corridor is too narrow. drop your bags one by one off the dolly and let the dolly go with the elevator to become someone else's challenge. The room is so tiny. Two people have to really squeeze to cross each other around the bed. There is no room to put a second suitcase except on the desk. You may have to run the hot water for 10 minutes on the 30th floor to get some warm water if you are lucky. Ice machines don't work. Vending machines are 3/4 empty. The mattress is saggy you may roll off the side of the bed. The parking is a 15 minute walk if you don't mind the weather. To checkout leave your luggage in the room get the car. leave it in the street, go to your room to get your luggage.  The lineup for breakfast extends from the tiny breakfast room past the elevator lobby. For the price they charge go elsewhere.

title: nice hotel, excellent staff
text: good breakfast, small but clean room. Good location. Front desk manager, Bene was fantastic, great customer service. Quiet room and comfortable bed. Late checkout was available. Will stay here again on my next visit to New York

title: Un hotel solo para dormir
text:
La habitación está bien para el precio, las camas cómodas. La ubicación es lo mejor.

El desayuno por el Covid es una caja con un pan duro, una barra de cereal y un yogur cuchareable. Los cuatro días fue exactamente lo mismo, decidimos no recibirlo dos días porque los dos primeros igual tuvimos que buscar desayuno afuera.

Estuvimos 4 noches y nunca hicieron limpieza de la habitación ni cambiaron toallas.
No tienen servicio para guardar maletas antes del check-in o después del checkout.

title: Robery
text: It was a terrible experience. I bougth an iphone 12 pro max and keep it in the room. I went to lunch and when i come back the iphone was stole from the room. The Hotel doesn't helpme, don't pay for the robery. The hotel is very unsafety

title: HORRÍVEL
text: Horrível. A expectativa era de um hotel simples. A realidade é de um hotel sujo e fedorento. O café da manhã é uma piada. Sem relação nenhuma com as fotos. Não recomendo e não volto nunca mais. A boa localização é o único ponto positivo mas não vale o custo/benefício

title: El peor hotel en el que he estado
text:
El hotel es muy viejo, está abandonado en su mantenimiento, la atención de las personas de la recepción fue muy mala no daban respuesta por los requerimientos. Pará empeorar la situación el desayuno era solo café y ponques (eso no es un desayuno), no realizan limpieza de la habitación si la estadía es menor a 5 días en la pagina dice que es a diario.
La experiencia en este hotel fue muy mala

title: Not the best stay
text:
Had to change rooms because the tub was broken. The tub in the second room was also broken and the top lock was missing. That was a safety issue I truly did not appreciate. On top of that the parking garage I was sent to did not want to validate my car after checkout. The hotel staff apologized for that and said they were going to waive the parking fee but they haven't yet. The issue is: the hotel charged $45 for parking but the garage wanted over $100 for the one night we stayed. My traveling companions were left very disappointed with our stay and we won't be returning to this establishment.

The extra star is because the beds were comfy, the floors were quiet, and the added security (needing your room key to access the elevator) was appreciated.

title: Ultra friendly front desk saved review from being 1 star
text:
Recently stayed at this location during Covid. My expectations weren’t high being a past guest of Hotel Carter I don’t expect much. I knew up front that rooms would not be cleaned, breakfast would be limited and possibly other things could be impacted.

The front desk was ultra friendly and tried but they just can’t fix everything and you can’t complain about everything. I was a IHG member  staying on points.

My first surprise came a few hours before check in. My credit card was charged $225 for a room that was already paid for. When I called to find out why I was told it was for incidentals like charging things to the room. They said they charge $75 per night up to $450  total but you get it back up to a week after check out. Here is the catch though, they don’t have a restaurant or almost anything to charge to the room. They have a small snack shop. You would have to buy 75 sodas to spend that much. No where on my confirmation or the ihg website is this $75 per night frelisted. 

When we arrived to our room there were two noticeable problems. The first was a good size stain on the carpet. Stains don’t bother me (remember I’ve stayed at Hotel Carter before) but what did bother me was the fact that it was still sticky. Stains are acceptable but for it to still be sticky makes me wonder if any effort was given to clean it?

The second issue was the safe. We regularly use the safe and when we tried to lock it, it wouldn’t work. We called the front desk and they sent someone up. A guy came into the room and didn’t do much more than I did looking at the safe trying to get it to work. He said I’ll be back and left the room. We waited a hour and he never returned. By this point it was 11:30 pm and we decided to go to sleep.

The next morning we explained to the front desk again about the safe and were told they would send someone right up at 8 am to fix it. We asked again at 7:45 because we wanted to go explore the city and was told it would be closer to 8:30. We waited until 9 and no one showed up. Not wanting to waste our day her left and assumed it would get fixed and hoped our valuables wouldn’t get taken.

We came back to our room that night and the safe still wasn’t working. We called the front desk again and they called the maintenance supervisor up. Within about .15 minutes he got the safe to work. However the next morning, it wasn’t working again. At this point we gave up on having a working safe. 

That evening our children dropped a toy behind the night stand. When I went to grab it a found a half full bottle of soda that was a flavor we never had in the room. Another indication that room wasn’t cleaned well.

Other room issues during the stay included the toilet paper holder falling off the wall and the bath tub faucet falling off. Both things were were able to put back on but again not something you expect from a IHG property. 

The final disappointing thing was they wouldn’t hold our bags at check out, which is customary at most NYC hotels. I was told it was due to covid. Not sure how holding my bags in a closet spreads covid and other hotels are still doing it. At first it was suggested we visit one of the local stores that would do that service for us for a fee. Eventually late check out was offered (thank you friendly front desk staff) which helped some but didn’t fix our entire problem.

Overall my expectations weren’t high but for a 3 night stay we had issue after issue. The front desk staff saved the rating from being a zero.

title: Highly recommend
text:
Staff was hospitable and helpful. Tiffany was efficient and friendly. 
The room was impeccable, very clean and updated. Not too close to Times Square that it’s loud but still central. Would most definitely stay here again and recommend to others.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Muy buena ubicación, muy cómodo. Buen precio para estar en Manhattan. En la recepción hablan español y son amables.Enseguida del hotel hay un Seven eleven bien surtido.Puedes caminar ir caminando a todos los lugares turísticos sin necesidad de usar el metro. Tuvimos habitación en el último piso en la parte de atrás y tenía vista espectacular!!

title: Muito bom
text: o Hotel é muito bom, sobretudo pela localização, pois o acesso às principais atrações turísticas de NY pode ser feito à pé. Quarto era novo, com tudo funcionando muito bem; equipe foi bastante prestativa e atenciosa. Pontos negativos: espaço para café da manhã, muito pequeno, sendo que havia filas para pegar os alimentos; apenas dois elevadores para atender todo o hotel, o que gerava muitas filas. De modo geral vale a pena hospedar-se no hotel. Recomendo.

title: Bien, pero puede mejorar
text: Nuestro check in fue demorado, porque no tenían lista la habitación. Tuvimos que ingresar con una hora de retraso. La  pieza que nos dieron la puerta no tenía pestillo, quedaba siempre abierta e incluso no cerraba del todo. No tenían housekeeping para estadías menores a 5 días (nosotros nos quedamos 3). La presión del agua de la ducha era poca. En cuanto a la habitación propiamente tal, las camas eran cómodas, habitación muy amplia, TV de 32"" y café a disposición. La persona que nos recibió temprano era muy amable, siempre a disposición, quedamos encantados con ella, muy distinto al personal de la tarde.

title: Nice hotel
text:
This hotel was better than expected for the price. The room was clean as was the bathroom and the amenities provided were good and always replenished. The rooms were bigger than I thought they would be and the hotel was quiet enough to get s as great nights sleep before exploring the city.
The breakfast was wonderful.
Would stay again.

title: Consigliatissimo
text:
Hotel a due passi da Times Square e dall’Empire State Building in una posizione perfetta per tutti gli spostamenti.
La camera molto accogliente con letto spaziosissimo (la nostra si trovava al 37esimo piano).
La colazione dispone di ogni tipo di proposta dolce e salata, tutto molto buono. 
Il personale gentilissimo e disponibile nella prenotazione di servizi, eventi e taxi.
Avevano sempre a disposizione e gratuitamente acque rinfrescanti aromatizzate , perfette per noi che rientravamo accaldati dalle nostre lunghissime camminate 😊
L’unico problema sono gli ascensori davvero affollati e con un’attesa importante soprattutto nelle ore di punta della colazione. 
Consiglio sicuramente questo hotel e ci tornerei sicuramente se dovessi essere a New York.

title: Excelente ubicación y buen servicio
text: Los cuartos estan pequeños , pero limpios, hay mucha gente, asi es que para usar el elevador llegamos a esperar 10 mins para poder abordarlo. Optabamos mejor por bajar Por las escaleras. Dan desayuno grauito, nones la gran cosa, pero al menos empiezas el dia  con algo En el estomago 😜. El servicio fue muy bueno. La ubicación excelente!! Tiene dos estaciones de metro cerca( una estación a una cuadra y la otra como a 3)

title: Big Apple Big Birthdays
text:
A family trip to celebrate two big birthdays, we chose the hotel for three main reasons - firstly this was a reward night stay using points which I felt I have been saving for ever - secondly the location near to Times Square - thirdly being an Express, the complimentary breakfast.

We had asked for a room on a high floor thinking we might get a decent view across the city, we were able to see the Empire State Building and the new development at Hudson Yards but that was it. In hindsight we shouldn’t have bothered, more of that to follow.

One the plus side, the location was ideal, the complimentary breakfast provided a good selection of hot and cold items. The staff were very helpful and friendly - a special mention for Mayely on the front desk who was extremely polite and helpful.

The hotel was very busy as you might expect, the breakfast area is very small and so fining a table can take a while, we managed ok with a family of four - sometimes in two shifts. The hotel is a high building but the footprint is small so there isn’t much that can be done to enlarge the breakfast area so be prepared to wait.

The hotel only has two lifts, both of which were constantly busy, they are used by housekeeping also,  our choice of a high floor in hindsight was a mistake - if we had been lower down then we would have used the stairs - a twenty minute wait for a lift in the morning around breakfast and checkout times was not unusual.

On some days house keeping did not get around to servicing our room, we wondered if they were just busy with changeovers, under staffed maybe or just that we were points paying customers and therefore further down the list ? One one occasion only one bed was made up in the room, when we mentioned it to reception we were told if there is anything left on the bed then they are not allowed to touch it ! This is the first time ever I have heard of this but it was also the first time in New York so it must be hotel policy.

All in all though a good stay.

title: Bien situé !
text:
Nous avons séjourné une semaine en septembre 2019 dans cet hôtel.
La chambre était correct, un peu petite. Nous n'avons pas apprécié la climatisation beaucoup trop forte dans la chambre qui après chaque passage du service de nettoyage nous la remettais a fond les ballons !!.
La chambre était propre et la salle de bain également propre et correct.
Nous avons apprécié le petit déjeuné qui était varié.
Le personnel de l'accueil était très serviable, nous avons eu a les solliciter de nombreuse fois du a des problèmes de badge pour ouvrir notre chambre qui ne fonctionnait pas ainsi que de demande de couverture supplémentaire du a la climatisation .
L’hôtel est vraiment très bien situé a deux pas de Times Square

title: excelente atención y ubicación
text: El hotel es perfecto para quien quiere ir a conocer Manhattan es ideal, sus habitaciones son reducidas pero es cálido y cómodo, tiene un baños con espacio suficiente y se puede tomar un rico desayuno bufett. desde el hotel se puede dirijir rapidamente a Times Square, Quinta Avenida, Grand Central Station, Los edificios Trinity, Woolworth, Chrysler, Empire State,Hotel Waldorf Astoria, la Iglesia de San Patrick's y cientas de atracciones, este sitio esta en el el centro de la capital del mundo. Cometi el error de mudarme de hotel para conocer la parte media y alta de Manhattan y la verdad no valia la pena. fue en pleno invierno y la verdad senti mucho frio en los otros hoteles.

title: Much better than expected
text:
We booked a couple of rooms here. Got off to an eye-rolling start in both rooms as one had a faulty safe and the other had a faulty smoke detector - both problems were fixed in a matter of minutes thanks to the maintanence guys being on the ball.   

We got a decent rate so weren't expecting The Raffles in Singapore or anything but it had what we needed. Housekeeping did a great job, the rooms were comfy, the elevators were pretty quick. The breakfast staff did a good job and there was a decent enough variety of food: fruit, cereals, yoghurts, toast, eggs, sausages, cakes and some weird, shiny circular baked things?

FYI. Hot tea is always available downstairs. They will store your luggage upon check-out. A small shop in the lobby sells nibbles etc. The young lady on reception is cute.

Would happily stay again.

title: Room issues
text:
First two nights of our stay the elevator was down and we waited 10-15 minutes for each elevator lift.

The room had no liners in the trash and we found dried pasta under our bed.  The phone wire kept falling out after every use of the phone.  
Armoire and bathroom mirror was all scratched up and looked like it came from goodwill.
For $150 a night I was very disappointed.  We received a note under our door this afternoon noting because of the corona virus - they will not be turning down the rooms.  You would think they would disinfect all the rooms because of the virus?

title: Brilliant place and very nice breakfast.
text:
I came here nice welcome got water bottle and crisps packets. My room was on the 22nd floor. There was flat screen TV, tea/coffee tray, En-suite shower, nice fluffy towels, Nice toiletries. I did use the gym which was out dated machines.
I did have a good sleep. Please come early to get your breakfast. There was hot and cold food. I did have a brilliant stay Thank you to all the staff.

title: No Refund
text: I was looking forward to my trip to NYC and staying at this Hotel.  Unfortunately, the work conference I was planning on attending was cancelled due to the Coronavirus.  When I called this hotel to cancel my reservations, 20 days before the planned stay, I was told I could not get a refund.  On the hotel website, they stated that their main concern is the well being of their customers, I feel that they are more concerned with the money they would lose rather than the lives that could potentially be lost due to the spread of the virus!  They also have posted on their website that if people are travelling from out of the country, they will be fully refunded, too bad they are not as concerned for the citizens travelling in the USA!

title: Poor response to hotel issues
text: When we checked in  one of the two the elevators in the hotel was broken. This was a problem all weekend, and although the maintenance staff, who were manually running the elevator, were very patient, there was no legitimate response from management. When we had to walk down from 28 floors up, and then wait in a line to get back up, something should have been done. The rooms were tiny, and the beds were very firm. Breakfast was average, but very crowded. We will not be back because there are so many other choices!

title: Blah
text:
I hate complaining and don’t expect much, but I pushed the nightstand out a bit so I could access the wall outlet to plug in my phone charger, and found an old Lindt candy wrapper and a plastic wrapper...along with dust bunnies. There was also a signifanct amount of dust around the edges of the lamp shade that is attached to the headboard. I didn’t dare look under the bed as my friend and I were exhausted and needed to be up and checked out of the hotel by 5am. The bathroom sink filled up with water and took forever to go down the drain, and around the drain it was evident it wasn’t cleaned properly. 

Thankfully we have an Airbnb for the rest of our time in NYC, which sadly is way cleaner and worth the money. My friend is having surgery today, so we thought staying at the Holiday Inn Express would be closer (which it was) and the hotel name is one I’ve come to know and trust, versus a random hotel in the city. Now I think I should have taken my chances are a much cheaper room.

Also disappointed that there wasn’t a mini fridge or microwave in room—at very least, a mini fridge should be a staple item in the room. Hard to eat out in the city and have left overs that end up needing to be thrown out. 

Last but not least, the “destination fee” on top of an already over-priced, tiny room is outrageous.

Will find a different place to stay in the future.

title: Super séjour !
text: Nous avons passé une semaine formidable à la découverte de New York et notre hôtel y est pour beaucoup. Très bien situé à Hell’s Kitchen, à deux pas de Time Square, Central Park, Broadway et de 5th avenue. Accueil très chaleureux et sympathique. Petit déjeuner continental et très copieux. Chambre calme et spacieuse.

title: Too small / muy chico
text: Si vas solo esta bien, pero si vas acompañado esta demaciado chico el baño no tiene privacidad por que esta a lado de la cama, ojo si les dan habitación en la ventana no tienen doble vidrio y como es una calle muy transitada no podrás dormir hasta las 11 u 12 que se calma el tráfico en NY es muy comun las sirenas de patrullas y ambulancias así como los claxonasos, lo único bueno es la  hubicacion y esta limpio el lugar, pero yo no lo recomendaría, hay mejores opciones por ese precio.

title: Five days sightseeing in New York
text: Hotel was had nice  and clean and comfy beds and pillows.Good breakfast including fabulous cinammon buns. Problems with lifts. Long wait in mornings. Okay coming down 21 floors but didn't walk up. Very close to Times Square friendly staff.Would recommend.

title: Estupenda ubicación, buena calidad-precio
text: La habitación silenciosa, en perfecto estado, todo limpio y nuevo. Teníamos la habitación con vistas en el piso 17, no eran vistas al Empire State pero estaban bien. El desayuno bastante completo, con dulce, salado y fruta incluido en el precio. La situación del hotel es estupenda, permite llegar caminando a muchos sitios de interés como Times Square, la 5ª Avenida y Empire State. Para repetir.

title: Very impressed for a budget hotel
text: The hotel staff is wonderful at this hotel. They made the hotel experience way more than a budget hotel. Good job on hiring amazing employees! The bed was nice and large and the breakfast was impressive for a Holiday Express. The rooms looked clean. The bed was a little hard for me but I brought my own pillow. I think that helped a little. The rooms are also small but it’s NYC. I’m sure most hotel rooms are smaller than I’m used too. I recommend this hotel. Book through AAA and it’s a good discount.

title: Solid Room at reasonable cost, but misleading price
text: Room was clean, and relatively spacious. Biggest drawback was the non-optional "resort fee" which was added on. There is no resort and you can't opt out, so essentially it's just more room cost that should have been included fro the beginning. I will always ding this type of fraud at least 1 star when they do this.

title: Nice clean hotel
text: Hotel very nice and clean. Was there for a week. Can’t complain about anything major. Small issue with lifts in busy morning time. Definitely will recommend to all want to stay close to Times Square, Subway, train station. Generally highly recommended.

title: Comfortable stay. Friendly staff
text:
I very much enjoyed my stay at the hotel.  The staff were friendly and the rate affordable. The location is well situated. 
Breakfast included. Try and get a lower floor as the elevators are slow. I'll be back

title: Centrale
text: Posizione eccellente, centralissimo a due passi da Times Square, Penn station e Port Authority. Buona accoglienza, camera piccola con arredamento un po' datato ma letti ampi e comodissimi che è la cosa più importante. Ottima la prima colazione davvero completa di dolce e salato. Molto gentile il personale di sala. Come già segnalato il problema degli ascensori è reale, nelle ore di punta l'attesa per salire o scendere c'è. Se siete mattinieri e alle 7  fate colazione troverete la sala, che non è molto grande, semi vuota e gli ascensori liberi. Scendere più tardi è un delirio. Buon rapporto qualità prezzo vista anche la bassa stagione.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
I had stayed for 4 Nights and if travel again to New York I would love stay again with this Hotel. They offered good breakfast to start off your day along with unlimited Tea & Coffee through out the Day. Pretty Good Rooms although TV installed in Room's are lit bit older with current times. Rest I am 100% satisfied with there services. 
Please check with hotel about Destination Fee / Resort Fee as it will range from $ 20 -$ 25 Per Room Per Night.

title: Great experience - Will return!
text:
My husband and I booked a one-night stay as part of a trip to the city to see the Harry Potter show.  We arrived before check-in time to check our bags and I was greeted as the ‘Member of the Day’, given a complimentary beverage, snack, extra rewards points and our room had balloons! They also had our room all ready for us so we didn’t even need to check our bags - Because it was my husband’s birthday this made us smile even more!  

We requested a high floor and found it to be such a quiet hotel! For NYC, I only heard one siren and hardly any elevator noise or peoples voices.  We slept well - the room/bathroom was clean and the bed was comfortable.  

The hotel breakfast was above par for this type of chain with numerous fresh, hot items.  The breakfast Staff was always refilling things and the front desk staff was fabulous and friendly! 

It is only a few blocks to Penn Station and 42nd ave/Theater area.  I will definitely consider staying here again! Thank you to everyone who made our stay so enjoyable!

title: Decent hotel in Times Square
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights and it was good. Breakfast was good, hotel staff was helpful. There is additional destination fee of $20 plus tax per day, I guess this covers Free WiFi and Free breakfast.
There are only 2 elevators so be patient or ready to take stairs. I heard some banging sounds coming from the elevator shaft. If your room is right next to elevator, the noise will bother you.

You will not have much view even if you book a city view room.
Book a standard room at lower level and save your money and time.

title: Excelente lugar
text: Excelente servicio. Tienen un area de comedor pequeña pero funcional y te sirve para empezar el día. Cada cuarto acomodado y fue perfecto para mí y mi pareja. Eso si tambien cobra el impuesto de extranjero con tarjeta. Porultimo es un lugar céntrico. Estan cercas las lineas m1 y m2 de autobuses para ir 5ta avenida, central park, wallstreet. La linea de metro jamaica te deja justo estacion 42 linea azul y bajandote son 3 cuadras al hotel. Recomendado 100%

title: A decent hotel that's let down by easily fixable issues.
text:
Just came back from a solid trip to New York and stayed at this hotel for four nights.

Positives - 
Unlimited tea and coffee downstairs
Decent enough breakfast as part of the hotel
Really friendly chef who is around in the mornings, brilliant customer service, takes the time to say hello to everyone and chat.
Coffee machine in the room
Maids did a good job of cleaning room
Front desk was always manned and could answer any question I had.

Good choice of television shows in room

Good wifi

Negatives - 
Unbelievably poor higher management. I recieved an email telling me I needed to pay 250 deposit for my stay and a destination fee. After several attempts of contact I was ignored.
When arriving it turned into just a 50 dollar deposit, with an unsure answer on when I would receive the money back.
When offering to pay with cash was told I needed a credit card. Offered to pay by debit card and was told no. To only then be told ten minutes later I could pay by debit card. So confusing.

The lifts during the times the maids are cleaning are very annoying to use, it can take up to 15 mins to get your lift down.

Door card stopped working on several occasions meaning I had to go all the way down to get it sorted on each occasion

title: Vicinissimo Time Square
text:
Nulla da dire 
Situato vicinissimo a Time Square , stanze piccole ma confortevoli per l’uso che serve a New York , pulite .Colazione da paura dolce e salato eccezionali ! Rapporto qualità prezzo eccezionale !

title: Good value for money - don't expect anything fancy
text:
Upon arrival we were slightly early for check in but there was a very lovely man on reception who said that we could check in early.  We were given a room on the 23rd floor.  The room was TINY.  There were 3 adults staying in the room and we were often on top of each other.  

Within the room there was a coffee machine which was OK.  Would rather have had a kettle personally, however.  There is a huge amount of waste in this hotel as they provide paper cups throughout, as well as paper plates for breakfast which I think is a bit lazy and really unnecessary.  The room was VERY poorly lit.  The beds are quite small but not uncomfortable.  There was no view from our room, but can't say we really expected one. 

The lifts, as many people comment on, are a bit of a pain.  I dread to think what they would be like in peak season.  One morning we waited 15 minutes for a lift.  When one did arrive it had the cleaners in it who turned out the lights and told us to get another lift.  We eventually gave up and walked down the stairs.  

The day we were due to check out, I called down to reception to ask if we could keep the room a little later and was told we could have it an extra hour (no charge).  Amazing.  When we went down to check out we asked to leave our cases with them.  The bellboy was so unbelievably rude.  Rolling his eyes at us and tutting.  NO TIP to him.  So rude.  

Breakfast is set out in a really tiny, cramped space and felt a bit like a school canteen.  No outside windows.  Was very disappointing. 

Location wise - you're a couple of blocks from Times Square which is great but at night the outside of the hotel did feel pretty intimidating and not particularly safe.

title: Perfect.
text: Stayed her with my son in August. Amazing service from friendly helpful staff. Rooms are clean and spacious. Food was very nice, just what you need to get started on your adventure out in the city. Had a slight problem with the safe in the room, young lady on reception got it sorted in no time at all, can't fault. Thank you for a great stay. Would definitely stay again when in New York City.

title: Excellent stay
text: Came home after a 7days stay at this hotel. First checking in easy. Took just 50 dollars for deposit. Rooms was on 27 th floor not much of a view but very clean. Beds comfortable coffee machine in room. Hot breakfast which was free and very Good. The dining room staff were wonderful couldn't do enough for you. Small dining room but can take away. Free tea and coffee all day and night. Hotel on side street but 2 doors down was a lovely coffee shop with sandwiches to order.10 minutes to times square. Round the corner is the bus terminal. In a great location. Would stay here again.

title: Muy buen hotel, agradable y bien ubicado
text: mi experiencia en este hotel fue superadora, a mi llegada 10 am ya me asignaron la habitación, muy comoda, con todo lo necesario para una buena estadía, cama muy comoda, baño espacioso, con calefaccion perfecta, muy limpio, el servicio diario de limpieza es excelente, el desayuno perfecto , muy variado para lo que es NYC, muy bien ubicado, cerca de Times Square, de port authority bus terminal y de 42 St-Port Authority Subway Station, o sea, del hotel puedes ir a donde quieras, el personal es super agradable, amable, y la atencion en general es muy buena.

title: Liked It!
text: I liked this hotel.  It's Times Square area so for around $200 a night you really can't expect anything better.  Yes, tthe elevators are sometimes slow and the rooms are small, but that's pretty standard in that area.  I liked that the room was clean, quiet, comfortable, and well appointed.  In-room coffee in mid-town was a plus and I enjoyed plenty of choices at the complimentary (also rare) breakfast.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Close to everything.  I would not hesitate to stay here again!

title: Αποτυχημενη επιλογη ......
text:
Οταν πριν ξεκινησεις το ταξιδι σου,το ξενοδοχειο αυθαιρετα σου εχει παρει απο την καρτα σου,την διαμονη 2 δωματιων για 6 νυχτες,συνολικα 2.200 ευρω,οταν δεν μπορεις να επικοινωνησεις μαζι τους,οταν η ιδια h booking δεν καταφερνει τιποτα,οταν πας εκει ταλαιπωρημενος και σου λενε οτι μονο το ενα δωνματιο ειναι προπληρωμενο,οταν σου εχουν επιστρεψει χωρις ειδοποιηση,οταν δεν σου ζητανε συγγνωμη, για αυτο το λαθος τους ,οταν πλημυριζει η λεκανη της τουαλετας στις 5 το πρωι,και ερχονται μετα απο μιση ωρα,να στο φτιαξουν,οταν για να φας πρωινο λογω του πολυ κοσμου,περιμενεις μεχρι και 15 λεπτα,οταν κατεβαινεις απο τον 14 ο οροφο με τα ποδια ,γιατι δεν ερχεται το ασανσερ,οταν στο μικρο χωρο του πρωινου μαζευονται 100 ατομα ,οταν πληρωνεις 170 ευρω την βραδυα με ολα αυτα τι να πεις?
Σε κεντρικο σημειο,αλλαο δρομος λιγο σκοτεινος και κακοφημος.

title: Our trip
text: First off, I would like to say the room was super clean and well kept. The guy with the black timbs who runs the luggage room was super friendly and welcoming. He has exceptional customer service and I’d like to thank him for his hospitality. The old male “supervisor” with the pushed hairline was kind of as ass. The elevators were a huge issue as we were on the 27th floor and every single day I was there, one of the elevators was broken down some point of the day. There was some instance we waited over 10 minutes to take the elevator and when we FINALLY got to the top, both our keys were deactivated. When we put it on the sensor, they blinked red. That means the key reader on the door needs a battery replacement or our keys were made for only 2 nights. Anyways, we went down to get our keys and the “supervisor” who worked at night (pushed hairline) was interrogating us and insinuating we incorrectly handled our door key. I don’t understand why he felt the need to be rude and talked to us like we were crazy! All he needed to do was shut his mouth and give us a reactivated key! Don’t work in hospitality if your customer service is below average.

title: gutes Hotel für Städtereise
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist absolut Top! Viel besser geht es fast nicht. Die meisten Sehenswürdigkeiten sind von hier fußläufig erreichbar. Das Personal war immer sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Es gibt eine Art "Concierge" bei dem man Tickets für Shows, Sehenswürdigkeiten, Shuttle zu den Flughäfen und andere Dinge buchen kann. Zwei Punkte Abzug bei meiner Bewertung gibt es für die renovierungsbedürftigen Zimmer und das Frühstück bzw. den Frühstücksraum. Zu den Zimmern: wir hatten wahrscheinlich eines der besten Zimmer im ganzen Hotel was die Aussicht betrifft. 36. Stock (ganz oben, allerdings muss ich sagen, dass die Wartezeit auf den Aufzug nicht anders war, wie in Hotels mit weniger Stockwerken. Kann also die Aussagen anderer Gäste nicht bestätigen) mit Blick auf das Empire State Building, One World, Freiheitsstatue und den Hudson. Die Zimmer müssen aber dringend renoviert werden, Teppich sehr abgelaufen, in der Wanne splitterte bereits die Beschichtung ab. Aber es war alles sauber und das ist mit das Wichtigste! Der Frühstücksraum ist für die Zimmeranzahl zu klein und zu eng. Die Qualität war ok, mehr aber auch nicht. Ist halt typisch amerikanisch womit wir Deutsche uns wohl nie so richtig anfreunden werden.
Alles in Allem können wir das Hotel aber weiterempfehlen!!

title: Professional staff!
text: During check in May from the reception was very welcoming towards us and started out stay very nicely. Unfortunately we encountered an issue with our room; however, May and Colton helped us immediately with a solution. They are very professional and friendly. I can also recommend this hotel because of the location in the city.

title: Petit mais bien
text:
Bien situé , bien entretenue, bien que le matin, mettre en maintenance un ascensur sur deux lorsque l'immeuble à 30 etage, c'est moyen.il faut s'organiser pour prendre le petit dejeuner car la salle est petite.
côté vue la rue etait en chantier en aout 2019, mais pas de nuisances sonores notables a declarer

title: Ottima posizione , peccato ascensore
text: Sono appena stato con mia moglie e devo dire che l’hotel non è male tenendo conto del rapporto qualità prezzo a Manhattan. A cinque minuti a piedi da Times Square, vicino alla metropolitana. Colazione molto buona dolce e salato Consigliatissimi i pancakes. Solite camere americane con moquette in tutto hotel , non particolarmente curata nei dettagli ma essenziale, buona pulizia, cambio asciugamani giornaliero. Unica grande pecca: ascensori. Solamente due ascensori per 36 piani , nel periodo natalizio un disastro. Bisogna calcolare bene i tempi per via del flusso di gente. L’ultimo giorno dovevamo scendere in reception per il check out e solamente un ascensore funzionava con a bordo un tecnico, abbiamo aspettato più di mezz’ora l’ascensore. Unico grande difetto questo. Per il resto mi sento di consigliarlo.

title: Excelente
text: Muy bien ubicado. Excelente limpieza. Súper desayuno muy completo. No es económico pero NY no es económico. Pero por el desayuno q tiene esta perfecto. Hablan español y son muy atentos. Nos tuvieron las valijas sin problema después del checkout

title: Cozy and Safe
text: I didn't originally book this hotel due to finding a cheaper price elsewhere, but when the hotel I booked actually had no rooms they allowed me to stay here for the same price and I was pleasantly surprised.  The room was clean, cozy, and I didn't even hear a lot of night time noise outside as I would have expected in NYC.  The location of the hotel is just a few blocks from all the Times Square action and a quick 15min walk to Penn Station the other way.  I was able to keep my luggage there after checkout as well, very convenient.  Overall, I would recommend this hotel and stay here again!

title: Very good
text:
We requested a high floor ( we got floor 26). Our view was very impressive, but not looking towards the Empire State Building.
The room was clean, but had a strange opaque door to the bathroom.
The staff were very friendly in the busy reception area. Especially the young man on the luggage room. We never had any problems with the area in front of the hotel, or the lifts.
Located in a good, busy area, short walk from Times Square

title: Goed, centraal gelegen
text: Wij hadden dit hotel gekozen nav recensies, wat een goed hotel met een zeer goede ligging. Binnen 5 minuten op Times Square, Macy’s, metro stations. Kamer is niet ruim maar schoon, fijne douche. Enigste min puntjes weinig druk op douchekraan, bed voor mij te hard en kamer in winter zeer koud. Er lag maar een dun dekbed op, voor de zomer prima maar bij temperaturen onder 0 echt te koud. Je kunt de airco aanzetten op verwarmen maar dat was voor ons weer te warm, jammer want voor de rest was het een prima hotel met vriendelijk personeel. De liften zijn druk en vaak langer wachten maar dat stoorde ons niet. Kluisje op de kamer, wij hadden een kamer op de 10e etage aan de achterkant. Het is lekker rustig in het hotel, tip voor hotel leg in de winter een dikker dekbed op bed.

title: Everything We Needed
text: Everything was perfectly fine, room was clean and comfortable. Great location, easy walk to many attractions. We were on floor 24 and had great views and had no issues with the elevator. We would definitely stay there again.

title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS.  ELEVATORS IMPOSSIBLE.
text: This hotel has two tiny elevators.  It is virtually impossible to get one.  This morning there were probably 100 people jammed in the narrow hallway to get on.  Dozens and dozens of people were flooding out the stairway from upper floors with their suitcases.  All looked exhausted and angry.  You may need to walk up or down more than 25 floors, jammed full of people with suitcases.  It looked like a third world country in the stairwells.

title: Good Location
text: Walkable to many attractions.  The hotel is not fancy but adequate, good breakfast and friendly staff.  No security on site (at least that I saw), staff did not look up when we came in after hours and some people in the lobby area did not appear to be staying at the hotel.  Rooms were clean and supervisor asked for feedback.  Only comment, we stayed 6 nights and only received one bar of soap.  I suppose I could have asked for another one but should I have to?  I didn't think so.

title: Gute Lage
text: Das Hotel liegt zwischen Times Square und Hudson River, sehr zentral. In5 Minuten ist man quasi „mittendrin“. Zimmer sind funktionell und sauber. Frühstück ist Standard, aber man findet um die Ecke viele andere Möglichkeiten. Einzig der Lift braucht ewig und Laufen ist bei 36 Stockwerken nicht immer die beste Variante.

title: Very happy with our stay
text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights while sightseeing and seeing some shows.  Hotel is clean, quiet and has a very friendly staff.  Good location for walking to Times Square, Rockefeller Center and Madison Square Garden.  Elevators and breakfast areas get very crowded.  We had to carry breakfast to our room for 2 of the 3 mornings since there was no place to sit.  This was just a minor annoyance given the overall excellent experience.

title: Un buon hotel holiday inn express
text:
Questa catena è una garanzia! 
Pulizia buona cambio biancheria da bagno giornaliera e kit cortesia shampo docciaschiuma e crema corpo ...macchina da caffe the in camera !
Colazione dolce e salata buonissima!Fantastica la macchina per farsi i pancake! 
Cortesia alla reception ed in sala colazione dove non ci sono moltissimi tavoli ...parlano inglese  spagnolo pochissimo italiano
Ascensori (2)nelle ore di punta affollati ma se siete mattinieri il problema non sorge  ....ottima la posizione vicino a Broadway e Times square!
  Lo consiglio e ci ritornerò al mio prossimo viaggio a New york!

title: Not bad
text: Stayed for 4 nights. Good location. Yes it can get crowded in the breakfast area but we were able to sit all the time. Breakfast was okay. The staff was great, really helpful. Room was a bit small. Only complaint was why toothpaste and toothbrush needed to be requested. Will go back to this hotel when visiting New York City.

title: Don’t expect 5* (you haven’t paid for it)!
text:
We were a party of 7, over 3 rooms. 

The staff are lovely & work so hard. 
I was delighted to find a card + towel art + gift for my birthday:) thank you x

Breakfast is a bit manic ~ but well organised, welcoming & tasty.

Complimentary coffee/tea (24hrs) is a nice addition.

Location is walking distance to lots of must see attractions.

Rooms are basic, but very clean ~ comfy beds & lush pillows! Bit so dark! They really need extra lighting in the rooms.

I’m knocking it down from 5* because of the lifts (they are erratic) and also it appears anyone can walk in from the street (we got approached several times in the lobby, and asked for $’s by people that had been allowed to wander in (having said that I never felt unsafe)). 

My first time in NYC, so difficult for me to judge? I will go back to NYC, but I’ll choose a different hotel next time.

title: Brilliant stay!
text:
Stayed here with my family for a long weekend in December. The rooms were very clean and all staff were helpful and Polite.The breakfast was good with a wide variety of dishes. My only complaint would be that the rooms were a bit dark. 
Overall an amazing experience and definitely would go back.

title: Recomendo
text:
Adorei a estadia.
O quarto era ótimo, arrumado todos os dias, o café da manhã também era bom. O atendimento foi perfeito, a equipe do holiday inn esta sempre disposto a ajudar.
Recebem encomenda e guardam as malas caso você chegue antes do horário do check in e se precisar após o check out.
Está bem localizado, Wi-Fi nos quartos.
Muito obrigado equipe holiday inn.

title: Good Points and Bad Points
text: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights on a city break to New York.  It got off to not a great start as we had paid for a room with a city view and weren't given one, so had to complain to be moved.  However, the staff dealt with this and we were moved to a room with a good view of the city.  The staff in this hotel were very friendly, courteous and accommodating and answered all the questions we had about getting around the city well.  The hotel could definitely do with more than two lifts, we stayed on the 35th floor and the waiting times for the lift were tedious.   The hotel was very convenient for all the sights of New York, though the street that the hotel was actually on wasn't that great, rubbish everywhere and smelt of weed.  The seven eleven on the corner was handy, but hanging around outside were alot of questionable characters. The hotel itself felt safe and was very comfortable but reaching it was another matter.   The breakfast was extremely good, lots of variety and we loved the pancake machine, however the breakfast room got very crowded and was very small so we often resorted to taking the breakfast up to our room.  We were very happy with the concierge service in this hotel who organised a return airport transfer for us when our holiday firm Jet 2 let us down badly.  They also organised some excellent theatre tickets for us too, so a big thank you to them.  If I went back to New York I probably wouldn't return to this hotel even though the staff in there were very pleasant.

title: Great location near Times Square
text:
Stayed for 5 nights - 3 of us in 2 rooms the third time we’ve stayed here
Lovely comfortable beds - clean rooms and an included breakfast 
2 minor gripes - the lifts take forever we waited20 mins for one as we were on the 35th floor! Also people in the breakfast room in nightwear - staff should ensure people are appropriately dressed for breakfast as it’s unhygienic
Good reception staff and cleaners and breakfast staff were efficient and friendly

title: Just Right Hotel in great location!
text: Hotel was just right for few days visit to NYC. The room, amenities, and buffet breakfast were the right solution for a traveller's stay in New York! Staff were all helpful, welcoming and knowledgeable. A welcome respite after each day's travels in and around NYC.

title: Correct pour le prix
text: Bonne literie, salle de bains fonctionnelle. Le problème est le bruit du chauffage de la chambre. Nous étions au 7eme et n’avons pas eu de problème d’attente des ascenseurs. Petit déjeuner ordinaire, mais avec uniquement assiette et couverts en plastique, que vous devez mettre vous même à la poubelle comme dans un fast-food!!! Le rapport qualité prix est très bien pour New-York et son emplacement est parfait.

title: The rudest bellboy I ever met.
text:
“What are you waiting for? A show or something?”...... This was how we were greeted by the bellboy at this hotel, (unfortunately I couldn’t catch his name).  I thought he was joking at the beginning but when I realised he was being absolutely serious I couldn’t believe it.  His face was like thunder.   

Myself and friends made a simple mistake of booking a taxi to lift us at this holiday inn instead of 60 West.  On departure we were advised by 60 West that we could drop our bags off here at the sister hotel until the taxi was ready to lift us so we grabbed our suitcases and walked round to leave them for an hour when this “delight” stated we in fact could not leave our cases there as we were not “guests” (even after he had already been told that this had been discussed and agreed between hotel managers).  His manner was extremely intimidating and it took him a while to finally back down and reluctantly agree to take our luggage.

We had just spent a fantastic four days in the city and couldn’t wait to let our friends and family know how brilliant and friendly everyone was only to be let down at the last hour by this person who left us with a bitter taste and an uneasy feeling.  We all have bad days at work but if I ever treated a customer like that I would be out the door. 

With regards to the reception staff/front of house, they were just lovely and very helpful and seemed to have absolutely no problem with us leaving our bags for an hour.  So a big thank you to them to help resolve his problem x

title: Fabulous Stay In NYC
text:
Just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay in this charming hotel. First time visit to NYC for my hubby and me and we loved every second. This hotel completely met our requirements and we would definitely stay here again. 
We arrived early due to kind traffic conditions from Newark and we were delighted to find that our room was already available. Fast and easy check in with super friendly staff.
Room completely adequate for our needs, bed comfy, bathroom clean and perfectly acceptable.
Read lots of reviews regarding the lifts and to be honest we never encountered any problems, our longest wait was probably 2 minutes and we were on the 24th floor.
Breakfast was delicious with plenty of choice, loved making pancakes every morning and the cinnamon buns were to die for! The breakfast area is busy but very well managed by the wonderful staff. Although I did wonder if it was just hotel guests enjoying breakfast as it seems anyone can just walk in, no one asks which room you’re staying in? I would have preferred my details to have been checked every morning to be honest.
The free use of a computer and printer was a great touch, perfect for if you need to print off boarding passes and tickets. 
Location of hotel is perfect, we walked almost everywhere from the hotel, this was lovely as you get to see so much more of this amazing city.
Last but not least, the staff who work at this hotel are wonderful, so friendly and eager to help, nothing seemed too much trouble so if you fancy staying at a well located, adequate friendly hotel then this is the one for you. It’s not luxury but if you’re in NYC why would you be spending hours in your room anyway?
Big thanks to everyone at the hotel, we hope to be back again one day 😊

title: Great stay ! Clean, friendly front desk
text:
Room was a bit small as expected since it was in the heart of NYC! Overall, very clean and comfortable. As well, front desk was friendly and pleasant. It is close to grocery store, bagels and other fast food and convenience stores.

Some areas of improvement - it took 48 hrs for them to find an amazon package delivered to the hotel and their elevator is extremely slow 

Overall a pleasant stay and we would stay again !

title: Breakfast non existent
text: Stayed in room 2204 which was ok apart from when needed to check out had to wait 45 minutes as only 2 elevators. Not acceptable nor was the advertised breakfast from 6:30 to 10 went at 8am no room anywhere,nothing hot to eat as was advertised. Managed to get a tiny muffin and perch in the hotel lobby. Seemed like loads of people coming in from outside to get a free breakfast.  Not right. Breakfast area was too small

title: Very poor service and smallest King bed I have slept on
text: I was in NY for the NYC marathon and I chose this hotel as it was closer to the finish line and also listed on the NYC marathon website as one of the hotels runners live in. On arriving at the hotel I was told I couldn't get a late check out even when I had a guaranteed late checkout on my reservation. I was asked to talk to some supervisor even though it was an easy thing for the person at the reception. We were offered water bottles on the 2nd night but then my wife was refused on the day we were supposed to check out saying that we need to buy that from the vending machine. Seems like policies kept changing every day. Loud music blazing through the night from the restaurant causing lot of disturbance. Also this hotel is 2 or 3 blocks away from Times square and we can't even see the Times square from the hotel. Not sure why the location says its the Times square. Overall it was my worst experience in a hotel. Will not recommend or ever stay again here.

title: Great hotel and location.
text: Visited NYC for our 30th anniversay.  Perfect location for visiting all the main sights and very nice staff. Great breakfast to start the day, clean rooms and super comfy beds.  On our last night the hotel staff left us a very nice surprise, baloons, sparkling cider and chocolate to help us celebrate our special occasion, they definately made our stay with them extra special.  The elevators are busy at peak periods, just ensure you give yourself time to get to places if you have reservations or tours planned.

title: Bien placé
text: Hotel bien placé à 10 minutes à pieds de Times Square 5 minutes de métro bouche de métro chambre confortable le seul défaut les 2 ascenseurs pour le nombre de personnes vous pouvez le matin attendre10 minutes avant de descendre

title: Excellent
text: Stayed here with a friend for four nights in NYC. Perfect location for sightseeing, excellent well specified  room, good view, great bathroom, fast WiFi, friendly staff and comfy beds. Good value compared with other hotels nearby. Only negative is only having two lifts for 38 floors, so takes time to get in and out at peak times.

title: Buon compromesso
text: L'hotel  nell'arredamento e negli spazi comuni porta il marchio della catena holiday inn express. Pulizia delle stanze buona e giornaliera.Colazione a buffet abbastanza buona ma sala per le colazioni piccola e bisogna aspettare che si liberi un tavolo. Camera piccola ma accogliente con tutto il necessario. Il quartiere dove è ubicato è molto comodo sia per la vicinanza alla metro che ai traghetti. Inoltre nei dintorni ci sono locali per qualsiasi tipo di esigenza. Lo consiglio.

title: Not the IHG standard... good location though
text:
Stayed in this listing for 4days. The hotel is centrally located, very near subway, walking distance to Broadway and Times Square. 

Checking in was a breeze as were the only guests at the counter that time. From the lobby, one can see the dining area across. Small but manageable. It gets crowded but the lady on duty replenishing breakfast offers was perfectly managing the guests to get a table or share a table with others. Busy breakfast time was posted inside the lift so guests were forewarned of the busy time.

We had issue with the tv channel and we informed the reception about it. Quickly the maintenance arrived but seem clueless how to manage the channel listing. No CNN and channel programs were limited.

On the second day, a note we received that we enrolled in the green program of the hotel which we did not register and was unaware of. Meaning towels and bedsheets will not be replaced. No issue. But together with this is non collection of garbage!? Good thing we only had shopping bags as garbage,  but what if we had food and other rotten fruits? We hang the notice outside for a room cleaning but no action taken. 

Good WiFi connectivity inside the room.

Beware of the shuttle service counter. It is not connected with the hotel and is a third party provider. We booked for a private car for airport transfer to maximize travel time and pay a higher price. Was surprised to see other passengers inside the service. The dispatcher and the driver pretended to be unaware of the booking and helped them unload their luggage when we complained. They never helped us with our luggage though. Inside the service, a note was posted for the tipping rate...option for $10 or $20. Nice try! 

There are other hotels within the vicinity..might try them next time.

title: Handy location
text: Didn't get off to the best start when checking in. Our room wasn't ready even though we arrived after the advertised check in time. The lady at reception had to make many calls trying to get a room ready for us and this took over 30 mins. I know we were in Manhattan, but the rooms were very small, barely room to place each of our suitcases (there was three of us and 3 suitcases). Not sure in this day and age why hotels in major cities don't have a fridge. Using a bucket to get ice to keep drinks cold is a pain in the butt!!! The only real benefit was that we spend most of the day out of the hotel room.

title: muito bom, atende ao desejado
text: Antes de tudo, no checkin, torça para ser atendido pela Gireidy. Atendente sempre sorridente, simpática e que fala espanhol e inglês. Muito competente. Os quartos dão conta, pois ninguém pretende ficar dentro deles o dia inteiro, imagino. A única limitação do hotel é o elevador, hehe. Existem apenas dois e na hora do café é frustrante esperar por algum vazio. O café é bom, apertadinho, mas bom e Oscar - manager do local - agiliza para que todos consigam sentar. O hotel é muito bom, perto de tudo. Recomendo firmemente.

title: Good location, nice staff
text:
My friend & I stayed here for 4 days. The staff was very nice & accommodating. The concierge could have been more knowledgeable about transportation (after giving us wrong info about bus & overall transportation to the Statue of Liberty - something I think most visitors would want). 

The location was good - walking distance to Times Square, Port Authority, and the theater district.  The hotel was clean but had very small rooms as well as small breakfast area and lobby.  We had a hard time regulating heat/cooling in our room & since one of the beds was pushed right up against the heat/AC unit it blew ICE COLD air directly across the bed so we had to ask for extra blankets.

With all the hotel options available in the area I probably wouldn’t stay here again.

title: Ubicación 10!
text:
Excelente ubicación, en el corazón de Times Square, el desayuno bueno, el lugar para desayunar es muy reducido, lo que dificulta a la hora pico, conseguir mesa. la atención de la gente del hotel muy buena, muy amenos, se esmeran es solucionar todo.
Algo para criticar, éramos 2 adultos y 2 chicos, por lo tanto estuvimos en una habitación con 2 camas grandes, pero la habitación era demasiado chica!! Al punto que no sabía dónde meter las valijas, considero que era un cuarto para 2 personas nada más, no me queje porque fuimos a conocer y la verdad que al hotel íbamos solo a dormir.

title: שירות מצויין
text:
הגענו ל 5 לילות לטיול בניו יורק, חגגנו ימי הולדת לשתי הבנות שלנו,הפתיעו אותנו עם  בלונים וקישוטים בחדר. אנשי הצוות ידידותיים ונעימים תמיד מחייכים.
מיקום מצויין קרוב להכל במרחק הליכה צוות שירותי מאוד.מומלץ

title: Excellent hotel for exploring the Big Apple
text:
My Mother and I arrived at the Holiday Inn Express at midday - our flight having arrived early and the traffic from Newark working in our favour. As such I fully expected us to have to leave our suitcases and go find a coffee shop until the 4PM check-in time. Lili though from the front desk was our savior - we were able to check into our room immediately! She also ran through the check-in process quickly but in a friendly manner, just what is wanted after a 7 hour flight!

We were able to get a lift straight away and the general first impression was good - everything looked clean and tidy. Our room (on the 23rd floor) matched this impression - it was very clean but the bathroom did appear dated. 

All the linen was clean and well laid out, after the first night we were given an extra set of towels which helped given we were sharing.
