The hotel also takes part in a greener scheme where you can choose to launder your towels or not. I couldn't fault the house-keeping, we didn't see many of them for the hotel size but they did a great job.

The bed was comfy and there were two pillows per person, one of which was firmer than the other which meant you had a bit of choice. 

The only issues we had with the room were it didn't get very warm (we tried fiddling with the air con units) so if you're not used to the colder air con that is standard in NYC this might take some adjustment - however the room was never cold. The shower was also a bit fiddly, in particular trying to get the water to use the shower head and not the tap, but once I got the knack to this it was easy enough. There was a bit of elevator noise but it didn't disturb our sleep. I imagine if you were in the 04 or 05 rooms on a floor it might be more of an issue, but in the 02 room it wasn't too bad. If you wanted to be sure though I'd suggest asking for an 01 or 06 room as they were furthest away.

As other people have said the elevators can take some time to arrive, but there are signs in them that warn of the 'busy' hours so to be honest with some planning you can avoid the wait at breakfast time.

Talking of breakfast I was quite impressed with the variety (though bacon was only available once during our stay - a shame as this was lovely!). Every day there were some choice of eggs, sausage of some kind (or bacon) and often there were hash browns! Tea and coffee were available in the outer area, along with various juices - the cinnamon buns others have mentioned (so tasty!) and a pancake maker. Next to the hot food were a variety of bagels (with jams (or jelly's) and butter), and various yogurts and cereals. 

If you're at breakfast rush hour you will struggle a bit, there were a lot of nationalities there and shall I just say that not all of them queue... but the lady in charge (blond, very friendly but I never caught her name) was very good at managing things, making sure people didn't cut in line and got seats quickly. I would say the earlier you got to breakfast the better though!

I want to take the time to make a mention of Felipe on reception. He was always polite to all guests, ready with a smile and was really helpful. He helped get my mothers phone onto the Wifi and then on check-out day gave me a temporary code so I could check on our flight whilst waiting for pick-up despite having checked out earlier in the day.

Check-out time is 11am but the staff seem happy to store people's cases for as along as necessary, as well as allow them to stay in the lobby area. This can make it crowded in the late afternoon - manageable but Friday afternoon was very busy when we were there.

Location wise this hotel is really well placed. 39th street is close enough to Times Square you can walk there in about 10 minutes, but its far enough away to be quieter. There are a variety of sub shops or restaurants nearby as well.

If I go back to NYC I would certainly look into staying at this hotel again.

title: Horrible, never again
text: Stayed Holiday Inn Express in Bangkok, Manila, Singapore and Hongkong. All are perfect but this one here is bad! After one day I got a letter informing that I signed up for the green Programm now the bedsheets and towels will not be changed anymore... never signed fir such a program and worse no garbage was cleaned for 4 days!! The breakfast area is jammed and the staff pretty noisy! At check out I asked to get change fir a 20 Dollar bill and was replied “we don’t have”... your a hotel cashier and don’t have change? The airport service st the lobby is even worse you pay USD 75 fir an airport transfer in privat car and then they pick you up in a bus with other people!... what a lousy attempt to cheat people!!

title: Excellent location
text:
I went to New York to see a play at a Broadway Theatre (Bernard B. Jacobs). For that, this hotel  was a perfect choice. It was comfortable, the staff is really nice, breakfast is included, the view I had from the 30th floor was good, it was a quiet room in a very busy city. I love walking and  I was able to walk to certain touristic sites such as Central Park, Empire State, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, Hard Rock Café, Rockefeller Center, etc. 

I liked the breakfast, but I’d love they have a larger variety of fruit. The dinning area is very small, but they provided so options around the main floor to eat your breakfast. Everybody at the dinning area was very nice and helpful.

I was received by Hillary Hardin, she was very nice and informative. Felipe, at the Reception desk was really nice too and helped me solved a problem I had.

For the days I visited NYC I felt that it was a little expensive, don’t know why from September 15th to 18th was higher than other days during the year. But I definitely would consider to stay at this hotel when I visit NYC again if I catch an offer.

title: Super bien placé
text:
Belle prestations, chambre twin  avec 2 grands lits très spacieuse.
Salle de bains avec baignoire. 
Serviettes de bain de toutes tailles et en doubl
Produits de bain neutogena
Pas trop de bruits malgré la localisation
Très bonne literi
Petit déjeuner buffet à volonté. 
Le client est informé des heures de pointe
Petit embouteillage aux ascenseurs  a 9 h malgré les 3 ascenseurs. Un peu normal vu qu'ils deservent 30 étages
Café thé a volonté dans la journée et petit sac à emporter le matin avec 1 bouteille d'eau, un muffin et un barre céréale compris dans la prestation
Espace ordinateur  et imprimante 
Wifi gratuit 
Personnel avenant et disponible

title: Great time in the city that never sleeps
text: First time in the city that never sleeps- a great time in this city, and the hotel. The room was big,cleaned everyday, and all staff were friendly especially Lili at the reception . Breakfast had a lot to offer,the breakfast staff each morning,made sure that nothing was missing, and helping out. The hotel is well located,not far too Times Square,the subway etc. First time in a holiday inn, would recommend.

title: Bien placé
text: Nous avons passé 6 Nuits dans cet Hôtel à New York, très bien placé, près de Times Square. Nous avons tout fait à pied. Metro et arrêt de bus y compris les bus touristiques sont à proximité environ 10 Minutes de marche. Il est au calme. Chambre très propre, excellente Wifi, Petit Déjeuner pas très varié mais correct. Personnel ne parle pas le Français, mais très accueillant. Les New Yorkais en général sont très sympathiques. Nous avons passé un très bon séjour dans cette hôtel. Nous le recommandons

title: Value for Money
text: Budget hotel conveniently situated for mid-town attractions and subway access. Good breakfast included - expect paper plates and plastic cutlery in a works canteen setting. Had requested and got a room on a high floor for quietness, and it was available immediately despite an early arrival from JFK. Elevators are old and slow and we spent quite a bit of time during our 5 night stay waiting for them. Room was absolutely fine. Do not book their airport transfers - hopeless. Our departure time was moved up without explanation and it took me and the receptionist an hour to clarify the time and get a reason, which was an expectation of traffic delays due to tunnel works. This was a lie. We had in fact been booked onto a bus where every other passenger was going to La Guardia (the route never went near any tunnels). For an extra $10 we could have gotten our own taxi straight to JFK and saved ourselves the stress. The hotel though is fine.

title: Good Value for Money
text: This is a great location. Right near Times Square and close to lots of theaters. The rooms were comfortable and the breakfast - wow there was plenty to choose from. It was healthy and plentiful. Staff were friendly in the breakfast room but some of the staff on the front counter seemed dismissive when asking questions. Overall though it was a good place to stay.

title: il peggiore holiday inn che mi sia mai capitato
text:
Dico subito che l'unica cosa positiva di questo hotel erano i due letti queen size fantastici.
Per il resto sono rimasto molto deluso, in alta stagione hotel era pieno... piu di 30 piani con soli due ascensori , la mattina è stato un problema arrivare a fare colazione, piu di una volta siamo scesi a piedi per 20 piani.
Arrivati a colazione i piatti e le posate erano di carta/plastica... e la scelta del cibo è scarsa non all'altezza di altri holiday inn. senza contare che è impossibile trovare posto in quanto la sala colazioni è piccola molto piccola...ce gente che raccoglie il cibo e va a fare colazione nella hall
Inoltre...
1) una sera rientro e trovo la porta aperta lasciata dalla cameriera la mattina (per fortuna loro non è stato sottratto nulla dalla camera.)
2) un altra sera rientro e trovo che la camera non è stata fatta.
3) avevo bisogno di fare la stampa di una pagina ma le stampanti erano rotte.. mi sono rivolto all'hotel vicino e mi hanno fatto stampare senza problemi.
4) condizionatore rumoroso
Insomma credo che si possa trovare di molto meglio. io di certo non ci torno piu,

title: Incredible Friendly Service
text: Hello from the UK - Wow, a wonderful place.  Arrived on September 7th for a few days to celebrate my partners 50th Birthday.  Reception staff were fantastic, friendly and helpful.  Being IHG members, we spun that wheel at reception and won . . . A bag of chips (crisps) !  😂 My partner upon arrival was wearing a “50” badge.  This was clearly noted by reception staff which made their welcome incredibly warm.  I’ve stayed at countless hotels across the world yet the reception staff here stood out.  The welcome is SINCERE as in meant !  Not just part of the job.  The room was fine and more than adequate.  I asked at reception if there was any refrigerator in the room to be immediately responded with “we’ll get you one up !  No cost”.  Five minutes later, a refrigerator arrived.  EXCELLENT!  On September 8th upon arrival back to the hotel, ( see picture ) - a wonderful surprise.  Balloons and celebratory gift on the bed for my partner.  This brought a tear to my eye.  Such a gorgeous thought.  Breakfast is unlimited and plentiful.  The staff on the restaurant as friendly as my own Mum.  A more senior lady working in the restaurant stood out !  ( bringing walnuts to our table )  This hotel employs the royalty of quality service and I don’t just give that accolade lightly.  Just incredible service throughout.  So sad to leave NYC but so looking forward to returning back to Holiday Inn Times Square.  Thank you so so much guys xxx

title: Gutes Hotel mit Frühstück nahe des New Yorker Herzens
text:
Das Hotel ist gut gelegen in der 36th Strasse nahe Macys, 6th Av, Times Square und Broadway. Für US- amerikanische Standards gibt es sogar ein gutes Frühstück.
Das Zimmer war sauber, wenn auch „benutzt“. Das Personal war sehr aufmerksam und nett. Einzig der Fahrstuhl und das Internet an den PCs an der Rezeption geben Grund für einen kleinen Punktabzug der B- Note.

title: Great location, can walk to almost everything, or just jump on a bus or subway
text: Great staff, price is great and the rooms are bigger than a lot of rooms in the city, great Breakfast with a lot to choose from. was very clean but little outdated but still very nice will stay here again.

title: Fun five day getaway!
text:
The Holiday Inn in Times Square was adequate for our stay. The rooms were clean and quiet, although quite small. We did not have any issues with the elevators, but they were understandably busier first thing in the morning. The free breakfast was tasty and well organized. The staff always helped you find a seat and were quick to refill the food stations. 
We found the reception staff to be friendly and helpful, especially Lili who seeminlgly went our of her way to help. She always had a smile for us. Thank you!
The hotel location was good, quite close to the subway and shows on Broadway and off Broadway.

title: Great hotel and location!
text: This was our second trip to New York City.  Our first trip we paid an arm and a leg for our hotel room and it was right in the heart of Time Square but the room was so small it was ridiculous. This time we stayed here at the Holiday Inn Time Square which is a 8-10 min walk to the hub of Time Square. We would definitely stay here again!! This Holiday Inn was great, our room was spacious, quiet and spotless extremely safe area as well. Breakfast was included , so many varieties of sausage, eggs, pancakes, fruit, muffins and cereals.

title: Bon hôtel, très bien situé !!!
text:
Bon hôtel, emplacement judicieux, tout est à portée de marche, Time Square à 10mns etc...
Petit déjeuner correct, propre, idéal pour ceux qui veulent visiter sans utiliser les transports en commun ou taxis.
Points négatifs: pas de frigo dans la chambre, affluence dans les ascenseurs ( suivant le moment de la journée, on a attendu plus de 20mns sur un des 2 ascenseurs !!!)

title: Pessima esperienza - NON SCEGLIETE QUESTO ALBERGO
text: Avevo prenotato questo albergo a marzo 2019 tramite Booking per un soggiorno dall'8 al 12 agosto 2019. Prenotazione confermata e documentata sul sito di Booking e via email. Sono arrivata presso questo albergo con la mia famiglia la sera tardi dell'8 agosto, dopo 10 ore di viaggio dall'Italia, ed ho scoperto che, nonostante Booking mi avesse confermato la prenotazione e continuasse a inviarmi remind di tale conferma, la struttura aveva in realta' cancellato tale prenotazione senza che io ne fossi informata. La receptionist dell'albergo di fronte alle mie rimostranze legittime (considerato che la prenotazione era stata fatta in marzo) e' stata estremamente scortese e indisponente: mi ha detto che l'albergo era sold out, che non c'era posto per noi e che non potevo pretendere niente visto che non avevo pagato (NB: la prenotazione citava esplicitamente che il pagamento doveva essere effettuato all'arrivo in albergo e che avevo diritto di cancellazione gratis fino al giorno precedente il soggiorno!). Ha aggiunto poi che avrei dovuto chiamare Booking x risolvere la situazione (...a mezzanotte, in una citta' sconosciuta, con due bambini, dopo 10 ore di viaggio!). Mi sono ritrovata dunque con due bambini di notte senza un albergo, senza alcuna assistenza e nessuna richiesta di scuse. In un albergo vicino ci hanno poi elemosinato (a pagamento ovviamente) una stanza con 1 solo letto matrimoniale, dove abbiamo dormito in 4. Sconsiglio questo albergo fortemente. Andate altrove,

title: Holiday Inn Express 343th west time square New York. (31July - 5/8/2019)
text:
For first time traveled to New York by our own, this holiday inn was up to our expectation. Room was spacious, quiet and many families stayed here, we felt very safe. Breakfast was included , so many varieties of hot foods, drinks , cakes and cereals, fresh fruits also fresh made pan cake. All the staffs worked there were helpful, cheerfully , energetic and friendly. From hotel it takes about 8-10 mins walked to Port Authority bus terminal where you can take a bus , 
train and Newark express bus to airport and walked distance to time square. If you would like to have breakfast in the hotel and longer stayed near time square, I would recommend this hotel reasonable price and good value for money.

title: Basic Hotel but location convenient
text: As with all Express by Holiday Inn hotels it is basic. Free breakfast is a big plus and breakfast was good but room was very busy and can be hard to get a seat. Rooms small but that's everywhere in NYC. Area around the hotel is rough. I say people sleeping rough and going through trash. Value for money definitely but don't expect luxury. A big shout out to the young lady concierge she got us a last minute shuttle to EWR after I booked my shuttle for the wrong day. Top class service from a lovely lady who is a credit to the hotel.

title: Completely met our needs
text: This hotel is conveniently located allowing us to easily walk to our destinations which included the Intrepid museum, Times Square, and Broadway show.  The hotel is clean and the staff was more than willing to help.  The breakfast was tasty and the staff stayed on top of refilling and cleaning. The only trouble we had was getting an elevator in the morning. At all other times, we had no trouble with the elevators. Since there are only two and so many of the people staying at the hotel were on the move in the morning it took a while.  The room itself was tiny (as they all are in NYC), but clean and totally met our needs.

title: Typical NYC Hotel - Small Rooms
text:
I often stay in HIE hotels; this is not what you normally find ,,, but remember that you are in NYC and won''t spend much time in the hotel.

There are two elevators and 36 floors so the wait can be long. The breakfast area is amazingly small and it's like "pigs at a trough" trying to eat. 

The room was typically small but adequate with a nice bed and decent size TV.  I like thee fact that the window opened about 4 inches. I'm strange...I like to hear the sounds of the city at night.

Overall it was a clean place, great staff, and adequate room.

title: Lovely clean and friendly hotel close to everything but......
text:
My son and I have just come back from New York where we stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Times Square.
The hotel is very clean and the staff extremely helpful.
The room was a good size and a problem we had with the safe was fixed in a timely fashion.
We loved the flavoured water, fruit and other treats on offer in the afternoons.
However, the breakfast eating area was way too small to accommodate the amount of guests staying at the hotel.
It was crowded and somewhat stressful.
It was hard moving around in such a small space and on our last morning we ended up taking our food to our room because there was nowhere to sit.
Having only 2 elevators was also an issue especially around breakfast and check out times.
We walked down 18 flights of stairs with a suitcase because it was too long a wait for an elevator to go down.
Having only one public bathroom with key card access was also an issue when we were waiting for our shuttle back to the airport and there was many people in the same boat.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is near Times Square, subway, theaters. There is also a good Irish pub up the street. The hotel will give you a discount card for the pub. Breakfast was free and pretty good. The hotel staff was very helpful and handled large groups well.

title: Great Location
text: Close to the theater district, Time Square and subway lines, the hotel offered us a perfect starting point for our daily adventures. Busy front desk but very attentive and helpful. Elevators between room n lobby were fast n efficient. Rooms were comfortable and quiet, Would stay there again!

title: Service was Great!
text: Recently I took my daughter and her friend and mom to NYC for a quick girls trip. The hotel staff was extremely kind and helpful. We were able to check in early and leave our bags after checking out. My 1 complaint was that we ordered a pizza from room service and it had hair in it! I called down and the woman who answered was embarrassed and offered to take it off the bill and make a new one. The pizza came up quickly and the second one was hairless!!! The food was decent pricing as well.

title: Everything was perfect up until the morning we had to check out
text: My partner and I were staying at the Holiday inn for 1 night. Everything was perfect up until the morning we had to check out. We had just finished coitus and was in our underwear. Someone opened our door without knocking and told us we had to check out. What if they had came earlier?! The hotel should call first at least and not barge in. Very unprofessional.

title: Fantastiskt läge!
text:
Fin reception men välkomnande personal. Hissen var hemsk. Tog lång tid och var alltid fulla. rummet var som att kliva in i 70/80 talet. Heltäckningsmatta och tråkiga mörka möbler. Det luktade och kändes väldigt fuktigt. Golvet under heltäckningsmattan var ojämnt vilket fick en att känna sig åksjuk! En barngarderob fanns så vi valde (två vuxna) att behålla kläderna i resväskan. Badrummet var en upplevelse. Duschmunstycke från 80 talet som sprutade överallt förutom där det skulle! När man skulle spola på toalettstolen så gick "spolhandtaget" av och sen kunde det stå och rinna vatten en stund! 
Bra frukost och väldigt trevlig frukostpersonal. 
Det är helt enkelt lagom. Men jag testar nog ett annat hotell nästa gång men i samma område!

title: Hotel bien situé, belles prestations
text:
Hôtel très bien situé à 3 rues de Times Square, déco sympa et moderne. 
Personnel à l'écoute et pro (attention que Anglais ou Espagnol). Petit déjeuner gratuit très varié, sucré salé, le top !
Par contre le point négatif est le monde aux ascenseurs (il y en a 2 qui balayent les 36 étages de l'établissement). Et le monde également au petit déj. après 7h00, nous y allions à 6h30 pour profiter au maximum des activités New Yorkaises. Pour le Week end c'est à partir de 7:00.
Chambres propres, café à volonté toute la journée à la réception.
Manque juste une chose essentielle: UNE FONTAINE A EAU, ce serait parfait, histoire d'avoir la 5ème étoile :)

title: Gran ubicación !
text:
Lo bueno : 
.-ubicación muy cerca del corazón de Times Square.
.- habitación pequeña pero funcional.
.- desayuno incluido tipo buffet bueno 
.- check in y check out expedito 

Lo malo : 
.-2 ascensores para 36 pisos, en algunos horarios toca esperar 10-15 minutos 
.- personal no siempre amable

title: Vacation
text: Clean,friendly and locally situated. Would definitely stay here again close to subway.penn station and time Square. Staff  is very friendly and helpful. Nice lobby. Room is clean. Bathroom is clean. A nice y place to stay

title: Visiting New York City?
text:
My wife and I on our recent trip stayed at this very pleasant hotel.
We chose it because of it's location: just a few minutes walk from Times Square, Penn Station and many other attractions.
The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the breakfast (part of the deal) was very good.
No downsides. Good value for money.

title: Good Location, Clean Rooms, Great Breakfast
text:
My husband and I just returned from a visit to NYC and stayed at the Holiday Inn Express on 39th street for 4 nights.  We were very pleased with our stay.  The location was great and within walking distance of many sights and fairly close to Port Authority and Times Square subway stations.  

I can be a little weird about the cleanliness of hotel rooms (to the point of not being able to sleep sometimes), and I was very comfortable and pleased with our room.  It was very clean and well maintained. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I'm not sure why people complain about rooms in NYC being small--yes, they are on the small side, but how much room does one really need? We had all the space and amenities necessary for our stay.  

We were also very pleased by the quality of the free breakfast in the hotel.  There were many options, mostly the same each day with a couple of changes. The eating space is on the small side and can get crowded at times, but there was a very friendly, helpful employee overseeing the dining area who quickly cleaned up after guests who were finished eating and helped newly arriving guests find a spot to sit.  I was pretty impressed with what a great job he did, and he did it with a smile. 

If we ever return to NYC, we will definitely consider staying here again.

title: Good location but with downsides
text:
Location-wise, this place is good with <10 mins walk to subway, Times square and 
Penn Station. Rooms were clean and staff were helpful. The rooms were tiny as one would expect in the area. As other have written, the breakfast area is too small for all the guests there. The two elevators are insufficient for this 35+ floor building - we had to once wait for almost 15 minutes to go to the first floor. Even the highest level of status didn't get any upgrades (although we went during a time of high-demand). 

One tip if you stay for long is the hotel guests can use the laundry facility in the  next-door sister facility Candlewood suites. Now, it turns out that for the days I stayed, Candlwood suites was slightly cheaper than the Holiday Inn express (I discovered that after I booked) and from what I saw of that neighboring hotel that *seemed* better with more facilities (obviously I didn't see the rooms).

title: Hotel muito bom, com funcionários prestativos
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, perto do metrô,perto  da Times Square, com funcionários prestativos, sem taxa de resort e com café da manhã. Excelente hotel. E os funcionários sempre nbos ajudando no que fosse preciso.

title: OTTIMA POSIZIONE
text: L'Hotel è vicino a Times Square che si raggiunge a piedi in in 10 minuti, e quindi al centro di New York, la stazione e la metropolitana sono molto vicine. Noi eravamo al 13° piano, ci sono 2 ascensori ma uno era quasi sempre fuori servizio. La camera ed il bagno sono piuttosto piccole e nella nostra mancava una lampadina e la cassaforte non funzionava, ma nonostante lo avessi fatto presente all'arrivo, nessuno ha provveduto a sistemare le cose. La colazione non è molto varia, ma ci sono dei frutti, i cereali, gli yogurt e le uova strapazzate, più succhi vari di frutta e il caffe americano, vari docetti molto zuccherosi tipicamente americani come le ciambelle ed i muffin.

title: Bien situé
text: Nous avons séjourné 5 nuits dans cet hôtel. Les chambres sont assez petites, la décoration minimaliste, mais elles sont très propres et la literie est excellente. Beau buffet pour les petits déjeuners (inclus dans le prix) et personnel attentif. Cet hôtel est très bien situé à proximité de 2 stations de métros offrant des lignes différentes et permettant d'accéder à de nombreux centres d'intérêts à Manhattan et Brooklyn. Il est aussi à 5mn de la gare de Penn Station. Le seul (petit) inconvénient est la proximité de la 8th St, pas toujours très engageante.

title: Squeaky pipes, tiny rooms
text:
When I realized one bed in the room was hard as a rock and the other was more reasonable, I did a little investigating. Sure enough, one mattress was on the bed upside down! The pillow top was face down on the bed. Who knows how many people suffered before now? For all future guests if room 2805, you have me to thank.  I turned the mattress right side up. 

Pipes squealing every time someone around us turns in water, AC unit rattles, and the room is absolutely cramped. The hotel is very compact, so all rooms are basically right at the elevator, which dings very loudly. 

Oh well.

title: Overwhelmed front desk staff
text:
Overall, hotel was adequate and ideally located. As expected for NYC, the room rate was a little higher and square footage was significantly less than a typical HIE room.  But we were pleased with the room itself. However, it felt as if the hotel was overwhelmed by the number of guests.

When we arrived at 5PM (check in posted as 4PM), our room was not ready.  The front desk stated they would check with housekeeping and asked us to wait in the lobby.  We did for 20 minutes.  Finally I went back to the desk to inquire and a different woman said it was indeed ready.  How long we would have waited... I am not sure.

On check out, we asked them to keep our bags for us which they happily agreed to.  Upon our return, we waited patiently in line for our turn and presented our tickets.  She took them, sat them on her computer and took another three customers before I asked about my bags and only then they were promptly retrieved for me.

Also, breakfast was packed with people, but we were able to get a table and there was plenty of food and it was good.

There are only two elevators and at 10:00 one was in use by housekeeping, leaving everyone else trying to use one elevator to make the 11AM checkout.  My family opted to carry our luggage down 26 flights (and we still beat someone who waited for the elevator).

title: Clean, comfortable hotel near Times Square
text:
We just returned from a 5-night stay at the Holiday Inn Express NYC Times Square. This was my first time in the city and I was so excited for the trip. We were traveling together as a family of nine and booked three rooms. 
After reading the reviews about the frustrating experience others had had with the elevators, I called several days before our arrival to request a lower floor and have the rooms be together or at least, close by. When we arrived, we were given one room on the 8th floor and the other two on the 26th. I asked if there was anything available for lower, and the front desk staff moved two of our rooms to the 16th and one to the 13th, which worked out pretty well. The hotel is very narrow, with only 8 rooms per floor. Our rooms all faced an adjacent building with absolutely no views, but that was fine. If a view matters to you, I suggest asking for it, because as I understand, some of the rooms have spectacular ones. Our room itself was very small, but clean and comfortable. My room had three people in it, myself and my teenage daughter and niece. We’ve stayed in cruise cabins together before, and this room was somewhat larger. It had two full-sized beds and a tiny bathroom with no counter-space. We kept our toiletries on a little shelf below the sink. The bathroom towels are stored in the shower, which we thought was weird, but happily, they never got wet. Although it was small, the bathroom was clean and the water was hot with plenty of pressure. There was only one luggage rack in the room, a tiny closet and no access to underneath the beds, so finding somewhere to store our suitcases was a bit challenging. There are drawers you can unpack into, but we preferred to keep our things in our suitcases. After some shuffling and improvising, we made it work. The beds were comfortable. The pillows are extremely soft and without support. Some people may like a super soft pillow, but I have neck problems and hated them. I picked the one in the room that was the most firm after a miserable first night, and it did the job. The teenagers in the room thought the pillows were comfortable (youth…lol!!!). Overall, the room was perfectly fine. We were right outside the elevator, but with only eight rooms per floor, there was little foot traffic or noise. We could hear the street noises below, but it didn’t bother us. 
As others have noted, the hotel is severely lacking in elevators and their accounts of the circumstances are accurate. My advice is to take the stairs going down, if you are able. From the 16th floor, it only takes about two minutes, which sure beats a 15 minute wait. Going up, bring your patience, especially during the busy times (mornings and afternoon check-in). We made sure to have everything together and be ready to go to avoid trips up and down. One note, and major annoyance, was our room keys continually would not work. This was the case with all our rooms. I had to have them replaced no less than four times during our stay. The front desk kept saying not to keep them near our cell phones, but that couldn’t have been the problem as some in our group had their key cards in their pockets and phones in their bags. They also suggested going in and out of stores could deactivate the key cards, but if that were the case, no one in the whole buildings would work!! One of the front desk people told my brother-in-law it was an ongoing issue at the hotel, so be forewarned. I didn’t so much mind the inconvenience (arriving at your door after the elevator ride and having all three keys not work was frustrating) as being told repeatedly it was something we were doing wrong. Other than that, the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even have cookies at the front desk, which the kids really enjoyed, and iced-lemon water which is very welcoming when you arrive back after a full-day of walking. Coffee, tea and hot chocolate are always available in the dining area too. 
We ate breakfast at the hotel each morning. The room was crowded every day, but we always managed to get a seat. People are very willing to share their table, so just ask. The hotel had even expanded its breakfast hours until 10:30 am, which was great. The food was good, like most other hotel breakfasts. However, the menu never changed in the five days we were there. Never. At all. I thought that was odd. Kitchen staff was very friendly and kept the place clean and nice. 
As for location, the hotel is only a block away from the nearest subway station (Port Authority at 40th and 8th). Get a subway map from the desk as soon as you check in and orient yourself if you’re new to NYC!! We arrived through Penn Station, but Port Authority is much closer to take the trains uptown and downtown. Times Square is about a 5-10 minute walk. There are tons of restaurants near the hotel. We found two nice Italian places and a good deli within a block on 9th street. 
Overall, I enjoyed our stay at the Holiday Inn Express. It’s clean, comfortable and not far from Times Square. Clean and comfortable are the most important things to me when I’m staying at a hotel.  Whether or not others would like this hotel probably depends on what you are used to when you travel plus how picky or critical you might be. I’m pretty easy to please, so I thought it was a perfectly adequate hotel that suited our needs just fine for this vacation.

title: Good location.
text: Really needs an IHG members express checkin line as I had to air 20 mins to check Inn. 10 min walk from Penn Station.  Breakfast was ok but very busy. $2 for vending machine water.  Decent restaurants nearby.

title: Good location tired room
text: Stayed two nights for business.  The location is very good.  The staff was nice.  Very small lobby that was constantly filled with kids on a school group.  Small breakfast area filled with suitcases checked for the day.  Room was worn and typical NYC size nightstand king nightstand small closet small desk small bathroom with little storage

title: Excellent location but rooms smell
text: The location is excellent with a 10 mins walk to Times Square. Great place to stay if you want to walk around and experience the city. The service can be courteous and they need to fix the smell in rooms.

title: Great  Location!
text: This hotel was very convenient to many restaurants and bars on the west side. The free breakfast had much to choose from and was quickly replenished by the staff. Therese, Kay, and Jazman kept the breakfast area well stocked and clean and were also very friendly. The room was a bit small, but comfortable for the two of us. Everything from the room to the lobby and breakfast area was spotless. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. I will definitely stay here again when in NYC!

title: Convenient and clean!
text:
This hotel is super convenient when coming from Penn Station! It's an easy walk to a lot of great places, including the convention center and Times Square. The rooms were clean and the staff were all so friendly and helpful. There are usually waits for the elevators because there are so many floors and not many rooms on each floor but staff was great about making sure people got where they needed to go. 

The single room is super small but what else can you expect in NYC! The bathroom door is a little unsettling because it doesn't lock and has that kind of opaque glass that makes you feel like people can see when you're in there. 

Hotel TV has HBO which is fun, and there's a restaurant downstairs open from breakfast until midnight so very convenient!

title: Does not meet IHG standards
text:
It was a bad omen when we walked into
the lobby of this HIE and had to wait
before checking in because some guy
was cleaning the front desk.  To make
the situation worse, there is a large
support column right in front of the desk,
which both clerks and guests have to work
around.  It seems that HIE repurposed this 
building into a hotel.

The room itself was extremely small and
cramped.  There was not even enough room
to pull out the office chair from the
desk.

The coffee maker was on the nightstand
because there was no other place to put it.
The ice bucket and tray were on top of the
wardrobe because there was no other place
to put it.  The clock was on the chest-of-
drawers because there was no room on the
nightstand because of the coffee maker.

The room was very dark and there were not
enough electrical outlets.  There was no
grab bar in the shower.  There was no
towel bar in the bathroom.  The HVAC
system did not work.

As IHG Platinum members we asked the night
clerk if we could have a late check-out.
She said yes and she said she would make a
note of it.  The next morning we asked the
day clerk to confirm our late check-out 
and he could not find any record of a late
check-out for us.  We again asked for late
check-out and he said he would make a note
of it.  At 11:10 am the maid came knocking
at our door wondering why we were not out
yet.

The breakfast bar was supposed to open at
6:30 am but when I arrived at 6:30 they were
not yet ready.  There were no bananas, there
was no hot sauce for the scrambled eggs, and
there were no serving utensils for the hot
oatmeal condiments.

At one point some black girl bulldozed through
the area slamming the cabinet doors and banging
the pans.  She must have worked up a sweat
because she then started wandering through the
dining room pulling up her shirt to cool off.
The male working in the breakfast bar was rude,
I think his name tag said Oscar.

The breakfast bar area is too small; there are
not enough tables.  There are no tables for
couples or singles, they are all 4 person tables.
They should rip out the second floor of the
hotel and move the entire breakfast bar 
to the second floor to alleviate the congestion.

It took a long time for guests to get from the
upper floors to the lobby.  It was common for the
elevators to be so full that guests had to skip
one or two cars and wait for the next one.
The maid named Khris should be fired.  She and 
her cart cut in front of a line of guests so she
could get from the 34th floor to the 32nd floor.
Employees should always yield the right-of-way
to guests.  There was another employee named Michael
who was manually operating the elevator controls.
He was shuttling employees among the upper floors,
making guests wait who wanted to go to the ground floor.
Two elevators are not enough for a 36 story building.

This location does not have a fitness center,
guests have to go to the Candlewood Suites
next door.  This location should be removed from
the IHG network, it does nothing but give the
brand a bad reputation.

title: Inn, Yes.  EXPRESS, Not so Much!
text:
Our room was small, but perfectly ok.  Bed was really great.  Staff were very nice about getting us to a room with a pretty good view. (we had paid for a view room.)  
Breakfast is handy and offered some protein. Enjoyed phone plugs next to bed.  Windows open for air. Special thanks to May at the front desk, who was aways welcoming, kind and efficient.   

That's it for the good.  
This hotel has so many problems...  the biggest being the elevator which has been discussed over and over here.  We became so desperate to get to our room above the 30th floor and make it to the theater that i crammed into an elevator i would NEVER normally cram into.  Scary.  It always had a wait, but one was broken one day and the wait was about 40 minutes.  Picture of line here.  There is no service elevator, so often, it would finally come, but be filled with a worker and a cart.  

I never grade down for a breakfast but must say that the breakfast room was super depressing.  No windows and very crowded.

Staff is very friendly but there is ALWAYS a wait to talk to staff, get a new key, etc etc. They do a lot of tours, so people come in in big numbers at once.  They need a separate line for people who are already checked in and just need a quick something.  

Finally, the neighborhood is ok... but lots of construction makes it seem kind of messy and dilapidated. 

For a comfy bed with breakfast, go ahead if you can get a great price.  Otherwise, there are 2 similar hotels on the same block which are about the same price.  One is actually with kitchens...  But we will stay elsewhere next time.

title: Hotel con lo justo.
text: El hotel tiene lo necesario. Y la atención es muy buena. Podrían renovar el edificio porque el mobiliario es antiguo. El desayuno esta bien. Con lo mínimo en variedad. Lo que si esta colapsado para subir h bajar en ascensor no menos de 20 min ( no exagero)y en horario poco tipo 9 am desayunar es muy complicado. Otro tema que no suma es la ubicacion. Vibe otra veces y es mas agradable parar de brodway para el otro lado. Si bien es todo seguro la otra zona es mas agradable especialmente de noche.

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Hotel cómodo, limpio, 2ascensores muy poco para la cantidad de personas y el comedor para el desayuno muy pequeño. En general muy bueno, las personas amables y queda cerca de todo, porque uno camina mucho para conocer

title: Good location. Earplugs required.
text: This hotel is well situated for many of the main attractions that NYC has to offer. The staff are friendly, the room was clean, the bed is HUGE and very comfortable, the shower is great. Everything you'd want really, except for the noise when trying to sleep. The window in the room did little to reduce any outside noise - I was on the 13th floor and could hear sirens and street noise more than I would have expected. And the room was right next to the elevator, which rumbled up and down throughout the night. But if you're a good sleeper, this wouldn't present a problem and you could always pack some earplugs! If you don't mind the exercise, I would recommend getting where you can on foot - save yourself some serious time stuck in traffic and get to see more of the sights. Breakfast is adequate but not something to rave about, and it's probably best to get there early as it fills up quickly. The dining room is very small and cramped for the amount of people that use it, but there is the option of filling a tray and taking it back to your room. Overall, not a bad place to stay but not the best either.

title: Great Base For Exploring NYC
text:
We visited NYC in Feb 2019, and picked this hotel as it was ideally located for exploring the big apple. We had a requested rooms close by as we had 2 rooms booked and were sharing with teenage children. Upon arrival they staff on reception explained we would be on different floors, but they did manage to put us all on the same floor, and the rooms were across the hall from one another. 

The rooms were great, comfortable beds and a great shower too! The heater in the room was a little noisy too. We did not really spend any amount of time in the hotel as we were out exploring. The one annoyance was getting down in the lift in the morning, this could take some time as the hotel only has two lifts and one was often out of order. 

As for location, it was perfect with Time Square just a 5 minute walk out the door.

title: Worst elevators I’ve ever experienced
text: Stayed in this hotel for convenience. In my opinion unless it’s the Four Seasons or a 5 star hotel all NYC hotels are pretty much the same. This hotel fit that bill. Tall skinny building with about 8 rooms on a floor. The rooms are small but have what you need. I did like the pillows. Will give them that. The problem with these hotels is they are built with two elevators to service over 30 floors. In the morning it makes for a rush. After waiting 15ish mins for the elevator I got on an already cramped elevator on the 36th floor (top floor). The elevator stopped on over 20 floors on the way down. These elevators should be programmed to go down to lobby after 5 stops. The fact that we stopped on almost every floor was ridiculous. Most people couldn’t even get on and continued to wait. But some jerks crammed in, putting us way over capacity. Finally the elevator stopped on the 4th floor and was stuck. For about 10 minutes with 15 people and luggage in an elevator built for 10ish. Thankfully it was only 10 minutes. But they got the doors open on 4 and we all walked down the stairs. I stay in many an NYC hotel and know that’s how these elevators are, but this was by far the worst. I’m never staying at this hotel and suggest you don’t either.

title: Good standard hotel
text:
We stayed at Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square for two nights – a spontaneous trip, where the hotel was booked the same day, as we checked in. We were looking for a cheap standard hotel, which we got.

The hotel is located at 39th street closed to Hells Kitchen, Chelsea and Time Square. There is a lot of restaurant and bars close by. Excellent location. We arrived to the hotel from Newark, and the hotel is located next to Lincoln Tunnel, which made it really fast to get to the hotel – about 30 min in an Uber. 

The check in was fast and the staff was kind. We asked for a late check out, which we got, but a late check out is 12 pm – we have hoped for 2 pm, which we couldn’t get. 

The room was a traditional New York hotel room – nothing special, but it was fine. The room was clean and the Wi-Fi was fast. We had a room at 29th floor, and it was peaceful. 

The breakfast is always included on Holiday Inn Express, and the food was ok, but the breakfast restaurant was really chaotic, but me manage to get a table both days. 

Conclusion:
If you are looking for a standard hotel in New York, this is a really good choose. If I am looking for a hotel in New York at this standard, I will choose this hotel again. Great value for the money.

title: Awful
text: I have never posted a bad review as I prefer to speak directly to people if I have an issue. The staff however don’t seem to care whatsoever about the issues with our stay. Before we set off from the UK they cancelled our booking literally the same morning, claiming our card was invalid. Our card company said actually the hotel tried to process it but failed to enter an amount. Hotel staff just smiled when we arrived, having rebooked with a new card, and brushed off the stress it caused as a joke. Since then a litany of issues; broken noisy toilet, cracked peeling paint, nowhere to sit at breakfast, no one changed the towels or made the bed ( apparently because we were in the room. We were not in all day!) . Staff never apologise, take no responsibility and generally seem to shirk off any problem as being the customer’s issue. Having travelled extensively this attitude is what I have an issue with. Bad accommodation I can deal with; terrible customer service I cannot. Avoid this place.

title: NYC trip with granddaughter
text: I chose this hotel based on location, price & free breakfast. The hotel was very clean, comfortable & quiet. Hotel staff was very nice & helpful. Room was very small, I think smaller than a cruise ship cabin. We only ate breakfast once, it was okay. Typical hotel breakfast. Overall no complaints except for crowded elevators. Only 2 for the entire hotel.

title: NYC Christmas Visit
text: I have always been a fan of the Holiday Inn chain.  This Express hotel is quite good.  The front desk staff is exceptionally helpful and courteous, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfast filling.  The location is very convenient to seeing all of New York City that one wants.  We walked to Central Park and Times Square with ease.  My only wish is a faster elevator, but one cannot complain at that as we were on a holiday.

title: Too cramped. Not enough elevators
text:
We stayed here for four nights. The staff is nice and the hotel is pretty average for what they charge. We booked off of the IHG website. The main problem with this hotel is the elevators- or lack of elevators. A few days during our stay only one was working, and even when two are working if you are in a middle floor you’ll wait  20 minutes or more unless you are up and out by 8 am.  Also - They do not have a service elevator so the staff with  their stuff rude the passenger elevators.  What you end up having to do is get elevators going UP instead of down just to get a space. We were up very high and did not want to keep walking the stairs. Find a hotel with more elevators, or stay in a low floor. 
The rooms in this hotel are very small as well. If you have 2 beds in a room or get a king they are cramped. We paid $200 a night on a few nights and it was not worth it.  Will look elsewhere on our next stay.

title: Discreto.
text: Hotel accogliente. A pochi passi da Time Square, si raggiunge benissimo a piedi tutta Middletown e oltre. Unica pecca la colazione, poco varia e stanza colazioni troppo piccola, difficile trovare posto a sedere. Nell'insieme comunque lo consiglio.

title: Ottima posizione, buon rapporto qualità/prezzo, camere un pò piccole
text:
Ottima posizione, a meno di 10 minuti a piedi da Times Square, a 2/3 minuti dalla stazione della metro della 42ma, sotto la stazione dei pulmann.
Personale della reception efficiente e cortese. Buona la pulizia sia dei locali comuni che delle stanze. Nella hall è presente un desk presidiato dalle 7.00 alle 19.00 per info, suggerimenti e prenotazioni per visite, tours, spettacoli, transfers per gli aeroporti, ecc.
Nota dolente, forse, la dimensione delle camere.... veramente molto piccole (lo spazio per sistemare le valigie è veramente ridotto al minimo) ed i letti "queen" sono più corti del normale (io sono alto 181 cm. e anche se di poco avevo i piedi fuori), manca il frigobar (sempre per problemi di spazio), il bagno è anch'esso piuttosto piccolo, essenziale ma funzionale.... forse non del tutto adatte a ospitare 4 persone, ottime per una coppia.
Colazione inclusa nel prezzo, buona come qualità e discreta come assortimento; la sala dedicata è però molto piccola e nell'ora di punta tra le 8.00 e le 9.30 spesso si deve fare la fila per trovare da sedere.... ci vuole pazienza.
Tutto sommato, vista la posizone e il costo, l'Hotel è sicuramente da prendere in considerazione.

title: Just what we needed
text: Hotel in the centre of it all- walking distance to subway, times square, Central Park. Lovely comfortable room with large beds and great power showers. This hotel offers free breakfast which can get crowded with school groups but the staff are brilliant at finding you space to have your food.

title: Perfect location. Great hotel
text: This is a budget hotel. Nothing fancy but superb location with great staff & very clean & comfortable. We stayed here as a party of four a girls trip for 5nights. The location is perfect a few minutes walk to times square couldn't get a better hotel for the price if you want to be close to everything. Our room was small but manageable their were four of us two double beds which were very comfortable we all slept each night comfortably. The bathroom clean & the shower powerful. We were on the 18th floor there was lifts & stairs lifts were quite packed every morning but it was fine. The breakfast which was included was basic but satisfying and tasty. The staff throughout the hotel were all very friendly & helpful. If I return to NY I wouldn't look up any other hotel this would be my Go to & will 100% be reccomending it to anyone I know who will be visiting NY.

title: Anniversary Trip
text: We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary in New York City and stayed here. We were given a room on the top floor and had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building.  Room was comfy and was very quiet at night. Elevator was broken at one point during our stay, but fixed quickly and staff handled the situation wonderfully.

title: Great location
text: Stayed for a week as 3 friends from England. Ideal location as everything is walkable from here. We got a taxi to statue of liberty but everywhere else we walked. Hotel is off a side street from main shops and a few minutes from the centre of time square. Fashion and food stores easily available and a 7 eleven on the corner. Easy to check in and door is open 24/7. Desk staff are helpful and booked our taxi return to air port. Breakfast was included:pancakes cereal apple sausage muffin cinnabon coffee and juice. Tea and coffee are always available. We stayed on the highest floor 36. Could see empire state and statue of liberty from our room. Free toiletries included. Great hotel would stay again.

title: Localização
text: O hotel é bom, a localização é excelente (próximo à Port Authority, Times Square, Estações de Metrô). No piso térreo (recepção) há uma máquina disponível com água. Fomos no inverno, então também tinha café, chá e chocolate quente a vontade. O hotel serve um bom café da manhã, com cereais, chás, sucos, frutas, café, pães, donuts, iogurtes (não só os tradicionais, ex.: lights também). O que deixa um pouco a desejar é a segurança, uma vez que dá a impressão de que qualquer pessoa pode acessar o hotel, a área de café da manhã, bem como os andares de quartos. Visivelmente os elevadores não possuem câmeras, nem os andares de quartos. Quanto a esses últimos, são um tanto quanto apertados (éramos três, com duas malas cada). Mas bem pertinho, tem outro HI (nos hospedamos lá em fevereiro de 2017 e é excelente, só não há café da manhã incluído no valor da hospedagem).

title: ideal central location
text: stayed twice , very helpful, comfortable freindly, ideal central New York location. ideal to have a bar/ resturant on the premises. Walkable to all Locations , Broadway, Penn station, etc..  right in the middle of the bustling city.

title: Good Breakfast/Good Location
text: We took a group of chorus students and the location was ideal! In 3 days, we walked to nearly every site on our list. The hot breakfast was ideal for kids, rooms were clean, noise level low. I would definitely recommend for a sight-seeing trip to NYC.

title: 位置超好房间设计脑残的标准hix
text:
位置很好，隔着时代广场50米，去曼哈顿哪里都很方便。
酒店给了我这个小PA高层房间，很厚道。但是然并卵，脑残的房间设计弄得我哭笑不得。面积都狭窄到椅子都拉不出来了，门厅那里却留了四五平米的完全空地！？
其余都没问题，标准的HIX。唯一要注意的是还有个时代广场南HIX很近，千万别走错！

title: Great location
text: This hotel is in a great location. Within walking distance to lots of the sights. The subway was just round the corner to good for getting around New York. Hot drinks available all day by breakfast area. Only issue was lifts. One morning we waited 10 mins to get down to reception. To avoid this ask for low floor

title: Custo beneficio
text: Hotel sem luxo algum. Muito próximo da rodoviária e Times Square. Não aconselho ficar mas que 3 noites. Os quartos são minúsculos e não tem room service. Caso sua viagem seja curta e a grana para hospedagem esteja curta é uma boa opção.

title: Bon hôtel, et bien placé
text: Hôtel confortable et propre. Literie agréable. Salle de bain petite mais pratique et propre. Emplacement idéal pour visiter Manhattan. Petit déjeuner copieux et à volonté, typiquement USA. Proche des restaurants.

title: Wouldn’t stay again
text:
Stayed for 3 nights. 
Staff and cleanliness good but didn’t sleep well at all. The heating in the rooms is very poor so you are either roasting hot and drowned out by the noise of the unit or freezing cold because you can’t sleep with the heater on.
Only have two lifts and although there’s signs saying there may be delays during rush hour, we waited over 15 minutes watching the lift go up every floor, one after the other and back down then a cleaner got out. Fair enough they need to clean but they shouldn’t be holding the lift on each floor whilst they work.
Location is OK but if I visited New York again then I’d prefer to stay closer to Times Square as it’s about 5 minute walk.

title: Fantastic location
text:
Recently stayed in this hotel for our visit to NYC. 
Check inn was quick and easy and we were in our room within 10 mins. The rooms are small but more then adequate to be able to get your head down after a long day. Breakfast is served from 0630 every morning and sets you up perfectly for the day. We never had an issue finding somewhere to sit but we was never down later the 7. There is only 2 lifts in the hotel and on occasions you find yourself having to wait a little while but never to long.
With only a 10 minute walk to Time Square and a short subway ride to lower Manhattan this hotel is in a perfect spot to get around and see the sights.

title: Péssimo atendimento
text: De todos os hotéis Holiday Inn que já fui? Este foi o de pior atendimento. Nem água eles têm disponível para clientes, coisa que em NY é mais que habitual. O quarto é minúsculo. Não ficaria novamente, apesar da excelente localização.

title: Amazing Rocky at desk is a star
text: Wow, what a find, this hotel in Times Square is value for money, great remodel with adequate bathroom and a walk in shower! Who uses tubs anyway. A great bed, modern room feel and a view of the iconic Empire State Building! A fridge no mini bar crap. 7/11 next door, pizza opposite as is liquor store! No bottle openers but 7/11 sell them. Check in was seamless with Rocky at the desk, what a guy, friendly, funny and just all round great ambassador. I’ll be back!

title: Amazing location
text: The hotel is about 8 minutes walk to the Times Square with plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area. The breakfast was good and the rooms weren’t as spacious but had all the amenities. Overall, it was a really good hotel but expensive for this category as it’s New York .

title: Handy location
text: Based on previous experience with the Holiday Inn chain we booked this place while visiting NY and were not disappointed! Staff were welcoming and very helpful, location is close to time square and many other attractions. Our room was small but not cramped, had a view of the Empire State Building. Overall very good.

title: I love NY
text: Ottima posizione in Times Square, nel cuore pulsante della grande mela, a pochi passi dalla metro. Camere non molto spaziose ma pulite, bagno ampio con apprezzabile kit di cortesia. Personale accogliente e disponibile.

title: Localização perfeita, Wi-Fi péssimo e muita gente e pouco espaço no café manhã
text: Hotel com excelente localização, perto do metro, da Macy’s, bons restaurantes, Broadway, Times Square. Café da manhã é um caos, falta lugar para os hóspedes, itens que compõem o café da manhã não são repostos rapidamente pelo Staff. A limpeza das mesas do café é demorada e o nº de funcionários destacados no café é mínimo. Tive que levar meu café para tomar no quarto quase todos os dias. O Wi-Fi não funciona adequadamente, velocidade ridícula, não conte com ele nem para fazer checkin do seu voo. Limpeza dos quartos feita após às 16hs. Fiquei 9 noites e era isso todos os dias.

title: Excellent choice for couples
text: From the moment we arrived the reception was welcoming with free cookies and quick check inn. As a traveller breakfast is very important for us and its amazing how the staff were friendly and variety of food with good tatse ...... We were delighted to have a complementary upgrade in the room with skyline view to the river , empire state and a wonderful city view ..... the rooms were clean and tidy bit small but with everything available including tea/ coffee maker..... The best thing about this hotel is its superb location couple blocks away from everything: broadway theatres, station, subway, all restaurants, center of times square. Yet the room was very quiet. And above all great value for money. I highly recommend for short vacations and couples trip. The only drawback was elevator, although during my stay this problem we did not face, but its highly probable to occur as its bit time wasting to have 2 elevators to serve a 36 floor hotel .... waiting time could be a waste .... but we were happy we did not suffer with that eigther. Definitely would come again later. Thank you Holiday inn express staff for the great stay, and response to my request

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed for 3 nights in feb, 3 girls on shopping trip,6 suitcases. Room for suitcases and could still get round room.beds spotless and comfy. Bathroom great with toiletries and clean towels every day and good shower with lots hot water..never had a problem with lifts we were on 13th floor..breakfast was great loads of choice and lovely staff.wi fi free and worked well. 5 mins from port authority and 7 or 8 min walk from times square

title: Fantastic Service & Accomodations
text: Fantastic service and accommodations. We got stuck in the city due to the storm last week. They were so kind to bring up new toothbrushes and extra towels for our room. Would definitely come back if in the area.

title: NYC
text:
First time to nyc
This hotel was adequate for our needs
Very good breakfast although very crowded
Only 2 elevators and in the morning there is a long wait
Bus guy was really helpful
Guy at the desk not so much
Great deli at the end if the street 9 ave and 39th
Very easy to get everywhere from this hotel 
Good value

title: Value, Location & a Nice room. What more could you want
text:
We are frequent HIE guests and were excited to read the reviews for this location. The stay was very much what we expected. One of the reasons we return to HIEs is the free breakfast. A key to the success of this amenity is the quality of the staff and they were fantastic. The hotel was very crowded, and the staff were professional, and fast. They kept the breakfast stocked, and tables clean and ready to turnover quickly.

The hotel was experiencing elevator problems over the entire stay. From what we could tell, there were 35 floors and 6 rooms per floor. The property has two elevators and one was down all 3 nights of our stay. Management tried to lessen the effect, but there were significant delays getting up and down. This issue reduced my review to 4 stars.

As said elsewhere, the location is fantastic close to Times Square, historic theatres and Subway stations.

title: Perfect location
text: What a great find in the heart of Manhattan! This hotel was a fantastic base for our stay in NYC. A short stroll to some of the highlights of the area and a subway station nearby. The staff were friendly and breakfast was a great addition. Would recommend for a city break

title: Proche times square
text: Hotel très bien situé permet de faire tout Manhattan à pied. Chambre petites mais confortable. Le plus les petits déjeuners sont inclus et tres copieux. Personnels tres a l ecoute. Le personnel ne parle pas le francais

title: エレベーターが。。。
text:
ホテル近くのコンベンションで展示会があり、距離的に近いのでこちらのホテルを選びました。以前もこの界隈のホテルに泊まったことがありますが、タイムズスクエアにも近く、ポートオーソリティでのバス発着などニューヨークのビジネス、観光いずれにも利用しやすいところだと思います。
ホテルは30階以上ある高層のホテルですが、エレベーターが２基しかなく、特に人が混み合う朝などはハウスキーピングの人の行き交いも加わり、エレベーターがかなり混雑することがあり、待ち合わせ時間に遅れる人がいました。この点だけが少し気になりました。
ホテルのスタッフはフレンドリーで、部屋も快適でした。朝の朝食は無料でそれなりのメニューがあるので、毎朝こちらでコーヒーにプラス何かをつまんで食べていました。別の方も書かれているように、加熱料理は特に塩コショウで味付けした方がおいしいと思います。コーヒーなどは部屋にも持ち帰れるので、今回はスタバでコーヒーを飲むことはありませんでした。
帰りに空港までの乗り合いバスを予約しましたが、予約後の送迎時間のブッキングの電話が会話力が無いためなかなか苦戦したので、こちらのツアーデスクの女性に頼んで調整してもらおうとしました。最初は嫌々な顔をされましたが、ちゃんと必要な手配をしていただき、翌日は難なくピックアップしてもらえました。
今回は特に問題があったわけではありませんが、近くにも別のホリデイインがあるので、送迎などされる場合に間違わないようにする必要があると思いました。
ホテルから徒歩圏内にはシェイクシャックやウルフギャングなど有名な店もあり、またミュージカルを観るのも近くにたくさんあるので、地理的には十分に楽しめる場所です。大戸屋やゴーゴーカレーなど日本のチェーン店もあるので、非常に便利なところだと思いますが、いずれにしてもニューヨークの物価が高く、さらにチップまで払うとそれなりに掛かってしまうのがNYの痛いところです。

title: Brilliant hotel fantastic location!
text: My partner and I arrived at the holiday inn on Tuesday 29th January when we arrived the hotel was so welcoming, check in was quick and efficient. We went to our room 2401 nice big spacious room bed was so comfy and the tea and coffee making facilities were brilliant. Bathroom was lovely with a lovely bath and the shower was tremendous. Hotel staff very attentive clean rooms and towels every day, breakfast was lovely buffet style but enough to start off your day, my partner loved the orange juice! The drinks and snacks available to be purchased at the hotel reception are also handy and easy to get to. Upon leaving we checked out at 12pm but didn't get picked up until 4.30pm the hotel staff kept our cases safe whilst we went and explored the last of New York city. The hotel is in a perfect location for Broadway, times square and only a short walk from the empire state and rockafella centre. Perfect hotel, lovely staff and a great all round holiday will definitely be returning! Thank you holiday inn!!

title: Great location
text: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the past 5 years.  Once I stayed in another hotel but had to come back to this one.  The staff is very very friendly.  The rooms are very nice (Small, but nice) but I love the location.  It is so close to what you come to NYC for.  Only negative is elevators can be slow but it isn't a huge building so not a big deal.

title: Perfect for a business trip
text:
I stayed at this property for 4 nights while at a conference at the Javits Center. Uber pool was inexpensive back and forth. 

Rooms were clean and nice, with a desk. Loved that there are only about 5 or 6 rooms per floor. Feels cozier. Housekeeping does a great job!

Breakfast is included. Tyler Scott, the Assistant Front Office Manager, was personable and helpful. He welcomed me back when I arrived back to the hotel in the evening, which was so sweet.

Great Italian restaurant on 38th & 9th. (5 minute walk) 

I’ll be back next January! Loved it.

title: interesting
text: Nice hotel close to TImes Square - I have never been in a hotel with only 6 rooms on a floor but land is at a premium so you build up....Breakfast was crowded but the servers were friendly and fast to please.  Front desk was amazing and followed up on an any problem that was fixed quickly.  Loved having a concierge in the hotel.

title: Decepcionada!
text: Ficamos decepcionados com o atendimento pois como falamos português tornou-se difícil pedir esclarecimentos. Pouco esforço dos funcionários para procurar nos entender. O local do café da manhã muito pequeno e sem toalhas nas mesas. Pouca variedade no Serviço do cafe. Café ruim ou seja, muito mas muito fraco mesmo.

title: Bom e com preço bem razoável
text: Um hotel muito bem localizado, com possibilidade de ir aos principais pontos turísticos da cidade a pé. O atendimento é bom e o café da manhã vale a pena. Excelente custo benefício. Aprovamos nossa escolha.

title: 年末年始の休みに
text: ニューヨークに旅行に行きました。ホテルは、ホリデイインにとまりました。部屋は、かなり綺麗で立地もそれほど悪くなく、空港からシャトルバスも出ています！

title: Good budget option for NYC
text:
Pros:
Great variety for breakfast
Good room size, big TV, bath and shower
Free wifi
Good location - multiple subways within walking distance
Helpful staff for the most part (although some women on the trips counter weren't always helpful)

Cons:
Room not clean enough! Found a lollipop stuck to the floor so obviously the rooms hadn't been cleaned properly from the guests before. Such a shame because if it was cleaner I would have rated this hotel as 5 stars. It's a simple thing to change so please CLEAN BETTER! 

Overall, I would recommend to a friend.

title: Bien située
text: Belle hôtel très bien située pour visiter New York.  Qualité et prix c'est parfait tres propre et bon service. Proche des restaurants et très bien centrée pour visiter.  Ce n'est pas le gros luxe mais tres confortable.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
Spent four days at the Holiday Inn Express and had a really enjoyable stay. The hotel is very centrally located within walking distance everything Manhattan has to offer. I had read some unfavourable reviews online about the breakfast so I was surprised with the variety on offer. The experience was made better by the friendly staff, particularly one male and female (I regret that I did not get their names) who went over and beyond to welcome everyone with a friendly hello and assist with any problems they may have had. Their hospitality certainly got each day off to a bright start.

The rooms were a touch on the smaller side as you would expect for central New York but the beds were large and comfortable. Given we were not spending a whole pile of time in the rooms this suited us perfect.

The only downside was that their could be a significant wait for the elevators around  peak times e.g. breakfast and check-in. However, during the rest of day this was not an issue and all-in-all was a price worth paying.

title: Friendly staff; unimpressive breakfast room
text: First, I want to thank Angelica. When I attempted to check in at around noon, no rooms were available, but she wrote down exactly what type of room I was looking for, and, six hours later when I went back, even though she was no longer at the desk, she had worked behind the scenes to make sure I’d be given the room I had requested. The room was clean and sufficient, and the service, including housekeeping, was extremely friendly and professional. The next morning, I arrived at the breakfast room fairly early, only to find it packed. Not the most enjoyable experience, especially given the non-so eco friendly disposable plates, forks, etc. However, there was a gentleman that works there—regret I didn’t get his name—who greeted everyone with a nice smile and a friendly “hello” and brought a lot of soul to an otherwise soulless room. (Speaking of soulless, why do so many hotels shove fear down our throats by blasting CNN or Fox or some other nonsense first thing in the morning? Why not a classic movie that puts everyone in a good mood? Just sayin’....).

title: Was ok
text:
Breakfast was good, repetitive but good.
Rooms hmm, clean, small, dated
To avoid; def the 9th floor the ice Machine is sooo noisy and refilled every night about 1130 and 2am 
The location is ‘not bad’ in a quiet kind of street

title: very nice hotel
text: We went to NYC to see a show and see the Christmas decorations.  The location couldn't have been better.  Very, very convenient! We walked to most things, and the subway stations were very close.  The staff was very nice and helpful.  The room was really small, but we weren't in the room much.  There were 3 of us but housekeeping only gave us 2 washcloths.  We didn't eat there so can't comment on that.  But highly recommend.

title: Ottima posizione, servizi non all´altezza
text: Ho avuto modo di soggiornare recentemente in questo albergo. La posizione e´ assolutamente ottimale, purtroppo i servizi non sono all´altezza, ci sono solo due ascensori per 36 piani, il che crea diverse code sia per salire che per scendere, inoltre nonostante il check out sia alle 11, il cleaning viene iniziato molto prima, intorno alle 9, creando qualche disagio.

title: Good location, good value
text: Easy walking distance to pretty much everywhere.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are very small and the breakfast cafe has a difficult time accommodating all of the guests.  Sometimes you have to wait a very long time for the elevators.

title: Wow a great hotel
text:
First timers in New York we couldn't have picked a better hotel. Check in was fast and efficient even surprised us with the fact that breakfast was included which were were not expecting. We did show our selves to our room which I don't have a problem with, the room it's self was great it had two beds in it, had they been the typical English single the room would have been twice the size as the beds were huge. Made up with clean, fresh, crisp linen pillows to sink your head into at the end of a tiring day, the mattress was firm just how we like them. 
The bathroom was small but addequate with lovely soft towels and lots of complementary shower gel/shampoo etc. Considering how cold it was outside we had a lovely warm room which we could control the heating.. There was a tv but didn't use it. 
Which brings us to breakfast ... The restaurant is small and if you were down early there was no problem with seating but leave it till much later and there were some standing around waiting to be seated. The choice was lovely I'd say something for everyone I can highly recommend the hot cinnamon rolls perfect you could even make your own pancakes with the natty machine. Over the 4 breakfasts we had there was always plenty to choose and a good selection what ever time early or late you ate breakfast. Breakfast was a hit for us and set us up for the long day of sight seeing.
Now the staff well what can I say they were brill always had a welcome smile and defiantly eager to help, we called at reception every morning explained our plans for the day and they gave us good sound advise and posted out what sub way we needed to use. They were so helpful I cannot praise them enough they helped make our experience a memorable one. Would definitely recommend the hotel great location.

title: Exellent location
text: The location is excellent obviously. Hotel is very ordinary. 4 stars due to location and affordability for that location. Apart from that it was a very normal hotel. Rooms not very large, also bathrooms quite small. Staff professional.

title: 585 8th Avenue, 10018
text:
9 éjszakát töltöttünk el ebben a szállodában.
Számomra teljes mértékben megfelelő volt.
A szoba kinézete teljes mértékben megegyezik a Booking.com oldalon található képekkel.
Kedves volt a személyzet, mindig tiszta volt a szoba.
Nagyon jó helyen van a szálloda, remek választás volt. 
Ha vásároltunk vámot mindig útba tudtuk ejteni a szállást, így nem kellett egész nap a szatyrokkal járni a várost.
Számunkra a legjobb választás volt, ajánlom mindenki számára.

title: Gute Lage
text: Die Lage des Hotels und die Nähe zum Times Sauare waren wirklich toll und das Personal war immer sehr freundlich. Die Bettlaken waren jedoch auch nach dreimaligem Wechseln noch dreckig und das Frühstück auf Plastiktellern. Wenn man nicht vor 7 Uhr frühstückte, musste man im stehen essen und bei lediglich zwei Fahrstühlen für 35 Stockwerke brauchte man fast 15 Minuten bis man wieder auf dem Zimmer war.

title: Nicest staff ever
text: I stayed here December 19-21 2018 with my 2 kids(17,11). This staff is probably the nicest group of people I’ve ever encountered in NYC. The breakfast is actually quite impressive with multiple options. The rooms are small...as all rooms are in NYC but clean and well stocked. Our flight got in early and they were able to accommodate us within a few hours plus they stored our luggage while we went sightseeing during the wait. I’m always pleased with Holiday Inn Express and this one is no exception to that. Would definitely recommend and would stay again. Thanks for helping make my kid’s first trip to NYC do memorable.

title: Girls weekend nyc trip
text: There are several items that are great about this location. Free breakfast was really good. We were able to check in early and they held our luggage when we checked out. Small rooms, view is the other building, boring view. Pretty close to NYC Times Square.

title: Convenient
text: Booked a room with queen bed. Room small, but not a problem as we spent most of time sightseeing. Quiet. Breakfast (included) was anything off the regular menu - delicious, excellent service. Friendly, helpful staff. Close to Times Square, theaters, transit and Penn Station.

title: Mitigé
text:
L’hôtel est très bien placé. C’est le meilleur point. Les chambres sont correctes mais pas immenses pour une occupation de 4 personnes. Propres, salle de bain classique. 
Buffet petit déjeuner ok, mais certainement bien pour New York. 
Dommage qu’il y ait du passage avec des bruits qui pourront déranger certains ...

title: Prima volta a NYC
text: Hotel centralissimo, a pochi minuti da Times Square. Posizione strategica per raggiungere i maggiori punti di interesse. Camera comoda e silenziosa, ma soprattutto molto pulita (infatti ne siamo rimasti piacevolmente sorpresi). Unica pecca la sala da colazione, piccola e affollata negli orari di punta, ma se ci si adatta, qualche posticino a sedere si trova. Nel complesso un buon hotel che consiglierei a chiunque viaggia in coppia.

title: NYC
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location, but just far enough from the biz of Times Square. The staff were all really friendly.Great bonus to have a lovely breakfast buffet to set you up for your day's adventures in this amazing city.

title: Great location...SLOW lifts
text:
I agree with what most of the reviews have stated, this property is in an excellent location convenient to MSG, Penn Station, Ties Square, etc. but the rooms are rather small and the elevators are almost comically slow. On one ride down it took me 17 mins from the time I hit the button in the hallway until I was down in the lobby. The property recognizes this and has signs posted by the lifts saying to be patient.
Either way, first world problem and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

title: Good Value Hotel in Central Location
text: Very good value hotel central for all the sights clean towels every day clean beds and great shower breakfast is also reasonable being disposable cups etc you can take out and eat on the run just around the corner from the port authority so subway is the best way to get around

title: Great Location
text:
The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating! 
Breakfast had a variety of options- and coffee was available all day which was nice after a long day of walking and an early flight! 
The location is great, close to everything but also a little bit away from the city chaos.
Would recommend to anyone looking to stay local.

title: Recommended hotel for a visit to NYC
text: I recommend the Holiday Inn Express NYC Times Square while visiting NY, great location, friendly andhelpful staff.  Buffet breakfast is ok, could be improved but acceptable for the price.  I found it to be a good deal.

title: Girls trip
text: Three of us went on a holiday trip to New York. With several hotels to choose from we picked Holiday Inn express for its central location. We arrived early and they had a room ready for us. It was small but addiquit for 3 adults. The front fest was ver friendly and informative. We used there advice several times a day. It was clean and all staff was very friendly. We would recommend it for business or fun. Great for shopping.

title: Great Location
text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Time Square is about 10 minutes walk from this hotel. Indian restaurants are also nearby. But the rooms are very small. There are very limited items in the breakfast. Hotel staff are nice and friendly.

title: Troppo poco per essere un Holiday Inn Express
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel dal 22 novembre per 5 giorni ma con sorpresa abbiamo trovato on sorpresa personale poco attento all’ospite discrete le camere che tra l’altro una struttura similare stessa categoria e posizione a 100 metri, con tanto di brand alberghiero internazionale è decisamente superiore. Veniamo a New York ogni anno da molto tempo ma questa volta siamo delusi. Avevamo segnalato una sistemazione particolare ma la segnalazione inviata via email per ben due volte se pur ricevuta è stata disattesa. Attenzione all’ospite pari a 3 su 10. Holiday inn prevede la cura dell’ospite ma questa volta se ne sono dimenticati. Per la cauzione non hanno congelato l’importo della carta ma lo hanno addebitato e su richiesta ci é stato detto che dipendeva dalla mia banca. Non é vero .. non sanno che lavoro proprio lì e l’advvisor Ci comunica laddebito e non il blocco della somma. i dont recomendable this hotel.

title: 10 out of 10!!
text: I typically don't leave reviews but I'd especially like to give a shout out to the female front desk agent named Alexis & the male concierge, Alexander. Both phenomenomal!
