I appreciate Alexis' great customer service skills and accommodating my needs. She truly made me feel "welcomed". I appreciate Alexander's knowledge of the city and hospitality skills! I appreciate you both!. Thank you for making my first stay in NY one to remember! ❤

title: No awe factor.
text:
My partner and I stayed here for four nights.  It is fine, and met our needs.  The breakfast was pretty standard fare and staff were friendly enough.  
I read reviews that complained of the lift being slow, we did not have this issue.  We never waited more than a minute or so.   
On the the plus side, people were commenting that it is conveniently located by Time Square.  As an avid walker, I found it to be about a 15 minute walk.  To be honest, I would have preferred to be closer. The last time I was in NY city I stayed in Time Square and really enjoyed the experience.  You walked out the door and “bam” you were right in the middle of the excitement.  
Tip,  when asking the front desk about nearby restaurant, they provided a list of different types and scales of restaurants with addresses. ask for this list, when you check in.

title: Nice location Great price
text: The location of this hotel was great for my meeting at the Javit’s center. It is easily within walking distance to Times Square as well. The staff was very helpful & always courteous. The room was clean (showing some wear & tear) but the bed was surprisingly comfortable. The only down side was the wait for the elevator. The hotel was near capacity and with 24+ floors the 2 elevators were frequently full. I woul stay there again for a work trip.

title: Great location
text:
Stayed here for 5 days during Thanksgiving with husband, hotel was a 6/7 walk away from Pennsylvania station and madison square garden. We had a room in 35th floor with views of Empire State, one world trade centre, you can just about see the  Statue of Liberty if it’s clear. 
Nice big comfy bed, coffee pod machine what gave hot water for tea. Nice powerful hairdryer & usual toiletries, lovely fluffy towels, bath bit grubby but ok for a shower. 
Lift took forever to arrive so leave plenty of time when you going out. 
Breakfast was okay we went around 7am not too busy, usual cereals, toast, muffins,pancakes,  scrambled eggs sausage etc
Next time we go to NYC will stay here again.

title: Needs upgradation
text: I was there for 4 days and was shocked that such a reputed hotel could have such poor standards.The check in time is 4pm which itself is not convenient.We were early and requested the front desk to keep our luggage so we could out.It took quite a while and the lady seemed to forget we were waiting g.Finally the bell boy ,who was there is certainly 15 minutes, helped us out.The restaurant for the breakfast buffet is ridiculously small for a hotel with 36 storeys.There are always shortages, including fruits, with minimum staff handling it.The rooms are matchbox size but this is expected in New York.The best is the superb location on Times Square which was value for money.

title: Excellent
text:
Tuvimos una estancia muy agradable. El hotel muy cómodo y el personal muy amable. 
Recomiendo el hotel ampliamente y lo mejor de todo es que tiene excelente ubicación. 

Front desk siempre fue muy atento y nos apoyó con todas nuestras necesidades.

title: Worst horror front desk employee Tyler
text:
My friend and I booked a room from 15/11/2018 till 18/11/2018 in Holiday Inn Express New York Times Square with employee-rate. We are both IHG-members.  
We arrived finally after 24 hours travelling  (delay plane, snow storm in New York, traffic completely blocked, completely wet)  in Holiday Inn Express New York Times Square at 10pm. 
We were very surprised that our booking was cancelled because a month ago I had to cancel my credit card. The girl at the front desk (Cynthia) asked her colleague (Tyler) to help.
He was telling us that the hotel was fully booked and he could do nothing for us. It was our fault because we cancelled the credit card. I asked him why he didn’t send an email to me to request a new credit card. Especially for IHG-members and employee. 
He said that we were in New York and he followed the procedures.  It was our fault and he didn’t want to help. 
We asked if he could help us because there were no more rooms available in Manhattan for less than 400$/N. His answer was that we had to make a reservation ourselves. He should not make a reservation for us. After a discussion that he had to help us, he finally called CRS  (reservations) but he gave me the phone immediately. 
I was on the phone four about 15 minutes. CRS found a room on employee-rate in… Holiday Inn Express New York Times Square !!! We booked the room on CRS demand ! When I said that we had a reservation for 1 night in H.I. Expr. Times Square to Tyler he became angry and said that they had no rooms available and that I was bullying him. Also an IHG-employee told me on the phone that the front desk employee had to help any IHG member. He made a report about our case.When I told Tyler he still refused even after the IHG-employee called him. 
At midnight my friend said several times “S...” and then Tyler started to yell that he was cursing on him. He became extremely rude and yelled loud. I think they could hear him on Times Square. He wanted to call the police. He said he could book a room (much more expensive) on Long Island or Jersey or the other choice was that we left or he called the police. I told him to call the police. He started to dial but probably he realized that he was wrong and stopped the call. My friend wanted to leave and looked for an Airport hotel to find a place to sleep at a decent price. 
At once the female front desk employee Cynthia told him that they had an early check-out and there was a room available. We only had to wait 15 minutes to make up the room. 
She was very affected about everything what happened the last 2,5 hours and she did everything she could to convince Tyler to give us the room. For us she’s the employee of the year 2018 !! Around 1am we could finally go to our room and at once we could even book the next 2 nights on employee rate ! 
Everything was impeccable for the next 3 days as we experienced on previous stays in H.I. hotels. We just had a bad feeling when we passed the front desk and saw Tyler. That guy doesn’t fit into a Holiday Inn Hotel. He better fits as a warden in Guantanamo prison.

title: Amazing!!!!!
text:
What can I say. This place was our life saver! After booking a holiday apart that fell through the night we arrived we were left with nowhere to stay. 

We arrived at the Holiday Inn Express Times Square and they were amazing! Sorted out 3 rooms for us immediately. Giovanni helped us at the front desk and turned the worst day of our holiday into the best. Giovanni was professional, empathetic, friendly and welcomed us with such warmth we felt like we were finally home. A huge thanks to everything he did for us throughout the trip too! No questions or request were too much. He always had time to help us. 

There were two woman at the breakfast that were amazing. They were so friendly and so so nice to our kids. The girls were so excited to see them every morning. I have attached a photo. They had to give them big hugs before they left. 

Without a doubt next time we are back in New York we will be staying there again. How lucky were we to come across this place by accident? We tell everyone we know that if they go to New York this is the place to stay. 

Great location. Great food. Great rooms. But more than anything...amazing staff!!!!

title: Nice Hotel in Good Central Location
text:
Nice hotel near Times Square, which is central to most tourist destinations like Central Park to 9/11 Memorial to Statue of Liberty ferry tour.

The room was a bit small but I expected that. Nice bathroom but not for two people, again small. My view was another hotel wall.

Lobby is nice with a small seating area, a hightop table for 6, and has a mini market with snacks and drinks. Breakfast was fine, nothing spectacular. The room is tiny so the earlier you go the better. If you go late like I did my first morning they might be out of food.

title: Right in Times Square
text:
This property is conveniently located to the Times Square subway station. Surrounded by all sorts of restaurants, from mom & pops to chains. 10 minutes walking distance to Javits and about 12 to Times Square. 

Impeccable lobby, well lit and courteous front desk staff. We were greeted with a warm reception and offered to valet our luggage since our room wasn’t ready. 

Room appearance clean & tidy.  The bed is very comfortable and the pillows are heavenly. Will mention that the lighting is dim and can be improved upon. Do like that there are USB port on the headboard lights. 

When visiting Times Square you should really consider this property.

title: Mixed bag
text:
Room is small yet comfortable. Housekeeping does a very good job. Front office is the highlight of this hotel-highly professional and welcoming. Elevators are SLOW and packed. The breakfast area is a zoo. 
Location is tops. 
Recommended,  despite the drawbacks.

title: Great Location
text:
This hotel is located just off Times Square. Great location to spend a short city break within walking distance of anywhere you need to go. Depending on traffic just 1-1 1/2 hrs from JFK costing under $70 by taxi.
The hotel staff are welcoming and happy to help with any of your needs. The lobby is clean and access to coffee/tea and water 24hrs.
The rooms are clean and what I would expect from a Holiday Inn Express.  When you are in NYC your not spending time in your room so more than adequate. Beds are great I never sleep well in a hotel bed but I did here, a selection of pillows to suit and coffee machine for your morning drink.

Breakfast is on the 1st floor with a small room available to sit and eat (we stayed during the marathon so was busy but you can take anything to your room if you wish) we didn’t eat here and can recommend eating breakfast at Westside Diner pankcakes are to die for. Arrive early as very popular. Just turn right out the hotel and right at the end of the road and keep walking a few blocks. Or if your sightseeing near Times Square can recommend Juniors too!! Lovely cooked breakfast. 

Can also recommend Ellen’s Star Dust dinner for dinner again very popular so you will queue. Basically the waiters sing aswell as serve, great atmosphere and awesome milkshakes try the tiramisu one.

I recommend the Empire State as a night attraction so you can look out over NYC with the lights it’s beautiful and great for the first night, I would also recommend Top of the Rock during the day so you can see the Empire State in all it glory absolutely spectacular and you can see Central Park great in Nov as there are an array of leaf colours.
Do, do a hop on hop off tour too, again at the beginning so you can see the city and the guides will give you so much information.

So much to see and do and then after a great day of sights, food, shopping the hotel is not too far from anywhere and a comfy nights sleep.

title: La mejor
text:
La Señorita Angelica V de recepcion del hotel Hollyday inn Express time square Se uñas persona súper atenta, atiende súper
Bien al personal, da toda la información pertinente , me encanto su trato en atención al Cliente

title: Mrs L Smith
text: Very friendly at check-in and -out. Although a busy hotel and breakfast area, staff was fantastic at breakfast.  Room was very clean and I can not find l single thing to complain about. Enjoyed our stay and would recommend the hotel.

title: Weekend with the Girls
text:
Nothing fancy with this Holiday Inn Express. I’m a Holiday Inn rewards member and prefer to stay at Holiday Inn Express for the free breakfast!

This hotel was in need of some updates. The furniture in our room was very beat up. Lots of scratches and small dents in the furniture. The rooms are your typical small NYC rooms. We had a room with two doubles and there wasn’t much floor space to move around, especially with two people in the room. There was no luggage rack and really nowhere to put your luggage but on the floor.

The breakfast was okay. Nothing special. Eggs were cold all three mornings despite one morning a new batch being put out. The breakfast area is not very efficiently laid out. 

Would recommend a higher floor because there are only two elevators and people on the lower floors had to wait as they were always packed.

The front desk and breakfast staff was the highlight of the stay. They were always pleasant and remembered you each day.

title: Fijn hotel en zeer centraal gelegen
text:
6 nachten hier verbleven. 
Ontvangst was goed! Giovanni heeft ons hartelijk ontvangen en stond ook regelmatig 's ochtend bij het ontbijt om even gedag te zeggen. Heel attent!!
De kamer is zeker niet groot, maar dat schijnt normaal te zijn in New York, kon in deze prijsklasse ook geen ruimere kamers vinden en zeker niet op zo'n mooi locatie. Geen last van lawaai van de straat.
Winkels en veel highlights op loopafstand. 
Wij zaten op de 31e verdieping (familiekamer) en hadden uitzicht op One Tower en Empire State Building.
Het ontbijt was prima, druk, maar goed verzorgd. Personeel is allemaal erg vriendelijke en zeker behulpzaam. 
In het hotel kaartjes gekocht voor Empire State. We werden ook goed geïnformeerd.
Voor de terugreis ook de transfer via het hotel geboekt, dat is veel goedkoper dan met een Uber.
Zal zeker weer naar dit hotel gaan bij een volgend bezoek aan New York en dat gaat zeker gebeuren!

title: séjour du 23 au 31 octobre 2018
text:
Du positif: l’emplacement à 10 mn de Time Square, le petit déjeuner très fourni et à volonté inclus dans le prix de la chambre, le personnel du petit déj, le wifi, deux ordinateurs avec imprimante à disposition dans le hall d'entrée, la gentillesse et le professionnalisme de Giovanni, cherchant à apprendre des mots de Français pour communiquer. 
Du négatif: le personnel de la réception (Cynthia) désagréable à notre arrivée, aucun effort pour se mettre au niveau d'Anglais des uns et des autres. L’hôtel ne recevant que des touristes à majorité étrangère, cela me semblerait logique. Le ménage non fait dans la chambre, le lit est juste refait et le linge changé.

title: Great stay in an excellent location!
text: Stayed at this hotel for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is very central and easily accessible to all 'tourist attractions'. The room was very comfortable with hairdryer, shampoo T.V, comfy bed etc. The breakfast was superb with everything you could want for a city style breakfast. Loved the pancake machine!! Breakfast can be very busy but this didn't affect us and people were seated quickly. Staff were extremely helpful especially when needing advice about travel and show tickets. Would only return to this hotel if in NYC again.

title: Friendly staff just needs updating
text:
hotel staff very helpful especially Giovanni who always had a smile on his face when ever we asked him a question about things. 
The rooms looked tired and were very basic, the bath had stains and you could see where they had ''patched'' up broken wall tile. The tap in the bath was very  loose and i did think it would come off at one point. One of the plugs were also very loose on the wall. 
Lifts take forever especially in the morning during rush hour ( 2 lifts for 36 floors)waiting from floor 35 10/15 minutes.
Breakfast was disappointing with so many people staying and very little variety the kitchen staff did try their best to keep it stocked and tidy but its no where enough room for all the hotel guests. 
Great location and great staff.
Just needs some TLC

title: Excellent location and service!!
text:
To the front desk and breakfast staff who worked Oct 17-19- thank you thank you thank you!   Every single one of you helped make our trip a fantastic one.  Especially to the young lady in the breakfast staff (black and pink headband I believe her name is Michelle) who went above and beyond each morning to assist us and start our day out right.

I was nervous about traveling to NYC with my 7 year old daughter and it couldn't have gone better.  

The location of this hotel is absolutely perfect!  Just a short walk to the the Port Authority subway station, Times Square, New York Public Library, Top of the Rock and Broadway St James Theatre.  We also walked from the hotel to Pier 83 where the Circle Line Best of NYC Cruise picks up, Central Park and the High Line.   

The free hot breakfast started each day out right.  Super friendly workers each day!  My daughter LOVED the pancake making station. 

We arrived early on a Tuesday before check in and left late Friday afternoon after check out. It was an easy and wonderful service to check our bags at the front desk when we arrived and on the day we checked out.

I highly recommend the Irish Pub "Tir na Nog" just a few steps from the hotel on 39th street.  

We also "braved" getting to the hotel from LGA via bus/subway instead of cab or Uber which saved us a lot of money.  We packed light just for this option, only 2 suitcases and a stroller for me, my daughter and my mom.  That process was much easier than I expected.  From Terminal 2 baggage claim at LGA go up to the 2nd floor (the bus also picks up at other terminals), pick up a Metrocard from the machine that is located at the exit just past Hudson newspaper stand.  You can get an unlimited one for the week for around $30 but we chose to do the pay per ride since we weren't going to use the subway much so we loaded the card with $10.50 each.  Cross the street to the green bus stand.  Get on the Q70 bus (they didn't check our metro card on this bus so we didn't need to swipe it until we got to the subway station- but on our return to the airport we did need to swipe our metro card to get a free ticket for the bus).  Get off the bus at Roosevelt Ave/Jackson Heights station.  Hop on the "E" train that's headed towards the World Trade Center.   You will get off on the 42nd street / Port Authority station.  Then it's just a short 7 minute walk to the hotel.     The Q70 bus had luggage racks and on the subway we just stood next to our luggage. 

I would definitely stay at this hotel again.  I agree with the other reviews that the rooms are small but since we were just there to sleep it didn't bother us.  Also, since we were packing light it was great that the hotel supplied shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap and body gel so we didn't need to pack any of those items.

title: Confortable y buena ubicación
text: La pasamos increíble el hotel es muy lindo y con una gran atencion.Lo mejor es la  ubicación,siempre hay alguien que habla tu idioma y te reciben siempre muy amablemente.buen precio por ser de la cadena.

title: NYC Bucket List
text:
the smell of marijuana in our room was very strong but we were so tired from a long day of travelling we just crashed, next morning we changed rooms , no better , just decided to put up with it because we wanted to get out and enjoy the city. 
Don’t expect luxury, towels are thin, linens are worn , carpets are old, the cheapest shampoos/soaps certainly no frills here. No counter space in bathroom , king room is very small . had to ask for water glasses . Breakfast was far too busy to be enjoyed so skipped it 4 out of our 6 day stay. 
But it is clean and the location is great , staff are friendly , helpful and always very busy !  Ben deserves mentioning as he delivered wonderful customer service.

title: Central and affordable
text:
The location is great as you are in the heart of New York. Simply a stone away from Times Square. Everything is within walking distance ... shows, shopping, bars and restaurants. 

The slight down side of the hotel is the small hotel rooms and breakfast area. These I believe however outweighs the benefits to the comfort of staying here.

title: surprisingly adequate
text:
I was a bit worried about what to expect. My expectations weren't too high as this is a holiday inn express (not some fancy hotel) AND you're in NYC so you know space is tight. Still concerned at check-in with the limited lobby and only two elevators. I was on the 19th floor (there are only about 6 rooms on each level). The room was small, as expected, but had just enough space for my suitcase and a little desk for my laptop. What I was pleasantly surprised and give the 5 stars are the comfy beds, wonderful shower (water pressure/temp) and I couldn't hear a thing! No busy outside noise. I slept so good and that rarely happens at a hotel - let alone in NY. Besides, after a busy day working or sightseeing all you really want is a good shower and good sleep! ;)
Due to the weather I didn't turn my heater/ac on as it wasn't needed until I woke up. That was loud but same as any other property.
Breakfast was a bonus and all the employees were super helpful and friendly. Would definitely recommend this property!

title: City break
text: Stayed 20/10 to 24/10 to celebrate our 35th wedding anniversary. Arrived very late but check in was very painless. Room on 30th floor that overlooked the city and could see the Hudson river. Room was lovely and warm when we walked in which is just what was needed. The room was small but perfectly formed for a short break. Had a bit of a problem operating the shower at first (due to being very tired). Toilet is low compared to UK ones which was a bit of a shock. Bed was very comfortable. The heater in the room was very noisy during the night- thank goodness I took ear plugs. Breakfast adequate. Special thanks the Theresa who explained what was what in the first day. All the staff were friendly and polite, but the kitchen staff took top honours. Hotel very central but take comfortable shoes as you will walk many miles.

title: Great breakfast!
text: What a bonus to have a hotel offer breakfast in NYC! It was so convenient! Eggs, toast, bagels, muffins, fruit, yogurt....And the coffee and tea 24/7 was great after a day spent outside in the cold. The staff was super friendly and helped us use the computer to print boarding passes for our departure. It was really cold in Nov., and it was a bit of a walk to and from the hotel but really close to subways stations if you plan where you are heading for the day accordingly. Great affordable restaurants just around the corner too. The beds were very comfortable and rooms are clean but like any hotel in NYC you do hear sirens constantly throughout the night....just part of the NYC experience!

title: Actually better than the UK Holiday Inn's
text:
Remember that, it's location is smack bang in the middle of Manhattan, it's going to be tall and thin on space. To anyone visiting and complains of space, what do you expect?

What I will say though, is that greeted by Giovanni on the first night was a pleasant experience. He definitely knows the hospitality business and is very friendly. When they say US customer service is great, he delivers it.

Now we move onto breakfast, being the package that it is, you are going to get 'fast food style' breakfast. It was good though, you do get:-

-scrambled eggs
-sausages
-veggie omelette
-turkey burgers
-yoghurts
-bagels and toast
-pancakes
-oatmeal (Porridge to us Brits)
-muffins
-cinnabons (cinnamon like muffins that are hot and have a vanilla? sauce on top
-juice / coffee / tea / hot chocolate

if you fill up on it then you wont go hungry during the day, service at breakfast was met by three delightful staff members called Michelle, Theresa, and Sharon. I don't know who is who (Giovanni told us their names as we were leaving). But they love their job. Extremely happy.

Like the other reviews about the Elevators, yes these are a pain as there is only two. One malfunctioned on me because it wouldn't level on floor 1, mind you some old geezer got on when it was full practically.

Great location, 7Eleven is up the street if you need late night amenities, just ignore dollarman on the door. NYPD often move him on but he comes back.

TV was alright, we had channels in HD but no TV Guide... no matter watching hells kitchen when the area you are in is named hells kitchen was quite funny.

All in all, if you need a decent base with great staff then go here, can't go wrong.

I was here from Fri 12th oct 2018 to the 17th oct 2018 - I was in Room 1803

title: Rooms are good. Elevators are problematic.
text: We stayed in a room with a king-sized bed. I thought the room was comfortable for 2 nights in the city - enough room for 2 people and a bit of luggage. The room was right next to the elevators, but we didn't hear them. The annoying part of the stay was actually the availability of the elevators. The hotel is tall - 36 floors - and only has 2 elevators. The location of the elevators makes it quite cramped while waiting and makes it difficult for people getting off and getting on to exist in the same space. If you want to use an elevator mid-morning on a Saturday or Sunday, good luck. Many people are checking out and/or heading out into the city. You may be waiting 15 mins or more. A similar bottleneck begins late afternoon into the evening when people are checking in and/or heading to dinner before seeing a show. During our stay, one of the two elevators malfunctioned two days in a row, which meant there was only 1 working elevator. When I say malfunction, it would stop at every floor for no reason, and the door would bounce back open instead of closing completely, thereby preventing you from actually moving to another floor. Again, the rooms themselves were comfortable. The problem is accessing them in a timely manner. (FYI: I was on floor 28 and did take the stairs down on one occasion because the elevator was taking forever).

title: Great location, could easily be perfect.
text:
Location is amazing, just two blocks from the Empire state, the same from Macy's and the subway.

Other good points, room was nice, good size clean and well equipped. Staff are always friendly and helpful, I think we should have asked them more questions as their answers always detailed and with a smile.

The hotel could easily be a 5 point "excellent" only one lift was working during half or our stay. Breakfast room became quite crowded especially on weekends and food wasn't re-stocked quickly enough. If you hit it at the wrong time there could be no where to sit but that would be ok as there won't be food either! The room (rear of hotel on floor 6) was also quite noisy due to air conditioning from the next building, although quite loud the noise was consistent (and constant) so it didn't effect our sleep.
The worst bit and easiest to solve was the cleanliness of the hallway carpet. It wasn't cleaned at all in our week long stay, evident by some of the larger pieces of debris being there all week.

title: Pleasure
text:
Staff was great, ladies that run breakfast bar were great, personal friendly and helpful. Room was clean breakfast was decent, location great. Outstanding staff
.  Also try the new York pass with the big bud trip... great way to get around and then admissions are paid for

title: basic facility, great staff
text: Typical midtown chain hotel- super tiny rooms, no amenities (gym, business center etc., breakfast buffet was just ok) but the staff were very helpful and friendly. When I asked for housekeeping to come because we were in the room when they'd come by previously and so the room hadn't been cleaned they sent someone up ASAP.

title: David Greene
text: We bring each of our 12 year old grand children to New York for their birthday. This is our second visit to this Holiday Inn Express.  The staff at the desk is friendly and helpful no matter the time of day or night.  They recommended a small pizza place around the corner that was so good we almost went back the next night.  The free breakfast in the mornings are crucial for us.  There is a good variety, even Cinnabon’s!  The ladies who keep things stocked are cheerful and helpful.  Nichelle went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed.  This is a good place to stay!

title: Great city hotel
text: The room was clean and neat.  The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The location of the hotel is ideal to explore the times square area.  Also close to the Port Authority Bus Terminal and the subway.

title: Holiday Inn Express NY Times Square en silla de ruedas
text:
Este hotel está situado en la 39 muy cerca de la estación de metro Port Authority (adaptada). Situado en una calle tranquila (toda la tranquilidad que puedes encontrar en Manhattan). Nosotros fuimos en agosto 18 y el hotel estaba bastante lleno. La entrada es pequeña y en la recepción hay dos trabajadoras que hablan español. Pedimos poder hacer el checking de salida más tarde ya que el avión salía por la noche y nos cobraron 10 $ por cada hora de más.  Encontré bastante caro pero era el precio que tenían (en total pagué 60$ más).
La habitación que nos dieron era en el piso 11. Hay dos ascensores para subir y son bastante rápidos. Solo había problema a primera hora de la mañana cuando todo el mundo va a desayunar. El resto del día no tuvimos problema para cogerlos.  
La habitación es muy vieja. Con moqueta bastante deteriorada y sucia. La luz no va con tarjeta como todos los hoteles, sino que va con interruptores de los de antes. Con este detalle se puede comprobar que el hotel ha quedado bastante anticuado. Además la habitación está llena de muebles que dificultan poder moverse en silla de ruedas. Yo voy con una silla manual que hace 60 cm de ancha. Al final tuvimos que sacar sillas al pasillo y mover algún mueble para poder moverme por una parte de la habitación. Imposible llegar hasta la ventana o hasta el armario, no pasas con la silla.
El aire acondicionado funcionaba bien, aunque era un poco ruidoso. La cama es alta y muy cómoda. Nosotros dormimos muy bien y no siempre encuentro un colchón tan cómodo en los hoteles. Esto después de las largas caminatas de cada día se agradece. 
El lavabo no está mal pero tampoco es de lo mejor. El wc tiene las típicas barras americanas que no entiendo como las ponen ni a quien le van bien. El protector del desagüe era de risa (adjunto foto) y la ducha era a cota 0 pero con deficiencias: la banqueta aguantó mi peso aunque se movía un poco. Y desde la banqueta no llegas al grifo por lo tanto alguien te tiene que ayudar a abrir y cerrar el agua. Y lo más importante: salían unos bichitos del desagüe que no hacían muy buena pinta. No sé si llegaban hasta la habitación porqué con la moqueta uno no veía nada.
A destacar que el personal de limpieza de las habitaciones no da abasto y tienen como prioridad limpiar las habitaciones que entran ese día por lo tanto a veces tardaban mucho en limpiar la habitación nuestra y hasta por la tarde no estaban hechas. 
El personal de la entrada no es que fuera muy simpático, e iban muy atareados siempre sin hacerte mucho caso.
En cambio el personal del desayuno era muy atento y muy simpático. 
El resumen es que por ese precio seguramente puedes encontrar otros hoteles que estén mejor. Aquí entra el desayuno en la tarifa pero es un desayuno bastante pobre. 
Yo recomiendo que tampoco te obsesiones en buscar un hotel muy céntrico. Vale más la pena buscar un hotel con estación de metro accesible cerca. Igualmente estarás arriba y abajo todo el día. 
Disfruta de NY, vale mucho la pena!

title: Good location but needs some improvements.
text:
The positives: The building was clean and the room was always clean. All the staff that we met but one person (see below) were professional, friendly, helpful and polite. The location was very convenient to most NYC attractions and transportation. The free breakfast was excellent. 

The negatives: We didn’t always feel comfortable walking to and from the hotel on 39th Street.  Every night there were several homeless people hanging around and doing drugs/drinking and one night we had to walk around a passed-out person to get to the hotel. The rug in the room had several missing areas that appeared to have been cut out due to some type of damage. The room didn’t have a refrigerator like other Holiday Inn Express properties but that is something I should have looked into prior to our stay. 

We were impressed by the hotel staff until last day when we were trying to enjoy our breakfast in peace and one of the employees decided to share her political views with everyone in the room. That’s the last thing we wanted to hear on our vacation.

title: Great stay
text:
Welcoming friendly reception staff, especially Giovanni who took great care of us and understood our British sense of humour.... we enjoyed a good laugh together. Our room was clean and comfy.
I thought that breakfast on Saturday morning would be hectic and crazy but no. We were able to find seats easily. The catering team kept items stocked up and despite the large number of guests they were engaging and took time to check we had everything we needed.

title: Ottima scelta!
text:
Abbiamo viaggiato in due per 7 notti dal 30 aprile al 07 maggio. Posizione perfetta a due passi da varie fermate metro, a 10 min a piedi da Times Square e da tantissimi altri punti d'interesse. Il letto è stato il più comodo di tutti quelli provati in ferie e questa non è una nota da poco! Il personale davvero carino e dopo il check out ci hanno chiesto loro se volevamo lasciargli i bagagli fino alla ns partenza.
La camera è vero è piccolina e l'armadio è praticamente inesistente, infatti tirate fuori le due cose da appendere nel mini armadio la valigia era da richiudere e tenere in verticale. 
Il mio unico consiglio è di assicurarvi una camera ai piani alti perchè noi eravamo al 4 piano e la vista era Horror e quindi abbiamo sempre tenuto le tende chiuse.

title: South African visitor
text: Room, service and amenities were very good value. Received very good support from Sandra, Cynthia and Congierge. Service at breakfast was very good and the food well prepared. Very friendly atmosphere at reception. Room was clean and hotel is ideally situated for a visit to NYC

title: First time in NYC
text:
Stayed for 9 days hotel room was tiny with no view except another building ,breakfast was very busy and sometimes no where to sit 
Overall ok and if you like to be closer to Times Square good choice 
but next time would stay outside Times Square

title: La mejor ubicación y las mejores camas
text:
Excelente hotel, bastante céntrico, buenísima atención y el desayuno es lo mejor, a solo unas cuadras de Time Square, cerca de muchos lugares comida y en una excelente zona y segura.
Una súper opción en NYC

title: Excellent location for theater and good value!
text: The rooms were small but clean, attractive and comfortable.  It is in a great location for restaurants and convenience stores as well as an easy walk to Times Square and the theater district.  There was a door man who greeted you whenever you entered the hotel.

title: Good value for the  money and good location
text:
Room was comfortable - - sink stopper didn't work in the bathroom.  For as much time as we spent in the room, it was adequate.  The breakfast is pretty good - - just incredibly crowded.  I think we would have preferred a bigger and more modern room.

Front desk personnel were very nice - - Giovanni was awesome!

title: Excelente ubicación
text: Todo estuvo perfecto en el hotel, la amabilidad de las personas que laboran en este hotel es de destacar, sobre todo la del señor que estaba en el comedor a la hora del desayuno, siempre con una sonrisa y unos buenos días, el desayuno muy bueno, tienen de todo, las camas y almohadas cómodas, la limpieza muy bien, totalmente recomendado.

title: Great Value for Money & Ideal Location
text:
We arrived at the hotel on Sunday 23rd September for a weeks break in the big apple.
The hotel is on 8th avenue so convenient for Broadway, Times Square,Central Park etc.
The only negative is the room size so should i go back i will book 2 rooms to spread out a little but lets remember that you are not in your room all day so to most families it will tick the boxes.
The staff at the hotel were very helpful and polite at all times, the hotel was clean and tidy throughout.
Rattle & Hum pub/restaurant served great meals a bit cheaper than eating in Times Square. 
The hotel has excellent security so you feel safe outside late at night. like any City you will have beggars ask you for change but they are polite and don't pester you when you walk by.
The family went to see Phantom of the Opera which is 3 blocks away opposite Port Authority bus station. 
i bought the tickets at the box office that morning for $69 each so great value while i went off to the see Bruce Springsteen at the Walter Kerr Theatre. You can easily walk from the hotel the Herald Square where you can take the subway to Wall Street, Staten Island Ferry, 911 Memorial etc. One negative i would say is be careful booking hop on hop off buses. Once again i paid $200 for a 3 day ticket for 4 of us and only used it once. We could have used the subway for $3 each. We've been to New York several times now (our favourite city) and like any main City Centre expect crowds, expect prices to be higher than the outskirts but make sure you plan your days and make the most of the vacation. Theres so much to do.

title: MP
text: Room is tiny for 2A & 2C. Bathroom is also tiny. Beds are comfortable, however one is pushed up against wall so can only be accesed from one side. Had to ask for 4 towels after only being given 3 for several days. Also had to ask for extra toilet paper as no extra roll left in room. Only 2 lifts to service 35 odd floors and they’re also small. Several times we waited quite some time for the lift only for it to be full so had to wait for another one. Free laundry facilities at adjoinibg property whis is a bonus. Breakfast room is chaotic after 7, best time is 6.30 when it opens. Good location, quick walk to Times Square.

title: Special birthday getaway
text:
Great location very close to Times Square on your right and Hell's Kitchen to the left and added bonus of fab Irish bar Tir Na Nog just doors away 
Basic but everything provided and a good price . Toiletries , iron , hairdryer,tea/coffee facilities.
We had one room for 4 of us which was adequate as only needed to sleep and shower as out all day long .Lighting could be a bit brighter and a few more coat hangers but that's minor.
If you go for breakfast from 9 ish be prepared to wait for the lifts (there are stairs) and a queue for a table .
However if you go at the right time breakfast is great and a good choice to set you up ready for your adventures all fresh and plentiful.
Sharon ,Teresa and Michelle were friendly helpful and welcoming also other members of staff were great.
I would recommend and stay there again .Thanks x

title: It gets the job done
text: Holiday Inn close to time square.   Fairly basic but ok.   Staff try to make you comfortable, Joelle and maintenance staff went above call of duty and pulled some strings for me.  ELEVATOR can take 15 minutes round trip if busy.   Breakfast is too tight to be functional.   Again it works for the rate, but not a high end NY hotel.

title: confusion about Online "Modify Reservation"
text:
it was a very surprising when I click the button on "Modify Reservation", the system strait away do the cancellation without any notification.  Not even got any pop up message.
My understand  on modify  reservation is to change the date on check in or check out. Where got direct cancel customer original reservation, am I understanding wrongly on the meaning of "Modify Reservation" ?? furthermore, we call the hotel directly, the staff tell us "noting we can do,  it all managed by system", then the staff end the call. furthermore, it charged the deposit which not refundable if  under cancellation.  But, the point is - we never do any cancellation, system just auto cancellation when we click the "Modify Reservation" button.   not sure this is a way of hotel try to make money.  feel like been cheat.  super bad experience !!!

title: ótimo
text: O quarto é pequeno, o padrão da rede mas bem equipado. O hotel é dos poucos em NY que tem café da manhã que para os padrões americanos até que é bom. próximo da times square e do metrô( estação  port authority)

title: Great hotel
text:
It was such a pleasant to stay in Holiday Inn.
I liked the room, it was so clean and fresh!
Staff on reception desk was very smiley and helpful!
Breakfast is very tasty and so good!
I will highly recommend this hotel to my friends and will come back for sure!
Thanks guys!

title: Muy recomendable
text: Estuvimos mirando algún hotel mejor en queens y Brooklyn pero al final cogimos este y fue un acierto. A 6 minutos andando del metro m, hotel pequeño pero limpio, habitación cuando n dos camas king size, eso si la habitación pequeña pero íbamos guardando las compras en las maletas para que no ocupara  así que b en. Hola clique desayuno lo noque es genial para com bazar el día, el sitio de desayuno es pequeño pero nosotros tuvimos sitio todos los días y también puedes subirlo a la habitación. Agua con hielo para el calor y café todo el día. Realmente es una buena opción económica (dentro de lo caro que es Nueva York)

title: Great location but small room
text: The location was great for our little mini vacation to visit New York. The room little on the small side. Very clean when we got there. Our tub wouldn’t drain but once we called for the second time it got fixed. Not impressed with maid service! She cleaned and made bed nicely but I had to search for my PJ’s, she tossed in corner on the floor not happy about that.

title: Un básico práctico y confortable
text:
Buena ubicación, habitación cómoda que se completaría ideal con un frigobar. 
Lo esencial es la muy buena atención de todo el personal.
Destaco a Ana, quien ha otorgado muy gentilmente su ayuda y orientación cada vez que fue de nuestra necesidad como así también la Sra que asiste y atiende la habitación 206.

title: Good Location but terrible breakfast - Disappointment
text:
Good Location near Times Square. Clean but small bedroom. Terrible Breakfast: tasteless muffins, no cheese or ham, very limited variety of fruit (banana, orange and apple). Staff at breakfast was quite rude. Breakfast room was most of the times crowded. People had to have breakfast at the recetion lobby or take it to their rooms! In the morning had to wait a very long time for the elevators. For so long that most of the times I gave up and decided to go down by the emergency stairs (16 floors). 
The room was quiet but there was no minibar.
Avoid any rooms from the upper floors (the hotel has 36 floors) because the elevators are terrible and you might have to use the emergency stairs. 
Too expensive!

title: Turismo familiar
text:
Es un muy buen hotel. Habiaciones comodas, limpias, ordenadas y confortables. Desayuno completo y muy bueno ( solo mencionar lo reducido del comedor, que de todos modos tiene un movimiento rapido de mesas).
Buena ubicacion en una zona tranquila, sin demasiado ruido. A mano de todo, comodo para conocer NY.
Para mi, lo unico  que incomodo un poquito, es el ascensor (dos para muchas habitaciones), igualmente no modifico mis planes porque llegamos para conocer y el tiempo no fue un apremio.

title: Soggiorno a New York!
text: Abbiamo alloggiato all Holiday Inn Express per 8 notti in camere triple. Queste in particolare risultano molto piccole ma credo siano grandi quanto la medi degli alberghi in città. Sono pulite e dotate di grande TV e macchinetta del caffè. L'hotel é in una posizione strategica molto centrale e vicinissimo a Times Square. La colazione compresa nel prezzo della camera é molto Varia e direi abbastanza buona. Caffè a volontà e latte fresco da prendere in frigo. Pancake, uova e succhi. La sala colazione é piccola quindi consiglio di andare presto per trovare dei posti. Il personale di sala é gentilissimo e si fa in quattro per farti accomodare appena arrivi. Reception ok e hall all'ingresso con possibilità di acquistare snak e bibite. Distributore bevande della colazione sempre attivo. Buon compresso per girare New York e ritornare il camera solo a riposare la sera.

title: Great hotel and hospitality
text:
Very nice hotel with good location and great service. 
It is not fancy and as usual in NYC the room are small but it is clean and effective. Great value for the money. 
Only drawback from the expected is that there are two elevators and they are slow. So, take the time going up and down.

title: Perfect Location
text: This hotel is what you'd expect on a mid-range budget in NYC.  Rooms are small but clean.  Location was great for us as we drove to NYC and wanted to stay somewhere close to one of the city's entry points.  The hotel is less than a mile from the Lincoln tunnel which kept our drive in Manhattan brief.   Staff are friendly and are readily available to help answer any questions you might have.  The breakfast buffet was more than adequate and an easy way to start the day.  The only complaint are the elevators.  Waiting sometimes for more than 10 minutes for one to arrive meant that many mornings we took the stairs down to the lobby.  The location is great for walking to many midtown sites including Times Square, Macy's, Madison Square Garden, the Empire State Building and the Port Authority Bus Terminal.   We found walking on 9th avenue was much quieter than 8th or Broadway and offered us a chance to view this part of the city without throngs of people everywhere.

title: Great location and clean...
text: First let me say that this was a small room.  Of course, we were expecting small in NYC.  It was clean and had a mini fridge.  One of our group members called the desk to ask if they had a microwave she could use.  They said to come down to first floor.  They escorted her to an employee lounge to use their microwave. So nice!  The location is great for the Times Square/Theater District.  We felt very safe!  The only issue I had:  Whose idea was it to put an opaque glass door on the bathroom??  When someone gets up in the middle of the night or early in the morning to go to the bathroom and turns on the light, the whole bedroom area is flooded with light!  Not good!  Attached restaurant was very good!

title: Séjour du 19 au 26 août
text: Chambre tout confort. Salle petit déjeuner où il fait froid. Personnels très accueillant sauf personnels de la conciergerie qui devraient parler français. Cafés et boissons à volonté toute la journée.

title: Good Choice for NYC
text: This is my second time at this hotel. I found it clean and convenient. Location of the hotel met my needs. Walking to many things was easy and getting an uber was painless. The staff were very friendly. This trip I was there for only one night. I did not take advantage of breakfast, only coffee. The rooms are a little small, but quite adequate. The elevators serve lots of floors and you do have to wait sometimes. This is an older property, keep that in mind - although, I'd stay here again without hesitation.

title: Vacation
text:
The staff were very friendly especially Gio. He was special to us because he was really kind and personally. He told us a lot about New York. 
The hotel has a central location. That‘s pretty great.
We enjoyed or stay very much!

title: Ok for one or two nights
text:
well positioned, but the breakfast is really not good at all even if I paid for it, I was going out for the breakfast!
the service is really to be reworked, it looks like they dont want to understand the problem you have.

title: Awesome place great people
text: I had to pick this hotel in a hurry for a large group. I was nervous but they really surprised me with their above and beyond customer service in all departments from front desk to kitchen to the maintanence guys who would call the lift for you . The whole experince from reservation directly with hotel to stay was amazing and i would definitely recommend it to friends and family. Shout out to you holiday express folks.

title: Servicio correcto, práctico y bien ubicado.
text: Muy buen desayuno pero siempre mucha gente. Habitaciones reducidas en espacio, un día no llegaron a hacer el servicio de limpieza y nos lo descontaron al señalarlo. El movimiento de huéspedes es permanente en un hotel de 35 pisos y 6 habitaciones en cada uno, en un espacio limitado. Pero nos sentimos a gusto, aprovechamos mucho el café de cortesía siempre disponible en la recepción. En la misma cuadra hay muchos lugares para comprar comida, Starbucks, 7 eleven, Pret a Manger y otros locales.

title: Zentral gelegen in der Nähe des Times Square!
text:
Die Unterkunft liegt in der Nähe des Times Square direkt in Manhattan, vieles ist fußläufig erreichbar.
Das Hotel verfügt über kleine aber saubere Zimmer mit kostenfreiem WLAN und Frühstück, welches in einem kleinen und häufig überfüllten Frühstücksraum angeboten wird.

Das Personal war freundlich und hilfsbereit, für eine New York Erkundungsreise ist also alles gegeben - empfehlenswert wenn auch nicht günstig!

title: Awful and frightening experience
text:
Because of a very late cancelled flight we had to find a last minute room. Fortunately we found 2 rooms at the Holiday Inn Express in Times Square on 39th Street. Unfortunately our driver dropped us off at the Holiday Inn and we had to walk to the correct hotel. The walk at midnight to the hotel was certainly not pleasant, complete with prostitutes, young men in gangs smoking marijuana and sketchy people everywhere. At the hotel we are greeted by a very friendly woman who said unfortunately I cannot get the two of you on the same floor. Ok fine whatever, just need rooms. Finally get our keys, head to the elevator and a middle aged man gets on with us. He tried to make small talk asking way more than he needed to know and gets off the elevator. I get off on my floor and my staff member goes on up to hers. Standing outside of my room I can hear voices. Wanting to make sure they were from my room I walked over to another room to listen. Nope the male voices are definitely coming from the room I was assigned. I head back to the front desk where the front desk clerk acts surprised. Then arrives my co-worker. Not only did I find my room occupied but she did too. She did not hear any noises and walked in the room to find luggage and men's clothing! Front desk clerk still acts surprised - other clerk looks at her and says did you actually put them in xxxx rooms and then shakes her head. We get new rooms - somehow on the same floor - told they just opened up. Really at 12:30 am and within 5 minutes? We get back on the elevator. Funny this same large man gets on with us for the 2nd time. He says hey what happened and very briefly say we needed our rooms updated. He looks at the button we pressed on the elevator and he looks at my co-worker and says oh I bet you are in room 1704, I will see you later. How in the world did he know what room she was in? We both had our keys hidden in our hands.

We were both absolutely shaken by his comment and at this point who do we trust? Is this a set up? A scam? We are both extremely tired and hungry and had been at the airport for over 12 hours. We knew we could not leave the hotel because where in the world would we go? Cannot trust the front desk agent and who is this man? What if I would have walked into that first room? What if that man would have been in the room my co-worker walked into?  We were so shaken, I had my co-worker in my room for our safety and even pushed the chair and table up against the door for added protection. What the hell is happening at this hotel?

title: Buena localización
text: Hotel de batalla para recorrer NYC...recomendable coger plantas altas y bajar pronto al desayuno que por otro lado no es demasiado bueno, pero aceptable. Pocas mesas y mucho comensales. Si hace buen tiempo recomendable sacarlo a la terraza.

title: Daughter wanted to see musical
text: My daughter wanted to see Be More Chill as well as Dear Evan Hanson. This hotel is very close to both theatres (a short walk to each). The staff was very nice and the rooms were adequate for our needs. When we return to New York, this will be the hotel we choose.

title: Friendly Staff but Cramped Hotel
text: The desk staff were very helpful and nice and that was great since the hotel itself is small, cramped and in need of some renovations.  While my room was tiny but clean, other areas of the hotel felt dirty or run down.  The noise in my room on the 17th floor  was minimal and the AC worked great so I'm sure that covered some of the city noise.  The location was close to many tourist attractions but that also made the traffic heavy and the area very crowded.  The breakfast supplied was free and adequate but was often crowded with not enough seating for everyone.

title: 快適でした
text:
観光メインでホテルは寝るだけです。スタッフは気持ち良く対応してくれましたし、部屋は清潔でした。シャワーの水圧も問題なく、熱いお湯が出ました。排水はあまりスムーズではありまんが、問題なし。部屋にコーヒーメーカーがありましたが、ロビーでコーヒー無料なので、誰も使わないのでしょう。使いたいと思えない状態でした。これもロビーでもらったほうが早いので、問題なし。コーヒーと水無料は大変ありがたかったです。
高層ホテルですが、エレベーターが2基。エレベーターは時間がかかります。エレベータートラブルで階段を使用しましたが、高層階だったので、つらかった。
朝食は無料なのにメニューも選べるくらいあって、十分でした。味は薄く自分で塩などを振っていただくスタイルのようです。野菜はありませんが、フルーツはありました。食堂は狭く、席も限られていますが、スタッフがうまくまわして、食卓を清潔にし、補充も速やかだったので、回転が早く、快適に食事ができました。部屋に持ち帰りもできます。
ツアーで他のホテルの朝食風景をチラ見しましたが、パンをもらうのに長蛇の列でした。それに比べるとすぐに暖かい食事がその場でいただけて、とても良かったです。
立地もタイムズスクエアに徒歩圏内で便利でした。
この値段でこのホテル。エレベーターに時間がかかるのさえなければ星5つです。

title: Good accommodation in industrial NY
text:
Stayed with my cousin relatively comfortable stay it was clean and tidy we had all we needed. Staff were very friendly and chatty would stay again. 
The immediate location is not pretty very industrial straight out of an 80's NYC style gritty film. However, after a short walk you on the main streets easy access to shops and transportation. 
Front view faces industrial site and rows of houses. Back also industrial but can have a view of the city block in the distance.

title: Mixed feelings
text: 10 out of 10 location, it is perfect. Close to Central Park and Times Square. Also several subway stations around. The room are decent and clean. But wow the breakfast is wild, firstly the have limited choices and it’s the same thing every day. You get tired of it by the 3rd day. Wow even the breakfast area is so small and busier than Times Square. Also I got to the hotel early around 2 but had to wait for 4pm to get a room. The hotel staff were not even trying to check me until the official time. That kinda bored me after a 16 hour flight to have to wait for my room.

title: Amazed by Customer Service
text:
My friend and I arrived on a very early bus (7am), exhausted and not feeling all too well. The staff not only offered to text/call us when the room was ready, but when they noticed we kind of had no where else to go until later in the day, they let us check in 5 1/2 hours early. They were patient with us as it was our first time renting a hotel room, and the rooms themselves are a perfect size.

We are considering coming back in February, and will 100% be booking with this hotel again :)

title: It's a good room, just small
text: The room was fine, it just was really small. The location is really close to Time Square which is either good or bad depending on your personality. The only issue with the place was the elevators. It took a long time to get one and get down out on the street. But clean room, not run doen it was nice. It's probably molre of a 3.5 but trip advisor doesn't do halves so I will go with 3

title: Nao voltaria
text:
O hotel  tem uma localizaçao ate q razoavel , perto da Times Squere, porem sua infra estrutura eh pessima, um dos  elevadores estava quebrado e nao consertaram fazendo com q se formasse uma fila enorme e qdo conseguia,  para descer novamente era um sufoco, e nada diziam aos hospedes como alguma desculpa,ou previsao de conserto , a maquina de gelo no andar tb estava quebrada e com isso nem agua para encher a garrafinha se conseguia, uma furada.O cafe da manha era ate bonzinho por ser gratuito.
Mas nao volto mais, posso ter dado azar, mas nao vejo uma boa administraçao por la.

title: Nice stay
text: My kids were surprised when we opened the door bc of the tiny room, but since in NY life obviously happens outside the hotel room, it was enough for us. Only thing was that shampoo bottle was half empty, so we never knew if it was used prior to our arrival or what happened, but beyond that, everything was very good. Very conveniently located, we walked to the subway, Empire State Building, Fifth Avenue. I think their best feature is the location. Very kind service as well from the front desk and bar staff.

title: Very Convenient with great staff
text: Whenever I'm in New York (at least 5 times a year) for business, I stay in this hotel. It is located a few blocks from all offices and business meetings that I need to attend. Also for the touristic part of anyone's trip, this hotel is located very close to the famous Times Square and many restaurants. Also have to mention that it has a great staff, always trying to make you feel at home away from home.

title: Basic hotel but suited purpose
text:
Hotel was basic but clean enough. There were 4 of us in the room so we couldn't all move at once! The elevators were broken most of the time so luckily we were only on the 15th floor!
Breakfast was included and although it was crowded at times it was really good. The staff at breakfast were great, so helpful.
It's not a hotel to spend a lot of time in but it suited our needs for 4 nights

title: We (4 people, 2 rooms) spent a week in NYC at the Holiday Inn Express on West 39th street
text: The rooms were "tight" and the elevator service was very poor at times.  Fortunately, we were in good health and only on the 12th floor because one day, after we tired of waiting for an elevator, we walked down.  On the plus note, the staff was very accommodating and the free breakfast was very good.

title: Ottimo e molto comodo a tutto come posizione
text: Per la nostra vacanza a NY abbiamo scelto questo Hotel della catena Holiday Inn express , non lasciatevi ingannare dalla  parola express, gode di tutti i confort, pulito e accogliente. Molto vicino alle metropolitane e vicinissimo al Medison SG. Una colazione americana da sogno. Consigliato sia per famiglie che per lavoro.

title: Below par- please keep stairwells clear!
text: The hotel is centrally located, on the slightlier 'edgier' side. The main issues were the lifts and the stairs! We were there 3 nights and there was only one lift in use. Sometimes the staff would take manual control of the lift (during busier times)  and unless you phoned reception it would never appear. We walked down twice. The lift is shared with staff, so often had bin residue and was generally not an acceptable situation for a large chain hotel, wasting our time and being a general inconvenience. I guess we all had to accept this inconvenience as we were not offered any discount to the rate we paid- nor were we advised of this beforehand. The other issue is a little more worrying. I noticed (on my walk down the 20 odd storeys) that several landings had black bags of rubbish. I brought this to the reception staffs attention, out of concern for fire hazard. The next day, this was still the case. I would urge the hotel to please review this and make improvement as it would appear to be the normal.

title: Good location but lifts are an issue
text: Good location, rooms are clean, staff friendly. Can be a bit chaotic at breakfast time but good selection and staff were very friendly at breakfast and tried to get you seated as quickly as possible. Alot of reviews spoke about only having two lifts, when we were there, there was only the one as the second one was broken so you can imagine the wait for the lifts. We always walked the 21 flights downstairs (which isn't practical for everyone) and just waited for the lift up a although did walk it up once when there was about 20 people ahead of us queuing. They did have someone controlling the lift at peak times so if you phoned reception they would get the elevator to stop at your floor. Overall it was a good location which is a huge bonus and literally around the corner from a subway station but the lift might be an issue for some people.

title: great value and great location
text: stayed her for 3 nights for a long weekend away,it was perfect for us as the location was within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go and the room was perfect and had everything we needed, check in was very quick and they had a helper on site if you needed to book anything

title: Great Hospitality
text:
were a group of six which stayed at this Hotel from 27th June to 30th June.
Patel, Maniar & Bangia. We were very happy & special thanks to the Young Lady Manager, who made special arrangements for us in our breakfast, since we are 100% vegetarians, NO EGG, NO FISH NO MEAT. Yours being Express Hotel , not having Kitchen Facility, she did make sure in whatever best capacity she could. We really thank her & her team.
Rgds

title: A bit small but comfortable
text: Our first trip to NYC since moving to Maryland and we stayed here. The area is clean it's right near times square, walking distance to shops and alot of restaurants. Didn't know it didn't have a fridge or microwave however I'm guessing that most new york cheaper priced hotels do not. The breakfast was ok. The room was tiny but again it's New York so I'm assuming that unless you pay way more for a room this is the norm. The staff were friendly. We felt safe. Walking distance to central park and subway.  No view at in our room but you have to remember their is so much to see in NYC you might not spend to much time in your room so for the price I think it was reasonable and comfortable for our stay.

title: Convenient
text: Rooms are a bit small but conveniently located. The breakfast area is also small. It is a bit crowded when we ate. Did not expect much with the breakfast spread. Filling but limited choices. Friendly staff.

title: a great time with family and wakling distance to tomes square
text: i had a great time in here with family. Hotel was nice and services was good. my first time came to new york but i have a great time in here. the breakfast was good. yhe ambicences of this place is good.and walking distance to times squares. we took the services car to the airport it's nice. looking forward to be back in this hotel.  fully recommended

title: Muito fraco!!!
text:
O quarto é bem pequeno! A limpeza deixa a desejar, chegamos cansados e o lençol não estava limpo! Tinha cabelo e sujeira! 
O banheiro não é muito bem limpo! Ficamos num andar onde tem máquina de gelo, acho que 8º andar, é insuportável o barulho a madrugada toda de hóspedes pegando gelo.
O local do café da manhã é pequeno e tem espaço para poucas pessoas. 
O café da manhã é péssimo! Bolos sem sabor, fruta só banana e maçã (qdo tem), nada tem sabor!

title: Girls trip
text:
Best place to stay walking distance to eveything especially time square. Rooms are small but comfortable. Break fast was the best. Staff was friendly and help. Will definitely stay there next time I go to New York .
Be sure to ask for a high floor and u get great views of empire

title: Buen hotel, buen servicio.
text: Buen hotel, a unas cuadras de Times Square. El único problema es en la noche, está un poco peligroso, mucho homeless y drogadictos. Pero en general está bien si vas por pocos días. Las habitaciones pequeñas pero limpias. Personal muy amable!

title: Ottimo
text: Ubicato in posizione fantastica. A pochi passi da tutto. Hotel piccolo, sviluppato in altezza, ma confortevole. Stanze piccole ma organizzate. Colazione super, varia e ben rifornita. Se prenotate con larghissimo anticipo, potete trovari prezzi molto vantaggiosi.

title: Good location, good stay
text:
Easy to get to - you have Penn Station or 42 St Port Authority very close by.
Hotel closely situated one block to Times Square or two block into Hell's Kitchen where you'll find plenty of good restaurants.
Staff are lovely, friendly and informative.
Hotel room for 4 people is adequate - not small but not spacious either. Our room faced 8th Avenue but it was still surprisingly quiet than what I was expecting. 
Like a lot of reviews, the only bugbear is the lift. There are two and you could be waiting what feels like a very long time for one. Then there's the lift stopping at any floor where someone is waiting yet can't get on as it's full. You will need to exercise some patience but other than that it's fine. (Alternatively you can walk up/down the fire escape route which we did once, it was an amusing experience!
Hotel was perfectly situated for our first time in NYC and I would use again.

title: Nice people
text: This hotel had very nice and helpful employees!  Rafeel was a great help!  The room was smaller than any I have used in New York City.  It was clean and the breakfast was what you would expect from a Holiday Inn.  Unfortunately, they couldn't get our keys to stay loaded.  We kept them away from cell phones and magnetic cards but they still only worked once.  We had to keep going back to the front desk, wait on line, and get a new one.  One employee told us to check the key buy using it on the downstairs stairwell.  It would work and then when we got to our room it didn't.  Very frustrating when it would take 10 - 15 minutes + to get into our room after a long day!

title: First class stay
text: This hotel is excellent. The front desk staff met every need and answered all questions with a smile. Breakfast had so many options. It is a few blocks from the bustle of Times Square and on the border of Hell’s Kitchen. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Dated
text:
The staff on reception and at breakfast time was so nice and polite also very helpful. 
The room appeared to be ok but the carpet was filthy, one of my pillow's had a big yellow stain on and our quilt had a rip in it.The large mirror also appeared to have snot on it, when we  complained they promised a special clean. HAHA! When we got back into the room it smelt nice the bed was made towels etc BUT the mirror still had snot on, the quilt and pillow was the same and the same bit of fluff  was on the floor so it didn't get a hoover. Get new cleaning staff as it really put me off my stay! Location dirty full of rubbish etc but only a couple of blocks to time square shops etc. The Irish pub few doors down was fab lovely food not bad on prices for NY.

title: Great Experience
text: This was our first time staying at this hotel. It was nice and clean. The rooms are really nice and cute.  Just a few rooms per floor, which I really enjoyed. The location to Times Square was magnificent. We could walk into Times Square grab something to eat , shop etc or they were local places nearby to stop and grab a bite as well. What a great central location. If you are  looking for a reasonably priced good quality hotel to enjoy New York City, this is your place. Access to cabs, Time Square, Rockefeller and Broadway were all within walking distance - to name a few places. I will certainly stay at this hotel again on my next visit to NYC!

title: Great location and staff
text:
The location is great, although the block itself is off-putting what with litter, garbage and people sleeping on the sidewalk. The hotel staff is terrific — very friendly at the reception desk, extremely friendly at breakfast (and great at moving people along when seating is at a premium). Our room overlooked another high-rise, but we had a wee glimpse of sky so could guess at the weather in the morning. The room was small but adequate, with a desk and lots of plugs for devices. The AC/heating system was really good and easy to operate, though noisy. Take your earplugs! Other than the fan noise, the room and hallways were quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable with clean, crisp linen. The bathroom was small but worked for us.

On the downside, there were some issues that should be addressed. The security chain on the door was missing a screw, the bottom of the bathtub needed a good scrubbing, and the easy chair in the hall needed a thorough cleaning or, better yet, replacing. On the plus side, the lighting was good for reading or for working on a laptop.
The complimentary breakfast had lots of options — hot egg dishes, bacon, sausages, cereals, fruits, yogurt, etc. Delicious cinnamon buns!! But be warned: if you don’t get there early enough, you won’t get a seat. Between 6:30 and 7:30 is your best bet, but even then, you’ll probably have to share a table.
As with many hotels, the Holiday Inn uses disposable plastic or Styrofoam cutlery and dishes. Very distressing to see the amount of material that’s thrown out every day. Styrofoam cups and plastic glasses in the rooms as well. And the pathetic signs (often ignored) to “save the planet” by re-using your towels. When will this nonsense stop?? Use glassware and wash the dishes!

title: Decepción
text: La situación es muy buena la 39 con la octava. Anuncian que la habitación tiene 23 metros con dos camas y hasta 4 personas. Pues la realidad es: dos camas de 1.35 arrimadas a pared en laterales, en medio una mesilla de 45cm, eso es la anchura de la habitación. En frente un armario liliputiense de 1.85 de alto  por 1 m de ancho donde guardan la plancha, la tabla y la caja fuerte. Una mesa escritorio pegado al armario y unos cajones que aguantan un plasma. Ah el largo de la cama es de 1.80 (te salen los pies) No esperes milagros si vais 4. El micro baño para ducharse y salir.. La habitación de unos 10m2 y el baño de unos 5m2. La limpieza muy buena, los empleados de limpieza y cocina son la mayoria latinos, y son simpaticos y hacen de traductores en recepcción cuando la recepcionista no te entiende. El desayuno es bueno, repetitivo pero bueno. Opción de prepararte un bocadillo con una burger o tortilla para "llevar"

title: It is ok for NYC
text: Small hotel but it is ok  for staying in NYC. Too many people for breakfast. Very good situated in Broadway. You have coffee ata the room but not a friedge. good service and stuff people are friendly. Good hotel for nyc

title: Good
text:
I have been staying here during my vacation in NYC, room was clean and comfortable, breakfast ok and position very strategic. Service could be so much better, they held more money than what they should on my credit card because few dollars was missing at the check in. This issue wasn’t explain clearly by staff but at the end they did not charged me more than what they should.
Not more than ok.

title: Blocks to Times Square
text: Decent hotel - small rooms, but typical for New York. Stayed six nights. Comfortable beds and pillows. Only two elevators for many floors and guests - sometimes wait was a while. We were on the 21st floor so construction noise wasn't too bad, but our friends on lower floors found it more disturbing. Breakfast was included so that was great. But it was standard Holiday Inn fare, so it got a bit old fairly quickly. And it was super busy, but we managed to share a table and even meet some other travellers. The hotel had citrus-infused iced water 2-3 of the 6 days at the front desk. It was awesome although I wish it was there all the days.

title: Stop over
text:
We stayed in New York for 3 nights and chose this reasonably priced hotel for its location. 
Upon arrival the staff could not have been more helpful, we were given recommendations-to eat and all given help to purchase bus tour 
This hotel was in a good place near to 42nd street and good for tourists

title: gut gelegen...
text: das Hotel ist gut gelegen, vieles kann in Gehdistanz erreicht werden. Kleine aber geräumige Zimmer, erstaunlich ruhig für die Lage, jedoch keine Aussichten...freundliches Personal, grosszügiges Frühstücksbuffet jedoch sehr kleiner Speisesaal für die grosse Anzahl Gäste. Alles in allem für die Preisklasse ganz ordentlich...in New York will man seine Zeit ja nicht auf dem Zimmer verbringen 😀

title: Excellent location
text: Great location with proximity to Times square & all shopping areas . No frills hotel but has big spacious rooms with good view . Being an IHG member was treated special & given all concessions like late check out , welcome kit .

title: Place to stay
text: Not too far from the public transport or times square. Room is small but clean. Lobby very small but the night staff was friendly. It is just OK. The neighbourhood is not the best at night. Price is reasonable. Compared to other hotels in Times Square , I had stayed the past, this would be low on my list

title: Ottimo locale al centro di NY
text: Consiglio a tutti questo albergo sia perché è situato al centro di NY e vicino alla fermato della metropolitana sia perché gli arredamenti interni ed i sanitari sono nuovi e puliti. Il personale è sempre disponibile alle richieste dei clienti. Lo consigliato a tutti.

title: Welcome to Tiny Town
text:
Yes, I know, it's Manhattan, so you can expect to pay twice as much for half the space, and that's just how it is. This is a tall, skinny building. The hallways are very narrow (barely wide enough for a housekeeping cart). People waiting for the elevator on the ground floor are in the way of people using the stairwells and also in the way of people going to and and from the breakfast area. The breakfast area is small and cramped, and the signs in the elevators warn you that it will get more crowded as time passes. They are telling the truth. A good choice is to take a tray back up to your room, since it can be very hard to find any place to sit.

We weren't surprised that our room was small. It was smaller than most "studio" rooms we've seen. With the king bed and a little bit of furniture, it was tight. Two adults could not move around at the same time. Just getting dressed in the morning required careful choreography. The tiny bathroom had no counter space, although there was a tiny shelf over the toilet. The towels were hung in the shower instead of on the wall, so they tended to stay damp all the time. This is the first time we've stayed in a Holiday Inn Express that didn't have a small refrigerator in the room, which was disappointing. But, seriously, there wouldn't be room for it unless you got rid of something else. 

This 36-floor building is served by two elevators. There is almost always a long wait for the elevator, and it is worse in the morning when people are checking out and the elevators fill up with bodies and suitcases, with the elevator stopping on almost every floor, only to disappoint people who can't squeeze in.

Apparently there is no good place to store the housekeeping carts. One was always left parked outside our room overnight, partly blocking the doorway.

There was a really nice looking vending machine on our floor, but it was out of order the entire week we were there.

On the positive side: We didn't hear too much street noise in our room, because we were on the side of the hotel not overlooking 39th St. We used the fan to block outside sounds. The bed was comfortable. We appreciated having a good-sized safe in the closet. The WiFi worked well most of the time. The building is in walking distance to restaurants, subway stops, and Times Square. There is no guest laundry, but there are laundromats in walking distance. The people working the front desk were courteous.

title: Podeira ser melhor pelo padrao da rede e o preço
text: O hotel é até bem localizado, nao muito distante da times square e outras atraçoes que se pode ir a pé o quarto é razoavel, mas pelo padrao e o preço caro, poderia ser bem melhor, nem frigobar tinha no quarto, apenas uma maquina de gelo varios andares abaixo e se ao menos fosse uma em cada andar menos mal, o café da manha é bem fraco, pois nunca vi café da manha americano nao ter ovos e bacon, em qualquer lugar do mundo tem isso, mas é algo tradicional do americano; sem falar que o hotel estava lotado é local para se tomar o café é minimo por pouco nao tive que comer em pé e estranhei. Adoro a rede, pois ja fiquei em varios outros em paises diferentes, mas me decepcionei com esse e sinceramente o custo benéficio é muito alto pela qualidade, pois pelo mesmo preço poderia ter ficado em um hotel melhor e com certeza é um daqueles que nunca voltarei, qdo for a NY na proxima vez

title: Lovely Trip
text: We stayed for 6 days at this hotel this was my 2nd visit had a very comfortable stay the breakfast staff are very friendly they give you a very warm feeling in the morning with their lovely smiles the rooms are very comfortable and clean overall had a very good stay here but would also like to say the check in staff should also be a little freindlier not all give you smiles when you check in anyways we will surely stay there again next time

title: Avoid this hotel
text:
The Hotel is not what you would think of as a Holiday Inn Chain.
the service is poor. Some staff is just rude and unhelpful.
fixing a problem take over hours of your time and you need to personally run down to catch the guy to fix the issues.
Had same issue for 2 days out of 4 day stay in the hotel.
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Very disappointed - old, threadbare and not what you expect.
text:
We have stayed at many different holiday inn express all over UK and had nothing but praise for them.  Have checked into this one in New York and got the shock of our lives. 
Whilst reception staff and concierge really , really helpful and friendly, the room is awful. The carpet is threadbare in about 8 places, the furniture is all scratched and looks second hand, bathroom has some mould in it too.  Didn’t expect the ritz, but did expect same quality as in U.K. what a shame IHG have let the brand slip here. Will see what breakfast it like - but thinking of checking out and going elsewhere.

title: Excellent Place to Stay Near Jacob Javits Convention Centre
text:
Looking  for a place to stay with comfortable beds, quiet rooms and a big breakfast included within 15 minutes' walk from the Jacob Javits Convention Centre?  Look no further than this Holiday Inn on West 39th with friendly staff.

Note:  A quick and cheap way to get from Newark Airport to this Holiday Inn is via the Newark Express Bus that costs $18 for adults and $9.50 for senior citizens.  This bus is direct to the Port Authority on West 42nd that is only a five minutes' walk to the Holiday Inn Express.

title: Excelente Ubicación
text:
Me hospede junto a mi pareja por 7 días.
Lo mejor del hotel sin duda LA UBICACIÓN a escasas 3 cuadras de Times Square y del corazón de NY!!! 
Me toco el piso 28, La habitación es pequeña pero cómoda - total solo vas a dormir porque si estas en NY vas a pasear todo el día, si ese es tu plan este es el hotel perfecto!! 
El desayuno típico continental (frutas, cereal, pan, muffins, etc) puede ser caótico a cierta hora de la mañana.
Particularmente no tuve inconvenientes con el ascensor!!
Si regreso a NY me hospedaría nuevamente.

Para mejorar: Poco personal que hable español.
Olor penetrante de sustancias extrañas en el pasillo del hotel!

title: fiquei e ficarei dinovo
