The hotel is situated close to all areas of Manhattan and 5mins from Grand Central Station 41st Street.
On checking in we were meet by very plesent and helpful staff. We got a room on the 33rd floor were you can get good views of the Hudson River. 
Rooms are basic USA rooms with a fair amount of room in it We had a king-size bed .sideboard with draws.; wardrobe and a good size TV if you got time to look at. There is ice machines on 3 floors .In the lobby there is coffee and tea available all day as well as your room. They also had  ice water available all day for you which was great in the hot weather they get . The breakfast was very good and on one morning when we had to be out before breakfast a breakfast bag was supplied to us .
We stayed for 5days for our Wedding Anniversary and we enjoyed every bit of our stay. Would go back again when visiting New York.

title: It was okay....
text: Room was fine, great pillows, bed kind of hard. Nice and quiet, only about 6 rooms per floor. The worst part was waiting for the elevator in the morning. They only have 2 and it took me 10 minutes to get down from 23 of 36 floors. The breakfast area is also quite small, standing room only. Other than that, it's a great location, close to shopping and fantastic restaurants!  Times Square only a block or so away.

title: Clean, Nice Location
text: This is a clean hotel but has elevator issues. Plan your up and down, especially during breakfast hours. The staff was very friendly. We were able to store luggage before and after check in/out. Close to lots of sights. Best to use the 42nd St station for subway instead of 34th St which was more congested. Best to walk over to 8th or 9th Ave to hail a cab depending on if you are going down or uptown. Always felt safe walking to and from.

title: Bloody Lift
text: Great location for a hotel but boy have you got to sort out this lift - we were on the 27th Floor and every day there was a problem with the lift - sort it out for gods sake!!!!  Other than that the staff were wonderful - breakfast staff are the best of any holiday Inn I've stayed in ( we are platinum guests so you can imagine how many).  My husband also left our passports in the safe an the wonderful Anna got them back to us as we stayed in Cape Cod. So well done on your staff but your hotel lets you down big time!!!

title: Birthday celebration
text: What a great hotel! Reasonably priced, great location, and a friendly staff. Rooms are typical size for NYC. Nice outside seating to wind down so no need for a bigger room. Clean spaces and happy faces made it a great stay.

title: Couldn't fault it! Very convenient
text:
My husband and 2 young children stayed at the Holiday Inn express New York Chelsea for 2 nights in August 2017. We chose this hotel as we had stayed there on a previous trip and we knew that it was pretty close to Penn Station.

Let's be honest, the rooms aren't big but they are adequate for New York standards (most budget hotel rooms are pretty small in NYC). The room we had has 2 double beds. The bathroom was small but was really good with all the amenities required.

The hotel offers free breakfast which included eggs, sausage, yoghurt, fruits, selection of bread including bagels and a pancake maker. The coffee was also good but the are can get crowded during peak times. 

Overall, very convenient. We will likely be back in September for our journey back to Australia!

title: Nice hotel
text:
Stayed here a couple weeks back for one night. Booked the hotel on short notice so didn't even look at reviews etc... 

4 of us stayed here and we were all happy with our stay. The girl on reception was very friendly, exceptional at her job. The room we stayed in was spacious and modern as was the bathroom. The wifi was fast which was a nice bonus. 

We had some breakfast which was well presented, plenty of choice you just help yourself to what you want. 

It's not quite on Times Square so don't be expecting that, still it's only a short walk. 

Would definitely recommend staying here 😀

title: Good for the location
text: The best thing about this Holiday Inn is the location. Easy walk to Times Square, shopping, even Central Park. Subway station just a block away. Bryant Park (Thursday free Broadway in the Park!) is a block away. The breakfast is ok but way too crowded and nothing special. Our room was clean and private. We didn't have any problems but I didn't get the impression that the front desk employees would go out of their way to help. Good stay overall; not a cheap hotel but reasonable price for the location.

title: What you see is what you get
text: Our room was clean and modern. Breakfast is included but don't expect anything special. There is not a full English option or even half a one. Overall however the hotel is reasonable value and is well situated, the staff are friendly and accommodating and it is a fair option.

title: Location
text:
This hotel is perfectly situated for harbor excursions from piers along 12th avenue. Easy walking distance to Piers 73 and 78. The hotel itself is geared towards efficiency. The rooms are small, but clean, modern and comfortable. You are provided with a nice desk console and wardrobe, plenty of charging outlets and an ergonomic chair. I am not sure if any rooms have a direct water view, but my view along 38th (?) was interesting, and a sliver of the river could be seen. There is also an outdoor terrace of sorts, in the front of the hotel, which I didn't use,but  looked like a pleasant place to sit and people watch.

'My only complaint is breakfast, which ends at 9:30.  I went down at 9 and it was a mob scene. And there were no seats. I ended up at a computer table. I suggest breakfast go until ten, or that they add more seating. At any rate, go earlier for breakfast. Breakfast is the usual Holiday Inn affair. Not gourmet, but adequate.

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: This is the 3ed Holiday Inn Express we have stayed at in NYC and it was probably my favorite. Getting to the hotel was easy since it is close to the Lincoln Tunnel. I did not use their Valet parking since I found another place up the street that was about 10$ less than what the hotel wanted to charge us. Check in was friendly and quick and they allowed us to sign in early. Yes, the room was small but we are used to it. Not much of a view but we preferred the early check in instead. The location was the best. We were able to just walk to Times Square from there, we also walked to Bryant Park. The room was clean, and hotel was quiet. Breakfast was tight (it always is in these hotels) but it worked. We will stay here again when we are in NYC. The location alone makes it the hands down choice.

title: No vengas
text:
Lamentablemente mi opinión para este hotel será la peor que pueda dar, pero es mi responsabilidad como crítico de Trip Advisor.

El hotel está bien ubicado pero desentona completamente con la cadena Holiday inn express, el elevador no funciona adecuadamente, tuvimos que esperar hasta 15 min. para poder tomarlo para ir a nuestra habitación, de los 2 elevadores disponibles regularmente solo funcionaba 1; el diseño del hotel es malo, ya que precisamente frente al elevador hay un resaque que disminuye el espacio; el espacio para el desayuno es muy pequeño y no corresponde al número de habitaciones; el personal es poco amable, solo quiero destacar la amabilidad del señor encargado de limpiar las mesas durante el desayuno es lo único bueno del hotel.

El servicio de TV igualmente muy malo, pocos canales y con muy mala señal, el aire acondicionado igualmente muy mal, en 2 ocasiones tuvimos que reportarlo por qué sin causa aparente empezaba a funcionar la calefacción; las habitaciones huelen muy mal.

En fin, es un hotel al cuál no recomiendo visitar nunca, lástima que no aprovechen la buena ubicación.

title: Nice and clean hotel for price
text: When we visit NYC, we don't typically hang out in the room much, preferring instead to see the sites. We are looking for a clean comfortable room and bed in a place that feels safe at a reasonable price. HI Express provided all that. We were greeted warmly by a great staff that were helpful in providing recommendations. It was a bit crowded at breakfast, but the very nice lady at the helm did her best to keep food and coffee filled and help diners find seats. With a smile. I was impressed that she was so helpful and didn't lose her cool. Our room was smaller as one would expect in an older city hotel, but was updated, clean and comfortable. Hotel was well located, three blocks from subway, and near Time's Square. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Well located and includes breakfast
text: We are IHG members and booked this hotel for the walk-to location for the theater district and for the easy free breakfast (some hot items such as sausage, well-stocked) to get us going quickly. It is a typical nice and clean Holiday Inn Express. It has almost no lobby (the Candlewood Suites next door has a more spacious one) which can make for a bit of a check-in crowd. A big group of teenagers was staying one of the nights we were there and the two small elevators and the breakfast room were a bit overwhelmed by them. When the teens had checked out, everything was fine. I must also compliment the gentleman on the breakfast room staff who found my little handbag and made sure it was safe at the front desk. One tip: I had booked about 10 days in advance, and I forgot to look at the prices before it was too late to cancel and rebook at a lower price. The prices had dropped a not insignificant amount, and I should have looked and saved myself some money!

title: it was ok
text: not a very big room. The hotel is close to everything. good breakfast and free wifi. the dining room is not very big, people may have to wait for seats during the peak time. a train station is not far away, if you have time (1.5 hrs for the ride), people could consider taking a train all the way to JFK, it's less than $10/person.

title: Hotel Bom
text:
Hotel bom, muito perto do agito da Times Square e isso era tudo que eu queria. Metrô pertissimo e com isso favorecia rolês altas horas sem o menor problema.
O café da manhã era razoável, não tinha a variedade que tem nos hotéis do Brasil(principalmente aqueles banquetes no café da manhã nos hotéis do nordeste), mais para economizar ajuda muito. O Wi-Fi principalmente no andar que me hospedei praticamente inexistia( o que me irritou bastante). Outra coisa que me irritou bastante foi que: comprei a hospedagem pelo Booking (como já havia feito outras vezes aqui no Brasil), imediatamente já desconta uma diária no cartão, até aí tudo ok; quando fizemos check-in eu falei prá recepcionista que queria pagar o saldo restante em cash naquela hora e ela disse que não podia(só no check-out), coisa que aqui no Brasil sempre funcionou assim prá mim, um dia antes de irmos embora questionei se poderia pagá-los por que queria ir ao outlet tranquila para gastar, eis que a péssima surpresa veio: A conta já estava paga( foi descontada integralmente do meu cartão de crédito), fiquei transtornada... Tive que chegar no Brasil vender os dólares que tinha para pagar o hotel e quitar a dívida do cartão, lembrando que quando comprei o dólar ele valia 3,45 e quando vendi tive que vendê-los por 3,15, um bom prejuízo! por esse motivo especialmente não me hospedarei mais nele, deixei claro que iria pagar em cash e me aprontaram isso, prá mim foi o suficiente...Lamentávelmente.

title: We really enjoyed our stay!
text:
This is nice hotel near everything that you will like to see and visit! It's a great place to stay.
Staff was polite and helpful so we would stay here again. 
If you need an airport shuttle you will have to pay in advance for it, and I thought it was included on the hotel services, but no big deal.

title: Not expressed
text: When we (4 people) walked through the door of the hotel it wasn't big but when we walked in our hotel room it was smaller than a normal size living room there were 2 bed a TV and a bathroom. Whenever there were 2 people trying to get past the beds 1 person would have to sit on the bed to let the other person get by.  We planned on staying 3 nights but after the first night we had to ask the workers to move us to a sweet room. Other than that every thing else was good.👎👎

title: Convenient to Time Square
text: We stayed at Holiday Inn Express Times Square (343 W. 39th St, NY City). Five minute walk to Time Square. Breakfast included (sausage, biscuits, eggs, muffins, yogurt, bagels, cereal, milk, juices). Had issues with TV but the very friendly engineer fixed for us. Cold room & comfy bed. Elevators were fairly quick. Didn't use parking garage. Flew in from LaGuardia & used a private minivan service roundtrip for 4 was $104.

title: No fue mi mejor experiencia.
text:
Nos hospedamos una semana por la ubicación y no por el precio porque era carísimo. El hotel está bien, las camas son cómodas. Tenés que ir a desayunar afuera. 
El botones nos trató de manera un poco desagradable, adjudicando que no entendía nuestro inglés. Luego nos ofreció un transfer para ir al aeropuerto a un precio y luego el chofer nos cobró otro (nos dijo que siempre les pasaba lo mismo con el hotel). 
La verdad no estuvo bien

title: Boa localização, mas deixa a desejar
text:
Algumas coisas deixaram a desejar no hotel, mas o principal foi o elevador. Eram apenas dois para um prédio enorme. Por diversas vezes ficavam em manutenção e por outras você chamava e não vinham. Algumas vezes tivemos que enfrentar 14 andares de escadas devido a demora do único elevador que quando chegava, estava lotado e tínhamos que esperar mais.

Como se não bastasse, as chaves dos quartos sempre "perdem a memória" e você tem que pedir outra na recepção, e advinha? Enfrentar a escada ¬¬. Foi o que aconteceu em uma das vezes que chegamos exaustos 2h00 da manhã.

O espaço do café da manhã não é suficiente para o número de hóspedes. Aliás, é minusculo. Devem rever isso com urgência. Vários hóspedes faziam seus pratos e tinham que subir para tomar café nos quartos. O atendente gordinho não tem muita paciência com os hóspedes, além de falar gritando de forma desnecessária.

Tem uma boa localização o que permite ir à pé à Times Square, teatros da Broadway, Empire State, Top of the Rock, Rockfeller Center e etc. Também fica bem próximo à estação de metrô Port Authority, o que ajuda a chegar com mais facilidade a outros pontos da cidade. O café da manhã poderia ser um pouco melhor, mas é bom e supre a necessidade além de terem uma equipe atenciosa no café da manhã.

title: Close to every thing
text: New York is a fabulous place to visit and with so many things to visit a convenient place to stay is in order. Usually a hotel room is for catching a few hours sleep and to be on your way.  You want a clean room, fresh towels and courteous staff.  This place provides that and is highly recommended.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: The staff was excellent, as we have found at all of the Holiday Inn's we stay at.  They were very helpful, polite and prompt.  The room was comfortable and clean.  The breakfast were the standard Holiday Inn Express free breakfast -- which is plentiful -- with many selections from eggs to pancakes to muffins and bagels.  The wait staff at the morning breakfast were hustling and putting in extra effort to make sure all the guests had what they needed.  Very impressive!  One down side was how slow the elevators are especially at rush times.

title: Hotel near Times Square
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights for our New York visit. Located on West 39 Street, it is less than 10 minutes to Times Square. The room is basic and small but clean. The hotel provide free breakfast that is goos enough to start your day. There is only 2 elevators serving 36 floors and waiting time for it can be long. Free WiFi is available in the property. A good base to explore NYC.

title: Vacation
text: Good place clean and easy access to go to times square. Easy to get transport and the are restaurants around .The rooms where clean and the welcome was wonderful. I would not hesitate to go back again. the staff are very helpful. and we booked the same day as we were coming from Connecticut and the was no problem

title: Not a pleasant stay
text: This was my first time in New York City and I wanted to choose a hotel that was close to Times Square and the bus station.  I have had good experiences with Holiday Inn before so I thought my hotel stay was the least of my worries while in NYC.  We were there for 3 days and on the first day, one of the elevators was out of service and there was a 20 to 45-minute wait to take the elevator.  On the second day they had an employee operating the one working elevator and this was even worse as the elevator often bypassed your floor because the elevator was too full, and we had wait times of 45 minutes or more.  Mind you, we would have walked down the stairs had we known how long it would take, but being on the 26th floor I was not looking forward to having to walk down.  The day we were to check out was the worst of all.  We left early because we knew there would be a delay but did not imagine that it would be a minimum of 1 to 1.5 hours to wait for the elevator.  We had a flight to catch so I had no choice but to carry our two bags down 26 flights of stairs!  By the time I got to the 18th floor I was so exhausted and in pain that I could hardly lift the bags, and having to carry 2 bags side by side caused them both to scrape against the stairwell walls.  When we got to the lobby, I was so out of breath that I could not even talk and both bags were completely ruined.  I wanted so badly to complain but I didn't have the strength or time to do so, and just left as quickly as possible.  To make it worse, we ended up missing our train and had to wait nearly 2 hours for the next one to our destination.  I am thankful that I will never set foot in NYC; let alone in that hotel.

title: Nice hotel and great location
text: We stayed here for around a week in the winter and easily found the hotel from the subway. The rooms may not be huge but they are comfortable and very clean. The buffet in the morning was delicious (try the pancakes from the pancake maker!), however the seating area was quite small and could get congested. The hotel is situated in a safe area and within walking distance to Times Square/Broadway. Our only negative would be with the lifts- sometimes only one was in operation due to construction works on-going, and at peak times it would mean having to wait very long to get to the 24th floor. All in all we enjoyed our stay in New York at the Holiday Inn Express.

title: ¡Muy buen hotel!
text: Es un hotel muy bueno en el que, a pesar de que las habitaciones son pequeñas, se descansa muy bien; está muy cerca de las grandes atracciones del Centro de Manhattan, por lo que es muy recomendable. Además tiene desayuno americano, aunque es un poco reducido, es bueno para desayunar.

title: A Good Location!
text:
The Holiday Inn Express Times Square offers a very good location to lots of attractions, such as Times Square, Broadway district and theatres, restaurants and the subway.  All are within walking distance, usually about 10-20 mins. away.  This is a real "pro" for this hotel.  

The hotel itself is nothing fancy, for the price.  Everything in New York proved to be expensive, especially when close to Times Square and the hotel's price of about $270.00 U.S. a night was definitely steep, for the quality of the hotel, which is pretty basic.  The front lobby entrance is not overly impressive, nor was our room, which was quite small, but clean. However, the staff at the hotel was excellent-very friendly and informed, especially the different concierges that were there, during our 10-day stay.  Issues were dealt with quickly and efficiently. e.g. the stopper in the bath was not working well and an engineer was sent right away.

One day there was a problem with 1 of the elevators (2 in total)and people were waiting longer than half an hour to get one.  Some got very irate, because they were leaving that day and had luggage with them.  This problem did not occur again. 

Nearby 9th. Ave offers lots of choices for places to eat, as does 7th and 8th Ave.  Do also try the food trucks on the street!  Unfortunately we did not try them until fairly late into our trip and they provide yummy food at a more reasonable price than the restaurants.  Westway Diner on 9th is a nice spot for typical American food.

title: Hotel bom
text: Hotel fora da Times Square, dá para ver melhor como funciona a cidade com seus habitantes, sem os turistas. Bom acesso a metrô e comércio. Pessoal simpático e solícito. Café da manhã com poucas opções, mas suficiente e bom para sair andando pela cidade, sem perder tempo.

title: Moyen pour le prix
text:
Deux nuits et c'est assez! Chambres vielliotes, literie très correct, salle de bain fonctionnel sans plus. Acceuil un peu froid, gros problème de connection avec le wifi!! Pour le prix 160€ en promo à -50% j'trouver ca cher, heureusement je n'ai pas payer le prix fort!
Situer à 10 minutes de Times Square il est assez bien situer. 
 Un très gros problème d'asçensseur !!!!!!!!!! En journée c'est long mais le matin au moment du petit déjeuner c'est très très très long les gens font la file par dixaine, c'est juste incroyable... deux petits ascenseur pour 36 étages c'est abuser!!

title: Nice and clean
text: No complaints at all. We received a friendly greeting at check-in and the process went smoothly. The room was spotlessly clean, which is most important to me. I chose a "room with a view" and so did my friend. Her view was great, mine, not so much. Request a room facing 39th Street for the better view. The fresh baked cookies were delish! The breakfast was chaotic, as with most hotels that offer free breakfast. Only slight annoyance was the grumpy employee at check-out. Otherwise, I would definitely return!

title: holliday inn tercihimdir
text:
new york her gittiğimde aynı oteli seçmeye gayret ediyorum, tercihim daima Holliday İnn otelleridir.
hem en merkezi yerde, her yere yürüme mesafesinde, hem temiz ve de uygun fiyat aralığında
kahvaltısı bana hitap ediyor
devamlı kahve mevcut
odalar da son sistem kahve makinası ve her gün kahve kapsülü hediyeli

title: Good stay
text:
Positives- Friendly staff on arrival.
Breakfast- good mix of hot and cold food. 
Rooms were clean and a good size. Air con rooms. Wi fi was excellent. 
Most of all the location was great. Near Times Square and the bus station if you want to head to woodberry common. 

Negatives- 
Lifts can be slow some mornings especially at breakfast time. 

Overall I would recommend and stay again.

title: Not a Good Experience
text:
Although we had prepaid through Booking.com,  the Holiday Inn Mgr gave away our room 2 days before our arrival and put my husband, myself and our 2 children in a very tiny room with only 1 bed...no sofa and no cots available.  They told us to put the children to sleep on the floor as a solution. Our booking via booking.com clearly stated 2 beds and was confirmed as such. Terrible experience for a Holiday Inn, who also initially tried to blame Booking.com until I provided the confirmation email. Then,  the admit that their manager who was no longer working there had given away our room 2 days prior, for unknown reasons, and without contacting us.   The would only provide a partial refund as we slept in the room, due to us checking in close to 11pm as our train was very late. That said, as some of us were forced to sleep on the floor...we had asked for a full refund of the first night. Not impressed and expect more from HIE NYC. 

눇Staff were sympathetic and friendly,  yet had no power to help us and GM was offsite for a busy weekend.  No manager on duty and only a shift supervisor to deal with issues and no empowerment is not acceptable.

title: Good Value - it's not the Ritz, don't expect it to be.
text:
I'm not sure what people are expecting to find at this property. It is a reasonable choice for a hotel. The level of service is below "5-star". So were the prices, so it seemed to work out for us.

The first night, our AC didn't work. It was either freezing cold, or off. Those were our choices. Two engineers tried to fix it over the course of an hour and couldn't. So we slept in a sub-60 degree room. Not ideal, but better than 80+.

The next morning, we requested an actual fix while we were out for the day and upon return, the AC was in fact fixed. 

There is no gym in this hotel. You can use the one in the hotel next door. Great! But it's in the basement where there is no WiFi, and no Cell signal. Not Great! That needs to be addressed for sure.

The room was clean, the location was excellent, and it was easy to get to and get out of (via Henry Hudson Pkwy). The price was right as well.

The 40-minute wait to get my car was less than ideal. They did warn us of that, but, still.

For the price we paid, and what we got, including breakfast, I would stay at this property again.

title: Hotel à éviter (periode visitée juillet)
text:
N'accepte pas une arrivée avant 16h ne fait pas de pre check in ==> Non négociable et acceuil froid
Hotel à 2 ascenseurs avec 36 étages - il faut attendre 10 à20 min avant d'avoir un ascenseur car il est aussi utilisé par le personnel
Petit déjeuner = heure de pointe ==> aucune place pour s'assoir  si on arrive pas assez tot - 9h30 tout est enlevé - nourriture moyenne et pas très fraiche
Notre chambre pour 4 était très petite (standard à NY peut etre) et la vue sur l'immeuble en face - rien avoir avec les photos de l'autre coté 
juillet 2017 batiment en construction en face détruit et en chantier bruit monstrueux
bout de la rue habité par des SDFs alcooliques qui dorment à terre toute la journée
fréquentation moyenne - Très tès dérangeant pour nous
Près de Time Square
On nous a demandé de démenager à la 4 ieme nuit pour raison de travaux ????
nouvelle chambre au 34 ieme etage au lieu du 7ieme impossibilité de descendre à pied - un vrai calvaire ces asenseurs car nous avons fait étage par étage au petit dej alors qu'il était plein depuis le 30ieme étage ==> si vous avez du temps à perdre ...
Il y a d'auttres Holiday Inn à la 36th street beaucoup mieux placé

title: Amazing hotel with great service!!!
text: I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are on a little tight budget. The location of this hotel is the best coz it's 5 minutes walking distance from Times Square. The staff is very helpful. I would like to especially thank Henry for his great service. The breakfast is better than some of the 5 star hotels I've been to. I would recommend everyone on a little tight budget to stay on this hotel!

title: Très bien placé
text: Hôtel très bien placé pour découvrir New-York. Belle vue sur NY en prenant une King View, personnel sympa et dispo et principalement Mélissa qui nous a été d'un grand secours avec le transfert. Je conseille vivement cet hôtel, c'était pour mes premiers pas à NY et j'en suis pleinement satisfait.

title: FANTASTIC
text:
Absolutely perfect for a week in the big apple.  Manager and all his staff so friendly and helpful couldn't do enough for us.
Breakfast was really good...fruit/yoghurt/eggs/bacon/cereal etc. Fresh and tasty and staff would help in any way.
Room small....its New York.....but very clean and had everything u could want.
Location perfect.
Thank u for a wonderful stay.

title: 16th Birthday Weekend
text: This hotel is in a pretty decent location for walking to a lot of great sites and attractions.  There were only two staff members that were friendly to us though, Anna and a gentleman helping with breakfast.  We were very rudely yelled at by Theresa for attempting to take a muffin before the 6:30 opening time.  We sincerely thought that breakfast opened at 6:00 and wanted a quick muffin for the walk to be in the audience for the Today Show.  No muffin for us and a very upsetting way to start our morning.  The hotel is very small but adequate when you don't plan to spend too much time there.  There are only 6 rooms per floor so it was surprisingly quiet.

title: Es un hotel para bañarse y dormir, un desayuno express y afuera
text:
La habitación es demasiado pequeña, a nosotros nos resultó útil ya que la utilizábamos para dormir y bañarnos, pasábamos poco tiempo. Pero al realizar algunas compras ya no había disponibilidad de espacio, el placard era pequeño, considerando que éramos dos personas, la mayoría de la ropa quedó acomodada, pero dentro de nuestras valijas en el suelo.
Para ser un hotel de 36 pisos con 4 habitaciones por piso, cuenta solo con 2 ascensores, por momentos la hilera de personas era larga, así mismo la zona del desayuno, como un patio techado, demasiado pequeño para tanta gente, muchas personas juntaban elementos para desayunar y se iban a hacerlo a sus habitaciones, previa fila larga para acceder a los ascensores. Nosotros calculábamos el último horario para poder desayunar sentados, la variedad de alimentos fue limitada, pero fue suficiente para nuestro gusto. Nosotros no tuvimos demasiadas pretensiones, pero tampoco es un hotel super económico.
*** La atención del personal de recepción, hablen en inglés o español. La ubicación del hotel es lo mejor, cerca de Port Autorithy, Penn Station, Times Square, etc. La cuadra no es la mas bonita, muchos comercios de fábricas de indumentaria y ya a la tarde paquetones y paquetones de cartones. 
*** La vista desde el piso 22 fue alucinante, tanto de día como de noche, con tantas las luces desde altura. Eso si, cuando construyan un edificio en el terreno vacío frente al hotel, perderá ese encanto. 
*** Muy buena consideración el tener varios enchufes y usb disponibles para carga de celulares y tablets. Excelente wifi en las habitaciones

title: They do NOT care about you!
text: This is, by far, the WORST hotel that my family and I have ever stayed in with regards to the amount of care and effort the employees put into performing their job duties. First, we arrived around 10:00pm on a Tuesday night. We drove, so of course we needed valet parking. We checked in and asked about what we needed to do. The front desk lady told us to take all of our belongings out of the car and then bring her the keys and she would have it taken care of. We did as she instructed, went on up to our room and got settled in. We decided to go for a short walk, so we headed on back down approximately 35-45 minutes after we had checked in. To our surprise, our vehicle was still sitting in the street, unattended. This was our first  clue that perhaps the hote wasn't as dedicated to customer service as they should be. When we stayed at the Crowne Plaza in Times Square, they took your car and drove off as soon as you unloaded! However, we decided to go on towards Times Square for a little bit. We returned to the hotel sometime after 11:00pm, and our car had been moved. We went up to our room and noticed a strong smell of smoke. The air conditioning unit had just kicked on, so we didn't think much of it. However, the smell of smoke was strong every.single.time. the unit came on. Concerned, I called the front desk to report the problem. Immediately, the gentleman that answered the phone assured me that I had the heat on, instead of the air. I informed him that the thermostat was set to 60 degrees, so I was pretty  certain that it indeed was not the heat. He said he would have an engineer come up within 5 minutes. 5 minutes later, the engineered entered our room and declared "Oh, its working now, huh?" to which I replied that the unit had always worked, but smelled of smoke every time that it turned on. He said the same thing as the front desk, that I must have the heat on, to which I offered him a look at the thermostat. This behavior struck me as unconcerned because this guy hadn't even attempted to LOOK at our unit or the thermostat and was already offering excuses. So I told him that I didn't feel as if he could declare the unit to be problem free if he hadn't even looked at it. He literally walked over to our unit, looked over and put his hands over the unit and assured me that there wasn't a fire and that it was fine. Then he went on to say that there were no other rooms available so he didn't have any other suggestions. I should just take his word because he had worked on those units for 9 years. Somehow, I didn't feel any better about the situation. He then left the room. After his departure, I assured my family that this would be our one and only stay at HIE NYC-Times Square, and probably Holiday Inn/HIEs in general. What a terrible first night of our NYC trip, compliments of HIE NYC-Times Square!!

title: Not quite like I imagine a good hotel chain to be
text: This was not a pleasant stay.  The Air Conditioner was out of whack and could not be repaired even after 3 visits from the engineer.  It was either too cold or too cold.  The Telephone was broken and had been broken before the room was even rented.  The maids insistence to wrap the cord around the bottom of the desk set  had broken the cord tip in to the phone its self.  The TV was too dark and could not be brightened.  The maid decided to skip my room one day and I did not have service. The most unfortunate problem was sever  Fruit Fly Infestation in the Breakfast room. After I complained to the manager, the problem was solved and I did not see a fly for the next 3 days.   These were all house keeping problems.  The Bed made a bump sound  every time you got into it.  The drawers stayed open and could not be closed.  The Breakfast was very good and generally speaking, the hotel was bright and cheerful.

title: Muy buena atencion
text: Hola! Muy buen hotel. Pero debo destacar la mejor atencion que recibi fue de Juan Bellman, que nos asistió en todo momento con lo que necesitabamos. Nos ayudó  también con los tours y todas las indicaciones de los sitios que visitar. Sin duda, gracias a el pudimos pasar una excelente estadia. Gracias!!!

title: Semplicemente eccezionale
text: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, albergo centralissimo, basta attraversare la strada per arrivare a Broadway e di conseguenza a time square, personale preparato e amichevole, stanze comodissime e con vista su Manhattan. Se dovete trascorrere una vacanza a New York e vivere a piena l'esperienza newyorkese questo hotel fa veramente al caso vostro.

title: Week in New york
text: The only problem with this hotel is only two lifts which when the chamber maids are using them or at breakfast time its a nightmare, sometimes waiting 20 mins for a lift. Other than that the rooms are good,the staff are excellent, and breakfast is good but repetitive. The location is very good 5 mins walk to Time Square, 20 mins walk to Central park, 10 mins walk to Macy's. two tube stations two mins walk away, and two brothers pizza at the end of the road for excellent pizza, and the bus to New Jersey for shopping round the corner at the port authority station. Its also in a pretty quite location for New York

title: Discreto
text: Hotel prenotato mediante expedia, l'inserzione diceva: prenota ora paga in hotel, appenna effettuata la prenotazione mi hanno prelevato il costo della prima notte più le tasse, protesto con expedia: un muro di gomma. Volo cancellato arriviamo con in giorno di ritardo, avverto l'hotel: altri 50 dollari prelevati... L'hotel ha camere piccoline, 6 per piano per 36 piani, sconsiglio i piani alti, potreste passare la vacanza in attesa di un ascensore, noi dal 14 piano spesso scendevamo a piedi. L'ultimo giorno siamo rimasti chiusi in uno dei due ascensori, un po' di panico ma il personale è intervenuto in brevissimo tempo. L'hotel si trova sulla 39 strada quasi ad angolo con la 9 avenue, zona piuttosto degradata non frequentata da bella gente. Ora i pregi: personale sempre presente, disponibile e cordiale, colazione eccellente anche se la sala è un pò piccola il personale di sala fa di tutto per venirti incontro, veramente un valore aggiunto. La stanza era un po' piccolina per 4 e vecchiotta ma molto pulita. Diciamo pure che si salva solo grazie all'impegno di tutto il personale.

title: Dream location in the heart of Manhattan 5 min-walk from Times Square
text: Located between 7th and 8th Avenue on 31st West St. Times Square is on 7th Ave, 42 St (that means only 8 blocks=streets away from the hotel entrance (5 min walk) and 1 min walk from Pennsylvania Station (or PEN Station). The most convenient way to get to the hotel is Yellow Cab from the JFK Airport. There are shuttle busses (only online detailed reservation guarantee your seats, which might be a problem with your flight or passport control delays), Big Bus service (does not go to the Manhattan Centre), and a Train-Underground connection with multiple changes (might be tough with luggage and jet leg:). The yellow cab will cost you between 60-65 dollars from JFK to the Hotel front door, and if you consider to arrive in style it is better to do it as an outward journey rather than return one, which is always more expensive: around 10-15 dollars more.The shuttle bus service (up to 6 passengers) from the hotel to the Airport is available to arrange from an independent provider at the hotel reception (around 25 dollars per person). I booked en-suite twin double-bed room- good size room with a tea/coffee express, a big TV screen and Free WiFi just to mention these. There is a free of charge computer lounge with free printing facilities for the guests, which we used to print our museum reservations and boarding cards. On checking-out you can safely stove your luggage on request at the reception (no extra charge). There is a free breakfast included: not just a piece of toast and a cup of coffee but a real feast. There is everything you could possibly wish for: you can have French-style breakfast, or English fried-up or eat in American style. I loved self-made waffles with strawberry or choc chips with maple syrup, and hot jam-rolls/ buns and fruit and choc cup cakes. Varied selection of cereals/ porridge, meat and egg meals,yogurts and fresh fruit. Breakfast served between 7 and 11 to suit everybody's schedule. After that time, there is 24 hour tea and coffee service available in the hall with take-away options. How nice is that: a cup of coffee on your way to Times Square. Hotel staff friendly and discreet, always helpful and patient with your requests. Very quiet hotel at night time - best quality sleep I had for months. Ten-floor rooms had a lovely window views. There are two lifts for guests and they seemed to work a bit slow especially at breakfast time. The hotel was planning to undergo redecoration, so be ready for some improvements. In America the weather is measured in Fahrenheit degrees, so do not get excited if you hear on the weather channel - 25 degrees, as I did:). I had to learn how to do conversions into Celsius: 32 F is equal 0 C degree, but it is not only about deductions, since the formula is more complicated, eg. for 25 degree it will be: (25-32)x5/9. I have seen hotel guests staying with their dogs, so there must be a possibility to do pet-friendly bookings. As far as I know there is a fitness room, however I preferred to run outdoors, along Broadway to Central Park. I had absolutely lovely time in Chelsea Holiday Inn and I will definitely look for more promotions to do another booking soon.

title: Great Stay At This Hotel
text: The hotel is in a great location.  So many things are within easy walking distance.  Yet, it's in quiet area.  Very clean and modern.  Great location, great staff, great room, great hot breakfast (that's included).  The staff were very friendly and helpful in assisting with any questions.  Definitely will stay there again while in "The Big Apple"

title: Too Many Disappointments This Time
text:
My husband is a loyal HIE visitor. We've stayed at this location as well as the 5th avenue location in NYC before as well as dozens of other cities.

Disappointments: In our first room, we arrived to a leaking toilet. At first we hoped it was just a dirty room with shower water left on the floor but that wasn't the case. We notified the front desk on our second day. Someone came within a few hours. The next morning we woke up to even more water on the floor and could see that it was coming out of the base (gross). We called again. Someone came at 9 at night and then randomly again at midnight! He scared us to death. We were told it was fixed. The next morning we woke up again to puddles everywhere. The front desk offered to move us rooms. We didn't really want to pack and unpack again but we didn't want toilet water on the floor either so we moved. My second disappointing issue was the daily housekeeping service. We stayed 8 nights - most days we came back to a random number of things (like no floor towel, 1 washcloth, 2 lotions instead of a conditioner, not enough TP). It didn't seem to matter what floor or what day it was - we never had the correct amount of anything and either had to make do or call and ask.  Unfortunately the air conditioning was frustrating too. We had it set for 68. Every 10 minutes or so it automatically changed to 72. It was a heat index of 98 this week. It was ridiculous that we couldn't cool the room down. And lastly, although an issue in NYC in general, there just aren't enough elevators. We waited 35 minutes to make our first trip to the lobby to checkout. 

Positives:
The location is great. 10 minutes to Times Square. 30 minute walk to Central Park. A few restaurants a few doors down (an Irish Pub, a sandwich/coffee shop, etc.). Front desk is friendly. Breakfast staff friendly. Although the free breakfast isn't anything I really eat, my husband and daughter found something every morning. There's a parking garage right before the hotel (opposite side of road). It's expensive but easy to get to.

title: Pathetic customer service
text: I am a gold elite member hence have stayed at IHG hotels across the world. The worst welcome I received was here. No greeting, nothing. After an overnight flight I requested a checkin at 11 am. I am entitled to early checkin and late checkout subject to room availability.I was given a very curt refusal. I know that people do checkout in the morning and I had previously checked that the hotel was not full. So I am certain rooms were available. Anyway, I left it at that and after a couple of hours checked back. Again I was told that no rooms were available, at which time I said that I had seen people check out hours ago and there should be something. Then I was told that "my room type was not available". She didn't even know my room type so she had just lied to cover up. Such people should not be in a hospitality job. I will definitely not stay here again.

title: Fun tourist trip
text: Room small but comfortable. Easy check in. Ample free breakfast. Front desk arranged for a second chair in the room. Also extra towels.  Surprise on day three that room was not cleaned. Beds not made. Dirty coffee cup still on counter. A few clean towels were thrown into in. No new hot or cold cups. Tv reception is bad.

title: Buenísima experiencia
text:
Perfectamente ubicado. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, al igual que todas las de los hoteles del sector, pero cuenta con todos los servicios necesarios para tener una buena estadía. A pesar del alto recambio de pasajeros, el hotel se mantiene en excelentes condiciones. Comparado con otro hotel en el que estuvimos en la misma calle, éste es bastante silencioso.
El personal del hotel es muy amable, con muy buena disposición.

title: 50th anniversary celebration
text: This hotel was a great location. The staff including Sandra, Melissa and Henry were gracious and helpful.  They even got us an anniversary card and NY cup with candy treats. A great experience. They went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

title: Great place to stay!!
text:
The Holiday Inn was a great place to stay, staff are extremely helpful and friendly even before we arrived, in a great location close walk go everything.
Rooms are extremely clean and perfect size for multiple people to stay in. 
Thank you Holiday Inn Express for helping us have a great holiday!

title: Habitaciones muy pequenias
text: Buena ubicación, muy limpio. Muy buen servicio y personal. Buen desayuno, pero las habitaciones son muy chicas, casi no hay espacio para moverse en ellas, muy poco espacio para la ropa personal, y valijas que se llevan. El banio bastante cómodo

title: Great position and great included breakfast
text:
A fantastic position. Walk to Times Square, theatres, restaurants etc.  close to subway etc.
Room was good. A great breakfast is included in the price, this makes a big difference.
Staff were all excellent and very helpful.
Only two elevators, long wait.

title: Central location that serves a need.
text:
This hotel is right in mid-town and within good walking distance of lots of attractions. Forget Uber, too hard and you will not understand the driver, use taxis $10-$20 to most places. Do not use those 3 wheel bike rides, we got charged$140 for 15 minutes.
The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Our room 1504 was adequate but needs a black out curtain. Comfortable bed and pillows. The breakfast is a bonus, very good start to the day. Recommend this place, we had 8 nights cost us $NZ3700 , reasonable.

title: Bueno pero solo 2 ascensores para tantos pisos
text:
El hotel esta bastante bien ubicado. No es la mejor ubicacion pero esta bien igual. Quizas te confunde el nombre Times Square porque queda aproximadamente a 7 cuadras de alli que son largas asique no es justamente ahi donde esta. La zona aledaña tampoco es la mejor salvo que camines hacia la 42 o ir para el lado de la 5ta avenida.
El subte que queda mas cerca esta a 3 cuadras del hotel eso esta bueno porque vas hacia varias direcciones. El desayuno es buenisimo porque tenes variedad lo unico el lugar es pequeño para hacerlo, entonces tenes bandejas para desayunar en otro lugar o en la misma habitacion.
Lo q me parecio pesimo es que solo cuenta con 2 ascensores y son 35 pisos o 36. El ultimo dia tuvimos q bajar por las escaleras 20 pisos!!!!!!! Eso es de terror!!!!!! Eso es un punto dificil de remontar mas alla de lo bueno del desayuno y que habia capsulas de cafe y te en lahabitacion. Con eso compensaba otras cosas.
La limpieza en las habitaciones tampoco era la mejor.
Relacion precio calidad considero bueno tan solo por el desayuno incluido que es lo que suma.
De todos modos, un cafe latte sale alrededor de 3 dolares o 4 y un muffin lo mismo, es cuestion de sacar cuentas.

title: Comfortable stay, friendly staff, worst elevator service in existence
text:
My boyfriend and I were spending Memorial Day weekend in NYC with out-of-town friends. I selected this location because it was close to Times Square and other points of interest. The location is very convenient as you can take the subway from 42nd street and it's a short walk from Penn Station.

We were greeted warmly by the front desk and they mentioned my IHG reward membership. Our attendant mentioned our room would be upgraded (although I'm not sure what this entailed - perhaps a higher floor with a view?). Our requested accommodations were noted and the most important thing to us was to have 2 double beds in a non-smoking room.

Our room on the 24th floor was clean and had moderate space (it is NYC). The bathroom was clean as well, but the sink drained slowly and we were only given 2 towels despite my noting of a total of 4 guests. I called the front desk and more towels were delivered in a timely manner. The beds were comfortable and the shower had good water pressure. There is a hair dryer in the bathroom. Note that there is no mini-fridge in the room. Free wifi is provided and that was fine, although my boyfriend mentioned at times it was a bit slow.

We partook in breakfast every morning. On weekends it runs until 10am and weekdays until 9:30am, I believe. The quality of the food and the selection was decent and matched other Holiday Inns I've stayed at before. The dining area is a little tight so you might have to wait for a table to sit down.

During our three night stay, our room was picked up once but towels were forgotten. I'm not sure if this was due to the issues with the elevator, but again we called and replacement towels were brought up in a timely manner. 

So the elevator issue. My suggestion is that if you stay here, select a room close to ground level so you can take the stairs. This entire hotel is serviced by only two elevators, so going up and down takes a significant amount of time. If you are trying to catch a specific train, leave with ample time to get down to the ground floor or be ready to take the stairs the entire way.

If that wasn't the worst of it, on the last morning after breakfast, my boyfriend and I were in the elevator with at least 11 other guests. We were trying to go back to the 24th floor and the elevator stopped at least 4 times, denying other guests from getting on because there was simply no room. Around the 10th floor, 2 guest pushed their way on, we hit the weight limit, and were stuck on the elevator for at least 10 minutes. The technicians arrived as quickly as they could (the time it took for them to get to us was probably them climbing 10 flights of stairs). 

Upon checkout we mentioned the incident and the front desk was apologetic. Check out went smoothly.

title: Excellent staff makes this a great place to stay!
text: The location of this hotel makes it a great jumping off point for a million things you could be doing in NYC.  The rooms are small and sometimes you wait for an elevator.  I am not going to lie.  But, everyone from the front desk to housekeeping to the bellman and the restaurant staff make it clear that they want to help you make great memories exploring NYC.  You won't be sorry if you stay here.

title: Elevator problems....
text: Hotel staff was incredible! All were very helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean and updated but small, with 3 adults we were pretty cramped. The elevators are another story. We missed breakfast one day due to the fact that it took 45 minutes to get downstairs. We stayed on the 10th floor and every time an elevator came it was packed. My mother is elderly, so the stairs were not an option. The free  breakfast was nice, but the other guests acted like animals. Pushing, shoving etc. to get to the food. There was plenty, no need for that behavior.

title: Boa hospedagem mas...
text:
Quarto pequeno mas nos acomodou bem,limpo e organizado.O preço gira na média de NYC. A localização é ótima muito perto da Times Square e fácil acesso a outros pontos turísticos. O metrô fica a alguns minutos a pé.
Café da manhã bom nos moldes americanos. A área do desejum fica muito cheia por isso comíamos no quarto mesmo.
Funcionários atenciosos em especial Ivet que sempre nos atendia com carinho e atenção!
Tivemos problema com a recepção em relação ao check out. O pagamento era em dinheiro e o hotel cobrou no cartão de crédito gerando muitos problemas. O reembolso foi realizado mas o cartão cobrou taxas na fatura.
Infelizmente esse ocorrido me deixou bastante chateada mas o hotel em si é bom.

title: One night stay
text:
Great find on Travelzoo, got a fantastic deal £110 for on night 2 adults and 1 kid. 
Place close to Times Square, close to train and bus stations. Close enough to Central Park and close to Empire State Building. Also pretty close To Madison square garden Penn station to take the Metro to Battery park to catch the Ferry to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. This hotel was Fantastic find and would use again in a heartbeat. 
It was very clean, staff very helpful, great beds and pillows and plenty of room. Shower was great too. Can't fault the hotel at all.
I wish there was an option on travelzoo to buy breakfast.
The hotel can not beat travelzoos price. $194 per night at the hotel about $40-50 cheaper to buy via travelzoo. Stay high up on floor 34 and get a great view of the Empire State Building

title: Redelijk
text:
Wegens zaken 2 nachten in dit hotel verblijf gehouden en had een kamer op de 29e etage met uitzicht op de stad. Kamer is ruim genoeg om de nacht door te brengen; bij binnenkomst lekker koel door de airco. Verder lekker bed, en goede hygiëne. En ook mogelijkheid om koffie of thee te zetten. 
Geen koelkast op de kamer. En het ontbijt kent geen kaas en/of vleeswaren. Als "servies' wordt papieren bord en plastic bestek gebruikt en kartonnen drinkbeker.

title: I said I would return
text: I last stayed here in Dec 2013 with my family and wrote a review then. I still think its a good location to Times Square and the staff are still friendly. The rooms are the same - pretty cramped but standard for the price and location. The room furniture is starting to look worn and the elevators were out of order several times during my week long stay. There are 6 rooms per floor and the elevators or people talking in the tiny hallway can be heard clearly. Breakfast is still in a tiny space but the wait for a table is not too long and the selection of food is good. This time however there were bugs in my room! I was promptly moved to another better room and the staff apologised profusely and dealt with the situation. In conclusion although the hotel is starting to show its age and can do with some upkeep I think I will still stay there next time as I trust the staff to provide excellent customer service in any circumstance.

title: Super friendly staff!
text: The rooms are super clean and comfy. The staff, especially Anna and Jorie, were super nice and very helpful. Lots of selection for free breakfast! The location is close to Times Square, Penn Station and subway stops.

title: A viagem mais emocionante da vida❤️🙏🙌🏻
text: Acabo de sair de NY. 1a vez...e sei que voltarei! A cidade é surreal e a escolha do hotel foi no escuro. Foi uma opção de preço econômico próximo a Times Square. Confesso que tive receio. Chegamos ao meio dia e já nos receberam guardando nossa bagagem eqto daríamos uma volta na região. Logo foi minha 1a surpresa: o hotel é perto de toda região top!!! 3 quadras da 5a Avenida, 4 ruas acima da 34 st e distancia contrária da Broadway com Times Square. Retornando ao hotel a melhor surpresa! Quarto agradável e banheiro novooo! Limpo! Muito bem limpo todos os dias! O trânsito de hóspedes é intenso o tempo todo e o pessoal simpático! Ameiiii tudo! Estou agradecida em Deus! Cheguei aqui em Orlando é meu coração ficou lá em NY❤️🙏

title: For the price and location - excellent
text: I stayed here during a recent trip to Manhattan.  The hotel is consistent with other Holiday Inn Expresses - not fancy, but clean and well maintained.  The price was very reasonable for Manhattan.  The location is great. The hotel is on 39th St. between 8th and 9th Avenues.  It is easy walking distance to Times Square and to either the Times Square or the Penn Station subway platforms.

title: My 50th Birthday.
text: This hotel is great. Its a close enough walk to the centre of Broadway but also far enough away from the noise. The rooms are comfortable and clean. The staff are genuinely helpful. Breakfast is supplied by the hotel which to say the least was brilliant. Make your own waffles hot and cold choices fruit yoghurts the works. Only one small drawback was there was not enough seating. We sat on the front porch of the hotel where there are seats but even though it was a hot and sunny day would gave been a struggle if it had been raining. All in all so good we are going back nect year.

title: New York the city  that never sleeps!
text:
Location of this hotel is ideal within walking distance to Time Square and Broadway where its all happening.
The rooms are not huge but comfortable good beds, bathroom and coffee machine. How much time do you spend in your room...in our case not much.
I had read the reviews about breakfast and that was chaotic as mentioned however if you were not in a hurry and timed it early or late no drama. Fresh fruit to take with you and a good selection. One morning we took our breakfast back to our room as there was a school group and very busy.
My only concerns was the lift was accessible to all even though advised you must use your room card and the internet was tad hit and miss.
Good value for the location

title: Overnight stay
text: The only reason this establishment didn't get a five rating was housekeeping.  My friend and I met up in NYC and we needed a place to stay for one night.  Check in was great, the staff was great and accommodating, but the next morning housekeeping was rushing us out by 0900.  I don't understand the purpose of an 1100 checkout time if the hotel has staff knocking at the door every 15 minutes to see if you are ready to leave.

title: Una delusione
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 6 notti pagandolo profumatamente. Avevamo scelto questa sistemazione in base alla sua posizione e al buon nome della catena Holiday Inn. Purtroppo ci siamo ricreduti su molti aspetti del nostro soggiorno. Hotel datato e abbiamo notato che ai piani inferiori era frequentato da persone di dubbia provenienza, sorpresa assai spiacevole. Attese lunghe per prendere l'ascensore. Stanza piccola ma pulita. Colazione self-service abbondante. Allo stesso prezzo, consiglio vivamente di soggiornare altrove.

title: Good clean hotel near Times Square
text: Simple hotel with clean rooms and friendly, accommodating staff. The hot continental breakfast was good. Very convenient location near Times Square, the Port Authority, and Penn Station. Bed was comfortable. Breakfast is from 6:30 to 9:30, so around 7:15 seemed like the best time to avoid the worst of the crowd.

title: Accueil pas très pro
text:
Nous sommes arrivées de l'aéroport PARIS CDG / NEWARK avec des heures de Routes et d'avion soit exactement plus de 24h sans dormir, mais excitées par ce voyage ; L'accueil des agents de l'hôtel , sûrs d'eux : vous n'êtes pas dans le bon hôtel? il faut ressortir avec vos bagages à traîner et aller au bout l'avenue, dans la rue ,pas très loin etc... 
Sauf que nous regardons notre réservation une fois dehors et nous constatons que nous étions bien à la bonne adresse. Nous sommes donc rentrées à nouveau , là les agents se sont excusés. Les chambre demandées avec 2 lits QUEEN BED , il n'y en avait qu'un seul. nous avosn réclamé, nous avons obtenu notre chambre avec 2 lits QUEEN BEDS , propreté de la chambre seules les fenêtres et la climatisation étaient sales. Par conte personnel du petit déjeuner très très gentil. Hôtel très bien situé dans times square. Juste l'ascenseur qui fait un peu pester tout le monde.

title: Excelente ubicación, pésima mantención
text: La atención del personal es excelente, pero considerando que un hotel de 36 pisos tenga solo un ascensor funcionando durante tres días, sin contar el día en que ambos estuvieron malos (bajar 33 pisos caminando no es agradable), la cafetera y el secador de pelo de la habitación no funcionaban lo mismo una de las máquinas de hielo, y el comedor para el desayuno es muy pequeño por lo que hay que esperar mucho rato para tener mesa, hace olvidar lo atento del personal.  Ayudaría que hablaran un segundo idioma sí, había mucha gente complicada tratando de hacerse entender durante el inconveniente de los ascensores.  La ubicación es excelente, pero hace falta una mejor mantención y una puerta de servicio ya que permanentemente habían bolsas de basura afuera.  En resumen, no repetiría este hotel

title: Sufficient for my trip to New York
text:
I booked through a third party website like booking.com or Expedia.com. I requested 2 beds and when I checked in they said it wasn't guaranteed. The front desk clerk was nice enough to give us a king instead of 1 queen, but it was still a bit disappointing. 

I noticed on another review that they said they had laundry service. Come to find out, the laundry service was next door in Candlewood Suites in their basement. Housekeeping in that hotel was also using the washers and dryers so you had to wait for one to be available. Since I was in the other hotel and doing 2 loads, I was walking back and forth and jogging up and down basement stairs, which was a bit inconvenient so head's up about that. 

In the morning and evening, expect to wait a while for the elevator. There are only 2 and they are used by the hotel staff and all guests. You can wait up to 10 minutes when it's really busy. In the afternoon the housekeepers are in there with their carts. Also, we had housekeeping come at 6pm one day and when we asked for basic amenities (shampoo, etc) the housekeeper said she didn't speak English so we didn't get what we wanted from her.

This was my first time to New York. I would say the location was fine. It's about a 5-10 min walk to Times Square depending on how fast you walk. In the mornings it is complete madness because you're close to the bus station, which is the busiest in the US. There are a lot of eating places and a drug store nearby if you need one. 

I wouldn't feel comfortable walking around at night. Although there's a bunch of hotels in a row, there are some shady characters just sitting on the sidewalk or near ATMs and such. 

The breakfast was good and the staff was very friendly, which was nice. I used Apple Concierge to take a private shuttle to the airport ($70). I didn't think this was that bad considering how far the airport was and the fact that we made good time and beat the morning traffic. 

All in all, I think this hotel was an okay choice for our first time to the city. It was relatively close to Times Square, offered shuttle services to the airport, had laundry service (even if it was in the next hotel) and if you're traveling by bus, you can't go wrong.

title: Staff was GREAT
text: Good mid-town location. Average room and amenities. New Bathroom. The staff was the highlight of the stay. Most impressive was Juan who was attentive to our every need. He belongs at a 5 star hotel. Everyone else was friendly, courteous and helpful. The staff  made up for anything that was lacking in the facility.

title: Location and Caring Staff
text: Nearness to The Great White Way is a plus.  Comfortable beds.   Practical, no-frills breakfast buffet.  Small dining area can be crowded but encourages sharing tables and converstion with fellow travelers.  Attentive, caring staff who go beyond impersonal greetings.  Small but adequate and pleasant.

title: Will Never Stay Here
text:
Shatia Wise

She contacted the president of my job about my personal business dealing with this hotel. I will sue you if you ever contact me again. She also spoke with someone other than me about my personal business in dealing with this hotel. The only person you should ever talk to is the person on the contract.

title: Perfect place for a stay
text: Location is tops ... service is wonderful ... will stay here a third time for sure ... make sure that you walk a bit though to find a deli - the place next door is just so-so and I am wishing that I had walked a bit despite the weather

title: Zu empfehlen!
text: Freundlicher Empfang, saubere Zimmer und eine TOP-Lage. Die Zimmer sind klein (New York eben) aber ausreichend. Frühstück nicht notwendig, in der Umgebung gibt genug Möglichkeiten (z.B. Starbucks schräg gegenüber). In wenigen Schritten an der U-Bahn (42 St - Port Authority Bus Terminal Station- Linie A,C,E) und am Times Square. Im Hause das Rattle N'Hum, eine Craft Beer Bar - super!

title: À 5 mm de Times Square
text: Idéalement placé même si le prix reste un peu cher mais c'est NY. Accueil correct et les chambres sont propres. Petit déjeuner compris dans le prix. Bien  que la vaisselle soit en plastique et avec des produits alimentaires basiques, il est bien agréable de partir visiter New York avec un minima dans le ventre pour aller marcher plusieurs heures.

title: no es lo que esperaba
text: La habitacion es buena, buen servicio de limpieza. Atencion del personal , dependia de quien este de turno.Un hotel con demasiada gente para un lobby tan pequeño, un desayunador donde no habia espacio para todos, Y el tema principal es el de los ascensores que no dan a basto ademas de estar averiados frecuentemente.

title: USA vacation
text: My husband and I stayed at Holiday Inn Times Square in April for 5 nights.  The staff were friendly and accommodating. Our room was small but very comfortable and clean.  The hotel is a tall thin building about 3 blocks to Times Square. Breakfast room is very small and we had trouble getting a table most mornings but the food was excellent. Two lifts  one lift stopped working but fixed quickly. These can have too many people in them at times. The hotel is in a great location close to Times Square broadway hop on /off buses restaurants and shops.

title: Great stay
text:
We stayed with our two childrens in February 2017. 
Our room was small but well equipped. 
The staff was nice and very polite, and helpful.
We appreciated all mornings the breakfast (a lit bit too noisy and sometimes too small for people). 
We want to thanks again to Mary Perez (and Nan). Mary is a very smiling person, very helpful and a good professionnal. Thanks again for your kindness.

title: Great
text: I stayed here with my daughter. The rooms are clean and well equipped  (hairdryer,  iron, ironing board,  coffee/tea maker T.V) We found all the staff friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was plentiful and was constantly being replenished by the hard working catering staff. Some of the goods on offer ...muffins, cakes, cereal, egg, bacon, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juices and nuts to add to yogurt. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Buen servicio, habitación confortable
text:
Ya habíamos leido las opiniones negativas en el tema de los ascensores y cuanta razón...... si a esto añadimos que durante 3 días estuvo averiado uno de ellos pues sin comentarios, hasta 30 minutos esperando que llegue. Una vergüenza.
  Sin embargo tengo que destacar su servicio, la limpieza de las habitaciones y lo confortables que son. La cama muy cómoda y la tele grande. El Wifi va y viene.

title: Ubicación perfecta
text: Si lo que quieres es visitar cada rincón de Manhattan, la ubicación del hotel es perfecta. A unos metros de Times Square, te permite moverte a lo largo de la 5ª Avenida de forma muy cómoda. La relación calidad precio es buena. Las habitaciones y los baños están muy limpi@s y están bastante bien aisladas contra el ruido. La atención es buena.

title: Mas o menos
text: Una verguenza los ascensores, siempre malos, ultimo día no podíamos bajar las maletas. Nos tuvieron que dar late check out. Unos amigos tuvieron que subir caminando 18 pisos. Wifi funcionaba cuando quería.

title: bon rapport qualité prix
text:
nous avons apprécié notre séjour dans cet hôtel situé à 2 pas de Times Square: chambre confortable et propre.
la chambre à 2 lits king size peut sembler petite mais est largement suffisante et vivable quand on trotte toute la journée dans les rues de NY.
l'accueil nous est apparu un peu froid au 1er contact mais s'est vite réchauffé. Nous avons retrouvé le service attendu. Nous étions logé côté avenue au 28ème étage avec une vue spectaculaire sur l'Empire state building et les toits des buildings alentours. l'hôtel offre assez calme pour cette avenue passante mais on s'habitue vite aux bruits extérieurs à NY! 
Pour une famille de 4 personnes, cet hôtel offre un excellent rapport qualité-prix.
j'aurais aimé cependant à ce que la SDB soit correctement cleanée et les serviettes réassorties jusqu'à notre dernier jour .

title: Estadia Romântica
text: 5 dias de estadia neste hotel incrível na mais incrível ainda cidade capital do mundo, a BIG APPLE. Com a grata surpresa de chegar uma semana após ter caído muita neve, chegamos a ver ainda muita neve acumulada, inclusive na entrada do hotel. Pessoal do hotel muito solícito, falam bem explicado, então dá pra entender bem o inglês, mesmo não dominando bem o idioma. O mais surpreendente foi o break fest que não é comum ser tão bom fora do Brasil. A localização excelente também é outro ponto forte. Afinal tudo de bom.

title: Broken Elevators & Rude Staff
text:
The elevator was broken all weekend. No one had info on when it would be fixed and people were kept waiting for 15+ minutes for an elevator. When you call down they tell you "you're on the waitlist" and when you ask how long "i dunno"

Add insult to injury i had 20+ people saying in the hotel and one of them got stuck in an elevator.

My room key didn't work one night and the front desk guy sent me back up with a not working key. He wasn't at the desk i said "excuse me" a few times and no one came out so I knocked on the door. He came out with an attitude. He then took 10 minutes to find another staff member who could help me get into my room-- the whole time being very rude and non apologetic.

also the housekeeping was inconsistent. Multiple times during my stay i would only got 1 towel.

I cannot emphasize enough how bad this hotel is.

title: Hotel Nightmare! Urge you not to stay
text:
Check In:
When I arrived to check in it was 10am, so we knew we probably wouldn’t get a room, so we asked to store our luggage. There was only one bell person working so it took about 10minutes before someone could assist us. 
We came back to the hotel around 4:30pm to check in. The room was complimentary due to the hotels Best Rate Guaranteed Program, but it looked like the hotel was unaware of this. I was told by their corporate phone number that it would all be taken care of by the time I got there. When I informed the front desk of this they told me I would need to call the corporate office to resolve it. I asked the hotel to check me in and then I will take care of it when I got upstairs. 
We walked to the elevator and found out that only 1 out of the 2 elevators were working. There were 36 floors and we were on the 30th floor. After walking everywhere in the morning we were too tired to take the stairs. So we waited 15 minutes for the elevator. 
Room:
When we got to the room it was quaint and clean. I had no problems with the room at all. AC felt nice after a long hot day. 
After taking a quick shower and with no time to spare I got ahold of the hotels corporate office. The gentleman I spoke with said he would take care of this. He had me wait on hold while he called the hotel. He said he spoke with Melissa and it was all set! I then hung up with him and called Melissa, she acted like she had no idea what was going on. She had me wait on hold for 15 minutes. Then she took me off hold and said, “ How can I help you?” I told her I was waiting on hold and she was supposed to have figured out what happened with the room rate. She then said, “ We are busy with check-ins and we will have to investigate and call you back.” I had no problem with that answer. MY PROBLEM was that she left me on hold for 15minutes just to tell me that!!!!
Elevator:
After not getting much rest at all it was time to go to dinner, we went to the elevator and clicked the button. The button wasn’t working which is when we notice a sign. The sign read that the elevator is out of order and the engineer is working on it, so if you want it please call the front desk. I then call the front desk and she said it would be up shortly. 7 minutes later and with a dinner reservation to attend to, I called them again. The girl said it would take a long time because the elevator had to stop at every floor going up and every floor going down. AGAIN, WHY was I not told this when I first called!!!! So then we took the stars 30 floors down. 
Service:
Though In my opinion, I thought the service was a 1/5 the 1 star is because of Henry. That evening Henry emailed me telling me he was able to resolve the issue and that the room was complimentary. Much appreciated!
Check Out: 
The hotel provides you with a bill already in your room when you wake up, this was very helpful. I took a quick glance at the bill and immediately noticed I was charged, then refunded, then charged again! I went to the front desk to resolve this, but I had to wait 15 minutes because both agents were already helping 1 family. Eventually the manager noticed us and asked the other fd agent to help us. 
Luggage:
We arrived back at the hotel at 6:10pm to retrieve our luggage and then to go catch our bus at 6:30pm. We had to wait 10 minutes for our luggage because the Front desk had to call the bell man. Why could the front desk not help us? Why did the concierge lady taking selfies of herself o snapchat not help us? Why did we have to wait for this one man?
Other:
Ice machine is only on select floors. We went to 2/4 of the floors for ice and the machines were broken. We gave up after the second one. 
Wi-fi was difficult to connect to, but one were connected it was good. 
About Me:
My family is in the hospitality industry, I work in the hospitality industry, and we normally love IHG. However this was just not a good stay again. We will be staying at another holiday inn Express in Orlando in a week and I hope that stay is better.

title: Perfecta ubicacion
text: Ubicacion exelente, me encanto el detalle de recibirnos con toallas una tarde q estaba lloviendo.Pague $169 por noche.Desayuno basico 24/7 cafe y chocolate.El maletero y las muchachas del frontdesk muy amables.

title: Vacanza
text: Hotel comodo, vicino a Penn station. Facile da raggiungere da JFK e ben collegato con i mezzi della città. Personale gentile, colazione buona, Ana al servizio colazioni è stata gentilissima.Consiglio l'hotel se avete bimbi.

title: 9 jours a NY
text: Nous avions choisi l'hôtel pour sa localisation et n'avons pas été déçu ! Proche de Timesquare, très pratique quand on veut ressortir le soir. La chambre était propre et suffisamment grande, bien qu'un peu bruyante (autant pour l'extérieur qu'au sein de l'hotel), mais en même temps on est a NY !  La sdb pas très fonctionnelle en revanche (manque de rangement). Petit déjeuner inclus, avec pas mal de choix même si ce n'était pas d'une grande qualité. Bcp on critiqué la salle pour y manger car sois disant trop petite.. En 8j nous n'avons jamais eu de mal a trouvé une place. Autre bon point, taxe de séjour incluse. Sinon personnel très serviable. Nous le recommandons

title: Excellent location near midtown!
text: I needed a last minute hotel room and found this place to be a wonderful choice!  Even though it was last minute, they didn't price gouge my rate.  The room was small, which suited me fine.  It was clean, comfortable, with a king-sized bed and a view of Manhattan!  I didn't have time to avail myself of the complimentary breakfast, but I've never found the Holiday Inn to disappoint me and I expect it would have met with the same quality of service otherwise provided!  The staff were fantastic, even though I walked in just behind a very large group of international travelers that were just checking in.

title: Great location terrible Hotel to stay
text: Although this hotel is in great location the service and the rooms are terrible. The A/C was incredible loud on the floor and next to the bed making it really difficult to sleep. I would not recommend this hotel at all.

title: Good Hotel...
text: Proximity to times square is the reason why this hotel was chosen otherwise everything is pretty much same like other properties. The rooms are smaller but it is acceptable as it is in NYC. Breakfast was good, staff was well behaved.

title: Great location
text: This is a great hotel in a great location. Very busy though and breakfast can get hectic with guests having to eat in the reception area and some take breakfast to their rooms due to lack of space. There is a fair amount of lift- waiting time due to there only being two very busy lifts, but due to space there's not much choice. Otherwise this has been a pretty good place to stay for a pretty good price.

title: Hotel muy recomendable!
text:
Si bien tiene habitaciones pequeñas, tienen lo necesario, camas cómodas, buena ducha, muy buen desayuno y la ubicación es inmejorable, está a pasos del Times Square, se puede hacer todo caminando, tiene metro (Subway) cerca, y la habitación que nos tocó era muy tranquila, no había ruido de ningún tipo (piso 31). 

Cerca del Madam Tussaud, Believe it or not, Madison Square, etc.

title: Dirty
text:
dirty and smelling rooms, carpeted floor not cleaned and we found one black hair under the pillow!
Breakfast food quality very poor and not refilled, we don't feel to suggest to anyone.
the only pro is the location.

title: Great location..!!
text: just stayed at this property from the 14th of April till the 19th and the stay has been a great experience. I had requested for a higher storey room as I was keen on having a view. Management has been on the top of things right from the time I booked till I checked in. No hassles or delays in connecting with staff. Joirie at the front desk is extremely friendly and was pretty helpful. (Gives great advice on places to check around) I'd also like to thank David Randall who sorted out any issues at the earliest and was also very helpful in arranging for a delayed parcel to be sent over to me in Boston. Great work guys!

title: BEWARE OF OVERCHARGING AND THE ELEVATOR
text:
I've been wanting to write a review to warn tourists of our experience. I frequent in Manhattan but had to take this Hotel specifically because my family wanted to do the NYE Times Square Ball Drop. If you're planning to do that I'd say this is a pretty good location and especially for it's price, I don't think you can find any hotel in that area of the same rate especially around that time. They jack up the price up to 400% because of the Ball drop. 

Overall, minus my two issues which I will explain further below, the place was decent. Only 2 blocks away from Port Authority / Subway where all lines pass. The only draw back to that, it's a VERY big station and could be confusing if it's your first time. As far as the rooms, they were super tight. We had a room with 2 double beds and we can barely move around because there was absolutely no space to stash our luggage. All of that inconvenience though is forgivable in my opinion esp since I'm not exactly expecting 5 star. 

The two things that I would warn people about is the ELEVATOR AND THE OVERCHARGING . Do take note these issues have already been resolved with their manager. However I thought I should still give a fair warning  esp if you're the type who don't double check your credit card bill. 

The elevator problem happened on January 2nd. About 8-10 people were stuck in between 8th-9th floor for about 20 minutes before we were able to get out. The bell button was not working correctly and it took some muscle to get somebody to respond. Do take note that this happened during Winter so everybody in that elevator were wearing thick coats and it was all adding up to the claustrophobic anxiety we were all about to get into. At situations like this people are quick to panic . There was also no signal inside the elevator so we couldn't make a phone call. Of course the hotel said it has never happened before but I seriously doubt that. Given that the elevator was overloaded, its safety system should not have allowed it to close its doors the moment it reached its threshold. For something like that to happen means something is off with the hotel's preventive maintenance. 

With regards to the overcharge, this happened 2 months after we left NY. We found on our credit card bill that we were charged $470 even though we settled our account in cash when we checked out.
