If we hadn't been thorough in checking our statements that $470 would have been a total giveaway. Called the manager about this and in fairness to him he was quick to give me a refund. However, it's never a good thing to be in a hotel that charges you erroneously especially after being victimized by their faulty elevator. 

Would I recommend this place? Not Really. What I encountered is enough for me to stay away and I advice you to do the same.

title: quartos pequenos e caros
text: É um hotel em que se paga muito caro pela localização, e conta com quartos bem pequenos. Se reservar com antecedencia consegue quartos bem melhores nos hoteis dos arredores. cafe da manhâ bem simples com pouca variedade. Bom atendimento porém.

title: Good Location
text:
Pros: Location is decent, nice and central but away from the immediate busyness of Times Square.  The staff are all very polite, the room was nice and clean, and the breakfast was good, if not a bit chaotic at busy times.
Cons: The only one was the lifts.  We were on floor 31 of 35 and as there were only 2 lifts breakfast times meant you had to wait a long time getting up and down.
Overall it was a good experience at a decent price.

title: Un hotel muy confortable
text: Un hotel muy confortable, ubicado estratégicamente en una zona muy concurrida, cerca a farmacias, a Port authority, a la estación de metro de Times Square, al movimiento de la ciudad. Las habitaciones son cómodas (no muy grandes) la cama es increíblemente cómoda, quedé enamorada de la suavidad y la calidad de las sábanas, muy limpio, recursivo, con un restaurante y muchos sitios de comida alrededor. Una excelente opción y un muy buen servicio. El grupo de atención, muy esmerado y amable, varios hablan en español y hacen de tu estadía una experiencia agradable. Pedimos una habitación silenciosa y así fue.

title: Excelente opción par estar cerca de las principales atracciones. Perfecto para ir al Madison Square garden
text: Un hotel con gran ubicación.  Sus habitaciones son pequeñas y algo apretadas. Pero cumple la función de tenerte cerca de todo caminando y de descansar. Sus camas son confortables y el desayuno clásico de un holiday inn.  Nada espectacular pero te sirve para empezar el día. Caminando llegas a  broadway y times squares.  Y a dos calles el Madison square.    Las compras están a la vuelta de la esquina porque esta la 5ta avenida. (Si llevas mucho dinero). Y si no te recomiendo ir a century 21.

title: Efficace
text:
Un peu surpris quand j'ai ouvert la porte car j'ai trouvé La chambre un peu petite. Nous étions 3. Cependant après une bonne nuit, nous avons fait un autre constat.
Chambre est propre comme la salle de bain d'ailleurs. Nous étions lèves tôt et finalement l'accès au petit-déjeuner était assez simple. Merci à Theresa pour son sourire et sa bonne humeur, ça vous met de bonne humer pour toute la journée. 
Sinon, hôtel bien situé, peu voir pas bruyant , nous étions au 29eme et La chambre était un peu sombre mais comme vous passez votre journée dehors....
L'accueil est aussi sympa. 
Bref à recommander.

title: Awesome experience
text: I  stayed for three nights in the hotel. Overall my experience was awesome.  The lady on the front desk was very curtious. Room was cleared. The only thing I observed that I had to wait a lot for breakfast due to rush but overall excellent hotel being very near to times square.

title: Girls just want to have FUN!
text: When we arrived at the hotel at 1130 am, after traveling all night, they actually had a room ready for us to check into, even though check in is not until 4pm. The good things - The front desk staff was very kind and always helpful! The hotel is near Times Square - 2 blocks below and 4 blocks for 42nd street. The bad - The rooms are tiny! There is only 6 rooms per floor and there is 36 floors. There are no drink machines available - all were out of order and I could only find 1 working ice machine.  The street the motel is on is dirty and there is construction going on across the street. NO VIEW from the room even thought we stayed on the 31st floor. When we entered the room, there was still poop in the toilet ! YUCK!! It was not a 5 star hotel, and I wasn't expecting it to be, but to be a part of the Holiday Inn family, I expected more.

title: Very central - easy to all attractions and shopping
text: Was there with my two sons last May, although the room ended being smallish, the location was what we had been after, my two sons where visiting NY for the first time, as grown up teenagers and was important to give them easy access to Manhattan. Breakfast was a little factory served, but covered the needs to start the day, i think we had been allocated room on the 32nd floor and the elevators took some time to arrive and get us up or down...staff very friendly, the luggage guard was super too. I am not sure I would have to stay there again but certainly was an experience, the facilities afe limited but then this is a sleep over hotel , for city visitors who want to be near time square and with easy access to busses and museums etc

title: Great place to stay!
text: This hotel is clean, front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The room is typical for this price range, however the bathroom was larger than most. Bonus to have a safe in the room. Walking distance to MSG, Time Square, Macy's and theatres. Fantastic free breakfast every morning included cereal, oatmeal, bagels, toast, cinnamon rolls, pancakes, sausage, fruit, omelettes, yogurt etc. I would stay here again.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: While this is a no frills property we did not experience what other guests have. I needed lotion and was given it right on the spot. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with directions. We did not have free breakfast package but did have breakfast in that restaurant which was ok. The bathrooms are brand new and beautiful. Comfortable beds too. Elevators did take forever to arrive especially upon check out morning. We reserved 2 double beds and that's what we got.

title: Emplacement idéal
text:
NOUS avons séjourné dans cet hôtel 4 nuits. Situé à deux pas de Times Square et de TOUT ...... NOUS faisions en moyenne 20 kms jour à pieds mais apres in soir difficile contents d'être à 1rue du métro !!!
Petit dej en formule Buffet , pas mal et tres rare à New York 
Literie confortable . Seul petit bémol avons des lits en 140 .... hors, habitués à la maison en 160. 
Sinon TOUT ok à recommander

title: Unfortunate Experience
text: I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn Express with a group of 12 women for a bachelorette party. We booked a total of 3 rooms and had requested rooms with 2 queen beds so we could sleep 4 to a room. Check in was supposed to be at 3, but all of the rooms were not ready at that time. They gave us one room to “start with” that was a king bed only. When we called the front desk to notify them we were given the wrong room, we were told they were completely booked and they gave us all king rooms. We explained our original request for 2 beds and they stated there was nothing they could do. We then requested extra cots or chairs, as there would be several of our guests (one being pregnant)with no bed to sleep on and again, they stated there was nothing they could do. I called again and asked for a manager and requested a transfer to another local holiday inn. They stated they don’t do transfers and all reservations are made through a central scheduling line. The front desk then said they would call their “sister hotel” next door and then call us back with more information. We received no return phone call and when I called back I spoke with a different receptionist and was told they had changed shifts from the previous receptionist, then having to explain our issue all over again. As per the previous discussions, there was “nothing they could do.” The other rooms were ready so late that we almost missed a show that we had purchased tickets for. Also, the rooms were supposed to be in a block, but they ended up being scattered throughout the hotel.  Other issues included the safe in the room being broken, as well as trash in the stairwells. Normally, I would not have taken the stairs down from 22 floors up, but there are 2 tiny elevators that sometimes took 15 minutes to arrive at the floor. Finally, after much complaining, the hotel agreed to return a small amount of our money for our inconveniences. We are truly not a group that complains, just a bunch of friends that were hoping for a great stay in NYC to celebrate a friend’s upcoming wedding. The bride actually has rooms reserved at a local Holiday Inn Express for her wedding and is considering canceling the block due to this past weekend. We still had a great time enjoying the city, but an unfortunate experience at this hotel.

title: Bien
text: A pesar que la habitación no es de lo más grande es suficiente para 4 personas, a pocas calles esta muchos sitios turísticos recomiendo tomar el desayuno muy temprano ya que después hay demasiados huéspedes y la cafeteria es muy pequeña en relación del hotel

title: No frills but very clean
text:
We only spent one night here although we were booked for six.  Unfortunately as I was traveling for business our plans changed, hence the one night.  The lobby is very small with very limited seating but the staff at the front desk were very welcoming and as we arrived well before normal check in we were fortunate our room was ready.  The rooms are small even for NY standards but clean, furnishings looked to be quite new and the bathroom was well appointed with a stall shower, vanity sink and the usual amenities.  Only problem was the closet.  It was a free standing unit and barely 30" wide.
This is a good hotel for a business trip but might be too cramped for families.  The usual Holiday Inn Express breakfast is complimentary and quite passable.  Love those cinnamon buns!  A nice selection of cereals, fruits, scrambled eggs and bacon, juices and breads were available.
Building demolitions were in progress across the street and they started very early in the morning so sleeping in is not an option.  There are about 35 floors in the hotel but only 10 rooms per floor so you can imagine how narrow the building is.  I have an aversion to height so we were on the 9th floor an did hear a lot of traffic noise.

title: Pessimo
text:
Quarto ,muito pequeno,mini armario,minusculo,as portas do armario nao fechavam,quando,fechava ligava a tv,gavetas da comoda,insuficientes,faltava cadeira para pessoas sentarem ,a que tinha era quebrada,o banheiro,nao adequado para uma pessoa deficiente,a banheira,com cortina suja,eu la estando nao usei papel higienico,por ficava do lado oposto do vaso sanitario,o quarto tinha cheiro de mofo,o mais grave.. fomo picado BED BANS,dentro do quarto ,o cafe da manha e repetitivo,nao tinha ,um restaurante,ao menos uma cantina,que pode se,fazer um sanduiche ou um suco,outro grande problema, 30 andares,para 2 elevadores,superlento que as vezes inguicava ,chegou a minha filha ficar presa no elevador,que costatemente esta molhado,acho que e da neve,ou transporte de alimento para os andares.do Hotel , Hotel
  lotado com obra na portaria.
Ainda ate hoje dia,27/03/2017,me debitaram 50 dolares no meu cartaõ de credito,como garantia ao entrar no Hotel,ate a presente data nao me  estornaram,fui neste hotel ,por indicaçaõ de um amigo,que amigo,estou acostumado sempre viajar,mais e a minha primeira vez a Nova York,que amei esta linda Cidade,que voltarei sempre,considero esta minha viagem um programa furado.
Ja visitei,Dubai,Abudabi,,Mexico ,Cancum,Ilhas Gregas,no Brasil,Resort nannai, e outros
Mateus de Lima

title: Too average for Holiday Inn standards
text:
I am a IHG member since 12 years or more, i have stayed with IHG partner hotels everywhere (INDIA, CHINA, FRANCE,ITALY,KUWAIT....) you may check your records.
This was my worst experience, as first of all i got a second hand treatment because for the first time i booked this hotel through third party website
The staff at the front desk treated us like an outsider because we booked through third party website, after check in when i asked for lotion they didn't delivery, next day i asked again but they delivered after an hour!! after an hour or so i asked for the paper glasses as the housekeeping forgot to replace for the coffee machine, when i asked for the paper glass the front desk person told me to check what else i need as they can't give so much service!
If you guys (IHG) are so particular about the bookings to be done through your own website, then why give authorisation to other agencies & disappoint your loyal long time clients?
To my surprise i was informed that i will not get any points for my this stay as i have not booked through IHG !!! 
I booked through other agency because it was cheaper by 20% then booking on IHG website.
The rooms & bathrooms are very clean, bed was comfortable too. Breakfast was reasonably good, as they served same variety for all six days....no change! The dinning area is too small for such a large hotel, most of the guests took breakfast to their rooms, so long queues at elevators in peak hours when you want to go to work!
This property is in a bad shape too....the rooms are extremely small & doesn't feel Holiday Inn

title: Lovely staff but renovations
text: Ana on reception and the catering manager guy at breakfast were ace. My room, 1304, had amazing views over Manhattan. The renovations made it a bit chaotic and the lifts took a long time - especially when one out of the two broke. A solid budget option but noise from construction site over the road - even 31 floors up.

title: Nada malo, lo que le sigue...
text: El equipo es demasiado desorganizado con las reservaciones, con la correspondencia, se les olvida las peticiones, el aseo de las áreas comunes es muy regular, pueden ingresar personas que no se hospedan en el hotel, en general no quiero regresar allí y no lo recomiendo en absoluto.

title: Nothing spectacular
text: I stayed here for my first visit to NYC in nearly 20 years.  The room was clean but small for a double and very pricey.  It's in a decent neighborhood not to far from Times Square which is a plus for visitors.

title: Holiday/ birthday treat
text:
Upon arrival quite disappointed to find out major disruption of builders and decorators everywhere! Any kind of health and safety disregarded walking over tools and dust sheets etc!!
Room was fine, we were lucky enough to be away from where the builders are working and also at the rear of the hotel where there is less noise. We were fortunate to only be on the sixth floor which was good as the elevators were very small and hardly worked efficiently, we quite frequently walked down the six flights of stairs as we could sometimes wait more than 5 minutes for the elevator! ( how people higher up survived we don't know), the stair case which also doubles as fire escape was full of dust and building materials from ongoing building works. Breakfast was a bit hit and miss, if you got there early enough you had a half decent breakfast but if you wanted a lay in as you do there was hardly anything left, poor .
It's a great shame that guests were not informed of the maintenance/ works that we're going on.
The staff were great and hotel in reasonable position but unfortunately all the above issues go against it quite considerably. SHAME !! Wouldn't recommend it whilst building works or appalling elevators, room was kept clean but towels were forgot and refreshments not topped up either.
SORRY GUYS, ONLY 3 STARS MAX !!!  :-(

title: Weeks holiday
text:
The staff here are very friendly first and foremost - shout out to the catering staff who always made us feel welcome and found you a table to eat at and constantly refilled the breakfast - cinnamon rolls delicious - breakfast is all you can eat - fresh fruit, yoghurt, cereal, toast, bagels, eggs etc. Yes the hotel is a little tired but it is undergoing renovations- the construction workers were polite and friendly too.
Room very clean and maid service everyday - even when we had a blizzard last week the staff maintained a good standard of service despite difficulties themselves getting to work.
Having a hotel with breakfast saved us as a party of 3 at least $150 for the week. Rooms are small but that's New York for you! Location is great as you are just around the corner from Times Square and easy walking distance/commute to all the attractions. During our stay we only had one long wait for the elevators which was ok.
Would definitely rebook again as a great price for a base hotel to explore New York - thank you to all the team at the Hotel from concierge team to catering, maid service and day staff - had a fabulous week. Check out the Irish bar a couple of doors up - brunch - big Irish breakfast $14 and a complimentary cocktail.

title: Renovations....ugh!
text: I have stayed here before, but this time was very disappointing. If I had known about the constructions/renovations- I would NOT have booked here. Upon arrival, the hammering & noise were so bad, I could not even here what the desk staff was telling me. The lobby was filthy,loud &had debris everywhere. One elevator was being used to store building supplies. Leaving only one in use for a 30 story building. Ice Machines & Vending were not available.

title: BUON RAPPORTO QUALITÀ PREZZO
text:
A prima vista sembra molto spartano: la reception sembra una grande sala mensa aziendale. 
In realtà il principio di questo hotel è la FUNZIONALITÀ: la hall reception ha il caffè sempre caldo e consente di comprare la cena in asporto e di consumarla li risparmiando un po' di dollari.
Le camere sono piccole ma molto funzionali.
La colazione non è sofisticata ma abbondante.
La posizione è strategica tra la V  e la VI strada.
Un hotel che consiglio nel rapporto qualità prezzo.

title: Great staff
text: Typical small room but clean and upgraded. Great view on top floors if you can tolerate the elevator. Lot of construction inside and across street but the room was nicer than expected. Management helped accommodate room change and Joirie at front desk couldn't have been nicer! Her friendly smile and personal attention to help fix the issue should earn her special recognition.  With all my travels, I do not often see someone that represents the IHG brand as well as Joirie. Special thanks and I didn't forget

title: Perfect Hotel at the perfect place!!
text: Bang on! In the heart of New York City!! Times square is a five minutes walk from the hotel! The staff is good and they have complimentary breakfast on the house which is great! The rooms are considerably quite small but at the price, it is good enough!

title: buena ubicación
text: en general el hotel es  bueno , cuenta con los servicios necesarios , pero lo mas  importante es  la cercanía que tiene con las estaciones de  metro para poder llegar  a  cualquier lugar cómodamente , las  instalaciones son cómodas el personal y el personal es bastante amable

title: Avg NY hotel
text:
Another typical NY hotel with
Phone-booth sized rooms. Bathroom was rudimentary and in
Need of tlc. Breakfast is a jungle.
Good location a little south of T Square but close to MDG. Staff
Seemed overrun at all times.

title: Best hotel in Manhattan for the money-bar none!
text: Newly renovated hotel, very comfortable king size room, superb full breakfast, and a very friendly and helpful staff. The price for this experience in the Times Square area, less than $125/night. It is the best deal in Manhattan I have found, if anyone can beat it, let the world know.

title: 4 days in NYC & a great location
text: Just returned from NYC. The HIE is about 4 blocks from Times Square, so it's not noisy or bright. The 34th Street/Herald Square subway stop is about a block and a half away, which took us everywhere we wanted to go (as long as you don't mind changing lines). Breakfast was typical, well stocked but nothing exciting. It got pretty busy around 8-9 am. The main downfall is the size of the room. With 2 beds, there was little extra room. Beds were a bit too firm. Bathroom has a sliding door to save room. It is near bars and restaurants and was very safe.

title: Great Location Great Service & Comfy Room
text: Stayed here for four nights. Location to Times Square and Theatre District was great. Front desk staff, especially Anna was very professional, friendly and helpful. The Concierge was very helpful too. Room was small as is the norm for NYC but clean and comfortable, especially the bed. Had one issue with the room thermostat but it was taken care of immediately when brought to the staff's attention. Breakfast was good too and staff there was friendly as well. Also, had a late flight home and they were kind enough to store our luggage to allow us to enjoy our last day in NY before catching our ride to LGA.

title: Great Location
text:
If what you want is luxury, fine dining and pampering in an exquisite location you'll have to splash out on one of the upmarket hotels bordering Central Park. If what you want is affordable comfort in the heart of Manhattan then the Holiday Inn Express in 39th Street is an excellent choice.
The street itself is a bit tired but the hotel, which is being gradually refurbished, offers a decent   breakfast, endlessly helpful reception staff, free Wi-Fi and lovely comfortable beds. The staff overseeing the breakfast buffet were patient and ensured fresh food was available throughout. We never had to wait for a table. Whenever we returned to the room after sightseeing, it had been cleaned and soaps, coffee etc replenished. The housekeeping staff could not be faulted. The refreshments that are permanently available in the foyer were welcome.
The hotel is ideally situated for all we wanted to do. It is close to the theatres and we had a ten minute walk to see a fabulous production of The Lion King. A short stroll to the west will take you to the piers where you can take the landmark cruise to catch the main sights and have a potted history of New York. Trips to the Top of the Rock and The Empire State Building were worth the short taxi rides. Penn Station is conveniently close so we took the subway to the 9/11 Tribute which was as informative as it was moving.
I know that should we ever visit Manhattan again we will book the Holiday Inn Express, even if I could afford one of the swankier places around Central Park.

title: 車や人通りが少ない通りにある小ぎれいなホテル
text: Jacob K. Javits Convention Centerでのイベントに参加するため、こちらに滞在しました。初めてだったので、小ぎれいな感じの良いホテルでした。部屋からはハドソン川が見えました。タイムズスクエアからもほど近く、便利だと思いました。

title: Bien ubicado excelente relación precio calidad
text: Acostumbro a hospedarme en los IHG siempre que los valores esten dentro de un rango lógico. Este hotel está muy bien ubicado. El desayuno es muy bueno y variado. Las chicas que atienden en la hora del desayuno muy gentiles super predispuestas siempre con una sonrisa saludandote y preguntando si necesitas algo. Punto negativo para todos los IHG si contratas por otra página tipo Expedia no sumas puntos para el programa de pasajero frecuente una locura! Si reservaste directo te tratan bárbaro por que sos miembro te dan los puntos late check out internet high speed etc,  si reservaste por otro medio te tratan como si tuvieses una enfermedad contagiosa. IHG a ponerse las pilas con esto!

title: Satisfied customer
text: Very nice hotel and staff.  We arrived before check in and were greeted quickly by the friendly staff.  The bellman, Juan, made sure our bags were taken care of so we could start our weekend.  From our arrival to our departure, he made sure we were very well taken care of.  We did not return to the hotel until late that night and while the lady who helped us at that time was not very friendly the rest of the staff made up for it.  They made sure we had what we needed the entire weekend.  Plus the beds and pillows are sooo comfortable!  Great location.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text: L'établissement est très bien situé et bien entretenu. Les chambres sont spacieuses et beneficient d'une vue splendide sur New York. Le tarif est abordable pour New York avec les petits déjeuner inclus. Le buffet du petit déjeuner est varié.

title: Mai 2014
text:
Nous avons ete 4 jours a cet hotel.
C'etait super on a fait des kms en 4 jours a travers manhattan central park le MOMA wall street hyde park soho etc...
On a ete voir et ecouter un concert de jazz dans un hotel privé au coeur de central park ...(dizzy's coca cola)
Magique :)

title: Gute Verbindungen
text: Das einfache Hotel liegt ziemlich zentral.. direkt in der Nähe des Busbahnhofes. Es gibt Frühstück in Pappteller und Plastikbecher. Die Zimmer sind einfach und funktional eingerichtet. Es gibt im Hotel rund um die Uhr Tee,Kaffee,Kakao und Wasser. Der Frühstück ist gewöhnungsbedürftig, eher schlecht.. Es gab Muffins,Bagels,Toastbrot.. total trockene und Pappige fertig Omeletts, ein Pancake Automaten mit Sirup, Philadelphia Käse und  Marmelade und Bananen. Das große Problem in dem Hotel sind die Aufzüge..mal wieder war eine defekt, so daß man echt lange warten musste..und der andere Aufzug wurde vom Personal und den Bauarbeitern im Hotel ständig blockiert.

title: Plenty of construction!
text:
Stayed in this hotel for a short period of time while in NYC. The hotel is under
construction on many floors! The elevators are constantly used for work purpose!!! As a result, only 1 working elevator for all guests!!!! Elevator wait time is too long at times you have to wait more than 10-15 min!!! Not an option for stairs when your room is located at a high floor!!! This hotel it conveniently located for sightseeing in Manhattan. Staff are friendly! Breakfast is good and  the room are not big but clean and decent. I found it a little expensive for its facilities but perhaps worth for the location.

title: Port Authority近くにある清潔でリーズナブルなホテル
text:
安定のクオリティのHoliday Inn Express、リーズナブルで清潔なホテルでリピートしています。
Port Authorityに近いのでNewark Airportからバスでマンハッタン往復する時に便利です。
他のマンハッタン内のHoliday Inn Express同様、部屋は狭いですがデスク、コーヒーメーカー、冷蔵庫等が揃っており、日本のAPAや東横イン同様に安心して利用できるホテルです。
朝食無料ですが、平日朝8:00-9:00は混雑して座れない時もあります。部屋にテイクアウトするか、時間をずらすといいでしょう。

title: Good location
text: I recently stayed at this hotel during a short trip to New York, which is conveniently located for sightseeing in Manhattan. My room was very basic but clean and decent. Facilities are a bit old and elevators are small and also used by staff for cargo, which makes you wait for long time to go up/down, especially if your room is located at a high floor. It could be quite pricey for its facilities but perhaps worth for its location.

title: Muy central, con restaurant pequeño para el desayuno
text: Ideal ubicación para ir a ver comedias musicales. Habitaciones un poco pequeñas y pocos elevadores. No hay mucho control de los paquetes que a uno le llegan. El desayuno es bueno pero cuesta encontrar puesto. La cafeteria con te y cafe todo el dia abierto, maravilloso

title: Under construction
text:
Clearly the hotel is under construction on many floors! Only 1 working elevator! Elevator wait Tim 20-30 minutes happened 4 times in a 1 night stay!  
Had to change roooms due to heating issue and door to room malfunctioning! 2nd room heat was either to hot or to cold, bathroom freezing!
Went down 32 flights of stairs to change the room so we wouldn't be late for a birthday surprise! 
I complained and was told to be patient... I had no time to take it further due to time wasted with elevator, room change etc.
Worst stay ever!!

title: Hotel Desorganizado
text: Me hospedei pela segunda vez nesse hotel,ficamos por 8 dias e o escolhi pela segunda vez pela localização( muito próximo a Times Square).Equipe do café da manhã são ótimos, mesmo lugar sendo pequeno e sempre lotado procuram atender a todos com gentileza e rapidez. Já serviço de limpeza dos quartos péssimo,mal arrumavam a cama, teve dia que nem o lixo retiraram, vaso sanitário do nosso quarto com manchas de sujeira e que continuaram mesmo após reclamações.Elevador um verdadeiro caos, em média de dez minutos para conseguir descer, e para ajudar quando lá estivemos um elevador quebrou ( ficamos 4 dias hospedadas sem elevador) e ai quase impossível para conseguir subir e descer, no mínimo quinze minutos, estávamos no 22º andar e tivemos que descer de escada a maioria dos dias se quiséssemos sair. Hotel está em reforma e todos os ambientes estavam sujos , muita poeira e mal cuidado.Na recepção fomos muito mal atendidos pela recepcionista Ana , sem paciência, falava muito rápido e não gostava de repetir.Nosso ar condicionado no quarto estava com problemas, engenheiro- técnico esteve lá por trees vezes pois parava de funcionar e não sabiam justificar o porque. Não tivemos sorte nessa hospedagem e não pretendo voltar a esse hotel.

title: Good hotel
text:
Many positives to this hotel; great location, friendly staff, good selection for an early breakfast, free coffee and tea facilities, very clean. 

Only a few negatives to this hotel, the rooms are very small, as is the wardrobe, 1 of our rooms door did not shut at the bottom. Lifts are quite slow also. 

For the price and location I Would recommend this hotel.

title: Una buena experincia
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado ,no es lujoso pero lo primordial para mí es una buena cama y una buena limpieza y e cuanto a eso pueden ustedes estar tranquilos,y además un dato para no perder es que este apart hotel cuenta con servicio de desayuno bufet que no es fácil de encontrar en New York,siendo este  muy completo y cómodo ya que si quieren                                                                                                                                                                            
 desayunar en el lugar establecido lo pueden hacer y si no se sirven las cosas y se las llevan a la habitación y cómo está todo equipado (fíjense en las fotos de la página )lo hacen en la forma y tiempo que quieran sin gastar un dólar de más.Lo mismo si desean prepararse algo ligero para almorzar o cenar.En cuanto al personal es muy amable y en el caso de no hablar inglés cuentan con dos personas que hablan español.El precio es aceptable por la comodidad que ofrecen y tratándose de New York es bastante bueno.En realidad no tengo nada malo que decir de este hotel ,solo que en algunos horarios se pone denso usar el ascensor.

title: December trip
text:
Hotel was to be expected. It was a small room but that is normal for NYC.  The hotel was clean and guest services was friendly but their vending machines were empty and it took a long time to get an elevator in the morning.  The lobby was always super crowded but it was close to everything...irish pub down the street was so convenient if you wanted to grab some late night drinks.....
Hotel was super convenient to Time Square and the Theater district as well.

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
très bien situé dans un endroit sûr et calme.Hotel n'ayant qu'un ascenseur pour desservir 35 étages pendant cette période (1 en panne), c'est peu!! J'ai demandé à l'arrivée de ne pas encaisser sur la carte Visa car je voulais payer CASH en partant (m’évitant des frais de commission avec la carte visa). Au moment du départ, la première journée a été encaissée... Petit déjeuner complet avec des fruits frais et personnels très sympathique. 
Clim bruyante.

title: Buena ubicación.
text:
Muy buen hotel. No falta nada. Es cómodo, tiene muy buen servicio y está muy bien ubicado.
El desayuno es bueno y las habitaciones a pesar de ser un poco pequeñas están muy bien ambientadas y está muy bien aprovechado el espacio.

title: Poor
text:
36 floor hotel that had only 1 working elevator!!! Crazy. 

Room with King bed wasn't king size at all. Very small-- though chair was comfortable to sit in. Lobby was ill appointed. Disappointed in the product. Not up to standards.

title: Un check in muy complicado
text:
Buen desayuno, completo con gran variedad de alimentos, el personal del desayuno muy amable en especial Katie que siempre estaba muy atenta y dispuesta a ayudarte. También nos ayudó mucho Neuro Bellman con el tema de la comunicación. El día que llegamos no tenían personal que hablara español tampoco al día siguiente ya que la única persona que hablaba español tenia el dia libre, gracias a Neuro pudimos comunicarnos con recepción. Al llegar al hotel nos querían cobrar 300 dolares mas de lo que habíamos reservado por booking por suerte el personal de booking soluciono el problema. No encontramos buena disposición de parte de recepción del hotel, desconfiaban de la reserva realizada por booking. Y todo esto sucedió a las 3:30am luego de 18 horas de viaje desde Uruguay. 
La primer noche habiendo reservado habitación para tres personas con dos camas dobles nos dieron una habitación con una cama king size porque no tenían disponible la habitación que habíamos reservado y pago. Esa primer noche no fue confortable. Otro inconveniente fueron las largas esperas en el ascensor en horas pico. Solo funcionaba un ascensor y era utilizado por los huéspedes y el personal que trabajaba en la remodelacion del hotel. Uno de los días esperamos 20 minutos el ascensor y terminamos bajando por la escalera (estábamos en el piso 11).
Era bueno que disponga de café y hielo las 24 horas. Buena limpieza y ubicación.

title: Awesome weekend
text: We stayed day for one night in the city. We book a room with twin bed by accident and they were still able to switch us to a room with a queen bed. They're awesome especially Joirie Mayers. She switch us into a room on the top floor with excellent view. Props to her.

title: Massive bed!
text:
We stayed here for 5 days, the staff on the front desk were friendly, there was building work going on when we were staying, but we weren't affected by this. The room was a bit dated, but had a very large bed that was very comfortable. There was a TV with about 40 TV channels on, the wifi was a bit slow at times. 

The breakfast was good and had a decent sized selection, that changed every day. The hotel was a 15 minute walk from Times Square and Broadway.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: This hotel was recommended to us, and I wish to do the same!  The room was not large, but we had plenty of what we needed....and everything worked!  There were plenty electrical outlets, the room was very clean,the elevators worked well, amenities were readily accessible, and staff was friendly!  The continental breakfast was amazing.....hot dishes every day along with a wide variety of favorite choices, both food and drink-wise.  The location was good, also.  It's an easy walk to many sites and to the Port Authority.

title: Excelente!!!!!
text: Full recomendado me quedaría 1000 veces más me encanto!!!!! El desayuno la habitación la atención los pequeños gran detalles que hacen la diferencia, definitivamente cuando vuelva a New York me hospedare en el Holiday Inn Express. Saludos

title: Excelente!
text: La ubicación buena, cerca Time Square, subways, estación de buses, cerca de 7 th Avenue, el desayuno excelente, el servicio del personal muy amable, las habitaciones limpias aunque un poco pequeñas. Llegue ahí de Newark en un Share VAN, el servicio fue tan bien bueno y me costo $us 89 por 3 adultos y un niño

title: Weekend in NY
text: Nice size room for NY clean friendly staff conveniently located to Port Authority, Broadway and Times Square definitely will stay again. Had on site restaurant and lively bar which was great because our weather was a wet weekend

title: Few days in NYC
text: This hotel is a hidden gem. Recently renovated, the rooms are small, but very nice. The water for the shower is always hot and the pressure is great. A great addition is their coffee, tea and hot chocolate station that is always clean and stocked. The breakfast is nice with your basic pancakes and eggs. Oscar and Theresa are great breakfast attendants and keep things flowing. If I had to complain about anything, it would be waiting for the elevator, but we just had to be patient and allow time.

title: Good location
text:
Hotel staff was amazing courteous, service was good. As it was quite near to time square and other tourist location, i would say location was good. Parking was available right in front of the hotel .

Breakfast was very reasonable. 

There were two issues; room size was too small and heating/ aircon could not be adjusted, either it was hot or cold.

title: Buen servicio y excelente ubicación
text: Convenientemente ubicado a pocas cuadras de Times Square, cerca de la estación de bus y estaciones del subway, a dos cuadras en la calle 41 hay una parada del bus turístico.  El hotel ofrece justo lo que se necesita cuando visitas Manhattan,  habitaciones cómodas (aunque pequeñas), desayuno y buena conexión a internet. El personal es amable y dispuesto a colaborarte, en especial las personas que atienden el desayuno, las chicas de recepción y Carl el auditor nocturno.

title: Small hotel with great staff near Time Square
text:
After we were dropped us off at the hotel, a Holiday Inn Staff member greeted us and directed us to the receptionist. We were promptly checked in and went to our room. 
Our room was small but well appointed. The bed was very comfortable. There was a room safe to store valuables.
The front desk receptionist recommended the best restaurant my husband liked in New York City.
The breakfast area is small but if you pick your times you will be able to have seating. The kitchen staff are friendly, efficient and go out of their way to seat and accommodate quests.
The activity person was very good to obtain tickets wanted for various NYC activities.

title: New York state of mind.
text: The hotel is in a pretty good location.  The rooms are super small.  I would not recommend more than 2 people per room.  Elevators are not always available.  However, on the plus side - the staff were fantastic.  They were so friendly and tried very hard to make our family feel welcome.  The hotel is currently doing some renovations as well.

title: Conveniently located
text: This hotel is nothing fancy, but there isn't anything wrong with it either. It is conveniently located near the Port Authority bus terminal and several other subway stops. The only issue we had is that there were 4 of us in the room and they always only left 3 towels and washcloths for us, so we had to call for more each night.

title: Expensive and Tiny, but what isn't in NYC!???
text: We had 2 college students and 2 adults in the room, would have been okay for 2 total.  Very small room, one of the beds had a couple of inches to the wall, and the other did not have much more than 8.  Very small bathroom too.  BUT we could walk to lots of places pretty easily.  It is inexpensive for NYC, the last one I stayed in was $650 plus tax per night (much nicer hotel, big room), this was $270 to $320 plus $50 to $60 each night in taxes.  We do not really need a nice room in a city where we will be out and about all the time, but just wanted to warn you.

title: Hotel ótimo custo benefício
text: O hotel tem um café da manhã bom, porém é melhor chegar cedo no local porque tem muita gente e quase não tem lugar para sentar. O Hotel fica bem localizado, andando uns 5 minutos até a Time Square. O quarto e o banheiro muito limpo e organizado. Eles tem serviço de transporte até o aeroporto, mas lembro que precisa agendar e pagar uma taxa pouco menor que o táxi. Quando as malas se caso chegar mais cedo, eles guardam até o horário do seu check-in.

title: hôtel sympa
text: Propre, confortable, personnel accueillant, cet hôtel est très sympa. Juste le petit déjeuner est un peu cheap et les ascenseurs un peu 'rares' mais globalement c'est très bien. Et je ne parle pas de l'emplacement... un must !

title: Christmas in NYC
text: The hotel is perfectly located as a base to get around. More importantly, the staff is terrific. They really try harder. Free hot chocolate and cookies  travel packs for the day and a very nice breakfast included. This is a great place for your NYC visit

title: Bon rapport qualite prix
text:
Hotel bien situé à15 mn de penn station et 5 mn de times square 
La chambre est petite mais correcte ( nous etions 3adultes)
Le petit dejeuner est tres bien et inclu dans le prix 

L attente des ascenseurs est longue ce d autant plus qu' il y avait des travaux ... 
le personnel de service est gentil ainsi que la conciergerie

title: Garment District
text: This property is advertised as a new Holiday Inn Express.  The only thing new was probably the name plate over the door.  It is also advertised as om the heart of the theater district when in fact it is in the heart of the garment district.  Basically a hole in the wall with 4 rooms to a floor.  We reserved a King and barely had enough room to walk around the bed.  Bathroom small with no room on the pedestal sink to sit a shaving kit.  Vending machines look like they are from the 19th century and when you bend over to make a selection you block the entire hall (yes it is that narrow).

title: Very disappointed,dreadful service
text:
We have used Holiday Inn hotels over a number of years.Just lots of inexcusable issues that should have been avoided during this stay.1 or 2 is to be accepted, but not 8.
The ones I can remember:-
Stayed here for 7 nights.
No gluten free breakfast provided for coeliac,but checked before booking,emailed a few days before arrival and no response.Reminded again upon arrival,and then next day,kitchen/breakfast staff not aware.
First night we didn't sleep well at all(we are not light sleepers and very rarely have a problem)Htg/air con unit very noisy and kept modulating all night,fan and bearings/pipes noisy.In fairness an engineer fitted a wireless thermostat on the wall instead of heating controls directly on the heater,however this had no effect whatsoever and was just as noisy because it was the fan and vibration that made the noise.
bed side light flickering badly(affected my vertigo)
Unable to use bath,plug didn't fit.
Extractor fan in bathroom also very noisy.
No towels in bedroom on one occasion.
No cups in bedroom on another day,wife collected some from reception(we were on the 35th Floor)
Bedroom cleaning service completely missed one day.
The only way to sleep was to put Htg on high when coming in at night,then switch off before bed so we could get some sleep.
Promised reduction in bill due to numerous issues.Given invoice indicating refund when we checked out on 20th Dec.
Complained through BA,and still waiting nearly 3 weeks now.
The administration and supervision is inefficient and the cleaning/maintenance staff are very poor.
Very disappointed,and would not recommend this hotel.

title: "Comodissimo"
text: Abbiamo scelto l'hotel per la sua posizione centrale,molto vicino a Times Square la camera non grandissima ma confortevole (mi dispiace non aver avuto una camera nei piani alti ,ma non era disponibile)La prima colazione è compresa nel prezzo, devo dire con molta scelta e di qualita' personale molto disponibile

title: Hotel muito popular.
text: Different from the Holiday Inn in Milan, Paris and Los Angeles (which I've stayed and were great), this Express is very average, not to mention bad. Despite a great service from the reception staff, the hotel itself is very popular. Only two elevators that are literally impossible to use during the morning, because always crowded with guests who go down to the dining room to grab breakfast and eat in the room. Room cleaning was also average. Behind the furniture and under the bed were dusty. The bathroom is good, but still with a bath, which in my opinion, besides being dangerous (slipping) is contrary to the environment, because filling a bath spends water for more than a week! Anyway, unless you have a tight budget, it's not worth the price charged. Holiday Inn only if it is not the Express.

title: Great location - close to MSG, restaurants, pubs & shopping
text: I stayed here for three nights during a pre-holiday visit that culminated with a Billy Joel concert at Madison Square Garden. The room was small, but very nicely appointed, with a nice king bed, desk and chair and a nice-sized bathroom. The location was super convenient to several very good restaurants in the area, not too far from Macy's and just a few blocks from Madison Square Garden. The staff were very friendly as well.

title: Goede uitvalbasis
text:
Keurig, schoon en net hotel in de buurt van Times Square, Penn treinstation en de metro.
We zijn aangekomen van Newark en dan is het met de airtrain en vervolgens met de normale trein naar Penn statio ongeveer een half uur. Van Penn station naar het hotel is het ongeveer 10 tot 15 minuten lopen. Dit is goed te doen. De omgeving is veilig met veel mensen op straat (zoals in heel NY).
Personeel is vriendelijk, er is goede wifi en de lift is razend snel en stil. Binnen een mum van tijd ben je op de 30ste verdieping. Alleen in de ochtend tijdens ontbijt kan het wat langer duren als er op vijf verschillende etages gestopt moet worden, maar je dat heb je in Amsterdam ook bij vier verdiepingen. 
Ontbijt is keurig, geen uitgebreid Europees ontbijt met zes verschillende broodjes etc, maar wel de pancakes, muffins, oatmael, koffie, eieren, vruchtensapjes, yoghurt en vers fruit.
Kamers niet overdreven groot maar er past wel een kingsize bed in, maar dan past er niet nog een bijzet bed bij.
In de lobby staan ook twee computers met een printer, zodat je de terugvlucht kan inchecken en uitprinten, keurige services

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: My family of six recently stayed four nights. We had two rooms side by side and had a wonderful time!  The rooms were NYC small but the layout made it seem bigger. Nice big showers and comfortable beds. The staff was courteous and eager to please. Would stay again in a New York minute!

title: Comfortable and Close
text: Recently stayed here as a family of 4.  Rooms were small but they all are in the heart of NYC.  Room was clean and bathroom was large.  Front desk staff was very nice and helpful.  This hotel is located right in Times Square so the location is perfect!

title: Excellent location, good value
text: Title says it all.  Rooms are small (but hey this is New York), and the place for breakfast so small that most folks just grab the food and took them to their rooms.  Service acceptable.  Overall a good base if you want an inexpensive base for New York for a couple of days.

title: Vale a pena
text:
Não se trata de um hotel requintado, quarto pequeno (como a maioria em NYC), limpo, com carpete sem cheiro de mofo (não atacou minha rinite em 8 dias... amém).
Café da manhã incluso na diária, mas com cardápio bem enxuto e sem muitas variáções.
Localização muito boa, mas por estar no centro, as vezes dá sensação de insegurança para sair muito tarde da noite.
Por se tratar de um hotel de baixo custo recebe turistas tanto estrangeiros, quanto americanos.

title: Overall, it is a good place to stay for visiting Manhattan
text:
We got a room in level LL, which is sort of in the basement, but you do get something like half of a window. The room is small, but it is good enough considering it's Manhattan. One bad thing is that the vending machine is just outside of our room, and the wall of the room is so thin that we could hear every transaction done by the machine.

The location of the hotel is good. You can easily walk around or take the subway. I do like the 24/7 coffee and tea service in the lobby, but the lobby is too crowded during the free breakfast time so you may not find a place to sit down and eat.

title: good location for tourists
text: Friendly desk staff and good continental breakfast. Rooms were clean but showing their age. Long waits for the elevators often because cleaning staff had to use the same elevators to move their carts from floor to floor.

title: Our family Tour of NYC , Seeing a Broadway Show, One World Observatory Etc.
text: 1) This hotel was convenient to the LGA Laguardia Airport Shuttle bus ( The Airporter) . The bus runs every 1/2 hour.  So our family of 5 was able to roll our luggage 3 blocks to and from the shuttle drop off and pick up.  2) The rooms are as small as a cruise ship's room but they were clean and the 2 rooms we booked were fine no problems.  3) the coffee and breakfast area is bigger than the photos showed from previous posts of others'. It looks like they added on an area so that 30+ people could sit down and eat breakfast. All the food is kept stocked and the area is maintained & cleaned well. They had omelettes biscuit, bagels, turkey sausage, pork, sausage bacon and the coffee creamers , milk etc all kept full /stocked . One day we were in a hurry and I just made a quick breakfast sandwich and brought it with me to walk and ride the NYC subway.  It was good!  4) the workers were all professional. The maintenance, housekeeping, front desk all were very professional.  The only negative was the slow elevators but they were only an inconvenience once during our 5 day trip. We only used the subway and walking during our 5 days. We were able to do a Broadway Show ( Wicked), Ellen Stardust, One World Observatory, World Trade Center Memorial, Modern Art Museum, all of Time Square walking and Shopping ,Rockefeller, Little Italy / China Town, Katz Deli, Lombardi Pizza (The Oldest Pizzeria in the USA) . We don't have to use any Taxis or Ubers. So this hotel serves this family of 5 vacation needs. I would recommend!

title: NYC Whirlwind trip
text: The room was small, but adequate.  No noise from anywhere.    The people at the hotel desk were excellent.  They booked a "hop on-hop off" bus tour for us and they also booked a "car" rather than a taxi for me when I was ready to leave the next day for the airport.  Excellent driver, BTW, much better than the taxi driver from the airport. The bar beside/attached to the hotel was busy and the food was very good.

title: me gusta la cadena holiday
text: me gusta por que tienen el desayuno incluido y es muy abundante.la ubicacion  esta bien.cerca de todo.  en la recepcion nadie hablaba español, el resto del personal muy amable. la habitacion correcta y camas comodas. pocos ascensores para la cantidad de gente. pero en realidad nunca esperamos muchisimo.

title: Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square was friendly
text:
Holiday Inn Express New York City Times Square was friendly and room was clean.  That is all I am looking for in a hotel.  We missed breakfast since they only serve until 9am which is a little early for a hotel.  Good location and friendly staff.
ConsumerMarineSupply.

title: Short 3 night break to visit 'World 'Trade 'Centre Museum
text:
After an hour transfer by Newark Airport taxi transfer we arrived at the hotel.  Check in was very quick and the receptionist was very pleasant.  This hotel does not have many rooms (4 rooms on nearly every floor), the room had everythig you would need, compact but perfectly adequate for a short stay.  The walk to the museum took 10 minutes, and just across Wall Street was the waterfront,   We were pleasantly surprised when told that breakfast was included,and it was perfect to set us up for the day and the lady that served it was lovely and friendly.  It included both hot and cold with a very good selection.  
If you are going to visit NY for the museum i would recommend this hotel as it is in an ideal location and cheaper than those on Times Square ( you would need to get a taxi or bus to the museum from Times Square)

title: i meant to review this instead of holiday inn
text: We booked a double bedroom but was very pleased to be upgraded to a suite room when we arrived there. Location was very good. The lift was quite small but then again, its New York. The breakfast area was near the main entrance and quite small especially when it was peak time so it's best to come in the earliest possible to avoid congestion. Despite of that, they have a good breakfast options. I particularly like the cinnamon rolls. The staff were pleasant and ver helpful. Would recommend to stay here if only you are after having a place to stay after a long day if exploring the city.

title: Good Hotel for short trips
text: Good hotel, clean and near attractions but very small rooms, elevator service is too slow so avoid peak time. In general a good hotel for short stays. Prices are good compared to location and services.

title: Great value
text: Hotel is very clean, rooms are small but you're only there to sleep. Walking distance to all major attractions. One block from Port Authority bus terminal. For the price and location is a great value. Breakfast is only serve till 9:30 am in a very small room

title: Muy limpio y buen servicio
text: Recomiendo este hotel, pues es de limpieza impecable y el persona de recepción es muy amable. Es lo necesario para una estancia en Nueva York, en la cual se está fuera la mayor parte del día. Llegué ahí de última hr, pues salí corriendo del Hotel Pennsylvania que es más caro y está tremendamente sucio y lúgubre. Fue un gran alivio encontrar lugar en el Holiday Inn Expresss.

title: For $150/night this is three stars. At $600/night, it's terrible.
text: Rooms are tiny, but serviceable. Two creaky elevators serving more than 30 floors mean very long waits, unless you get a 2nd floor room, which is accessible by stair. Location is ok. A quite mediocre location when crazy NYC pricing pushes it past $200/night.

title: Room Poorly supplied
text:
Room poorly supplied ,tv basic channels ,there is no AC or heat inside the bathroom,no gym inside the hotel ,you have to go next door 
the plus ,the location a few blocks from the times square , free breakfast and good wifi

title: Just location. Very ordinary with worst elevators!
text: Location is great, close to Times Square. But nothing else worth writing about. Worst thing is the elevator system - two of them which are ridiculously slow. We had rooms on the 34th floor and the average time of waiting is 20 minutes!!! On the day of check out, we had bags had to wait 40 minutes!!! Really poor  amenity for a hotel claiming to be posh.

title: sightseeing
text: Zimmer ok - Betten sind sehr kurz keine 1,75 m lang, Frühstück amerikanisch... , kleiner Frühstücksraum, war oft überfüllt, 2 Fahrstühle bei 36 Etagen - ging gar nicht!!!! haben einmal 15 - 20 Minuten gewartet !!!!

title: 3 nights in NY
text: OUr first visit to NY so lots to learn about the way things work in this city.  The hotel was Clean, simple, walking distance from all the mid town sights,  easy access to subway.  All in all a great modestly priced location in New York.  Staff are helpful and easy going,  breakfast was good with a wide selection,  but the dining room small so many guests took breakfast to their room.  I would be happy to stay here again

title: Great stay
text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express while touring New York in November 2016. The staff were very courteous and always there to help. The breakfast was very good. This property is very close to all major NYC attractions, well connected by metro as well. The rooms are decent and very neat. The space inside the room was limited - it did not matter much keeping in mind the economical rate for an accommodation in the heart of the city.

title: Excellent location
text: In the middle of town, very good breakfast, small rooms , good internet connection , friendly and helpful staff , 1 hour by taxi to JFK airport , walking distance from major attractions . I loved our view from 28 th floor

title: 性价比不错，位置很好
text: 酒店价格在这个位置算是很不错了，步行到时代广场，第五大道，帝国大厦，梅西百货都在十多分钟左右，附近地铁站也很多。Holiday Inn连锁酒店品质管理比较统一，让人放心，设施不全新，但很干净，大床睡的也挺舒服。酒店服务也很热情，关于早饭，在国外的话就别指望能吃到符合同胞口味的，图个饱。缺点如很多人反应的那样，酒店就两部电梯，高峰时很堵，我住在顶楼，尤其痛苦。

title: GREAT HOTEL
text: The staff here are great. They really helped us with directions places to see and just being friendly faces. The rooms are a little small but they are very clean. The location is great for such sights as Broadway The cake boss and of course times sqaure.

title: Great place we will be back
text: Sandra was great, the whole staff was very nice. My husband and I celebrated our two year wedding anniversary. Everyone was great. Thank you again ! Room was clean. We stayed on the 9th floor. We will be back soon!

title: Nice hotel
text: My wife and I spent a new get at this location on our way to  Zurich. The hotel is a good location to walk to Times Square, Trump Tower, Broadway and many other attractions in New York. The rooms are small with no microwave or refrigerator. The rooms are clean.

title: Terrible
text: Stayed here for 1 night prior to return flight home Carpet had sticky substance on floor in my room Coffee machine still had coffee pod in from previous guest yuk Girl at front desk was very condescending when I asked question When I had booked in looked online and found price was $120 cheaper than what I paid Was told rates fluctuate and it would have been cheaper if I just walked in off street Good grief and I am an IHG member Terrible

title: Good for a short break in New York
text:
A little further away from Times Square than we were expecting but the quieter location suited us. Room very clean, tidy and well equipped -  the king room city view room was just fine for our 3 night stay.
THe real bonus in this hotel is the complimentary breakfast which can save quite a few dollars. The dining room got a little crowded at times but the hardworking and helpful Oscar kept everything under control and good humoured. Plenty of choice of food and drinks available.

title: great customer service
text: Small rooms, big bed, all you need, BUT the carpets are hideous please change them even if they are not dirty they look it! Reception agents are superb, helpful, knowledgable and courteous. We had to ask most days for our coffee pods to be delivered for the morning, but otherwise it was a smooth easy comfortable stay in a central area, close to everything.

title: Small facilities Big Customer Service
text: This hotel was too small for two adults and two teenagers to share one room. The halls were small, the elevators were slow, and the breakfast room was too crowded (probably just because there were too many room for such a small breakfast area). We would not stay there again. But the customer service was big. Friendly staff at the front desk and in the breakfast area. It's a clean hotel too. The location is great. Near what we wanted to see and subway stations. So if you're not in a hurry and don't mind a small room you'd be fine staying here.

title: Superb my new go to hotel in  nyc
text: Superb from start to finish every member of staff so helpful espically ruben on the front desk booked agaib for November next year cannot wait to go back 5 stars keep up the excellent work guys!!! Top hotel cannot highly recommend enough

title: Excellent
text: Excellent service Sandra in front desk and the cleaning of my room is very very excellent. Great location. Near and all . Excellent breakfast nice customer service theresa. The check in and check out is very fast great price

title: Great location but things to be improved
text:
The location of this hotel is very convenient and rate is very reasonable for NYC. A few experience and observation to share.
Check-in: I gave my last name to the front-desk lady and she couldn't find it. I booked the room through Expedia but did not print out the receipt as I never needed in ages. I had to get on my laptop to get the email. When I provided the reservation number, she found it and exactly on "my" name.
Elevator: I have seen some complaint here about waiting for the elevator so when I was told I was placed on the 21st, I was concerned. However, for the 2 days I stayed, I never had to wait for long.
Room: Small (understandable in NYC) but very clean. Especially because I was on the 21st floor, this is one of the few experiences I stayed in NYC and not got wake up by street noise.
Breakfast: Typical Holiday Inn Express hot breakfast, no complaint. The dining area is a little small. There was a big crowd of tourists so it's packed both mornings (different time).
Overall: Decent location, good rate and a solid hotel. Like I said previously, there are places for improvements but I will always consider stay here when I return to NYC.

title: Lage Top, Zimmer in Ordnung
text:
Wir hatten 2 Zimmer für 5 Personen. Die Lage ist 1a man ist wirklich in wenigen Gehminuten mitten in der City.
Wir hatten keine Verpflegung gebucht - ist auch nicht notwendig: Food Court, Restaurants, 7/11, 2 Bro's Pizza und vieles vieles mehr ist sehr schnell zu erreichen!
Wir empfehlen dieses Hotel + New York Pass und es wird ein super Städtetrip!
Die beiden Aufzüge sind wirklich etwas langsam, aber alles in allem war es in Ordnung von den Wartezeiten.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Central location very close to Times Square. Very comfortable beds. Rooms not huge but adequate for our needs as did not spend much time there. Breakfast room was a little small but we managed to get a seat every morning. Quite a good choice. Free wifi for a definite bonus.

title: 房间不大， 但超级干净，整洁的
text: 酒店很方便，步行去时代广场3分钟，旁边的巴士站也可以直接换地铁和去肯尼迪机场的直达巴士 酒店楼层很高， 我住的高层房 还可以在晚上看到帝国大厦亮灯的夜景。 就是传统的美国酒店， 房间不是很大， 但超级干净，整洁的。

title: Cumple
text: Muy bien ubicado en referencia a Time Square, accesos rápidos al subway y habitación cómoda y limpia. Servicio básico de desayuno. Atención del personal suficiente y no destaca en nada especial. Terraza algo sucia aunque entretenida por la diversidad de pasajeros que se reúnen en ella al anochecer

title: Buon compromesso per posizione e servizi
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in occasione di Halloween noi 3 (2 adulti e un ragazzo di 16 anni) ed una famiglia di amici (2 adulti e 2 ragazzi di 17 e 18 anni).
Le camere effettivamente sono piuttosto piccole ma il tempo trascorso dentro è limitato solo al momento del sonno quindi noi non abbiamo riscontrato problemi. In camera c'è veramente tutto quello che viene riportato nel sito. Le stanze sono ben pulite e viene rimpiazzato tutto ogni giorno. Avrebbero bisogno di un ammodernamento.  Noi avevamo prenotato tramite booking un'offerta di "camera con vista città" ed in effetti ci è stata assegnata (27° piano). Abbiamo goduto della vista dell'Empire così come di un tramonto stupendo. Per il fatto di essere così in alto non abbiamo avuto problemi di rumori e abbiamo dormito benissimo. Avevo fatto richiesta di 2 camere vicine ed in effetti è stato tenuto presente assegnandoci 2 camere su 2 piani vicini (27 e 28).Noi non abbiamo avuto problemi di ascensore e sovraffollamente perchè scendevamo a fare colazione alle 7 e mi pare che qualche problema di sovraffollamento ci sia dalle 8 in avanti. Così come per la colazione abbiamo sempre trovato posto nella saletta. La colazione è abbastanza varia e tipica americana con dolce e salato, camerieri disponibili per eventuali richieste particolari (non c'era latte caldo e io lo facevo scaldare). Alla reception sono stati tutti estremamente gentili fino all'ultimo giorno in cui abbiamo chiesto di lasciare i bagagli una volta liberata la camera. Preziosa la presenza di 2 PC con stampante nella hall che abbiamo sfruttato per acquisto e stampa dei biglietti per il Top of the rock e per la stampa dei biglietti aerei. Poco distante da Times Square e da tutte le principali attrazioni. Sicuramente il prezzo è vantaggioso per le famiglie da 4 (tenete presente che si dorme in 2 letti alla francese) mentre diventa un po' più impegnativo economicamente per quelle da 3 perchè la camera costa uguale. Rimane, secondo me, una ottima soluzione soprattutto per il fatto che c'è la colazione compresa e restano fuori solo le tasse e l'imposta di soggiorno, mentre negli altri hotel ti aggiungono altri costi per servizi. Consigliato.

title: Small Hotel
text: I've stayed at many Holiday Inn Expresses all over and this one is tiny. Tiny lobby, rooms, breakfast.  Elevators take a long time because there are so many floors.  Good location to Times Square, Theater District and Hell's Kitchen and within walking distance to all.

title: Very nice stay
text:
We spent 5 nights at holiday in express in August 2016 and we were very happy regarding the welcome. the staff is very helpful and great. The room was clean and we had a small view of the Empire State Building. The location was very good, the hotel is near time square and everything in the upper side of manhattan.
The only bémol is the breakfast: it is very good for a free breakfast but it is open to the guest of the hotels around the holiday inn and so very crowded. 
We recommend kindly the hotel.

title: Very solid quiet and comfortable
text: Very pleasant comfortable stay. Very convenient to MSG, Times Square, and other attractions. Amazing how quiet the hotel was. Room was small but that is par for the course. Very quiet stay in a very busy place!

title: Ótimo hotel ...excelente localização e funcionários atenciosos
text: Fiquei por 5 dias no hotel . No início houve um contratempo com meu cartão porém foi prontamente resolvido pela equipe do hospital. Receberam minhas encomendas sem nenhum custo. Wifi um pouco instável porem de boa qualidade. A localização não poderia ser melhor, próximo as principais atrações e com shutter para os outlets e aeroportos. O quarto um pouco pequeno porém bem no padrão da cidade . O café muito bom para os padrões novaiorquinos, e embora o espaço seja pequeno a equipe organiza de forma a minimizar esse problema. Excelente para um casal.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: Our room was clean and around the size that you see for NYC. Not generous, but comfortable. It had a frig and coffee machine in it. The beds were comfortable and I appreciated the room darkening shades. The breakfast was good that came with our stay. The area is quite cramped though. It gave us an opportunity to meet other people from around the world though as we struck up conversations with them since we were so closely seated. :) I am a light sleeper and not used to street noise, so I found it to be noisy. You could readily hear conversations in the hallway. That is what knocks this down. For the price, this was a very good choice.

title: zentral gelegen
text:
Hotel zentral gelegen. Zimmer sauber, aber leicht veraltet. Kein deutscher Fernsehsender, schade, da man ja auch mal ausspannen will zwischendurch.
Frühstück sehr karg. Kaffee rund um die Uhr. Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Kamen auch mit spärllichen Englischkenntnissen zurecht. 1. Mal in USA:

title: Nice for a four night stay
text: My wife, daughter and I were in NYC for a long weekend to celebrate our daughter's 21st birthday. Her primary interest was seeing a few Broadway shows. We made it to 3 during our 4 night stay. This hotel was within a reasonable walking distance to everything that we wanted to do. Our room had 2 double beds and was pretty cramped, but everything was in working order. The WiFi worked well and breakfast was better than expected. The breakfast staff and the front desk staff did a great job. We would recommend this hotel.

title: Hotel a due passi da Time Square
text:
Hotel posizionato nel cuore della grande Mela. Comodo alla stazione ferroviaria e alla metropolitana. 
Pulito con la colazione compresa nel prezzo.
Le stanze sono un po piccole e in quattro è decisamente difficile muoversi .. bisogna organizzarsi al mattino per fare i turni.
Io ci sono stata lo scorso anno per 10 gg
Purtroppo c'è stato un errore di prenotazione e hanno prenotato una stanza con un KINGBED per 4 persone ... le ragazze della reception hanno però risolto in 1 gg la situazione e dalla seconda notte abbiamo avuto una stanza con 2 bei lettoni .

title: מלון מדהים, מיקום מצוין
text:
מלון במקום יחסית שקט, במרחק 10 דק הליכה מהטייס סקוור, צוות מדהים ,לבבי וחביב שרק רוצה לעזור, עם חיוך תמיד ובנימוס. חדר נקי מרווח, אמבטיה נראית כמשופצת וחדשה, קרמיקה יפה , ארון לתלית בגדים בחדר עם כספת, ומגירות לבגדים. הייתה לנו בעיה באמבטיה , ביקשנו לסדר ולמחרת הכל טופל.
המחיר כולל ארוחת בוקר שבהחלט הספיקה והחזיקה אותנו עד לשעות הצבריים המאוחרות.
ביקשנו חדר בקומה גבוהה וקיבלנו, הבעיה היחידה שהמלון לרוב עמוס וצריך לקחת בחשבון את זמן ההמתנה למעלית, במיוחד בעזיבה אם ממהרים.
ממליצה בחום רב

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: Stayed here for 3 nights after a trans-Atlantic cruise. You can walk to many of the New York attactions, for example Times Square is only 10 minutes walk. We were in room 1502, and as others have said the rooms are a bit small, but we managed fine with 3 suitcases. The hotel and room are kept clean and the front desk staff and the consiege were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is fine with a few hot choices, but the breakfast room is too small and got very crowded at times. There are only 2 lifts which is not really enough. We could hear the noise from the lifts and the air con was loud as well.

title: Great location
text:
Perfectly located near public transportation and Times Square.

The elevators do not seem to be fast enough for the number of floors, especially when house service is using them as well.

Over all great experience will return

title: Perfect for Solo girl travellers
text:
good location. simple and clean rooms, no frills hotel. The breakfast was a good spread and had good options to choose from. Stayed here for 4 nights as this was my solo trip to NYC and its a safe hotel for women travelers like me. 
Its a few blocks walking distance from Times Square.

title: Holiday break
text: Very good hotel,buffet style breakfast ,tea and coffee available at all  times,hotel staff very helpfull at all times ,very central to all amenities,easy access uptown,downtown Manhattan.5mins from time square

title: Ottimo
text: Hotel  in ottima posizione   nelle vicinanze di times square  e vicino alla metro .stanze non grandi ma curate  e pulite ,personale professionale e gentile  sempre pronto per consigli.perfetto per le  coppie .

title: Good position
text: Very central position for all the sights. Close to subway so can explore further around Manhattan. Clean bedrooms although slightly small but we hardly spent anytime apart for sleeping and showering, which was very large. Breakfast was excellent, better than we thought it would be. Plenty of bars and restaurants close by. We recommend this hotel

title: I'd stay here again
text: Simple, clean and in a fairly convenient location. Henry at the front desk was awesome. The staff were all wonderful - except the cleaning staff who insisted on talking non-stop outside our room the entire time they worked on our floor in the AM. Rooms are very small but who cares, we spent no time in there except to sleep. breakfast is tough to get - it's very crowded in there. My friend broke her tooth on one of the biscuits and it's an expensive fix. Thank God I didn't have any of that to eat. There are lots of places in the area to have a bite so no worries. Be sure to note that no two New Yorkers will give you the same instructions on how to get somewhere by train. Be very aware of that and have a good map.

title: Overnight stay
text:
Pro: Room was clean & staff was friendly. Was able to print our boarding passes for next day flight. Didn't get to have breakfast bc our flight was early am.

Con: We had packages delivered here that were unable to be found when we checked in. Not exactly great customer service since I called prior to booking to ensure this was allowed. 

Room wasn't ready when we arrived & we were plenty exhausted after flying for 13hrs. It was prior to 4pm check in though so not entirely their fault, just inconvenient but it's NYC. Stored our luggage as we went about the city sightseeing. Not bad

title: Lovely budget hotel
text:
We stayed at the holiday inn express from the 23rd October to 27th October. The hotel itself is in a perfect location, just round the corner from Times Square and in a great location for visiting most midtown attractions and is still close enough to walk to Central Park and downtown manhattan. 
The rooms are a tad small but the beds are comfy, bathrooms good and you have everything you need for a few nights stay in the city. I would definitely recommend asking for a city view room. 
There were only a few minor problems I had with the hotel. The pillows in the bedroom are too soft for my personal preference. They are labelled soft and firm but they all feel incredibly soft. The room could do with a small fridge just for putting in drinks overnight, we had to buy fresh bottles of water daily as there was no fridge to keep it cool. This isn't a bit issue, but can be a bit of a pain when you need to buy fresh bottles of water daily, especially if your staying in the warmer weather. And lastly they could do with a small shop, their sister hotel (candlewood located next door) has a small shop where you scan your keycard, get your items and pay at reception. A little facility like this would be extremely useful just for basics like drinks etc. 
Overall the hotel is fantastic, staff are friendly and always willing to help.

title: Worst HI Express property
text:
First visit to New York, so maybe this is normal. I've stayed at over 30 Holiday Inn properties and this was the worst property but triple the rate of other cities. Service was very good, but rooms were tiny and in bad need of renovation. Their website states "modern accommodations". Maybe it was modern in 1970. 

Excellent location. Short walk to Times Square. 

Only 6 rooms per floor so every room is close to the elevator that sounds like the subway. Front desk put us on 29th floor with a "view". Our view was the side of the next building. Bathroom door would not close.

title: Cpomfortable Place to Stay Close to Times SQ
text:
Check in was easy, we were allowed to check in 4 hours before the normal check in time, which was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was adequate size with King Size bed and 4 pillows. Also had a desk and office chair, Internet data cable, free WIFI, coffee pot with tea and coffee, iron and ironing board, in room safe, flat screen TV and cable channels, and a living room chair. They have 2 elevators, but wait times were not long.

The bath room was ample size with tub and shower head, shampoo, conditioner and body lotion available along with soap.  

The hotel also has an adequate free buffet type breakfast, with pancakes, various rolls, biscuits, eggs, sausage, fruit, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and butter and spreads, and other times I'm sure I forgot. 

There was a porter to help with bags at check in.  We were on the 20th floor, no view except the building next door, but we had a good, comfortable, one night stay. 

We were looking for something decent but  inexpensive, but of course, in Manhattan there is not anything decent for a lower price. We booked the AAA rate which according to the hotel is the lowest, but who knows.

title: Good hotel
text: Stayed here for 3 nights....and I really liked it...the breakfast was good the staff was amazing the hotel itself was good...just 1 problem though 36 floors at operated by just 2 lifts so it gets to be a long wait sometimes....

title: Comfortable stay in a superb location!
text:
Considering shocking hotel prices in Manhattan we were looking for nothing fancy but simple clean accommodation to keep the cost reasonable (real challenge btw!). I am glad we booked Holiday Inn Express. The price was reasonable to stay in Midtown (not cheap by any means), our room was comfortable and although small - very clean and we had everything we needed! I thought “continental” breakfast was fantastic and every day on top of warm pastries, pancakes and fresh bagels we were offered Greek yogurt, eggs, omelet with turkey sausages or bacon. Can’t complain when it is included in your room rate! Staff that works in cafeteria is amazing and super friendly (as well as super patient to deal with so many people going in and out and looking for a table in a not so big eating area! :) 2 small elevators for so many floors/rooms were definitely not enough and during breakfast time it felt like you were waiting to go up or down forever.
We didn’t use their parking/valet services. Since we were not planning to use our car for the 4 days we were there – we found a cheaper option and simply made a reservation and prepaid for underground garage in Chelsea area for half price and kept our car there for the full stay.
Plenty of restaurants and places to eat around the hotel as well as convenience stores. HK Hell Kitchen restaurant next to the hotel is amazing: trendy atmosphere, amazing food and friendly staff! Location of the hotel is fantastic – very close to Times Square yet away from all the noise, walking distance to Central Park, shopping and plenty of other major NYC attractions.
 
We were happy with our stay and would definitely stay there again!

title: Great stay
text: I stayed here for one night and the hotel provided a good stop-over. Henry provided a great check-in - personal, friendly - giving me everything I needed without being over-scripted. The room was great - very clean and presented - a credit to housekeeping. Fantastic city views from the room. I particularly appreciated the service to look after my bags on the morning I left. Great breakfast service. Just be aware that if the description leads you to believe this hotel is located on Times Square, it isn't. IHG should amend the title. This isn't to criticise the location - times square, central park, the empire state building are all within a few minutes walk.

title: hotel
text: buen hotel, la estacion del metro esta a 3 cuadras. Hay que tomar su tiempo para cuando uno sale o entra por las mañanas ya que cuenta con solo 2 elevadores y en ocaciones se saturan. el desayunador, demaciado pequeño. en general, buen hotel

title: Semi-convenient
text:
Short weekend trip to NYC booked by a friend. They had the three-sharing rooms, which is why we booked it, but a friend pulled out last minute so it was wasted anyway. Prices are similar to the garden inn, and you'd probably get more service there. You'd be hard pressed to get a smile at the check-in desk, in fact the lady at the woodsbury common concierge desk was more friendly, she approached us kindly with a city map while we were waiting around. 
Very basic hotel, some rooms tiny, some rooms small. My advice would be to get the double twin bed instead of single king, there's more space here. Clean enough, but the rooms are so cramped full of useless furniture like cupboards and dressers. 
No view, but no need. 
I guess you'd hardly be spending time in your room in NYC, but if you want to relax and unwind in your room, this isn't the place to be. 
There's a concierge who can arrange a shuttle to Woodsbury Common - we didn't have time to go. 
There's also breakfast included, but its very basic, I'd suggest to skip it, unless you're starving. Plenty of better calories available along the street outside! Also, the utensils and cutlery are disposable plastic and styrofoam. The hotel has a go green initiative - choose not to change towels and sheets daily, but all this just seems fake when they provide plastic and styrofoam plates and cups. 
Oh and there are only two lifts and during breakfast/peak hour, they take AGES TO COME and you often have to wait for a few lifts before you can fit in!

title: Super location
text:
Great  place... of course the rooms are smaller than Sofitel  round the corner...

Food on the breakfast buffet is great... a lot of make it yourself stuff...

The place is centre and so all the shopping ...maceys ....manhatten tower... bath and body works ...madison square ... everything is so close...

Immensely easy to get a UBER or NY TAXI yellow... just 60 $ flat to the JFK...
