The restaurant seems small , but in all the 7 days we never had to wait to get a place to sit.

The staff are busy but friendly.. Rubin was good to us...

title: Más de lo mismo
text:
Por el costo que se cancela, uno espera un servicio mucho mejor. 
El desayuno debe ser servido y llevado a la pieza, ya que el comedor es sumamente pequeño. Hay poca dotación de ascensores, lo que hace la fila interminable para subir a desayunar. 
En la recepción no hay personas de habla hispana, al menos cuando yo me traté de comunicar. 
La limpieza está bastante bien, el equipo de mantención trabaja bien.

title: Back to Basics
text:
I recently spent a weekend in New York where my accommodation plans fell through. I needed a hotel, and fast. I walked in to the Holiday Inn Express and was thankfully able to book a room for that night and the night following. The front desk clerk was friendly, approachable, and genuine. He quickly booked me into a room and I was on my way within minutes. 

I went upstairs to my room on the 20th floor and was very satisfied. The room was very clean, spacious (by New York standards), and well laid out. The king size bed was very comfortable and the linens were soft and cozy. The pillows were soft and fluffy, making for two great nights of sleep. Upon unpacking, I phoned the front desk to ask for more coat hangers and they promptly brought up the exact number that I had requested. The bathroom was spotless, with plenty of towels and shelf space for my toiletries. The room also had a safe, an iron, and an ironing board which was handy. Overall I was perfectly content with the room. Nothing flashy, but very clean, comfortable and enjoyable. 

One thing I wanted to mention was the speediness of the elevator. I think there were 33 or 36 floors in the building, and only two elevators. I don't think I ever waited more than 15 seconds for an elevator. It was awesome. 

On an aesthetic note, the front of the hotel was decorated with pumpkins and hay and looked rather charming. Made my autumn trip to New York all the more autumn-like. The gentleman that worked at the front door were always friendly, saying hello, smiling, and bustling around. In combination with the great front desk staff I felt welcomed throughout my time there.

On a constructive note, the concierge staff did not stand up to the welcoming standards of the other staff mentioned. Every time I entered the lobby the concierge was sitting behind their desk, looking rather disinterested and not overly happy to be there. On the one occasion that I did approach their desk to ask for a map and directions, the girl didn't even stand up to greet me or attempt to initiate any sort of conversation or banter. I would have rather received a map from the front desk and had more decorative barrels of hay replace the concierge desk. 

I never made it down for the complimentary breakfast in the morning, but was very impressed that that was even offered. Great touch!

Overall, the Holiday Inn Express nailed all the basics of a good hotel. Nothing flashy or fancy, but a good solid basic stay. I very much enjoyed my time there.

title: Good Location
text:
This hotel is in a good walking location just off Times Square.  Close to the subway station, Walk to Hudson River, Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller etc.... 

The hotel has a view of the Hudson River and skyline. 

The room was small, hotel was small but was clean.  Staff friendly minus the younger con siege lady handling bookings and shuttles.  Very rude dismissive. Her boss had to get her off the a personal phone call to look after us plus the day before she told us to get our own cab.  Lol

This hotel had a continental breakfast which was a bonus not having to pay for breakfast.  It was decent.  

Would stay there again.

title: Ok better than other hotels in time square area
text:
Nice small descent hotel
Very convenient when you want to walk around Central Park & visit the zoo; whoever wants to enjoy shopping & see the colorful night and wish to spend between $400- $500 a night, this hotel is definitely in the bucket, bed is comfortable likewise the shower is clean though tiny but we expect less room hotel space in NY time square, so not disappointed 
Checkin was quite efficient too as a member, we didn't have issue with elevator though we were @18th flr☺️
Metro & bus stations are also within few minutes walk, I suggest not to take taxi, waste of time being stuck in traffic

title: Cercano a la acción
text: Es un hotel pequeño pero muy cómodo. Los desayunos están muy bien, siempre hay pan, mermelada, queso crema, omelettes, salchichas, frutas, yogurt, té, café y chocolate...hay para todos los gustos y si pides que te envuelvan para llevar un dulce, te lo acomodan en una bolsa con una botella de agua (grandioso detalle). La habitación es pequeña pero super limpia y super cómoda. Mi sugerencia sería que dejen al menos una botella de agua de cortesía en la habitación para en la noche no tener que bajar a buscar agua. Además lo más importante es que está muy cerca de Time Square, se llega rapidito caminando, al igual que a estaciones del metro. Excelente Wi fi. Sé que algunos pensarán que está algo caro para ser un hotel "express" pero lo que estás pagando es estar cerca del centro de la ciudad.

title: Quiet location in Times Square
text: The hotel is in pretty good location in Times Square. It is almost walking distance to everything in Times Square but the hotel is actually in a quiet location, which we all loved. We all had a good night sleep. The room was pretty small compared to the HI Express we stayed at. They still offered the complimentary continental breakfast. My only concern was the elevator. It had a long time to get in and out of the elevator. There were only 2 elevators for the entire property so you had to make sure that you give extra time if you are in a rush or if you have an appointment. The staff in the breakfast area were both amazing! They kept the food trays refilled at all times. They were also very enthusiastic and helpful to guests who didnt have seat. They were there to help sit the guests and not only refill the breakfast food trays. They went above and beyond to make the guests feel accommodated. The guy, who works there and unfortunately, whom I forgot his name, was amazing! Although the breakfast area was small and has very limited space, it didnt matter to the guests because of him.

title: Average and Expensive Hotel
text:
Selected this because I was familiar with the name.  But the room was cramped, Food average and stay expensive.

This also is in the middle of NY and walk able distance from Times Square.

Dont keep this as the  first option

title: Just what we needed!
text: From what I have heard/read about New York hotels, this Holiday Inn Express exceeded my expectations. It is within easy walking distance of Times Square and the bus stops. The room wasn't oversized, but it was definitely larger than most cruse ship rooms. It was also very clean and felt safe. The breakfast also exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

title: Expres
text: Limpio, con desayuno completo, bien ubicado. Mucha gente en el desayuno y los ascensores...si no te molesta la multitud, todo estuvo genial! En la recepción nos atendieron muy bien y trataron siempre de satisfacer necesidades y pedidos.

title: Correcto
text: Hotel céntrico, limpio, habitación correcta, limpia y con cama muy cómoda. A cinco minutos andando de Times Square, y a tres del metro, salón del desayuno un poco pequeño, pero correcto. Personal muy amable.

title: Nice little spot to rest your head
text: Great location to broadway shows, Time Square and about very walkable to Central Park (1.4 miles).  We did not want to spend big bucks on a hotel room that we were literally only going to sleep in.  The beds here and bedding were actual very comfortable and the size of the rooms are typical NYC size.  However the AC that cuts on and off all night was super loud.  2 elevators serve the hotel and the longest we had to wait was probably 5ish minutes during prime time.  Toiletries are from Bath & Body works, not horrid, not the best.  I would recommend this hotel if you wanted to spend your money on shows, great food, and shopping. We took Uber from LGA to hotel and did a Uber share about $20 and the return trip we did the shuttle and it was $60 both were convenient.  Take comfortable shoes, we logged about 8 miles a day.

title: Posizione strategica
text:
Personale gentile e disponibile sia alla reception sia nella sala della colazione. Camera pulita ma molto piccola soprattutto per due letti da una piazza e mezzo, aria  condizionata funzionante, colazione abbondante purtroppo con poca scelta. Strategico per i vari spostamenti; a tre isolati una stazione metro che permette di raggiungere sia uptown e midtown (le zone delle maggiori attrazioni di Manhattan.
Mi è piaciuto soprattutto la posizione e la pulizia e non mi è piaciuto la mancanza di una sala di attesa e sala per la colazione troppo piccole per il numero dei clienti ospitati.

title: A good choice for lodging near the theater district
text:
Clean and comfortable, the Holiday Inn Express NYC Times Square was a good choice for a weekend trip into the city.  We were greeted with warmth and enthusiasm, and upgraded to a room on a high floor with a great view of the Empire State Building and the World Trade Center Liberty Tower.
The breakfast area wasn't very large, but the staff was efficient and friendly, and kept the food well stocked and the tables clean.  They even helped guests find seating and assisted them with their food & coffee.  
Thanks to Caroline and Ashanti, I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great service
text: Stayed here for a few days, everything was perfect, staff is great. Pop here for bussines and this hotel didnt dissapointed me. Has everything you can ask for. I will comd back and I will recommend it to my colleagues at work.

title: Night manager was amazing!
text: Flew in late for my birthday and he made the night for my husband and I and gave us an awesome city view room! Great breakfast buffet and clean rooms! Loved the location and would definitely stay here again!

title: Holiday Inn Express NYC Times Square – getting worse from visit to visit
text:
I stayed one night at this hotel. 
I come to this hotel 1-2 times annually and it is very sad to see how it goes down in the level of service.
The small restaurant is still too small for the hotel, and guests have to push each other and to take the food to the room.
The line for the elevator is still long. You have to take spare time for the elevator.
I complained to a lady at the front desk who presented herself as the manager of this hotel regarding the bonus point's strategy ("per stay" and not "per night"). She took a phone call while we were speaking and was extremely impolite. All she cared about was to whom I was sending an email before my arrival regarding this issue.
It seems like I have to find another hotel during my next trips to NYC. This is not a "home" anymore.

title: 立地が良いです
text:
JFK空港から地下鉄で移動しようと思ったのでＥラインの駅から近い場所を選びました。
ポートオーソリティからは１ブロックほどで8thAve.沿いでとても分かりやすかったです。
こじんまりとしたホテルで部屋は上層階でハドソン川が窓から見える位置でした。
部屋やバスルームはきれいで気持ちよく使えました。
付属品も記載されている通りでした。

今回、無料の朝食が付いていたら便利だなと思いこのホテルに決めたのですが、実際、朝、朝食を食べようとフロントに問い合わせたらそのようなサービスはないと言われました。
なんだかすごく損した気分です。
元々無いことが前提であればどうと言うことはないのですが、、、
結局、朝食は出かけるついでに食べたり、コンビニで購入したりと不自由はありませんでしたが、やっぱり不満は募りますね。

また、朝、9時ぐらいのエレベータはすごく混みます。
元々日本のエレベータの様にスムーズに動くタイプではないのもありますが、早目に出発しないとエレベータに乗れるまで10分ぐらい待つこともありました。
低層階であれば階段を使うと言う手もありますが22階だととてもとても階段で降りると言う気にはなりませんね。

それ以外はコストパフォーマンスから見て良いホテルだと思います。

title: Unser Geheimtipp für den perfekten CityTrip nach New York City!
text:
Wir sind als Paar schon öfter durch die USA gereist und landen auch jedes Mal in New York, hier übernächtigen wir immer in verschiedenen Hotels um uns weiter zu bilden und uns die verschiedenen Vielfältigkeiten, auch bei den Hotels, aufzunehmen. Allerdings muss ich sagen, das wir seit 5 Jahren das erste Mal so glücklich und zufrieden waren wie noch nie! Das Hotel ist sauber, der Service 1a, Preis-Leistung ist wirklich super!!!! Wir bevorzugen für unsere nächste Reise nach New York wieder das Holiday INN Express am Times Square, da wir uns hier sehr sehr wohl gefühlt haben. Von uns gibt es 5 von 5 Sternen!!! Vom Service bis zur Reinlichkeit ("und das ist in NEW York nicht einfach"), vom Aufbau der Zimmer bis hin zur Erreichbarkeit der Sehenswürdigkeiten - einfach der Wahnsinn! 

Wir reisen wirklich viel und auch in viele Städte und sind in sehr vielen Hotels auf der Welt gewesen, aber für New York haben wir dieses in unser Herz geschlossen!

Unser kleiner Geheimtipp!

title: bon hotel
text: bon hotel tres bien situé,à coté de la gare routiere et à 5 minutes de time square,personnel agréable,chambre au 36 eme étage avec vu magnifique,seul point negatif:le petit dejeuner,pas beaucoup de choix et souvent beaucoup de monde,à part ça je recommande vivement !

title: upgrade Please
text: The location took me by surprise, stench the streets ,Enter the Staff was friendly but several people waiting to be booked in, Priority Membership did not mean anything, the condition need upgrade....

title: Decent hotel, shame about the area
text:
I didn't feel safe around the hotel at night
Staff were lovely
Air conditioning loud
Easy to get to places, so long as you turn left when leaving the hotel and are in a group
Lifts can be a little slow
Breakfast is a basic as expected

title: bang for the buck
text: Good place to stay for business and leisure. Stood there with my family and enjoyed the Big apple, walking around. Good salumeria at the corner and very close to Times Square. the rooms are very small and the breakfast is a bit disappointing, but the staff is friendly and the price was exactly what i expected.

title: Times square, times square
text: if you look to be right at the center, this is an excellent choice ! just what you need, quick and efficient service, clean, free and good Wifi. Average price and worth it, with a very good breakfast that can keep you satisfied until your lunch.

title: Convenient to Times Square
text: Based on the prices that I've seen for other New York Hotels, this was a bargain for around $200 a night.  As stated with previous reviews, the rooms are quite small, but all I need was a place to sleep while sightseeing in NY.  Free WiFi was great.  Breakfast was good, but you'll get a better selection and smaller crowds early.  The only complaint I had was that I wished the room came with a mini fridge.  On the bright side, I didn't have any problems with waiting for the elevators.

title: Good location
text: Small room for the price paid. However I guess thats NY for you. Also the location cant be beat, located next to Herald Square. The worlds biggest Macy's is there, and if you like Japanese food, Izakaya Mew is in the next lane. Breakfast was sufficient, beds comfortable. If you want to go to JFK, ask the hotel to arrange as its convenient and cheaper

title: Solo la posizione è ottima
text: La camera sporca con una moquette da cambiare, aria condizionata inesistente, ho soggiornato ad agosto solo ventilazione colazione caotica se si arrivava ad un certo orario si mangiava altrimenti si si doveva accontentare, infine problemi con la carta di credito, la reception ha sbagliato l'addebito comunque poi risolto

title: Great locations and nice staff
text:
We stayed here for two nights on the 30th floor. Everything went smoothly, staff was nice and helpful and the rooms were clean. This hotel doesn't have the largest rooms, but they were comfortable with good beds. That's everything we needed while staying in the city. The location was amazing! We could easily walk everywhere we wanted for such a short stay; Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Broadway for example. We had breakfast the morning we left. Neither of us eats much in the mornings, but the buffet was good.. the omelet was amazing! I just wish I could have eaten more.
All in all, a good hotel for the value. I really value good staff at hotels I stay at, and this hotel definitely has very nice and friendly staff. I would recommend it to everyone that stays there to explore the city.

title: bom custo beneficio
text: otimo custo beneficio, otima localizacao. so tem um problema os elevadores nao comportam entao demora-se para descer. mas o atendimento e otimo a limpeza e boa. a localizacao nao poderia ser melhor proximo ao terminal de onibus, etc

title: Home away from home
text: I really am not a big fan of NYC or Times Square but my business brings me there.  I love going to the bar on Monday night and seeing Keith.  He knows everyone at the bar.  Introduces us to each other and remembers everything about you from the previous visit.  It's a pleasure to visit because of him!

title: Bon rapport qualité/prix
text:
Hôtel très bon rapport qualité/prix, bien placé, proche de Times Square.
La chambre était très propre, le personnel souriant et à l'écoute. Seul hic l'attente pour l'ascenseur qui peut être longue par moment..
Mais je conseille vivement l'hôtel.

title: Adequate accomadation
text:
Like all Holiday Inn Express, the rooms were adequate and served it's purpose for what we needed. 
The air condition in the main hotel and our room was brilliant. Would not have got by without it.
The staff were really helpful and friendly. They all were readily available to answers any questions or give us direction s and advice when needed.
The breakfasts were adequate although the dining area was a bit on the small side and became quite cramped very quickly. Although there was coffee available 24hrs a day there was a lack of basic milk. Instead they supplied flavoured milk which quite frankly doesn't taste good in tea

title: A evaluar
text:
Punto a favor: incluye desayuno y cafetería gratuita todo el día...
Excelente ubicación (5 minutos caminando de Times Square, 10 del Empire State y varios más)
Desventaja: tiene 2 ascensores de espacio limitado para un edificio de 36 Pisos..
Desayunos poco variados y lo q si o si deben mejorar es el espacio de los desayunos... Es poco amplio, pequeñísimo!!

title: Great location and very friendly staff
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights as a family of four, therefore we had a double room. The room size and beds are very small, however, I am aware this is typical of NY. The check in was relatively quick and we were given our room straight away. Our room and bathroom was very clean, we were given fresh towels every day and our rooms were tidied as well (sheets are not changed unless requested). The bathroom only had 3 small toiletries for a family of 4 which is a small amount but this didn't bother us as we had our own shower gel/shampoo etc. We were on the 24th floor and didn’t have much of a view (it was of another building). We had no issues sleeping being quite high up, nor did we have any noise from the elevator despite being next to it. We never had to wait longer than 5 minutes for an elevator during peak times.
The breakfast was filling, there was; bread, bagels, yogurt, cereal, eggs, pancakes and more. We often found a place in the breakfast area even during peak times (8.30 – 9.30). We did see a lot of people taking food upstairs but this would have been quite a feat for us given we were high up. The breakfast staff were amazing and cheerful every single morning. We had to have an early breakfast one day before 6.30 and the male chef and another lady were so kind and helpful in giving us what we wanted to eat – thank you so much for this. 
There is tea, coffee and water available throughout the day near the breakfast area and cold lemonade in the lobby which is wonderful after a tiring day!
The concierges were very helpful every morning, they would help us map out metro stops, which line to get, best walking routes and helped us book transport to airport ($88 to EWR!). 
Times Square is a good 10 minutes away, sometimes longer due to pedestrian traffic. Otherwise, EST was walkable distance, along with Penn Station and Port Authority Bus Terminal. We used a MetroCard for last few days so didn’t do much walking. We usually ate pizza places or food carts where there are many around the area.
I would stay here again if there was a bigger room size as this was my only issue, apart from that, everything was wonderful down to location, breakfast and staff.

title: Good value for money
text: We stayed in holiday inn express on 39 street for 5 nights. The hotel was located just few minutes from Times Square so it was very central. The breakfast was included and we could fill our tray and take it to our room if we wanted! The rooms were smallish but that's the norm in NYC.

title: Bon plan pour visiter NY en voyage scolaire !
text:
Un vrai bon plan pour visiter NY, bon rapport qualité/prix. Nous avions fait ce choix pour venir avec une classe (22 élèves) en avril. A quelques rues de Time Square, génial !
Les chambres sont petites mais confortables, très propres et le personnel très souriant, accueillant et disponible pour débloquer une poignée de valise récalcitrante par exemple ! la capacité d'accueil de la salle du petit dèj est petite mais les plats proposés sont typiques : les jus de fruits sucrés à l'américaine (très sucrés), les yaourts même de marque connue en France ont également une texture bien particulière... à découvrir... c'est pour cela qu'on aime voyager et non pour retrouver ses habitudes.

title: Very good location but the elevator...
text:
This hotel is in a very good location. Close to Times Square & subways. 
However the elevator takes a long time to come. Two elevators that serve more than 20 floors!
The rooms are also very tiny -- we have a 2 double bed room. We had barely room to move.  I also thought that being in a high floor will mean view. But I forgot I was in NY -- with a lot of skyscapers. So my view was the other building 😕.
Anyway the restaurant serves good food. The gyro tasted almost, if not the same, as the one I had in Greece.
Will come back again if I am back in NY.

title: perfetto
text:
Abbiamo alloggiato presso questo hotel a Novembre 2015 e ci siamo trovati molto bene! La stanza era piccola ma pulita e aveva tutto il necessario. La cosa fantastica è che si trova a 5 minuti a piedi da times square! Da li, con la metro, è possibile raggiungere comodamente ogni posto. 
Alla reception erano tutti molto gentili.

title: Ideale per visitare la città
text:
La struttura è in posizione ideale per visitare NY. Infatti l' hotel sorge a pochi passi da Times Square, Madison Square Garden ed Empire State Building. Le camere,la cui pulizia e sostituzione salviette avviene quotidianamente, non sono grandi ed arredate in maniera pratica (ma d'altronde se uno va a NY da turista, in hotel va solo a dormire). La colazione a buffet è ottima anche se poco varia. Personale gentile e disponibile (l'asciugacapelli della mia camera è stato sostituito dopo solo 5 minuti che avevo indicato alla reception che non funzionava). WiFi gratis in tutta la struttura (cosa che permette di chiamare tramite applicazioni, in Italia, gratuitamente).Unico punto forse un po' negativo è l'attesa che a volte occorre fare per prendere l'ascensore (ma si parla al max di 5 min).
Consigliato.

title: Great place
text:
We went for a quick trip over a Friday to a Saturday. EVERYONE- front desk, breakfast, valet... Were all VERY hospitable. They went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful. 
The room is really tiny, but who comes to NYC to sit in the room? 
Breakfast was great! Eggs, sausage and gravy. Pancakes, yogurt, cereal, and oatmeal. As well as muffins and I think bagels. 
There are only 2 elevators and when waiting to take the elevator down... We waited for a several minutes only to find that the elevator was crammed with way too many people- like squished! I said... I'll take the stairs. It was only 7 flights down. 
Walking everywhere- very convenient to Times Square, the Empire State Building. For a family who had never spent any time in NYC- it was a perfect location. 
The rudest people in NYC were the cab drivers- whom we didn't use... But they LAY on the horn. 
We will be staying here again! Very clean and above and beyond accommodating us!

title: Ottima posizone
text: La posizione di questo hotel è strategica per i turisti, centrale vicino a Times Square, tutto a portata di mano. Buona la colazione a buffet, con varie scelte dolci e salate.  Staff cordiale. Unico appunto che potrei fare, un suggerimento direi, è che una catena come questa dovrebbe disporre di navette per gli aeroporti a prezzi vantaggiosi. Noi ci siamo ritrovati a pagare la stessa cifra di un taxi privato per uno shuttle in condivisione con altri hotel.

title: 爛透的服務行為
text: 我們因為地點好，評價高而入住了3個晚上，原本愉快的旅程，以及早餐服務人員的熱情招呼，一切覺得很美好。但是最後一個非常令人不愉快的事情發生，讓我們對於飯店的服務大失所望。我們遺留在飯店的物品，在check out兩小時之內已經想起，並立即聯絡飯店，但是櫃台人員完全不在乎，不理會，不想讓我們留下任何資訊，也不想立即幫我們確認是否物品遺留在房間(但是物品很大，我們很確定我們確實是遺留在房間內忘了帶走),從我們check out到現在，已經有3天的時間了，我們前前後後也撥了3回的電話至飯店，但仍然完全沒得到半點回應，讓我們覺得非常的失望。

title: Unfriendly concierge
text:
While here while in transit. The hotel is in a great location very close to Times Square and other attractions as well as the subway for easy transit throughout New York. The hotel staff - primarily the concierge that i had the dis pleasure of talking to was the rudest person i've met at a hotel. No greetings, one word answers and she definitely makes you feel like you're bothering her by asking her questions. Please train your concierge to be more customer focused. The checkin staff were great however the concierge left a very unmemorable impression.

Room wise, it's small and probably a squeeze for more than one person however it is an "Express" and at least my room had a good shower, clean sheets and free wifi. Breakfast was good with a wide variety to choose from. Probably more so than other Expresses i've stayed at.

title: נהדר
text:
מלון טוב ארוחת בוקר עשירה  יש מאפים ביקון חביתות   לעיתים עם גבינה  יש עמדת קפה וכל סוגי החלב כל היום ויש עמדת מיץ לימון בקרח ליד הכניסה המיקום נהדר. חדרים בגודל סביר בהחלט לניו יורק   המלון קרוב לכל מקום מוקף מסעדות וdeliנהדר ברחוב 44 על השישית. שבו ביקרנו שלוש פעמים
יש רק שתי מעליות אבל עולים מהר .הצוות מאד אדיב ומשתדל לעשות כל דבר למען האורחים

title: what i thought
text: I stayed in this hotel and thought the location was brilliant .there  was a nice comfy  bed and a modern  television ...the shower and bath was very dated it definitley needed updating .The  noise at night from the air condition unit was far to  noisy at night whilst sleeping most annoying for a peaceful night sleep ...teabags are not supplied either cant get them anyway ..but the worst problem was when we checked out ....we were told no use of the pool when we tryed to enter pool area  we were so much dissappointment when all we wanted to lay by pool ...and sun ourselves , the charge was $100 each person ,my mother was furious ...complaining three times nothing was done saying its there policy,  well you need  to make people aware its  absoulutely stupid, no one would pay $100 dollars to use pool ...maybe $20 .you can always stay and use facilities normally why should the holiday inn be different !!!!!!!

title: Hospedaje
text: La ubicación es excelente pero el desayuno es muy repetitivo todos lo día y básico y en hora pico el ascensor tarda demasiado por el volumen de personas que transitan a esa hora y la atención es regular

title: Great Hotel, even better customer service
text: Ended up at the Holiday Inn after another hotel messed up our reservation. They went out of there way to help and make sure we were comfortable. They kept offering us breakfast while things got sorted out. The manager went to the other hotel to sort out our car/parking situation. The room was clean and great! They turned what could have been a mess into a great experience.

title: جيد
text:
فندق جيد نوعا ما 
الايجابيات:
موقع استراتيجي في قلب منهاتن 
في ساحة تايم سكوير 
سرير مريح 
الحمام صغير 
يعيب الفندق :
اللوبي صغير و زحمة دائما  و الطاقم مشغول دائما وليس متعاون    
ارتفاع الأسعار 
الإفطار بسيط و غير متنوع 
ينفع ليكون للنوم فقط .

title: Cool place ...less than a km from Times Square
text: Very nice.  Convenient place to stay especially if you have 2-3 days to cover New York. Stayed for 3 nights. Complimentary breakfast option can be skipped..it's gets pretty crowded in the morning  as they have a very small breakfast place. So if you get a discount for booking without breakfast go aheaf

title: Tiny room with a good location
text: The room is small but well kept. The view was great from the city side room on 34th floor.The bed was comfortable. The air conditioner cannot be totally turned off, creating draft wind (to the bed which is near by) and slight noise all night. There are only two elevators so a lot of people couldn't get in for a long time at check out time. Convient shops and eateries near the hotel.

title: aceptable
text:
el precio es muy caro pero claro, es nueva york.
la habitación es modesta
esta bien situado
la limpieza es aceptable
servicio correcto

dormir en nueva york es carisimioooooooo, o es esto o un albergue..

title: Buen hotel, buena relación precio calidad
text:
Fuimos con mi familia a este hotel y lo que más nos gustó fue la atención del personal. Está bien ubicado, puedes llegar caminando a Time Square y todas las atracciones cerca de ese lugar. El desayuno es bastante variado y contundente.

Excelente relación precio/calidad.

title: A great reasonable place to stay in Manhattan
text: This hotel is in a group of tall skinny hotels. Only 6 rooms to each floor. We stayed on the top floor with a great view of lower Manhattan. We chose this location because we can in to NY on a bus to the Port Authority Terminal (only a couple blocks away. This also makes it very convenient for catching the subway. The middle of Times Square is about a 5 min walk. This also on the edge of Hell's Kitchen area. The free breakfast was in a nice area about the size of a small cafeteria. Very well run breakfast. It is also very reasonably priced for Manhattan. The only downside is they have only 2 elevators. In the mornings when housekeeping is working, they usually have one of the elevators tied up so everyone has to use one elevator. Just try to be out doing something at that time.

title: Se potete scappate
text:
Nel tornare a NY in nottata dopo un lungo giro negli Stati Uniti abbiamo fissato tre notti invogliati sia dalla posizione,che già conoscevamo,che dalla colazione compresa nel prezzo....all 'arrivo appare tutto molto squallido ..inoltre al ceck in ci accorgiamo che la mia carta di credito è  scarica la receptionist molto seccata da ciò ci chiede se ne abbiamo un altra le porgo l altra carta ma quando la striscia non legge il chip...chiediamo se lasciando i passaporti ci possano far passare la notte cosicché la mattina dopo avremmo risolto il problema...Neanche per sogno volevano essere pagati anche se andavamo via quindi ho saldato la prima notte con i pochi euro rimasti sulla prima carta ed il resto con tutti i contanti che avevo ed ho disdetto le altre due notti...la stanza era un buco dove nn si poteva neanche aprire la valigia. Moquette dire sporca è fare un complimento...ma il peggio è che non avevano cambiato le lenzuola ed il letto era impregnato da un odore di profumo dozzinale del cliente precedente..pezzi di unghie sulla Moquette...forcine per capelli...
la mattina la colazione devo dire abbondante è stata un assalto alla baionetta tutti in fila e in un microstanzino.per nn parlare degli ascensori che nn arrivavano mai
SE POTETE EVITATELO SULLA 39ST C'È NE SONO MOLTI ALTRI

title: Buon Hotel, Favolosa posizione
text: Hotel vicinissimo a Times Square, raggiungibile a piedi in meno di 10 minuti. Camere: Ho avuto modo di vedere sia la quadrupla che la doppia ed erano delle stesse dimensioni, quindi per due persone va bene, ma per quattro risulta davvero strettina, lo stesso vale per l'armadio davvero minuscolo. Hotel comunque pulito, personale cortese, molto disponibili le cameriere al mattino. La colazione tipica americana di mio gradimento. Sempre disponibili te e caffe americano, nel pomeriggio cioccolato caldo e biscotti. Distributori automatici ai piani e guide turistiche. Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo, considerando la colazione inclusa ed i costi dei bar americani. Consigliato.

title: Clean and close to Times Square
text:
We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Times Square and Broadway, and the price, and weren't disappointed.  Compared to suburban hotels, the room was a little small, but it was very clean.  The beds and pillows were comfy, and the room worked well for my husband and I with one teenage son.  I was a little surprised to see that there wasn't a mini-fridge, since they seem to be standard equipment in most rooms.  
When we first arrived, there was an "out of order" sign on one of the two elevators, and even though it was fixed, we usually had to wait to return to our room. The breakfast room was small but the spread of food (coffee, juices, fruit, yogurt, muffins, bagels, cereal, eggs, sausage, pancakes... to name what I can remember) was more than enough to keep us going all morning long.
The thing we liked most about the hotel, however, was the staff.  Everyone we met was friendly, welcoming, and helpful.  They answered our questions, brought our car back from the car park quickly, and the gentleman who worked in the breakfast room really hustled to clean the tables as each group left, all the while greeting and commenting to the people getting breakfast.  We will recommend this hotel to others.

title: Horrible service
text: I used to be a regular at this hotel I haven't been here in a while yesterday 8/13/16 when I was checking in the front desk supervisor was very condescending he said he "waived early check in fee" when I'm a IHG member and then when I asked for late check out which I usually get 2pm when available was told the hotel was sold out the next day when the rate was very low for a Sunday and gave me a 12pm check out.  Today as I was checking out I witness a man asking to be checked in at 11:30am no mentions of any fee where mentioned and he was promptly checked in. A man with a heavy accent came up to the counter as the other man was getting his keys. With out looking for his reservation he was immediately told he could not check in and when he asked for a late check out the lady said it was a 30 dollar fee. The man was a walk in and was inquiring about rates, why was he not offered to join your member club, or treated in a manner that would make him want to be loyal to this company. The customer service here has gone down hill. The property and rooms are still ok. All I can say is rules need to be consistent and not a pick and choose when you feel like type thing especially for someone that's been staying with you guys for a long time. And I called 3times for towels and its took 45mins to bring them when I had to check out I had to dry off with a dirty towel smh

title: Bien ubicado, muy comodo, buen Descanso
text: Nos alojamos en Junio 2016, muy atentos todos, recepcionista, guarda equipaje. Personal en general. Nos alojamos en el  piso 27. muy bueno el descanso, la limpieza. El desayuno variado, self service. Y lo mejor, tenias a tu disposicion a la hora que quisieras, agua caliente y para prepararte un te o café. Ademas, cafetera en la habitacion, que no usamos, caja fuerte, y plancha. Muy buena wifi free. En el mismo hotel servicio de transfer pago  que usamos pues nuestro avion salia de regreso a la madrugada. Muy bien ubicado, cerca de todo, y una delicia para ir y volver por la noche a Times Square caminando. Seguramente volveria, por la buena relacion servicios, calidad-costos.

title: Bom custo benefício!
text: Estive neste hotel em Setembro de 2015. O quarto era pequeno, mas atendeu muito bem às minhas necessidades. A localização é excepcional, fica bem no coração de Manhattan, há umas duas quadras da estação de do metrô (o que é crucial para quem vai para Nova York). Os funcionários foram bastante simpáticos e atenciosos. Eu perdi a chave de um dos cadeados da minha mala e eles prontamente me ajudaram a resolver. O café da manhã é bastante variado e agradável, sendo certo que o único "porém" é o espaço que é pequeno. O preço da diária é compatível para a localização.

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text:
This was our first trip to Manhattan from the Midwest, and the rooms at this hotel were reasonably priced for being in Manhattan.

The hotel is tall and thin, only 6 rooms on each floor.  The rooms are on the small side but everything in Manhattan was on the small side.  Our family of 4 managed well with 2 queen beds, and in any event the point of the trip is to be outside not inside.  Everything in the room worked and was very clean.  The only thing missing that would have been nice was the fridge/microwave combo you sometimes see in hotel rooms since there tend to be opportunities for leftovers from Manhattan restaurants.  The elevators can take a few minutes to arrive when they're busy, but otherwise were pretty fast.

Manhattan is generally more crowded, expensive and fast paced than anywhere else we've been in the country.  Probably because of this, many of the people who work there seem to be on the grumpy side.  Not at this hotel though, everyone was very nice and that was a big plus.

There is no room service or restaurant, but that's not really necessary since there are a zillion places to eat within a few minutes walk, many of which are open very late.  The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the subway, and about 10-20 minutes walk from Times Square (longer if it's more crowded).  If you want to go to the Museum of Natural History from this hotel, it's only about a 5 minute subway ride, and the entrance to the museum is right inside the subway station.

The hotel breakfast is typical and good with eggs, pancakes, etc.  It will be very very crowded if you get there during the 8:45 - 9:30 period, so getting there earlier would be better.

The WiFi worked fine once we figured out that for some Android devices, the Chrome browser doesn't work well to log on.  Use Firefox instead.

We drove to Manhattan.  Regarding parking: there is no driveway, roundabout or other location that belongs to the hotel in which you can park your car and unload.  It's either on the street curb in front of the hotel, or double parking next to another car that is along that curb.  Walking around Manhattan, it seemed like almost no hotels had their own parking garages, so this is the norm.  Double parking also does not seem to be frowned upon in Manhattan as long as it's for a short time and other cars can still get by on the street.  The hotel staff will park your car somewhere offsite, and you need to call up to 45 minutes before you need it (ours came back in about 25 minutes).  But everything seemed to work well with this system.

If you come in via the Lincoln Tunnel, a major benefit of this hotel is how close it is to the tunnel.  When leaving the hotel in the morning, we were back to the tunnel in about 3 minutes, with almost no need to drive through Manhattan traffic.  Here's a hint when entering Manhattan via the Lincoln Tunnel:  print your directions to the hotel on paper.  You will lose the GPS signal inside the tunnel, and once outside the tunnel you will need to know which way to turn before your GPS kicks in again, so having directions on paper is the way to go.

We would certainly stay here again.

title: Clean, Quiet, Wonderful Location
text: We stayed one night here. The room had a king size bed. It was very clean.The bathroom was spotless. In room safe, iron, coffee maker. Full breakfast, eggs, pancakes, muffins, toast, bagels, fruit, yogurt, cereals both hot and cold, variety of juices, coffee and tea. Great variety for everyone. The staff was very helpful when asking for directions. They printed them out for us. They held our bags after checkout so we could sight see. It is a 5 min walk to the heart of Times Square. Wonderful hotel, great location and friendly staff.

title: Şehir merkezinde
text: Şehir merkezinde metroya ihtiyacınız yok her yere yürüyerek gidebilirsiniz.kahvaltısı fena değil,temiz bir otel fiyatı da uygun.özellikle 5.caddeye yakın olması ve yürüyerek central parka gidip sabah yürüyüş yapabilirsiniz.

title: More reasonable that a pretzel, a hotdog, and two sodas
text:
I have never felt shortchanged at Holiday Inn Express. Generally, I think their team is well trained, their places are kept up, and their breakfasts are more than starch and coffee. 

So when I was able to find a room a few blocks from Times Square, just a few hours before my ETA, for $180 dollars, I thought WOW! I did have to pay to park but that was not Holiday Inn’s doing, it was Manhattan’s. And I am the guy who wanted to drive to Manhattan!

A couple of nice extras I would never have predicted:
1.	My car got parked for 24 hours. I could have gotten it out any time I wanted, but I wanted to make the most of our time on the Big Manzana. So I checked out of the hotel at check-out time and then went later for them to call for my car via valet service and have it there a short time later.
2.	And they were likewise johnny-on-the-spot about my luggage when I checked out. Somehow they figured I did not want to take my Samsonites up to the 86th floor of the Empire State. So they hold luggage for you, you go back whenever you want and claim it.

Hats off to you Holiday Inn Express. You’re thinking!

Oh, “And the pretzel and the hot dog?”, you ask.
Down by Ground Zero my kids were hungry and being in Rome they wanted to eat like the Romans so they ordered one pretzel, one hot dog, and two sodas. The bottom line: Sixteen Dollars! If $16 is the going price for flour and ground pig at Ground Zero, I got a major steal up near Times Square.

title: Niente di speciale
text:
In breve:
- camera semplice, pulita, gradevole, bagno con vasca, wifi gratuito
- personale scortese e poco competente
- colazione abbastanza buona ma poco varia
- molto affollato, con code per la colazione e per gli ascensori
Rapporto qualità/prezzo buono per Manhattan, difficile trovare di meglio allo stesso prezzo nei dintorni, con wifi e colazione inclusi.

Nel dettaglio:

Gli alberghi a Manhattan sono molto cari e spesso fra tasse, tariffa resort, colazione e wifi finisce che si spende il doppio di quanto dichiarato in fase di prenotazione. Ho scelto questo hotel perché è uno dei pochi dove questo non accade: wifi gratuito in camera, colazione a buffet compresa, niente tariffa resort.

La struttura è un palazzo alto e stretto, più di 30 piani ma solo 6 camere per piano. Si presenta bene, anche se non è tenuto in modo perfetto. Gli ascensori sono due, ma spesso bisogna attendere parecchio o addirittura fare la coda, per esempio subito dopo colazione, quando tutti vogliono tornare in camera prima di partire alla scoperta della città. La prima mattina, dopo mezz'ora di attesa, ho deciso di salire a piedi fino alla mia stanza, al diciassettesimo piano (non troppo faticoso, visto che i soffitti sono molto bassi). I giorni successivi ci ho rinunciato a priori e sono uscito direttamente dopo la colazione.

La camera era abbastanza ampia, con un enorme letto king e scelta dei cuscini. Niente frigo bar, ma su alcuni piani ci sono distributori di snacks, acqua e ghiaccio. Macchinetta del caffè a cialde in camera. Buon livello di pulizia generale. Bagno gradevole e pulito, con vasca.

A parte la pulizia, il personale che si occupa della camera si è rivelato distratto e poco preciso, con bicchieri che a volte c'erano e a volte no, asciugamani mancanti ecc.

Anche il personale della reception e della sala colazione è stato, in generale, poco cortese e poco attento. Il checkin è alle 16, decisamente tardi e senza flessibilità alcuna. Non c'è posto dove lasciare i bagagli.

La colazione a buffet è compresa nel prezzo della camera. Il cibo, come praticamente tutti gli hotel USA, è quello classico americano: pancake con sciroppo d'acero, ciambelle, burro d'arachidi, eggs and bacon, omelettes, cereali con latte, muffins, frutta. Il buffet è davvero piccolo (e affollato!), così alcuni piatti sono a rotazione: un giorno omelettes, un giorno uova strapazzate. Insomma, niente di esaltante, ma almeno permette di risparmiare e di cominciare la giornata belli sazi.

Nel complesso non mi sono trovato male. Potrei anche tornarci, se non trovo di meglio allo stesso prezzo.

title: Nice location but too cramped
text: The room was very small . Probably understandable considering it was New York but the front desk were reluctant to hold our luggage (which we don't need in the room) so we're forced to keep 8 suitcases in a tiny room. The elevators were full all the time so each trip down took a good 5-10 minutes with waiting and stop at every floor. The only good part of our stay was the convinient location.

title: Excelente!!
text: Excelente ubicación en pleno Manhattan. Accesibilidad y locación inpagable. Desayuno completo, rico y variado. Habitaciones confortables, limpias y muy bien mantenidas. El staff, excelente!!! Volvería sin dudarlo.

title: Thanksgiving day
text:
Siamo stati per vedere la sfilata del thanksgiving day. L'hotel è situato vicino a Times square. Comodo per vedere la sfilata, vicino alla 5 strada. 
Io c'ero già stato parecchi anni fa. L'albergo è anche vicino all'Empire state building . Rispetto a come lo ricordavo ho trovate le camere più scadenti. La hall, dove si fa anche il breakfast è molto piccola. Comunque il posto da perdonare tutti gli inconvenienti, centralissimo in Manhattan. La reception è professionale ed efficiente.

title: Bem simples e com alguns problemas
text:
Hotel oferece o simples mas mesmo assim com falhas.
O pior dos problemas são os elevadores. Os dois elevadores não conseguem atender a demanda e acabado gerando grandes filas no lobby é muita demora nos andares. Tivemos a "sorte" de encontrá-los com defeito em uma noite quando retornamos (28/07/16 às 23:30), muito desconfortável.
O quarto é pequeno não há espaço para transitar e posicionar a mala, muito menos se fizer compras (que foi o meu caso). Há apenas uma armário minúsculo de aproximadamente 50cmX2m. 
O piso é carpete o que acaba deixando um cheiro um pouco ruim é incômodo para aqueles que possuem alergias.
O chuveiro possui pouca água porém esquenta rápido. O banheiro é limpo, mas também bem pequeno.
O atendimento não chega a ser ruim mas não espere simpatia na recepção. Já os que trabalhando com as malas são atenciosos e simpáticos.

Caso o preço esteja muito bom pode valer a pena, porém não recomendaria para outras pessoas e não retornarei.

title: Como se estivesse em casa!
text: Que hotel maravilhoso!!! Não maravilhoso de beleza, não, não, porque não é. Ele em si é bem simples, mas simplesmente acolhedor! Desde o check in ao check out fomos muito bem recebidas. As recepcionistas, carregadores de malas e o pessoal da cozinha. Nossa, tudo que precisei eles se esforçaram para me ajudar. o quarto é pequeno e se for para achar algum defeito, este seria o fato de não ter geladeira no quarto. Isso fez com que não pudéssemos nunca levar nada gelado pro quarto, uma sobra de comida em algum restaurante (o que é super comum lá porque nunca vi povo que gosta de servir muita comida, rsrs). Mas, eu só tenho o que agradecer e recomendar. Agradeço aos funcionários, Ivet e Oscar, que foram maravilhosos desde o início e sempre atenciosos. E, para finalizar, o hotel está numa localização maravilhosa, pertinho do coração de NY. Amei e se voltar à cidade, hospedo-me lá, com certeza!!!

title: Best location
text: The location on this hotel was the best it was our first trip to New York we did a lot of sightseeing from this hotel walked up the street time square around the corner Empire State Building the rockafella subways near by to go everywhere Central Park Brooklyn bridge etc.this hotel was so clean nice beds good free breakfast every morning loved it can't wait to come back and book this hotel again.

title: Justo
text: A primeira impressão é péssima: Portaria pequena, lotada, junto do ambiente do café da manhã, bastante suja. O elevador é velho, lento e pequeno. Ao chegar ao quarto não melhora muito: apertado e sem vista. Então você começa a perceber as vantagens: A localização em midtown é ótima, perto da Times Square e quase na esquina da quinta avenida. O apartamento é limpo e a TV tem boas alternativas de canais. A internet pega bem e o café da manhã está incluso. O preço é justo para o que oferece e os atendentes são prestativos. O maior problema é a falta de espaço na área do café da manhã, o que nos obriga a comer de pé. Em resumo, pelo preço que você está pagando, está adequado.

title: BUENA ATENCION, EXCELENTE UBICACION
text: Muy buena atencion en la recepcion, habitaciones confortables, un completo desayuno para comenzar un buen dia, con una calida atencion del ´personal a cargo. Todo el personal muy atento para una buena estadia

title: Convenient, gets the job done
text:
Overall, I was impressed by the hotel, good value for the money. I had to be in NYC on business in March and booked the Holiday Inn for location and great rate.

(+)
Conveniently located, I walked to all meetings I had over two days
Rooms and common areas were clean

(-)
rooms are tight even by NYC standards
lobby can be overwhelmed by groups during check in, etc. 

I would stay here again. Excellent restaurants nearby.

title: Great stay
text: We just checked out after a second wonderful stay at the Fifty NYC.  The location is terrific and the staff is uniformly warm, welcoming and helpful.  My kids LOVED the beds; they were very comfortable.  Our room was spotless, as were all if the common areas.  I especially appreciated the the doorman's commitment to getting a cab for us in the middle of a rain storm.

title: Good Hotel, Centrally Located
text: Centrally located. Room was clean. Breakfast was ok. Value for money. Times Square Manhattan is always expensive so this hotels is a good value for money. Hydrant Park is the closest train station. All major sky scrappers are around the corner.

title: Great location for a hotel.
text: This is a reasonable hotel for Manhattan.  We have stayed here twice and both times have been very happy with the hotel, staff, upkeep and the breakfast.  Close to Time square, Broadway shows and the subway.  A lot of good restraints near by in Hells Kitchen.  The Empire State building is within walking distance. Will stay there again.

title: Voltaria com certeza
text: Hotel bem localizado e muito bom. Quarto amplo com cama king size, cofre, cafeteira, lugar pra malas, banheiro grande, e bom preço. Tem um café da manhã bom com diversas opções mas que enche muito e tem hora que não sobre nem lugar, mas esvazia rápido. O elevador é minúsculo, mas é rápido e, apesar de ter gente demais, espera-se pouco. Ficamos no quarto 1504 e foi ótimo. Atendimento excelente.

title: 100% recomendable
text: Excelente hotel!!! Lo mejor es la atención de las/los recepcionistas, las habitaciones son algo chicas pero muy bien equipadas y cómodas. Tiene desayuno el cual no es una maravilla pero está bien!! Tiene café y te las 24 hs así como microondas platos y cubiertos. Por ahí la ubicación no es tan céntrica pero en new York se llega caminando a cualquier lado!! Sin duda volvería!!

title: Nice but small
text: I recently stayed at this Holiday Inn Express. I found the hotel staff to be friendly and attend to ones needs. The hotel itself is nice, clean but small rooms make it a tight fit. It's within walking distance of the heart of Time Square and provides great views of the city. Parking is pricey at $55 for valet and takes a long time for them to drop off the vehicle. Overall nice hotel to stay in.

title: Excellent service
text: Excellent service and co-operative staff. Accessible to most locations around Times Square. Quite and hygenic place. Breakfast is tasty and good variety. Our room was ready well before the check in time.

title: Early birthday gift for my daughter
text: It's been a very long time since I've been in NYC and I wanted to give my daughter an early birthday gift after camp was over. I was astounded at the prices, but the reviews this hotel got were very good so I took a chance and booked. The service was outstanding. We arrived early on Sunday and our room was ready. We checked in and all I can say is the room was immaculate, cozy and bigger than expected. We needed a few extra towels and some band aids, less than 10 minutes they were at the door. It was a pleasure returning every evening to "welcome back, how was your evening?" The breakfast hot, and so many choices. We got good directions and recommendations. The staff was professional and so friendly. I left behind two things this morning when I checked out, but just received notice the items were found. I can't wait to book my next trip and stay here. Thank you for your outstanding customer service and friendliness.

title: Muy cerca de Time Square
text:
Voy a serles muy franco:
El hotel no es una gran cosa, pero si vas a ahorrar para estar dentro de manhattan, es la mejor opción.
de partida debes pagar la habitación en el momento, y no reciben efectivo, debe ser con tarjeta de crédito, yo me quedé por una semana y me salió alrededor de 2 mil USD.
El desayuno sirve para salir del paso, repiten las mismas cosas, no es muy rico, pero salva.
La habitación es cómoda, aunque no sé si por cansancio pero caía en la cama como piedra en el agua, jajaja, pero si, las camas son cómodas, eso si, los jabones y shampues, lo dan por cuenta gota, igual les recomiendo poner una toalla en la tina, debido a que no hay gomas o algo por el estilo, y te puedes resbalar.
es seguro, dejé dinero a la vista y estaba íntegro el monto que habia dejado.
Los ascensores son una rompedura de c.u.l.o, se demoran un año en bajar a recepción. Para bajar varias veces lo hice por la escalera de emergencia, el problema es que no puedes subir por ahí cuando estás apurado.
El wifi anda bien, eso si, hay veces que cambian la contraseña y se debe preguntar.
Ningún recepcionista habla español, salvo los auxiliares que andan por ahí.
cerca no hay varios restoranes y locales de comida rápida, asi que no se preocupen.
Está cerca del mar, como a 5 cuadras, y a 3 cuadras de Times Square, lo que era facil llegar para ir a comprar algo o darse una vuelta. es seguro, a pesar de haber mendigos y algunos tipos con pinta de pandilleros, no tuve problemas, en general hay mucha seguridad y las patrullas merodean en todos lados cerca del hotel.
En conclusión, es práctico, no esperen grandes maravillas. ya que es lo más barato dentro de manhattan. porque en otros hoteles, te cobran el wifi, desayuno y hasta las tarjetas para entrar a la habitación por separado.

title: HOSPEDE-SE BEM EM NEW YORK
text: Estive com minha família em Nova Iorque por três noites e tive a grata satisfação de hospedar-me num hotel de qualidade, com uma equipe de recepcionistas simpáticos e prestativos, particularmente Henry, gerente de um dos turnos. Lá encontrei um hotel muito bem localizado, pois ficava na região da Times Square, a duas esquinas da estação de ônibus e do metrô da 8ª avenida; café da manhã de qualidade e como o wi-fi, ambos inclusos na diária. Preço justo,com conforto e limpeza do apartamento,além de contar pontos no programa da rêde hoteleira.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
We stayed here for the weekend. The staff was friendly. The hotel quiet and at a great location. The rooms are a bit on the smaller side. the rooms and hallways though need to be redone/refreshes/refurbished as the place has a bit of a dated feel. Once this is complete this hotel would be a 5 star rating for the value.
Overall I would stay here again.

title: Mediano
text:
Oferece cafe da manhã, uma raridade em Manhattan. 
Tivemos um problema com um vazamento no quarto e demoraram muito para solucionar.
Ótima localização, perto de Times Square e de diversas estações de metrô e de restaurantes.
No entanto, o hotel é muito velho, conta com somente dois elevadores, e não tem elevador de serviço, por vezes o elevador estava lotado com faxineiras ou outros funcionários. 
A cama é boa, e o quarto é limpo.

title: Excellent Stay
text: This is my second time staying here at I would never look elsewhere.  The front desk is very welcoming and know a lot about the area and what to recommend for getting around town, restaurants, and fun things to do

title: Positive Experience
text:
Will be revisiting this property
Clean Rooms
Wifi
Friendly staff
Very relaxed environment
Wish I was able to stay longer
I recommend this property to anyone traveling in this area.

Will like to stay here again :)

title: Cama e Chuveiro bom. Só.
text: Optamos por este Holiday Inn porque pela primeira vez estávamos viajando para Nova York com meus pais e queríamos um hotel com o padrão da rede, que poderíamos confiar. No entanto, o hotel deixou muito a desejar. A localização de fato é privilegiada, a alguns passos da Times Square, mas a rua do hotel é erma e nos deixava receosos de andar por ela a noite. O Hotel possui muitos quartos, mas a recepção é minúscula, assim como  o restaurante onde é servido o café incluso na diária. Logo pela manhã o serviço do café era caótico, os elevadores ficavam congestionados e formava-se longas filas. Não havia mesas para todos, então muitos dos hóspedes pegavam as bandejas para tomar o café no próprio quarto. As opções do café eram, contudo, muito boas comparadas com o tradicional continental breakfast dos hotéis americanos -- ovos, pães, panquecas e até pãezinhos de canela estão no cardápio. O quarto não era ridiculamente pequenos em se tratando de Manhattan, mas precisa urgentemente de reforma. Cortinas, tapetes e principalmente o banheiro bastante gastos pelo tempo. A cama era confortável e o chuveiro bom. O serviço de concierge foi bastante eficiente para reservar tickets para a nova atração One World e para locar carro para o aeroporto, mas fique atento para a taxa de serviço que costumam incluir -- pagamos bem mais caro pelos tickets do One World e não nos foi avisado da taxa que seria inclusa. Tivemos problemas também com nosso cartão de crédito, que deve ser oferecido mesmo quando as diárias foram previamente pagas, como foi nosso caso. Fizeram algumas cobranças indevidas mas prontamente estornaram quando comunicamos o erro. No geral, o hotel é satisfatório, mas não voltaríamos, creio que existem opções de hotéis com custo-benefícios melhores em Nova York.

title: Excellent overnight stay
text: Front desk staff very friendly, free breakfast was very good (I have stayed at a lot oh HIE & never had western omelette!).  Room was small but it's clean & its NY.  Only negative, is no ref or microwave on the room & no free parking.  Would definitely consider for my next NY trip.

title: Ubicacion Estrategica !
text: Me aloje en dos oportunidades en este hotel ubicado sobre la calle 45 entre la 5th y la 4... La ubicacion es muy buena ya que caminando estamos a 3 cuadras del time square a 2 de estaciones de metro estamos a 4 cuadras del central park. Podriamos recorrer las principales atracciones de NYC caminando ! El hotel es limpio y da una sensacion agradabable, buena atencion de parte del personal... Te dejan dejar alli las valijas en el caso de realizar un checkout o checkin Tarde/temprano ! las habitaciones son bonitas y calidas, cama comoda y baño con todos los accesorios necesarios ! Sin duda volveria a este hotel por su ubicacion principalmente

title: TOP HOTEL
text:
Guter Tipp für eine Woche in NY.
Sauber, Dusche u WC im Zimmer, Frühstücksbuffet, zentral gelegen nähe Times Square, hilfsbereites Personal an der Rezeption. Neben an hat es einen kleinen Kiosk, eine gemütliche Bar u das beste Steakhouse...ein muss
Wir waren bereits drei mal in diesem Hotel...immer wieder gerne

title: All around quality
text: My family of 4 stayed for 4 nights and our experience was a quality one from start to finish. Henry was extremely helpful during check in, the breakfast was amazing every morning-the morning staff did an excellent job of keeping it full and fresh, and the cleaning staff was wonderful and very friendly. The rooms were on the smaller side but nicely appointed. The location was perfect, walking distance to most things and a short walk to the subway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and our future visits to NYC will include a stay here!

title: Exceptional Stay
text:
Professional, friendly and accommodating. 

I had the opportunity to stay at this hotel and was quite pleased. I contacted the hotel the night before to confirm my reservation and spoke to Henry the manager who was professional and personable. He set the tone for my New York stay. Upon arriving at the hotel, Henry remembered our conversation the night before and displayed the same professional, personal and upbeat welcome. 
The hotel staff is amazing!  They greet you with a smile every  time you are  in their presence and attentive to assist you with what you need.   The concierge  accommodated my needs and answered questions that benefited me throughout my stay. 
The breakfast selections gave a variety for you to choose from, cold to hot meals. The breakfast setup was clean, attractive and plentiful. 
The comfort of the room was great. Comfortable bed with a city view and quite!
The entrance of the hotel had two large flower planters with a bench that you could identify the hotel from blocks when walking. The lobby is modern, clean and spacious. 
Even though this is not a luxury hotel it is a luxurious stay for the price.

title: Atendimento muito especial.
text: O Holiday Inn Express é uma excelente opção para quem vai a NY e não quer gastar todos os seus dólares em acomodação. Os quartos são pequenos, mas o atendimento é incrível! O gerente é o cara mais fofo deste mundo: atencioso, sempre pronto a ajudar. Os atendentes são todos muito educados. Outra coisa que é nota dez no Holiday Inn é o café da manhã farto, com frutas, café, leite, chás, pães, doces, panquecas e muitos outros mimos gastronômicos.

title: Great location, helpful staff and scrumptious free breakfast
text:
We stayed from 14th to 20th June.
The front desk staff were very helpful and made the extra effort to locate my missing walking stick. It is much appreciated.
 However, a big contrast in good and bad service was experienced at the concierge desk. The young man on concierge duty on 19th June was rude and condescending.
We love that there is always hot and cold water available at the lobby.

title: Perfect location for a Broadway Romp !
text:
So this hotel while being a cracker box with the sizing of the lobby - hallways - elevators is perfectly located to shows, restaurants and subway lines. When you have the freedom in NYC to walk to where you want to go ( yes even in high heels) and avoid a smelly , expensive taxi that due to traffic takes 20 minutes to go less than a mile then you are in heaven and in control of your own destiny !! Stayed 2 nights and saw Waitress first & Wicked 2nd. Highly recommend Waitress...superb.  Ate at Barbetta on 42nd ( great Italian) and only 3 blocks from hotel. West Bank cafe (1 block from hotel) and 4 ( one block from hotel on 39th) All superb. Subway line was only 3 blocks away so took the red line (15 minutes from hotel to 9-11) down to memorial and then shopping in Soho. Also took the same line north to Norma's for the best b-fest in NYC (56th) followed by a sunny, cool walk through Central Park. Lot of fun. Visiting the city in a quick fashion like this is a blast but only if you strategically centralize where you sleep.
Highly recommend this hotel as the staff was superb which was an added bonus. Was also pleased, the bedding was cozy. Loved that they had hot ( good tasting) coffee in the lobby at 4 am when I like to get up. All in all a memorable trip..highly recommend

title: Check in is hectic but further a good place to saty
text:
We were early and the lady at the check in desk was not very helpful: check in at 4.00 pm. I indicated that I am spire elite: same answer. At the other side of pilar there was a desk for IHG card holders. That lady saw the importance of the card holder for them. She asked for some time but after a coffee we came back our room was ready.

Try to get to the 34th floor during check in is more than hectic; particular when there is only one elevator available. Once you are in your room it is okay, The rooms are very small (usually in NYC); particular when you are 3 adults with each a big suit case.

Overall the sleeping is well; the breakfast is as usual in HI Express.

Good place to stay as you are close to the attractions.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: Sin dudas lo mejor es la ubicación del hotel, cerca de Times Square y de las estaciones de Subway que facilita el movimiento en la ciudad. El otro pilar del hotel es la gente que trabaja, súper serviciales y dispuestos a dar ayuda (las chicas del desayuno y los de recepción sin duda los mejores. El desayuno es bueno, acorde al tipo de comida que suelen tener en la región, sumado a opciones saludables de fruta y cereales. La habitación ordenada, capaz la vista no fue buena dado que era contra frente, pero no todas las habitaciones pueden ser con vista a la calle. Volvería, por la ubicación y el trato de las chicas que se encargan del desayuno.

title: 3rd time staying here - not once have we been disappointed
text:
My husband bought me a trip to New York for my 40th birthday as because we had already stayed in this hotel (twice before) he booked it again.  Like the previous two times we stayed we weren't disappointed at all.  

When we arrived we were greeted by one of their lovely receptionist who informed us that as it is my 40th birthday we were given an early check in, an upgrade to a room on the 34th floor where we had amazing views of the new Freedom Tower, the Hudson river and the Empire State Building.  We were also give a complimentary late check out on our last day.

As always breakfast was included during our stay.  This is a great way to set yourself up for the day.  We generally went for food at around 7.30am and were off sightseeing by 8.30am so we missed the busy breakfast period that I've seen a few people commenting on - the food is always fresh and the staff never let it run down.  

I have no hesitation whatsoever recommending this hotel - at the end of the day you are just there to sleep, shower and freshen up.....which makes it perfect.

Oh and not to forget the cleaning staff - we always came back to a freshly made bed and fresh towels.

Love this place and we most certainly will be back - its now like our home in New York when we visit :)

title: Exceeded Expectations
text: Having had some less than stellar experiences with other chains in NYC, I was not expecting great things at a Holiday Inn Express. I was pleasantly surprised when my expectations were exceeded. This is one of the NYC hotels that has few rooms on each floor but has numerous floors. After a very pleasant greeting at Check-In, they were able to accommodate a change in the bed configuration for the room we were given. We were on the 20th floor. Although there are only two elevator banks, we never experienced an excessive wait for the elevator. Our room, while small, was a decent size by NYC standards. The beds are triple sheeted and the room and bathroom were very clean. I was surprised to see Bath and Bodyworks amenities in the bathroom. Wifi is free and was at a decent speed (able to watch a show on Netflix with no problem). There is a complimentary continental breakfast every morning but we did not partake so I cannot comment. There is a Keurig type coffee maker in the room and coffee, tea and water (including infused water) are available all day in the breakfast area. While checkout is at 11:00, they happily hold your bags after you check out. I would definitely not hesitate to stay there again when in NYC.

title: Visitando la grande mela
text: Camera da quattro un po' piccola con i due letti francesini si ci si muoveva a malapena, armadio piccolo. Bagno nella norma con cambio asciugamani giornaliero. colazione self service, dolce e salata abbondante . Struttura pulita. Ottima posizione. Personale reception cordiale.

title: Semplice vicino a Times Square
text: Semplice hotel a pochi isolati da Times Square affacciato su una via non molto trafficata. L'hotel ha 36 piani, noi eravamo al 34esimo, ma a New York è impossibile essere nel totale silenzio, quindi si sentivano comunque rumori anche la notte, ma dopo un po' ci si abitua. La camera per 4 persone era molto piccola, più per due persone che per quattro.Buona prima colazione ma troppi pochi tavolini considerando il numero di ospiti, per cui a volte bisogna aspettare o ci si porta la colazione in camera. Si son dimenticati di farci la stanza una volta e le schede che aprivano la stanza spesso non funzionavano. Inoltre aria condizionata fredda sempre accesa nella hall e nella sala della colazione, non il massimo. Metro abbastanza vicina a due isolati.

title: Good Choice for Affordable Manhattan Lodging
text:
There is a great number of hotels in Manhattan, and certainly no shortage of Holiday Inns. This particular location features rooms on 36 floors, of which my girlfriend and I found ourselves staying on the 18th.

We had no difficulties when we checked in around 1:00 AM, and our room looked exactly as in the pictures. It was small, but the king size bed was soft and afforded us a nice night's sleep. The bathroom was clean, the water hot, and around the door knob was a little sign about reusing towels which I found in good taste.

Check out was easy, and the clerk was kind enough to procure a Band Aid for me. I will certainly consider Holiday Inn Express the next time I'm in the city.

(Originally written for Yelp)

title: Super City Hotel
text: Das Hotel ist super für einen Städtetrip. Die Zimmer sind sauber auch wenn die Ausstattung nicht mehr die Neuste ist. Das Frühstückbuffet war umfangreich und absolut in Ordnung. Wir könne diese Hotel mit gutem Gewissen weiter empfehlen.

title: Good location, good service
text: We chose self parking across the street instead of valet. It was about $10 per day cheaper. Check in was smooth. Rooms are typical NYC size but big enough. We have a corner room with a nice view of the city. Room service has done a nice job. Free breakfast every morning. Busy though. Several minute walk to Times Square area. We usually stay at the Holiday Inn on 5th avenue but I'd stay here too. The parking was easier.

title: Great Location
text: Me and my husband stayed here for 3 nights and it did just what we needed it to do. Great location, walking distance to all of midtown attractions. Even being near to times square wasn't a problem you wouldn't even know it was a couple of blocks away. The room was pokey but clean and the bed was comfortable which is all you need after all the walking. The staff were friendly on arrival and throughout our stay. On our last day the male concierge was most helpful with sorting a car to get us to the airport and making sure we had a comfortable ride. The breakfast was ok there was a good selection of cooked and cold. The only thing I can say bad is there are only two lifts which wouldn't be a problem until one wasn't working and that was for the whole stay! Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants great location at a reasonable budget.

title: Ótima Localização e Atendimento
text: Este hotel recém inaugurado é muito bem localizado em relação a região dos Teatros e a quinta Avenida. O quarto que eu fiquei foi com duas camas de casal e para duas pessoas foi ótimo, agora, para 4 pessoas deve ficar bem complicado. Em horários de pico (check in e check out) o elevador demora um pouco para atender todos os andares pois são mais de 30 andares para somente 2 elevadores. Eu fiquei em andar alto e não me arrependi, mas pra quem não tem muita paciência para aguardar 5 min, deve ficar em andar baixo para usar as escadas. Os funcionários são bem dedicados e prontos para te ajudar em tudo. Recomendo o hotel.

title: Funky smell and then they lost our car..
text:
There was an odd smell in our room and the wall between the bed and the bathroom was wet the two nights that we were there. We tried to switch rooms but there was none available so we cut our stay short. The smell was bad enough that we didn't sleep well. The weed smell in the hallway was better than the smelly odor in our room!

Then we called for our car, called an hour later to see if it had arrived before we took all of our stuff and kids down to the lobby and was told it was waiting there for us. When we got to the lobby our vehicle was no where to be found. Front desk staff took close to an additional hour to locate and get our vehicle! They said they were going to credit us, but that was a few weeks ago and we still paid full price!

The building across the street is a heap of construction with debris falling into the streets at times, so be careful of your tires!

Breakfast is in a tiny area, and the fruit disappears as soon as it is put out.

I will definitely send my clients elsewhere!

title: No threats, please!
text: Having been to hundreds of hotels, this one is a good value and location. However, they should immediately send the front desk lady to some hospitaly training - having checked out at 11:10 AM, there is no use threatening me with late check out fees. I even called up front and would have come to lobby earlier has the elevator travelled a little faster from 32nd floor. Not a nice way to treat loyal customers, Holiday Inn!

title: Excelente ubicación!
text: No cabe duda que el hotel ofrece grandes ventajas para quienes desean aprovechar al máximo Manhattan y algunos de sus alrededores. La atención es amable. Las habitaciones son limpias aunque pequeñas. Eramos 4 y realmente estuvimos muy incomodas con nuestro equipaje. La lavandería deja mucho que desear: no hay toallas disponibles y no saben cuando las habrá.  El desayuno es mejorable, como lo es también el espacio para ello. Es realmente pequeño, teniendo en cuenta la gran  cantidad de habitaciones que tiene el hotel. Las cajillas de seguridad se encuentran en el  pasillo. Debes solicitar que te abran la cajilla cada vez que necesitas sacar algo. Es incómodo debido a que es la salida del ascensor. Podrían idearse algunas formas de solucionar algunos de estos lunares.

title: Sehr gute Lage, aber.....
text:
Das Hotel liegt zwischen der 38. und 39. Straße. Toll.
Die Zimmer sind halt typisch Manhattan sehr klein, aber große Betten.
Das Hotel hat knapp 40 Stockwerke aber nur 2 Aufzüge - viel zu wenig, sehr lange Wartezeiten sind keine Seltenheit. 
Das Frühstück ist zwar inkludiert, aber die Auswahl ( a la carte ) ist nicht überragend.
Außerdem gibt es versteckte Kosten.

title: Best tourist hotel ever
text: Very friendly and helpful staff, room was clean and with all right amenities incl room safe, strong wifi, coffee pods, iron, etc. Breakfast and complimentary lemonade drink in lobby are pleasant surprises. Only 5min walk to the dizzy & glitzy Times Square and fashionable 5th Avenue. Can't ask for more! Definitely recommended.

title: Hôtel simple, peut-être trop...
text: Il s'agit d'un hôtel pas très loin de Time Square. La chambre est simple, rustique dans cachet. Après rien à dire, elle est propre, la SDB également. La literie est correcte. Il s'agit vraiment d'un lieu à dormir, rien de plus...

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed for 7 nights great location walking distance to major attractions Bus station around the corner sub ways walking distance 
Check in went very smooth rooms a little small but then its New York 
Breakfast first class

title: Todo lo bueno, queda opacado al volver...
text:
El hotel en si es muy comodo, limpio, las habitaciones un tanto pequeñas, pero es únicamente para dormir. El gimnasio, y la lavandería  no estan disponibles, hay disponibles uno a 40 metros en la misma vereda en otro hotel que te habilitan. 
El trato con el cliente es común durante la estadia, el problema es al retirarse.
El deposito en garantia que por lo general es al momento de retirarse. En principio me dijeron 5 días hábiles, luego, de 5 a 10, y luego de 10 a 15 días hábiles.
Es el dia de hoy que pasaron mas de 30 DIAS que volví a Argentina, y aun no recibi el deposito en garantía que cobraron al momento de ingresar al hotel.
Toda la buena experiencia se echo a perder, después de que el mail que figura en su pagina oficial no esta en funcionamiento, rebotan los mails, el único contacto que tengo con el hotel contesta cuando se le da la gana. Estoy hace mas de 1 mes intentando reclamar un dinero, muy complicado hablar, y mas aun que te escuchen.
Después de esto, NO RECOMIENDO,NI VUELVO.

title: Very good location - Nothing to complain about
text: Stayed in this hotel for a week and had a satisfying experience. The hotel is very near to Times Square 42nd Street subway station and this helped me travel throughout NY city. The reception staff were very courteous. We were 2 people and the double room was spacious enough considering this hotel is in the heart of NY city. The breakfast area is small and gets crowded after 8am. Hence, please go before 8am if you want a seat and have a relaxed breakfast. Otherwise, nothing to complain about. I would definitely come back to stay here.

title: Отель стандартный, расположение и персонал делают его уютным)
text: Отель стандартный, но из-за своего выгодного месторасположения и отношения персонала к каждому гостю, становится более выигрышным. Были в апреле, еда нормальная, есть все необходимое. Единственный значимый минус - тесно в лоби на первом этаже, где по утрам накрывают завтраки) Мы улетали на Гавайи и у нас был огромный чемодан, который мы не хотели брать с собой, отель разрешил погостить нашему чемодану у них на 3 недели абсолютно бесплатно. За что ооочень мы благодарны) Рекомендую этот отель, тем кто действительно приехал наслаждаться Нью-Йорком, а не сидеть 24 часа в отеле. Очень хороший вариант.

title: Great location.
text:
Our first stay in New York City.   We were very pleased. The Holiday Inn Express was more than we expected.  Polite staff and bellman. 

Hotel was very clean, quiet and convenient location. Short walk to food, sites, theaters. Would highly recommend.

title: Typical Holiday Inn Express
text: We usually stay in a Holiday Inn Express whenever we travel. We always feel it's a good value for our money. This hotel was no exception. Being in the middle of Manhattan close to Times Square, this hotel was pretty narrow with a small lobby. There were only 2 elevators to service 36 floors and over 200 rooms, so coming down during the day there are always multiple stops. Breakfast time is especially busy. The breakfast area is small and can get crowded so be prepared if you go during peak hours. It's complimentary hot breakfast (and it's good!) so what do you expect? Our room was a king bed with a city view. Our A/C never seemed to get cold enough - but being from the South, we don't think there's a such thing as cold enough A/C! Bed did not seem to be a true king size bed. Somewhere between a queen and a king maybe? Also wasn't the most comfortable I've ever slept in - but at the end of the day after walking 5 miles, it did the job! We left spare change out on the tv stand on 2 separate occasions, and both times the cleaning personnel took it! Hopefully this was the only thing they took.
