No way to know for sure, but this was surely odd and we've never encountered before. Somehow we had a Canadian coin, but they didn't take that one! We didn't alert the staff, with worries that our belongings might be tampered with as a result. Overall was a pleasant stay and would return - but will definitely leave my valuables/spare change/anything of value locked up and our suitcases too.

title: 3 daagse NYC
text: Conform HI express concept, maar dan in kleine oppervlakte. Wantwoord ruitte is ergeen kostbaar kn NYC. Lokatie perfect. Op loopafstand van Time Square en bus/trein/metro station. Personeel zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Inclusief ontbijt, dus goede start om de dag te beginnen. Wel op tijd gaan, want zeer druk. Ook daar zeer vriendelijk personeel. Kamers dagelijkse  schoonmaak. Netjes. Voldoende om bij te komen van drukke dag. Coffeemaker aanwezig.

title: Ótima localização
text: O quarto é padrão Holiday Inn. O tamanho é até bem razoável se considerarmos Nova York. A localização é excelente, poucas quadras da times square, próximo ao metrô, e quase na esquina da Carlos Bakery rs. Os funcionários foram muito atenciosos com meu bebê de 9 meses. O café da manhã é excelente, com uma boa variedade e sempre muito gostoso. Apesar de não ter frigobar e micro-ondas, indico para quem for com criança pela facilidade de andar pela cidade e pelo ótimo atendimento. Sempre tem café e água quente para o chá.

title: Ubicación
text: Para ir a conocer todo lo emblemático que tiene Manhattan , y a un precio razonable ( todo es costoso ) es un buen sitio, los desayunos son aburridos cuando estas por más de 3 días , pero la ideas es consumir frutas y jugos y eso esta bien !!! Las habitaciones pequeñas pero limpias ! Y la recepción muy amable

title: Centrale vicino Time Square
text: Hotel semplice ma centralissimo. Colazione a buffet non tanto e senza nessuna variazione nel corso della settimana. Poca comunicazione il giorno della decorrenza ora legale e personale inflessibile... un po' di clienti rimasti senza colazione. Per il resto personale gentile e buone indicazioni turistiche. Problema con la disponibilità della carta di credito: dopo aver liquidato tutto il soggiorno anche dopo sollecito non hanno annullato la prenotazione occupando la disponibilità per circa il doppio della cifra fino alla decadenza automatica dopo un mese. Per fortuna avevo alternative di pagamento perché ci siamo fermati diversi giorni ed il conto era notevole.

title: Buenaubicación
text: Lo que me gusto es que las habitaciones son limpias. Lo que no me gusto es que las habitaciones son muy pequeñas. Tienen un pequeño escritorio pero no se puede usar con la silla ya que esta la calefacción y estorba..

title: Clean Budget Hotel
text: Centrally Located hotel with clean room and well mannered Staff. This is Budget hotel on Times Square with Basic Amenities. Many eateries are nearby. Good budget option on Times Square for a person on business trip.

title: Great location & quality for price
text:
Stayed for 3 nights at this hotel, booked only 2 days before arriving because prices dropped last minute. Check-in was easy other than a short delay when the front desk staff having to answer a phone call while checking me in. 
Room on the 25th floor, very quiet and far from street noise, with a classic Manhattan view of a brick wall which we were not surprised with. Size is small but we still felt not cramped like in some other Manhattan hotels. Two elevators for 36 floors, they run super fast, I will say the only problem we had was on the day of check-out when the elevator had to skip many floors after it filled up - we were lucky to board on the 25th floor on the way down. Beds are adequately comfortable, not the best we've had but enough for a decent night's sleep. 
Bathroom - the shower had terrible pressure even though temperature was fine. Toilet also had a weak flush so we had to use it a few times before getting used to it.
Breakfast - goes until 9:30am weekdays and 10am weekends, we never got this because we slept in. However they keep coffee, juice, and water machines in the breakfast area all day which is nice. 
Laundry and gym facilities are in a neighboring hotel - we never used these.

Location - a block to PABT bus terminal. On the same block as the 42 st Times Square stop with easiest access to the ACE trains. It's a hike from the NQR or 1237 trains, but still accessible underground. Short walk to Times Square. About 6 blocks down is Penn Station. 

Overall I'd consider staying here again for a quick easy stay in Manhattan, if they offer the same price. The bathroom amenities leave much to be desired but the location really can't be beat given that we paid less than $200 a night tax included.

title: Nice affordable lodging in midtown
text: Weekend in New York, found this Holiday Inn Express couple of blocks from Times Square, easy walk from Penn Station. A lot of development going on in the area including most chain hotels. Relatively new property, typical tight NYC layout, 6 rooms per floor, nicely appointed - K-cup brewer, safe, firm & soft pillows, reliable Wi-Fi. Fast elevators, professional staff, decent breakfast with pancakes, premade omelets, and usual fare. Couple of minor negatives: ice & vending machines are only on about every 6th floor and the soda that I purchased was warm; the TV reception was poor (could not access local channels) and when it could not tune to a channel, the TV would "reboot" and restart to its default channel at high volume. But who visits New York to watch TV?

title: Clean but Cramped
text: Great staff, room was clean and in good repair.  The hotel is about 36 floors, I think, with six rooms per floor and two very small elevators.  Waiting for an elevator always took a while during check-in or check-out times or when the cleaning staff was holding one for their purposes.  We were on the 30th floor and found that it was generally easier to go up to 36 and ride back down than it was to get on an elevator already heading down.  Breakfast, too, was very cramped.  The food was the usual breakfast fare, but we ended up taking it back up to the 30th floor to eat.  The block where the hotel is located was a little sketchy compared to blocks on either side.  We changed our route coming back in the evening to avoid a group of men who were always hanging out and who got a bit close the first couple of times we passed them.    All staff were very helpful, though, and the location is within walking distance of most of the things we wanted to do.

title: semplice ma molto comodo
text:
hotél ordinato e pulito con una buona colazione 
personale gentile e disponibile 
camera non molto grande ma con letti molto comodi
bagno di giuste proporzioni con doccia nella vasca ma funzionale
posizione ottima molto vicino a time square ( qualche minuto a piedi )
rapporto qualità prezzo molto buono considerato la posizione e la città

title: 离时代广场近的过夜酒店
text: 选择这里是因为这里比较近时代广场，也比较近长途车站。 酒店外观就沿街但是基本没有庭院，前台接待速度很快态度也很好，还有存行李的地方，以及一个漂亮小姐帮你定去机场的taxi或大巴，这些服务不错。但是房间就是过一夜的水准，没有牙膏牙刷也没有拖鞋，只有肥皂和沐浴液。 房间也比较小，基本上一进门就是床，床旁边就是一个窗式空调，这个空调比较老，声音比较大，如果天气允许，最好不开，不然很难入睡。房间灯线比较昏暗，没有太大活动余地，桌子椅子也是属于比较陈旧的。房间会有少少味道，不知道是季节原因还是由于设施陈旧所致。 房间有提供保险箱，以及电视机。但是只有咖啡机没有热水壶。 好的地方是床单还算干净，睡觉感觉不难受。外面没有景色，只有附近的街道。 窗户是可以打开的，但是因为白天都不在房间，其实也没有打开的必要。 酒店附近还有很多其他酒店，可以方便换地方住。 我入住时预定的房间不含早餐，但是看酒店的规模，早餐估计也是非常简单的美式早餐，即咖啡，煎蛋，华夫饼或麦片牛奶。 酒店住客很多，大家貌似都是匆匆过一夜就转投其他地方，所以走廊里面很安静，估计大家都玩累了才会回来，早上如果要早走的话，要提前一点，因为酒店电梯比较小，繁忙时刻可能需要等待。下次再来纽约，有需要还是会入住。

title: Happy with my stay here
text:
First time here and would say it's a solid hotel in terms of location and functionality. Rooms were cleaned everyday, breakfast was fine (toast, turkey sausage, bagels, pancakes cereal, eggs and porridge available every day) but it is true that the dining area is small however they're fine with you taking your food to your room. The male chef is very friendly always saying hello to guests as they walk in in the morning which I thought was nice. 

The free quick wi-fi access in every room is a great bonus! My room was fine, 32-inch flat-screen TV with tea making facilities, iron and board. The bathroom was perfectly fine. Apparently you can use the gym of the 'parent' hotel, the nearby 'Holiday Inn'. 

Location-wise you can get to Times Square within a 15 minute walk. For shopping Macy's and other stores are nearby too. You can get to the Penn train station within 10 mins walk and from the station you can get the train to the (free) Staten Island Ferry. The concierge service is useful although we did get slightly incorrect advise on how to get to the aforementioned ferry as the 1 train which would normally take you straight there was not going to the ferry stop that day so we had to switch train and a take a shuttle bus to the stop (thank God for Google!). I do think the concierge should have had that knowledge of what was going on train-wise that day.

Nevertheless I'd happily come back again and hope to do so in the future.

title: Great Location
text: The hotel is in a great location to walk anywhere that you want to visit downtown. I didn't find that being in a busy neighbourhood was a problem since we were on the 39th floor. The breakfast was good. Not great but for the number of people being served it was what you expected. Go early for breakfast and you will definitely have a seat. Laundry and the gym were next door at the sister property. It was a nice surprise to be able to do laundry.

title: Great Staff
text: The staff at this hotel has been wonderful. All the bellmen, front desk and housekeeping  have been very kind and accommodating. The hotel itself is adequately clean and comfortable. No complaints. I have stayed at far "nicer" hotels that don't have near the quality of service we have here.

title: Average
text: For what I paid (over $200) I did not find the hotel value for money. The room was ok, breakfast place small and tends to get crowded, lifts very busy, the street in which the hotel is located isn't one of the better streets around.

title: 初NY３泊
text: ホテルが多すぎるNY。悩みに悩んでここを予約。予想していたよりも快適に過ごせました。スーツケースも広げれるし、水回りも問題なしです。遮光カーテンがないことが気になりましたが、Wi-Fiの繋がりも良く、観光名所・地下鉄etc.のアクセスも悪くないと思います。

title: Perfecto para estar cerca de todo
text: El hotel es cómodo y da lo que se espera de un hotel de cadena, lo que lo distingue es su excelente ubicación que permite estar a unos pasos de Times Square y de la zona de teatros de Broadway, también le da un plus la cercanía con al menos tres estaciones del metro que conectan con todas sus líneas, el único "pero" se da a la hora del desayuno, que está incluido en la habitación, la comida es buena pero no variada por lo que si solo deseas un snack basta con un muffin, un bagel, yoghurt, jugo y fruta, el otro inconveniente es el área de comida ya que es muy pequeña para el volumen de visitantes y que en hora pico resulta incómodo al igual que el elevador ya que solo hay dos para un edificio de mas de 20 pisos. Sugerencias, pidan habitaciones entre los primeros 5 niveles y usen escaleras de emergencia y degusten el desayuno en su habitación. Fuera de ello al igual que al comprar una casa este hotel cumple con la máxima de ubicación, ubicación, ubicación.

title: Their unorganized staff is costing me money
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in December - originally for 3 nights, but cut it back 2 nights.  We booked and canceled through hotels.com who send the cancellation request through to the hotel on the last night.  Well 4 months later we get an UNAUTHORIZED charge from this hotel on our credit card because they are insisting we came back and extended the night through them.  I have called a handful of times and noone can even give me the courtesy of a call back.  They don't want to hear what I have to say just that they will not refund the money because "we stayed the extra night".  I even offered to provide copies of my train ticket to prove I went home that night.  So rude and organized.  They are just stealing from us at this point.

title: Great value for money
text: Nice and central location All you need in a hotel. Warm breakfast a wonderful surprise selection great and just v efficient service all in all. Unbelievable value for the price can't recommend it highly enough

title: Hôtel que je conseille
text:
Un très bon hôtel rapport qualité/Prix.
Emplacement idéal pour visiter NewYork, proche de stations de métro et de Times square.
Personnel très agréable,toujours un sourire, Note de 10/10 pour LaToya à l'acceuil.
Chambre très propres et durant tous les jours.
Un petit bémol concernant les ascenseurs où l'attente peut être un peu longue,mais super séjour.

title: Hôtel bien situé
text: je recommande l'Holiday Inn Times square. Il est très bien situé près de Port Authority (nombreuses lignes de métro) , Times square et les  théâtres de Broadway. L'accueil est agréable, le petit-déjeuner typique se prend dans le bar attenant (attention en cas de "petit déjeuner compris" le prix ne comprends pas le service de 5 à 7 euros). Seul bémol : les ascenseurs bloqués à certaines heures du matin et de l'après-midi par le service, c'est gênant car il y a des temps d'attente vraiment excessif !

title: Muy Buen Hotel!!
text:
Fuimos a pasar un fin de semana, y justo encontramos una promo por aca, la verdad que buenisima!
El hotel, esta muy bien ubicado, a unas dos o tres cuadras del Time Square.
Muy limpio, silencioso.
El desayuno es muy rico!

title: Good for tourists
text: Stayed here for 4 nights in April. The hotel is in a good location just slightly away from the busy streets so not noisy but within easy walking distance of Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller etc. and Subway Stations. The hotel itself is very basic and the breakfast was fairly average, but I guess you get what you pay for and Americans don't have British bacon. The staff were all nice and helpful when we had any questions and also sorted out an airport transfer for us.

title: Gut gelegenes, günstiges Hotel
text: Das Hotel ist empfehlenswert, günstig, gut erreichbar, mit freundlichem und hilfsbereitem Personal! Nur das Frühstück muss auf Papptellern und Kunststoffbesteck zu sich genommen werden! Es ist auch recht voll zum Frühstück, Frühaufstehen lohnt sich!

title: Great location!
text: We had a blast staying at this hotel.  It was a great location for getting around the city.  It's easy to get just about anywhere from here. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was quite nice! I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel in a great location
text: This hotel is right out of the Lincoln Tunnel, so if you are driving into the city, you have very little city driving to do. It is also an easy out of the city by the Lincoln Tunnel. Really, it doesn't get any easier getting in and out of NYC than to stay at this hotel. You are only 1/2 a mile to Times Square, and in very close proximity to great restaurants. But the best part is the hotel itself. Even though it is in the heart of NYC, the hotel has the cleanliness, friendliness, and updated decor you expect from any other Holiday Inn Express. The staff was very helpful, even apologizing for the high fee of the parking. Hey, this is NYC, we expected a high fee for parking (although at $55 a day, be sure to budget that in to your stay.) The rooms were standard NYC size (aka small)  but they were very clean and had free wifi. The free breakfast was always hot and wonderful, including eggs or omelets, meats, fruit, pancakes, yogurt, coffee, muffins, cinnamon rolls, and the list goes on. I highly recommend staying  here if you visit NYC, (especially if you are driving in).

title: Great hotel central for main sightseeing
text: Stayed 4 nights early April. Room was good, bit small but perfectly adequate. Clean comfortable and price included breakfast and we had a 30th floor city view.  View of Empire State Building from our window. Buffet breakfast with excellent choice of foods. Oscar kept things moving and helped people find seats, wiped tables down quickly when they were vacated. Only 2 lifts for a tall building but they always came when we pressed for it. Reception couldn't be more helpful, especially Erika who was exceptionally helpful. Free wifi too. Tea/coffee in room.

title: This is Times Square experience
text: Located close to Time Square you literally hear and feel the city that never sleeps. Staff is friendly and helpful. Very clean and lately renovated room (27th F) is basic standard. Breakfast is OK from cereals to omelets and toasts. Better to be at breakfast before 7am to secure a seat. There is too little space to serve breakfast, so better be early.

title: Great  reasonable Hotel in  Times Swuare
text: Very clean, staff very friendly, great location. Also loved the fact you got the free breakfast, it was crowded in the mornings but staff worked hard to keep food stocked and tables cleaned up. Would stay there again...

title: Great location
text: Stayed in the hotel for four nights for a short break. Hotel is a good 'cheap' hotel if you're visiting New York and want to see the sights. Great location, welcoming staff and rooms well kept. Rooms are fine if you're sight seeing as you only really need it as a base to sleep/ shower etc. The breakfast is average, but gets very busy and not always space to sit down. This is really the only fault of the hotel.

title: Excelente ubicación y relación precio calidad
text: Muy buen hotel en términos generales. La ubicación muy buena y la limpieza excelente. El trato del personal muy bueno, siempre dispuestos a contestar cualquier tipo de pregunta. Lo único malo es el porte del lugar donde se sirve el desayuno, siempre está colapsado. Lo bueno es que hay bandejas para subir el desayuno a las piezas.

title: Good hotel in a very convenient location
text: I stayed here for a week for a trip to New York to see the sights. This hotel is in the Times Square area which makes it very conveniently located for the subway, to pick up taxis, restaurants and evening entertainment. It's very close to many of the main sights including the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Terminal. When we arrived we were greeted by a friendly member of staff who quickly looked up our booking on their computer and had us checked in within just a few minutes. Our room was on the 29th floor and had a great view of the Hudson River over to New Jersey and down to the World Trade Center and the new Freedom Tower. The room was a little small but this did not cause any problems and I understand it's to be expected from many central Manhattan hotels. There were two good sized, comfortable beds, a desk and a chair, wardrobe with hangers, ironing board and iron and a safe, chest of drawers, TV, mirrors and bedside cabinets. The bathroom was modern with a good shower and toiletries and towels were provided. The room was cleaned daily to a very high standard and they change your bedding upon request if you place the card on your bed to notify the cleaners. Breakfast started at 6.30am and was pretty standard - eggs, sausage, bacon, biscuits, pancakes, cereal, yoghurt, fruit, muffins, pastries. Plenty to choose from. For the size of the hotel, though, the breakfast room is small. This didn't cause a problem for me because I got there soon after they started serving and always got a seat but some people were coming down, getting food and taking it back to their rooms. As mentioned, i didn't find this to be a negative, but if you want an easier breakfast time this may not be the hotel for you, but is the only thing I found that could potentially have caused a problem. If you want a hotel in a good location that's a little cheaper than others in the area, and you like clean, comfortable rooms, it's great. I'd return.

title: First time in Newyork
text: This hotel is in a perfect location for getting around Newyork.   Front reception looks a little worn.  The room was small, but very comfortable, clean and modern.  We were on fourth floor so we didn't need to use the lift.  We were at the front of the hotel so we did have a bit of noise at night time, but being so busy during the days we were to tired to notice.  There is a decent iron, plus board, coffee maker, hair dryer, and the TV is a good size.  Breakfast is ok, plenty of tea, coffee, juices, toast, cereal, cheese omelette, sausage, cakes, fruit, and a pancake maker.  There is a pub next door and one across the road.  A lovely little deli to the right and another at the top of the street on the right.  If I go back to newyork I would be happy to stay here again.  And free wifi a nice bonus.

title: Friendly staff and convenient location
text: Just back after 3 night break with my daughter.  What you expect from an HI Express, clean, functional and efficient.  Typical small New York room but as you don't tend to linger in your room was not a problem.  We booked a city view and OMG what a view, we got the room key and was told on the 36th top floor, from the side we could see the empire state building, and in front of us was the south skyline and even the statue of liberty in the distance.  The lights at night were incredible.   Bathroom spotless but the hoover could have been used along the wall edge in the bedroom a bit more !!!!!  Location is excellent 10 min walk and you have a main subway, also within a 20 min radius you have all the theatres and into Times Square, Rockefeller Centre is 20 mins, Empire State is 20 mins in the other direction.  We booked a City pass (excellent value) before we left and Pier 83 is 10 mins walk for most of the sightseeing cruises.  Next to that currently is The Intrepid which has a sea ship and space exhibition plus a submarine to walk through.  Would definitely recommend booking the NBC Studio Tour before going plus if you want to do the Crown on the statue of liberty.  The hotel has a concierge desk and they will help with bookings and advice, plus they have maps etc.  Very helpful in arranging the time for our pre booked airport transfer.  Computers and printer in reception to check in and print return flight details.  Breakfast is again what you expect,  juice, cereals, yoghurt, hot options, bagels, toast, bananas and apples.  Would definitely recommend going down early at 7am was quieter, there is not a lot of tables and saw some people use the cardboard trays, get a selection then go back to room, hotel seemed relaxed about that.  Lifts are a nightmare around 9am as only two.  We were always away from hotel before that until morning we checked out and was a bit of a wait with everyone cramming in but with timing no issues the rest of the stay.  Hot water urn always on in breakfast area, had a hot chocolate a couple of times on returning to hotel or a tea/coffee.  NIce touch!  If you get a good priced package, would definitely recommend.

title: Klein maar betaalbaar kamertje
text: Op ca 7 min lopen van times square aan 39 street een klein holiday inn express hotel. Bed is prima...iedere verdieping maar een stuk of 7 kamers dus geen drukte op de gangen...kamet is krap maar wel ...zeker tegen NY begrippen....heel betaalbaar. Inclusief ontbijt. Naast het holiday inn express is candle suites...zuster bedrijf...die hebben een piepklein winkeltje voor een flesje water oid want verder is er niet zo veel. Functioneel dus.

title: Cozy and great atmosphere
text: I travel quiet extensively around North America for business. This hotel was superb, great for local dining options and friendly staff. Highly recommended. Downtown New York have plenty of options, but this is the place you want to stay. Thank you.

title: Centralissimo
text: Ho pernottato per una sola notte in questa struttura. Location centralissima a due blocchi da Times square. Camere piccole ma essenziali. Arredamento stile moderno. Ottima la pulizia e prezzi abbordabili considerando la posizione. Consigliato se volete una location centrale a buon prezzo. Unica pecca l'assenza della prima colazione ma si ovvia grazie allo starbucks quasi difronte l'albergo

title: Great staff, perfect location!!
text: Henry and the staff were a great help to us on our honeymoon.  They went out of the way to make sure we were taking care of, giving us tips on local restaurants, and out of the way places to explore.  The staff even supplied us with breakfast to go when we had to leave for an early morning flight.  A terrific experience!

title: Clean, comfortable, centrally located.
text:
Great place to stay if you are a tourist or attending a local show. 
The entire staff was very courteous. Our room was spotless. Ask for a room on the highest floor possible as the noise (Midtown Music) from the cars honking and sirens run around the clock. 
Yes, we would stay again.

title: Holiday inn
text:
Com essa rede de hotel não tem erro
Fiquei durante o carnaval nesse hotel e adorei.Eles realmente prezam pelos hóspedes.A localização é perfeita e perto dos principais lugares da cidade.Apesar de não ser um lugar luxuoso, o holiday inn está sempre limpo e possui um café da manhã maravilhoso, além de um atendimento espetacular.

title: You get what you pay for!!
text: Stayed here for five nights whilst in NYC - the hotel is in a great location near to everything which is great. Our room was very small, it had everything we needed for our stay and we weren't expecting a huge amount due to the price we paid. We were happy though! One thing to mention is the lifts particularly in the morning, it can take so long for the lift to get to you as there are only two for the whole hotel. We found it easier to walk down the stairs at times! The breakfast was a bit of a fight... only a couple of tables available. Reminded me slightly of a prison with paper trays etc It did the job though and filled us up so can't complain!

title: Ótima localização.
text: Os hoteis da rede Holiday Inn não precisam de muita apresentação. Seguindo a linha de qualidade adotada pela empresa, o hotel é muito limpo e os funcionários são muito atenciosos. Oferecem um café da manhã básico, mas que ajuda na hora de economizar algum dinheiro nos Starbucks espalhados por Manhattam. Localizado há poucas quadras da Times Square, o hotel fica próximo a diversos restaurantes, quase ao lado da Port Authority Bus Station e de diversas linhas de metrô.

title: Ótima localização
text: Hotel com ótima localização, bem perto de tudo inclusive Times Square, porem deixa a desejar em uma serie de pontos. SEgurança é um deles. Apesar de não ter acontecido nada conosco, dava a impressão de que qualquer um poderia entrar lá, não havia muito controle sobre isso. Limpeza razoável, café da manhã, razoável também.

title: Carino
text: L'hotel si trova vicino a Time Square, ottimo punto da cui partire per la visita delle Big Apple. Le camere non sono molto grandi ma nonostante ciò sono comode e ben organizzate, la biancheria (lenzuola e asciugamani) viene cambiata ogni giorno. Comodissimo avere la colazione inclusa, che è la tipica colazione internazionale che va dal dolce al salato.

title: 3 star hotel offering a 5 star service
text: On arriving in this hotel , my friends and I instantly knew we were on a winner. We were greeted by fabulous staff in a warm,welcoming environment. The location of the hotel is excellent but this comes second to its cleanliness,the efficient and helpful staff and last but not least it's on site restaurant and bar, Rattle and hum. The decor of the rooms is very tasteful and all amenities were available to us. We stayed 4 nights and had the holiday of a life time.A big shout out to Mery and Latoya who made our stay extra special

title: Bueno
text: Las habitaciones muy cómodas, los ascensores muy llenos, hay que hacer cola para poder subir o bajar, las bebidas calientes y fría durante todo el día gratis, el desayuno no es muy variado, todos los dias lo mismo, muy buena ubicación, .....
